speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... How is Sakura holding up?

speaker: Azura
text: Not well. She won't speak a word, and I'm told she refuses to eat.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not surprised. Poor thing. For someone so young to witness the massacre of all those soldiers... We're lucky we were able to take Sakura, Yukimura, and the retainers as hostages. If Iago and Hans weren't frightened of Xander, they would be dead right now. I've heard that Sakura is being kept separate from the rest. Is that so?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm afraid so. I believe her isolation has made all of this even harder on her. But Elise has been visiting her quite often, making sure she gets food and blankets.

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise has been doing all that? I'm a little surprised. Back in Izumo, she seemed rather hostile toward Sakura...

speaker: Azura
text: Perhaps she's learned to focus on what they have in common. After all, they are both princesses, and the youngest of all their siblings. ...You should know that Garon's men don't agree with our choice to keep them alive. We should keep close watch on them, or I shudder to think what might happen.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. I wish it weren't so... But those who still follow Father over Xander are not to be trusted.

speaker: Azura
text: Indeed. As it were... The Nohrian army is split in two as of now.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Azura
text: There are those whose allegiance lies with you, Xander, Leo and the others. And those who still swear fealty only to King Garon, Iago, and Hans. Conquering Hoshido is our only option, but our methods have drawn attention. If things continue like this, we might have a rebellion of sorts to contend with. It's convenient that King Garon is already here in Hoshido... But if something happens and we lose his trust, we will all be in grave danger. Until he sits on that throne, we should all proceed with extreme caution.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. We must be patient. The whole world depends on it. Once Father sits on that throne, everyone will finally know the truth. Only then can we—

speaker: Iago
text: Lord/Lady Corrin. Lady Azura.

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago?!

speaker: Iago
text: Am I interrupting something?

speaker: Corrin
text: No, not at all. Did you need something?

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon orders you and your troops to prepare for battle immediately. We will be arriving at the Great Wall of Suzanoh before long.

speaker: Corrin
text: The Great Wall of Suzanoh?

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, my apologies, young prince/princess. I take it you've never heard of the place before? It's the last hurdle that stands between us and the Hoshidan castle. Once we pass through, we will enter the capital city. My forces shall be leading the charge. You, on the other hand, have been tasked with conquering the enemy's core legion. That means defeating their leader, Prince Takumi.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi...is leading Hoshido's core legion?

speaker: Iago
text: Yes. We received word of it from our scouts not too long ago.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Iago
text: We already have Princess Sakura as a hostage, so no need to keep him alive. I'm sure you would prefer to spare him, but I doubt our dear king would agree...

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* You are correct, Iago. I will deal with Takumi for the glory of Nohr. However, first things first. For now I must focus on the battle ahead. I will tell my troops to prepare for battle.

speaker: Iago
text: Understood.

speaker: Iago
text: Heh heh... Now, to joyously watch Corrin suffer! Poor prince/princess... What will you do?!

speaker: Takumi
text: At long last. I'm glad you could make it. Prince/Princess Corrin of Nohr. But know that so long as there is a single breath in my body, I will not let you pass. I mean that. You shall not enter our capital under any circumstances. Are you ready, dear Brother/Sister? Today is the day you die! Even if I must give my life to achieve it, I will not fail. I WILL kill you, Corrin! Prepare to die like the coward you are!

speaker: Hinata
text: I have been practicing day and night so I could be the one to stop you! I won't back down to the likes of you no-good scoundrels! Stand back and watch as I protect Lord Takumi and all of Hoshido!

speaker: Hinata
text: Lord Takumi... Stay...strong... I hope he knows...getting this blade from him...was my proudest moment...

speaker: Oboro
text: You filthy Nohrians! As long as I live, I won't let you lay a finger on my dear Lord Takumi!!

speaker: Oboro
text: Aww...but I wanted to protect you...my sweet Takumi... I should have told you...how I felt... Lord Takumi... I have always...loved... ...

speaker: Takumi
text: All allies of Nohr deserve nothing but the cold embrace of death!

speaker: Takumi
text: NO!! This can't be...how it ends...

speaker: Takumi
text: I have waited far too long for this moment, Brother/Sister. I have dreamt of nothing but ending you, and now the time has come! I shall cherish the sound of life leaving your body for all eternity. Do you remember what I told you in Cheve? Do you?!

speaker: Corrin
text: You said you would not rest until you killed me—made me pay for my sins.

speaker: Takumi
text: That's right. There's no turning back now... Not for me. This is all I have left. For better or for worse, this will be our last meeting. It ends here. I made up my mind to kill you a long time ago, my forgotten brother/sister. I WILL have revenge for Mother and all the Hoshidan lives you've ruined!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... Brother...

speaker: Corrin
text: Your battle is over, Takumi. The Nohrian army has seized control of the Great Wall of Suzanoh. All remaining soldiers will be taken prisoner. That includes you.

speaker: Takumi
text: Dammit! Coward! I hope you rot in a pit of eternal torment for this!!

speaker: Leo
text: My, what a rude fellow. You should be grateful we are allowing you to live. You may be our prisoner, but we will not treat you cruelly. If you behave, we may even let you see your sister, Princess Sakura.

speaker: Takumi
text: WHAT?! You've captured Sakura too? You monsters!!

speaker: Corrin
text: I know how you must be feeling, Takumi, but please calm yourself. We must bind and imprison you before Father arrives. Please, just put out your hands and—

speaker: Takumi
text: Don't touch me! Don't you dare lay your filthy Nohrian hands on me!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi?

speaker: Takumi
text: I mean it! Don't come near me!! If it wasn't for you, none of these awful things would have happened to Hoshido! No one would have had to die! We could have been a family! Why did you go back to Nohr?! Why? TELL ME WHY!! Why didn't you choose us?! Your real family! Why?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! I...

speaker: Takumi
text: *sob* Don't you speak my name, traitor! *sob*

speaker: Takumi
text: It doesn't matter. Nothing matters—not anymore.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... Why would you say that?

speaker: Takumi
text: The time is now... I can still save Hoshido even without the blade of salvation... You can't keep me prisoner... See? Do you see?! You shouldn't have left me a way...a way to escape...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi?! TAKUMI! NOOOO!!

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi! Please, no...

speaker: Corrin
text: Th-this can't be happening... I won't let it! TAKUMI!!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! What are you doing?!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm going after him! He might still be alive!

speaker: Azura
text: No, it's too dangerous! That area isn't under Nohr's control yet! Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! Where are you?! He's not here... But how? He must have fallen somewhere nearby...

speaker: Azura
text: Wait, Corrin! You can't go that way! Hoshidan soldiers might still be afoot!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! What do I do? I can't find Takumi anywhere.

speaker: Azura
text: What?!

speaker: Corrin
text: We saw him fall... He fell down this very wall. But he's not down here!

speaker: Azura
text: How could that be? That's simply not possible. After falling that far, it would be a miracle for him to be alive, much less still mobile.

speaker: Corrin
text: Then where is he?

speaker: Azura
text: I...I don't know. Perhaps somebody removed his body. There must be an explanation.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, but we don't have time to figure this out right now. We need to get back to our troops. If we don't have the wall under our control when King Garon's forces arrive... There's no telling how many innocent lives will be lost.

speaker: Corrin
text: Dammit... You're right. OK. Let's go.

speaker: Azura
text: We must hurry, Corrin. There's no time to lose.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... Where are you...?

speaker: Elise
text: All right, Corrin. Let’s go in there together. I’ll help as much as possible. This is our father we’re talking about. He has to forgive you, right?

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Elise. I hope you’re right.

speaker: Elise
text: All right. Deep breath, and… here we go. Father! We have something we need to talk you about!

speaker: Garon
text: Gah hah ha!

speaker: Corrin
text: Father?

speaker: Elise
text: It sound like he’s with someone… Maybe we should come back later.

speaker: Garon
text: Hrmph! Who’s there?

speaker: Elise
text: Oh! Sorry to bother you, Father…

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, we apologize if this isn’t a good time.

speaker: Garon
text: What do you two want?

speaker: Elise
text: Father, we’re here to apologize. Right, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, that’s right. I’m sorry for questioning you.

speaker: Garon
text: You may enter.

speaker: Garon
text: Corrin… You disobeyed a direct order from me. Ordinarily you would not still be alive.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand…

speaker: Elise
text: No! Father, I can explain-

speaker: Garon
text: Silence! As you are my child, Corrin, I will grant you some leeway. I have something in mind for you. A mission. If you complete this task successfully, I will pardon your crime in full.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really?! What sort of mission?

speaker: Garon
text: There is an abandoned fortress perched on the Hoshidan border. I wish to know if the building there remains serviceable. You are to travel to the site and inspect the premises. No battle will be required. Do you understand? I won’t tolerate being disappointed twice…

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Father. It shall be done.

speaker: Camilla
text: Darling, are you sure you’re going to be OK out there? I don’t like this…

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course! Please don’t worry. It’s just an abandoned fort.

speaker: Leo
text: You’re acting rather casual about all this, Corrin. It isn’t like Father to be so forgiving…

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? What do you mean, Leo?

speaker: Elise
text: That’s enough, Leo! Don’t be so worried all the time, sheesh. And don’t even try to scare Corrin before his/her first mission!

speaker: Leo
text: Hey! That’s not necessary.

speaker: Camilla
text: I suppose I’ll just have to come along. That way I know Corrin will be safe.

speaker: Iago
text: I’m afraid that’s not possible.

speaker: Camilla
text: Why ever not, Iago?

speaker: Iago
text: Lady Camilla, King Garon intends his expedition as a test of sorts. As his top advisor, I have been entrusted with coordinating this mission. He would like to know whether Prince/Princess Corrin is worthy… After all, he/she IS a part of the royal lineage. Therefore, your assistance would simply muddy the results.

speaker: Corrin
text: Understood. Camilla, I need to do this all by myself. Surely you understand.

speaker: Garon
text: Not all by yourself, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father! I didn’t see you there.

speaker: Garon
text: Rest assured, I don’t intend to send you out there completely defenseless.

speaker: Hans
text: …Milord/Milady.

speaker: Garon
text: This is Hans. He is a veteran warrior and will ensure no trouble befalls you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Father.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm…

speaker: Xander
text: I’d be wary of that man if I were you, Corrin…

speaker: Corrin
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Xander
text: He’s a criminal. A murderer and scoundrel. I arrested him myself, years ago. Father seems to think he’s rehabilitated, but I’m not so sure. That said, he is a formidable soldier.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow… Is this it? The Bottomless Canyon?

speaker: Gunter
text: Yes. It’s the natural boundary dividing Nohr and Hoshido.

speaker: Corrin
text: It can’t be really bottomless, can it?

speaker: Gunter
text: Let the eternal darkness below be your answer. Those who fall in never return… I truly despise this place. Something about the land around here just isn’t right. The sky here is always dark and foreboding, and lightning strikes all who fly across. This clearly a place us mortals were never meant to enter. Normally we’d go around… But the fort that King Garon wants surveyed is right over there.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, it’s not so bad. Or perhaps I’m just happy to be outside in the fresh air! Compared to the inside of that fortress, this is downright exiting.

speaker: Gunter
text: Ha! That certainly puts things in perspective, milord/milady. Come, let’s proceed.

speaker: Gunter
text: Blast! It looks like this fort isn’t as abandoned as we thought. Why the devil is this place crawling with Hoshidans?

speaker: Hoshidan
text: Hold on! Do not advance any farther, soliders of Nohr.

speaker: Omozu
text: Crossing that bridge is a violation of our border treaty. Turn back at once, or we’ll be forced to attack!

speaker: Felicia
text: What should we do?

speaker: Corrin
text: We’re not here to fight. I suppose we’ll have to turn back and report to Father.

speaker: Gunter
text: Wise decision, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Hans
text: Who asked you, old man?

speaker: Gunter
text: What?!

speaker: Hans
text: Gyaaah!

speaker: Hoshidan
text: AAAUGH!

speaker: Hans
text: Ah ha ha! Die, scumbags!

speaker: Omozu
text: You’ll pay for this!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans, what are you doing?! We had no reason to engage these troops!

speaker: Hans
text: Pfft.

speaker: Corrin
text: We should have tried diplomacy first. We weren’t sent here to fight!

speaker: Hans
text: Speak for yourself, weakling.

speaker: Corrin
text: What’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: Omozu
text: Soldiers of Hoshido, hear me! Do not leave a single Nohrian alive!

speaker: Hoshidan
text: Prepare to attack!

speaker: Gunter
text: Argh! Looks like there’s no getting out of this now. Get ready to fight, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Gunter
text: Now then, Lord/Lady Corrin. There are two kinds of battle formations. You’ll need to learn both, and fast! You can take a defensive position by moving to the same space as an ally. Your ally will benefit from your support, but you won’t be able to attack. If you want to unleash the most potent attacks, stand in adjacent positions. From that alignment, allies may be able to attack simultaneously. I’d tell you more, but you’re about to receive some practical experience…

speaker: Gunter
text: I’m afraid the enemy’s position across that bridge may be impenetrable. We’ve got to look for another way across. Lord/Lady Corrin! See if you can find a Dragon Vein around here.

speaker: Omozu
text: Gods! Did you see what just happened to the cliff? Who are we dealing with here?

speaker: Felicia
text: Look! More troops are arriving from the south!

speaker: Gunter
text: More enemy reinforcements… Take caution, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Hans
text: Gyaaah! Die!

speaker: Hans
text: Bwahaha! Look like I’ve done enough damage for the time being. Time to lay low and see how this all plays out…

speaker: Omozu
text: Do you even realize what you’ve done here today? Hoshido won’t stand for unprovoked attacks like this. Revenge will be ours!

speaker: Omozu
text: Damn you! This isn’t over…

speaker: Corrin
text: This isn’t what I had in mind…but at least I’ve completed Father’s mission.

speaker: Saizo
text: You’re the leader of these troops? Pah. You’re nothing more than a boy/girl.

speaker: Corrin
text: Who are you?

speaker: Saizo
text: My name is Saizo. I’ve come to claim your life.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey! Everyone! We’re still under attack!

speaker: Saizo
text: Destroy them!
I won’t allow it!

speaker: Saizo
text: What?! This must be their real commander…

speaker: Xander
text: What’s going on here, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander! How did you know were in trouble?

speaker: Leo
text: We’ve arrived just in time. Your luck never runs out, does it, Brother/Sister?

speaker: Camilla
text: Are you all right? I was so worried about you.

speaker: Elise
text: We’re all here for you, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, everyone! Um, but before we get too carried away… we ARE under attack.

speaker: Camilla
text: Who dares attack my beloved Corrin? I’ll have their heads on a platter!

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m not hurt, Camilla.

speaker: Camilla
text: But, darling…it’s the thought that counts!

speaker: Corrin
text: I never knew Camilla could be so…ruthless…

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee! That’s right, you’ve never seen her on the battlefield before.

speaker: Saizo
text: This is not going well…

speaker: Kagero
text: Saizo! What’s wrong? What’s our status?

speaker: Saizo
text: I misjudged the situation. We’re outnumbered. Kagero, do we have anyone else on the way?

speaker: Kagero
text: Affirmative. Lord Ryoma is right behind me.

speaker: Saizo
text: Ahh… Then I think this battle is as good as won.

speaker: Xander
text: It looks like more Hoshidan reinforcements are on the way.

speaker: Leo
text: Indeed… What should we do?

speaker: Xander
text: Well, Corrin is safe, and the fort’s condition has been evaluated. There’s no reason to engage Hoshido further at this point. Corrin, you take the lead with Gunter. We’ll follow close behind.

speaker: Corrin
text: Will do. Thank you, Xander.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gunter, have you seen Felicia/Jakob? She/He was here a second ago…

speaker: Gunter
text: I’m sure she’s/he's right behind us. Now hurry up. I can’t stand being on this bridge a moment longer.

speaker: Hans
text: Don’t worry-you won’t have to stand there much longer.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans!

speaker: Gunter
text: What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Hans
text: Less talk. More death.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans, no! Why are you doing this? Your own ally…

speaker: Hans
text: Aww, did I knock your babysitter into the ditch? Here- you can meet up with him at the bottom!

speaker: Corrin
text: You’ll pay for this!

speaker: Hans
text: What?! What kind of…freak…are you?

speaker: Hans
text: It can’t be..

speaker: Corrin
text: I want answers, Hans! Why are you doing this? Why did you provoke the Hoshians? And why did you kill Gunter? Answer me!

speaker: Hans
text: Just following orders. King Garon’s orders.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! You lie!

speaker: Corrin
text: Come back here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Noooo!

speaker: Lilith
text: My kin, my gods, my blood… Dragons grant me strength! Great Moro, I beseech you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith? Is that you? What…ARE you?

speaker: Lilith
text: Lord/Lady Corrin… I knew this day would come eventually. This may come as a shock, but I am not a human.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I can see that. Are you a dragon?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, this is my true form. You’ve seen it before. Do you remember? That strange bird you rescued in the barn…

speaker: Corrin
text: That… was you…?

speaker: Lilith
text: It was. Once I recovered, I was able to take human form. You were so kind to me that I decided to remain a human that I might serve you. But now I have used a power that goes beyond the capacity of a human body. I will not be able to return to that form. I don’t mind, though. The most important thing to me is that you’re safe…

speaker: Lilith
text: Eeek!

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith! Be careful! Drop me if you must… I won’t have you sacrifice yourself for me!

speaker: Lilith
text: First Dragons, I call on you. Grant us access to the astral plane!

speaker: Corrin
text: What just happened?! Where…are we?

speaker: Lilith
text: This is a world parallel to the one in which you live, Lord/Lady Corrin. It is known as the astral plane.

speaker: Corrin
text: How were you able to get us here?

speaker: Lilith
text: The First Dragons have granted us the power to inhabit this dimension. Under their protection, we are safe here. Oh! Allow me to prepare a place for you to rest…

speaker: Corrin
text: Did… did you just use a Dragon Vein?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes. The power of the First Dragons flows freely in this realm. You should know that space and time operate differently here as well…

speaker: Corrin
text: I have so much to learn… Is there anyone else here?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, we are alone. There’s no one left here…

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to invoke any bad memories.

speaker: Lilith
text: It’s OK, Corrin. I’m not lonely as long as I have you in my life. Now…you should get some rest.

speaker: Lilith
text: How are you feeling, Corrin? I know this is a lot to take in.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, it is. But I feel much better now. My wounds seem to have healed already. And my mind is racing! I have so many new questions about this world…

speaker: Lilith
text: All in good time. For now, some business remains in the other world.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, you’re right. I can’t relax until I know everyone made it safely home.

speaker: Lilith
text: Of course. There is just one thing you should know before you go back. When I open the portal, you will return to the same location you came from. That means you’ll arrive right on the Hoshidan border. There may be soldiers lying in wait for you…

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand. I’ll be ready for them.

speaker: Lilith
text: Very well. Then I will open the gate.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, I’m back. But… where is everyone?
You’re mine, Nohrian!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm?!

speaker: Garon
text: I see you made it here safely, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Father. Long have I wished to see you and visit Castle Krakenburg again. I feel like I’m dreaming…

speaker: Garon
text: It is only thanks to your diligence that you are here. I am told you are now a warrior almost on par with Xander. You finally possess the strength to be an instrument of Nohr’s power in the world.

speaker: Elise
text: But, Father, will he/she be all right outside of the fortress?

speaker: Camilla
text: I worry about that as well. Isn’t it dangerous for Corrin to live outside the fortress’s magical barrier?

speaker: Corrin
text: I appreciate your concern, but I earned my way here and I’m ready to fight.

speaker: Garon
text: Corrin, as you know, Nohr is at war with the eastern kingdom of Hoshido.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Father. I have heard as much.

speaker: Garon
text: We of the royal family are descendants of the ancient gods, the First Dragons. As inheritors of that divine strength, we conquer those who oppose us with ease. One who learns to wield that power can destroy an entire army of common troops. Xander, Camilla, and Leo have already shown that they possess this power. I expect no less from you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I am aware of your expectations, Father. And I have trained every day to become more like my siblings.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmm…you show promise. But you will need a suitable weapon in order to serve Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow…

speaker: Garon
text: This is Ganglari, a sword infused with magic from another world. With this sword at your side, you will crush the Hoshidan army with ease.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you for this generous gift, Father.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm… Generous indeed.

speaker: Garon
text: Now, let us see you put that sword to its proper use… Bring out the prisoners!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Yes, sire!

speaker: Corrin
text: Prisoners?

speaker: Garon
text: These are prisoners from our most recent skirmish with Hoshido. I want to see your power with my own eyes. Use that sword to strike them down.

speaker: Gunter
text: I shall join you, milord/milady. My lance arm is perhaps rusty but still serviceable. Felicia/Jakob, will you join us well?

speaker: Felicia
text: Of course! I’m as much a bodyguard as a domestic, after all. To be honest, I was never that great at the domestic stuff anyway.

speaker: Jakob
text: Naturally. I couldn't allow someone of your advanced years to bear the burden alone. Lady Corrin, there is no need for you to soil your hands with this filth. Please relax and leave the fighting to us. Afterward, I will prepare you some tea.

speaker: Rinkah
text: I am Rinkah! Daughter of the Flame Tribe’s honorable chieftain. What is your name, Nohrian prince/princess?

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m Corrin.

speaker: Kaze
text: Corrin… Can it be?

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Have you heard of me?

speaker: Kaze
text: … I am Kaze, a ninja of Hoshido. Show me what you can do.

speaker: Garon
text: Kill them all.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that…

speaker: Felicia
text: Is something wrong, milord?

speaker: Corrin
text: I feel…something emanating from the ground. Could it be…

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh! Th-that’s amazing! You blew away all the debris!

speaker: Garon
text: Heh…Well done.

speaker: Gunter
text: Excellent plan, milord─now we can hide in there and ambush our foes.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that…

speaker: Jakob
text: Hm? Is something the matter, milady?

speaker: Corrin
text: I feel…something emanating from the ground. Could it be…

speaker: Jakob
text: Extraordinary! No debris field can stand up to your mighty lineage!

speaker: Garon
text: Heh... Well done.

speaker: Gunter
text: Excellent plan, milady─now we can hide in there and ambush our foes.

speaker: Gunter
text: Remain focused, milord/milady. This is no mock battle-a mistake here could cost you your life.

speaker: Felicia
text: You should know I’m trained to use daggers-up close or thrown from afar. I can even hit enemies hiding behind walls, which might come in handy!

speaker: Jakob
text: Milady, I'm well trained in the dagger─effective both up close and at range. I can even attack foes hiding behind walls, which may prove useful.

speaker: Gunter
text: Remember your training. Each weapon has strengths and weaknesses. You would do well to consider them before you attack.

speaker: Jakob
text: I’m sure you know this, milord/milady, but it’s useful to stay close to your allies. If you fight side by side, you can help each other in battle/combat.

speaker: Felicia
text: Maids can also use staves to heal wounds. If you get hurt, let me know right away!

speaker: Jakob
text: Butlers can also use staves to heal wounds. Please inform me immediately should you become injured.

speaker: Kaze
text: A ninja’s Shuriken may not cut deep, but it can sap you of your strength. Your death need not come all at once!

speaker: Kaze
text: I regret…nothing...

speaker: Rinkah
text: Behold the might of the Flame Tribe!

speaker: Rinkah
text: Nohrian scum…

speaker: Kaze
text: So this is how it ends…

speaker: Corrin
text: Phew! They’re really tough, aren’t they? I hope all Hoshidans aren’t this strong.

speaker: Garon
text: Don’t just stand there, idiot boy/girl. Finish them!

speaker: Corrin
text: But. Father…they’re beaten. You want me to execute helpless prisoners?

speaker: Garon
text: You dare question me?! I order you to kill them!

speaker: Corrin
text: No! It’s wrong!

speaker: Garon
text: I won’t argue the point any further.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods!

speaker: Kaze
text: Hm?

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin! What are you-

speaker: Xander
text: Unbelievable…

speaker: Garon
text: You would defy me directly, Corrin?!

speaker: Xander
text: Father, please forgive him/her! He/She doesn’t yet understand our situation…

speaker: Garon
text: Fine. Xander, you kill them. And if anyone gets in your way, kill them too.

speaker: Xander
text: Ngh.

speaker: Garon
text: DO IT! KILL THEM ALL!

speaker: Xander
text: Stand down, Corrin. If you don’t, I will be forced to-

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Xander. I won’t let you do this!

speaker: Xander
text: Why do you refuse, Corrin? You know the Hoshidans are our sworn enemies.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know, but…this is different. These people can’t fight anymore. Why not show mercy?

speaker: Camilla
text: Please, Corrin, don’t fight him… My dear, sweet Corrin…

speaker: Elise
text: No no no! Leo, what should we do?

speaker: Leo
text: *sigh* Why does this fall to me?

speaker: Leo
text: Father, I have dispatched our enemies on behalf of my softhearted brother/sister.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmph.

speaker: Leo
text: I only ask that you would be merciful in your punishment of him/her…

speaker: Garon
text: Enough! I will consider the matter later.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo! How could you?! They were beaten! There was no reason to execute them!

speaker: Leo
text: Agreed. Now hush.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, did you-

speaker: Xander
text: Enough, both of you. The battle is over.

speaker: Xander
text: Mark my words, Corrin… One day, an act of kindness may be the death of you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps, but if I’m kind. I will die without regrets.

speaker: Xander
text: …Well said. Guard! I would examine the prisoners’ belongings. Bring their remains to my quarters.

speaker: Nohrian
text: Yes, Your Highness!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, your spell…

speaker: Leo
text: Was only enough to weaken them, yes. I should have followed Father’s orders. But Camilla and Elise always make such a fuss when I do anything to upset you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo. I’m sorry for teasing you about your collar.

speaker: Leo
text: *sigh* You can repay me by not mentioning it again.

speaker: Elise
text: That was great, Brother!

speaker: Camilla
text: It was, but I doubt this will be the last we hear of this. Father never forgets a slight.

speaker: Xander
text: Listen well. It is only my brother’s/sister's kind heart that has bought your freedom. Disappear now, lest you be spotted by our king.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Tch. I am not a hostage to be freed. You said your name is Corrin? When next we meet, I will make you pay for this humiliation!

speaker: Corrin
text: I was hoping the next time we met, it could be as friends.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Softhearted fool! I am a Hoshidan warrior. You do not understand what you suggest.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand that right now Hoshido and Nohr are at war. But I’m trying to plan ahead for the day the war is over and we can live in peace.

speaker: Rinkah
text: I’ve heard rumors of a sheltered Nohrian prince/princess who knows nothing of the world. I see those rumors are true. If we do meet again, the world will have no doubt taught you the error your ways.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow. Leo wasn't kidding. This is the only way to travel. Did everyone make it through?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, we're all here. I'm almost certain Nohrian forces haven't laid claim to this area yet. We should be safe, for the time being.

speaker: Takumi
text: Heh, they're probably still looking for us in the forest.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Agreed. This could work out perfectly if we time everything just right.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Let's get to it. Er... Any idea how to actually find this Rainbow Sage person?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm afraid not. I suppose the first thing we should do is find someone to interrogate...

speaker: Corrin
text: Or...we could try just talking to people. Like that older guy, over there. He looks like he's been here awhile. Excuse me, sir. Do you have a moment?

speaker: Old Man
text: Hmm? Are you lost? Is there a troupe in town? Your costumes are splendid—just splendid!

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, actually, we're just...travelers. We're looking for...an old friend. Some people call him the Rainbow Sage. Have you heard of him?

speaker: Old Man
text: The Rainbow Sage is your friend? Hoo hoo hoo! So you're a traveling comedy team—is that it?

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean? Why do you find that funny? I suppose I misspoke earlier. We haven't met the Rainbow Sage yet, but we were hoping to find him. Do you have any idea how we might track him down?

speaker: Old Man
text: Let me spare you a great deal of pain... Give up now. Almost nobody has visited the Rainbow Sage and lived.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I assure you that we are up to the task. There is a man from Nohr, a prince named Xander with golden hair... Is he one of those few who survived?

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, yes! I remember him. You ARE quite knowledgeable. I believe he was the fourth person to meet the Rainbow Sage and survive. The first was Sumeragi, the former king of Hoshido! A young King Garon also made the pilgrimage. I heard the third individual was an unknown knight no one had ever heard of before. But yes, Xander was the fourth!

speaker: Corrin
text: Unbelievable... We're following in the steps of King Sumeragi and King Garon... Stranger, thank you for the warning, but we are undeterred. Can you tell us how to find the Rainbow Sage?

speaker: Old Man
text: Well, if you insist... See that mountain over there? That's Mount Sagesse. It's a formidable peak...and at its summit you will find the Sevenfold Sanctuary.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. And that's where we can find the Rainbow Sage?

speaker: Old Man
text: If the legend is to be believed, yes. He supposedly resides on the top floor. But let me just warn you one more time... Most people never even make it to the summit alive.

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can't imagine what kinds of challenges await in that place...

speaker: Old Man
text: Hoo hoo! I've heard every kind of rumor you can imagine. Rooms full of poisonous snakes...trapdoors everywhere... I don't believe a word of it! But the only way to know for sure is to reach the top.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, thank you, sir. We truly appreciate all the information you've given us.

speaker: Old Man
text: It's my pleasure. Good luck to you. Oh, and try not to die. Hoo hoo hoo!

speaker: Corrin
text: You hear him, everyone! I heartily second that advice. Now, let's make our way to that mountain!

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* Is everyone all right? So far the climb is strenuous...but not overly dangerous.

speaker: Ryoma
text: You're right. So far, so good. Everyone has managed to keep pace. However, I believe we're approaching that building that that old man warned us about.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. The Sevenfold Sanctuary. How do you feel, Ryoma? Are we ready for this? Perhaps I should go ahead to scout—

speaker: Ryoma
text: Nonsense! We're sticking with you, no matter what awaits in there.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Ryoma. All right, everyone...let's go!

speaker: Illusion
text: Warriors! You have done well to make it this far. But make no mistake—the challenge is far from over. Now...show me what you can do!

speaker: Corrin
text: All right, everyone, this is it. The moment of truth. Beyond this door, we'll finally meet the legendary Rainbow Sage...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Be careful, Corrin. Don't let your guard down just yet.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. Let's just take this slowly...

speaker: Corrin
text: On one...two... THREE!

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh! Hello!

speaker: Corrin
text: You?! What are we doing back here again?

speaker: Old Man
text: Hoo hoo! This is where I live. Sorry to disappoint you.

speaker: Corrin
text: It can't be. You're the Rainbow Sage? Why didn't you say so when we first met you?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Well, that wouldn't have been any fun, would it? The legend would take a bit of a hit if you could just meet me anywhere.

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I suppose you're right. Well, now that we've made it, will you grant us the same power you granted the others?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: No.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean, no? We've done everything you asked! Or is there some other challenge we have yet to face?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: No, there is nothing else. You've done it...you can hold your heads up high! Don't you see? You've all fought so hard just to get here... The journey itself is what has strengthened you. Your minds and your bodies. If I were to ask you to climb another 5,000 vertical feet, I have no doubt you'd do it. THAT is the power that Sumeragi, Garon, Xander...and the other...have tapped into.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I see what you mean.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hoo, hoo! You feel it, don't you? Like you could do anything you set your mind to?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. Yes, I do. Thank you, Rainbow Sage.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Don't thank me yet! There's one more thing I can do for you, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait, how did you know my name?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hoo hoo! I know ALL about you. More than you know about yourself! But that's neither here nor there. Now, show me the blessed Yato, if you will.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Does this have to do with the Seal of Flames?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Ah...you HAVE been paying attention. Good. Now, I must speak with the one who wields the Fujin Yumi.

speaker: Takumi
text: Huh? What do you want from me?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Both of you, lift your weapons, if you would. Now, look at each other with calm minds and open hearts. This is the beginning. The Seal of Flames must be unlocked to initiate peace...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: I, who forged the sacred blade... I, who committed the great sin... I, who wove the divine colors... I call on you now, Seal of Flames!

speaker: Corrin
text: Something's happening to the Yato... It's changing!

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: The divine blade Yato is no more. You are now the proud owner of the Noble Yato, its worthy successor.

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can feel a kind of power coursing through it...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: That is nothing compared to what you will feel later. But that's all I can tell you for now. Now, if my sources are accurate, there is a very confused army looking for you. I believe NOW would be an opportune time to return to Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. I had almost forgotten about that...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Understandable, given all you've been through. However, it would behoove you to gather your wits quickly and move on. I am certain greater challenges lie ahead.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Rainbow Sage. We are honored to have met you.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Well, it's been a pleasure to meet you as well. I'm just pleased as punch that you didn't die on the way here!

speaker: Corrin
text: I vow to return here and visit you again once the war is over.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Oh?

speaker: Corrin
text: What? Should...should I not do that?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Oh! Pardon me. Now you would be welcome to visit me anytime. Farewell, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Farewell, Rainbow Sage. Thank you.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Ah...I hope he/she can live up to the destiny that's been laid before him/her... I'll be long dead before I find out, I suppose... But still...it would be nice for him/her. Hoo hoo!

speaker: Corrin
text: This place is so beautiful...so calming.

speaker: Azura
text: Isn't it? This is Izumo. It is known as the kingdom of the gods. Even as outside kingdoms quarrel, it remains neutral and peaceful.

speaker: Corrin
text: So this is the beauty that peace allows for... How inspiring. If this place is neutral, perhaps we should rest here for a while. Everyone must be exhausted after all our many travels and battles.

speaker: Azura
text: Agreed. We might be able to gather some useful information here too. The area surrounding the Hoshidan capital is heavily guarded. As of now, we have no good options for getting there safely. Perhaps someone here know something that could help. Then it's settled. Let's go!

speaker: Izana
text: Hello there! Greetings and salutations! You've traveled far, haven't you? You have! Welcome to my not-so-humble abode, Nohrian friends!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you very much for the...erm, warm welcome.

speaker: Izana
text: My castle here is a teeny tiny bitty baby, but please make yourselves at home.

speaker: Corrin
text: We, um, will do that. But...may I ask who I have the pleasure of addressing right now?

speaker: Izana
text: Oh! OH! Silly me! Yes, allow me to introduce myself. I am Archduke Izana, first heir to the divine bloodline, descendant of the gods...keeper of prophecies, and winner of best hair six times running. Not to brag. It's so nice to meet you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Y-you're an archduke?! Really? ...Really, though?

speaker: Leo
text: Impossible. He's so disgustingly casual...

speaker: Camilla
text: I'm a little surprised he's able to lead a whole kingdom like that...

speaker: Xander
text: It's downright unsettling...

speaker: Elise
text: Hi, Izana!! It's great to meet you too! Let's be best friends, heehee!

speaker: Izana
text: Ooh! Aren't you the cutest little girl this side of the Bottomless Canyon! You are my new favorite, Lady Elise!

speaker: Elise
text: Hm? Um, did I already introduce myself? I know I'm forgetful, but...

speaker: Izana
text: Ah ha ha... Ehem. Right. Don't be a goose, milady. You are all part of the Nohrian royal family. I know all of your names! It's only fitting for an archduke such as myself.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, that makes total sense!

speaker: Azura
text: Hmm...

speaker: Izana
text: I must say, you royals have the most exquisite of exquisite timing. Tonight I am hosting a banquet fit for lovely little royal types like you! I already have the most TO DIE FOR guest list. You'll die! You simply MUST attend. You must! You will, yes? Will you? Won't you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Guest? Who might they be?

speaker: Izana
text: Yes! It's hard to believe, but you're not the only royals I've collected today. I also have the honor of hosting the Hoshidan royal family!

speaker: Corrin
text: What?!

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin?! Is that r-really you?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin... How unexpected.

speaker: Corrin
text: H-hello...

speaker: Xander
text: Stay back, Corrin! Those people are dangerous. They will stop at nothing to steal you away from us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ha. Nohrian logic at its finest. Don't forget who stole our brother/sister first.

speaker: Xander
text: Speak ill of Nohrians again, and so help me...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Why are you angry? It's not an insult if it's true.

speaker: Xander
text: You really desire to feel my blade at your throat don't you?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Just try it! I dare you!

speaker: Izana
text: Whoa! No, no, no! Stop this at once! You don't want to be held responsible for breaking Izumo's neutrality pact, right? Put those awful swords away THIS INSTANT.

speaker: Xander
text: What pact?

speaker: Izana
text: Our lovely little Izumo has a strict pact that prohibits fighting of any kind. Even princes like you would be severely punished if you broke said pact. So let's all just put those nasty weapons away and enjoy supper! That's an order.

speaker: Xander
text: ...Fine. As a fellow ruler, I will respect your laws.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I may stay my blade, but don't expect me to let my guard down. I don't need a weapon to kill you, should the need arise.

speaker: Xander
text: You wish to engage me in hand-to-hand combat? That can be arranged...

speaker: Izana
text: Heh heh...ehem. Now, now, silly princes. Enough of this combat talk. So boring! You may be at war, but as long as you're under my roof, you'll play by my rules. They're such fun rules too! We'll start by locking away those weapons of yours. Now, our bountiful banquet is still cooking, so enjoy our amenities in the meantime.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmph.

speaker: Xander
text: Well, that was unexpected. How are you holding up?

speaker: Corrin
text: OK, I guess. I'm so sorry about all this, Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Not everything in the world is your fault, little prince/princess. We're here because you're a good leader who wished to give us a safe place to rest. None among us would even consider blaming you for what's happening.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Brother...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hello, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma?!

speaker: Xander
text: What do you want, Hoshidan?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Please, calm yourselves. I mean no harm to either of you. I simply wish to speak with my brother/sister.

speaker: Xander
text: So that you can steal him/her away to Hoshido the first chance you get? I won't allow it.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Watch that temper of yours, Nohrian prince. I admit I acted out of line earlier, but I will not stoop to violating Izumo's peace pact. As high prince of Hoshido. I don't have the luxury of making such a political misstep.

speaker: Xander
text: ...As crown prince of Nohr, I am bound by the same political constraints. If you and yours can behave amicably then so can we.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Xander
text: Is something on your mind, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's just...despite your differences, the two of you are quite similar in some ways.

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin! There's no need to insult me like that. I could not possibly be anything like this sorry excuse for a prince.

speaker: Ryoma
text: For once, I agree with Prince Xander. To start, I'm far more attractive.

speaker: Xander
text: Beg pardon?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa! Easy there! Don't fight now—we just started getting along! And I wasn't talking about your looks. Maybe it's because you're both heir to your respective thrones... But the dignified way you carry yourselves...how you care so deeply for your kingdom... I just think deep down, you two are more alike than you may think.

speaker: Nohrian
text: There he is! The high prince of Hoshido! Get him!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Nohrian soldiers? What is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Xander
text: How dare you act against our orders!

speaker: Izana
text: Ignore those party poopers, soldiers. Capture Prince Ryoma! Do it now!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: What the... Unhand me!

speaker: Xander
text: As crown prince of Nohr, I demand you to stop this at once! What are you playing at, Izana? I thought all violence was forbidden here.

speaker: Izana
text: Heh heh, that's the best part. I...am not Izana.

speaker: Xander
text: What?!

speaker: Zola
text: Eeheehee! It's been a long time, Lord Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Zola!

speaker: Zola
text: Phew! It feels SO GOOD to finally be myself again! It was hard pretending to be that twit of an archduke with the Hoshidan royals around.

speaker: Xander
text: Where is the real Archduke Izana? What have you done with him?!

speaker: Zola
text: Eeheehee, I'm afraid he and his ridiculous hair have been locked away a long while. He'll no doubt enjoy the company of Prince Ryoma in that ungodly cell. Oh! Let's not forget the other Hoshidan royals. Sweet death awaits all of them! I wonder if the littlest one will c-c-cry when her time comes...

speaker: Xander
text: You monster! Do you really mean to kill them? Even the youngest ones?!

speaker: Zola
text: But of course! King Garon will be so proud when I tell him of my triumph! When I heard the Hoshidan royals were attending a royal banquet in Izumo... I used my incomparable illusive magic to take the archduke's place. Genius, no? Then it was only a matter of time until the Hoshidans crawled into my web, hyo-ho.

speaker: Xander
text: That's despicable, even for you.

speaker: Zola
text: No more flattery, please! I'll blush! Now we can capture Hoshido once and for all. I bet the king will grant me a new title! If you'll excuse me, I have some very important death sentencing to do.

speaker: Xander
text: Zola, halt! ZOLA!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... Wh-what are we going to do?

speaker: Xander
text: Don't worry, Corrin. I won't allow this treachery to go unpunished. Hoshido may be our enemy, but to murder its royals while they are unarmed... I won't have us win the war this way. We will win with honor or die trying. Come, Brother/Sister. Let us go set free our sworn enemy.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm with you all the way, Xander. You really are my hero. I hope you know. ...Heh heh.

speaker: Xander
text: Was that a guffaw I heard? Out with it, little prince/princess. What's so funny?

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh, sorry... It's just that you and Ryoma really are so much alike. If you weren't on opposite sides of a war, I think you could have been great friends.

speaker: Xander
text: Yeesh... Do me a favor and keep that nonsense in your head where it belongs. Now, to the task at hand. Gather our troops and prepare for battle. Zola isn't one to postpone violence. We haven't much time.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm on it!

speaker: Zola
text: Why are you fighting this?! I am not you're enemy, those Hoshidans are! I act only for the glory of Nohr! Why is this happening? WHY?!

speaker: Corrin
text: This place is so beautiful...so calming.

speaker: Azura
text: Isn't it? This is Izumo. It is known as the kingdom of the gods. Even as outside kingdoms quarrel, it remains neutral and peaceful.

speaker: Corrin
text: So this is the beauty that peace allows for... How inspiring. If this place is neutral, perhaps we should rest here for a while. Everyone must be exhausted after all our many travels and battles.

speaker: Azura
text: Agreed. We might be able to gather some useful information here too. The area surrounding the Hoshidan capital is heavily guarded. As of now, we have no good options for getting there safely. Perhaps someone here know something that could help. Then it's settled. Let's go!

speaker: Izana
text: Hello there! Greetings and salutations! You've traveled far, haven't you? You have! Welcome to my not-so-humble abode, Nohrian friends!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you very much for the...erm, warm welcome.

speaker: Izana
text: My castle here is a teeny tiny bitty baby, but please make yourselves at home.

speaker: Corrin
text: We, um, will do that. But...may I ask who I have the pleasure of addressing right now?

speaker: Izana
text: Oh! OH! Silly me! Yes, allow me to introduce myself. I am Archduke Izana, first heir to the divine bloodline, descendant of the gods...keeper of prophecies, and winner of best hair six times running. Not to brag. It's so nice to meet you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Y-you're an archduke?! Really? ...Really, though?

speaker: Leo
text: Impossible. He's so disgustingly casual...

speaker: Camilla
text: I'm a little surprised he's able to lead a whole kingdom like that...

speaker: Xander
text: It's downright unsettling...

speaker: Elise
text: Hi, Izana!! It's great to meet you too! Let's be best friends, heehee!

speaker: Izana
text: Ooh! Aren't you the cutest little girl this side of the Bottomless Canyon! You are my new favorite, Lady Elise!

speaker: Elise
text: Hm? Um, did I already introduce myself? I know I'm forgetful, but...

speaker: Izana
text: Ah ha ha... Ehem. Right. Don't be a goose, milady. You are all part of the Nohrian royal family. I know all of your names! It's only fitting for an archduke such as myself.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, that makes total sense!

speaker: Azura
text: Hmm...

speaker: Izana
text: I must say, you royals have the most exquisite of exquisite timing. Tonight I am hosting a banquet fit for lovely little royal types like you! I already have the most TO DIE FOR guest list. You'll die! You simply MUST attend. You must! You will, yes? Will you? Won't you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Guest? Who might they be?

speaker: Izana
text: Yes! It's hard to believe, but you're not the only royals I've collected today. I also have the honor of hosting the Hoshidan royal family!

speaker: Corrin
text: What?!

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin?! Is that r-really you?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin... How unexpected.

speaker: Corrin
text: H-hello...

speaker: Xander
text: Stay back, Corrin! Those people are dangerous. They will stop at nothing to steal you away from us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ha. Nohrian logic at its finest. Don't forget who stole our brother/sister first.

speaker: Xander
text: Speak ill of Nohrians again, and so help me...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Why are you angry? It's not an insult if it's true.

speaker: Xander
text: You really desire to feel my blade at your throat don't you?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Just try it! I dare you!

speaker: Izana
text: Whoa! No, no, no! Stop this at once! You don't want to be held responsible for breaking Izumo's neutrality pact, right? Put those awful swords away THIS INSTANT.

speaker: Xander
text: What pact?

speaker: Izana
text: Our lovely little Izumo has a strict pact that prohibits fighting of any kind. Even princes like you would be severely punished if you broke said pact. So let's all just put those nasty weapons away and enjoy supper! That's an order.

speaker: Xander
text: ...Fine. As a fellow ruler, I will respect your laws.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I may stay my blade, but don't expect me to let my guard down. I don't need a weapon to kill you, should the need arise.

speaker: Xander
text: You wish to engage me in hand-to-hand combat? That can be arranged...

speaker: Izana
text: Heh heh...ehem. Now, now, silly princes. Enough of this combat talk. So boring! You may be at war, but as long as you're under my roof, you'll play by my rules. They're such fun rules too! We'll start by locking away those weapons of yours. Now, our bountiful banquet is still cooking, so enjoy our amenities in the meantime.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmph.

speaker: Xander
text: Well, that was unexpected. How are you holding up?

speaker: Corrin
text: OK, I guess. I'm so sorry about all this, Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Not everything in the world is your fault, little prince/princess. We're here because you're a good leader who wished to give us a safe place to rest. None among us would even consider blaming you for what's happening.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Brother...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hello, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma?!

speaker: Xander
text: What do you want, Hoshidan?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Please, calm yourselves. I mean no harm to either of you. I simply wish to speak with my brother/sister.

speaker: Xander
text: So that you can steal him/her away to Hoshido the first chance you get? I won't allow it.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Watch that temper of yours, Nohrian prince. I admit I acted out of line earlier, but I will not stoop to violating Izumo's peace pact. As high prince of Hoshido. I don't have the luxury of making such a political misstep.

speaker: Xander
text: ...As crown prince of Nohr, I am bound by the same political constraints. If you and yours can behave amicably then so can we.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Xander
text: Is something on your mind, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's just...despite your differences, the two of you are quite similar in some ways.

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin! There's no need to insult me like that. I could not possibly be anything like this sorry excuse for a prince.

speaker: Ryoma
text: For once, I agree with Prince Xander. To start, I'm far more attractive.

speaker: Xander
text: Beg pardon?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa! Easy there! Don't fight now—we just started getting along! And I wasn't talking about your looks. Maybe it's because you're both heir to your respective thrones... But the dignified way you carry yourselves...how you care so deeply for your kingdom... I just think deep down, you two are more alike than you may think.

speaker: Nohrian
text: There he is! The high prince of Hoshido! Get him!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Nohrian soldiers? What is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Xander
text: How dare you act against our orders!

speaker: Izana
text: Ignore those party poopers, soldiers. Capture Prince Ryoma! Do it now!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: What the... Unhand me!

speaker: Xander
text: As crown prince of Nohr, I demand you to stop this at once! What are you playing at, Izana? I thought all violence was forbidden here.

speaker: Izana
text: Heh heh, that's the best part. I...am not Izana.

speaker: Xander
text: What?!

speaker: Zola
text: Eeheehee! It's been a long time, Lord Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Zola!

speaker: Zola
text: Phew! It feels SO GOOD to finally be myself again! It was hard pretending to be that twit of an archduke with the Hoshidan royals around.

speaker: Xander
text: Where is the real Archduke Izana? What have you done with him?!

speaker: Zola
text: Eeheehee, I'm afraid he and his ridiculous hair have been locked away a long while. He'll no doubt enjoy the company of Prince Ryoma in that ungodly cell. Oh! Let's not forget the other Hoshidan royals. Sweet death awaits all of them! I wonder if the littlest one will c-c-cry when her time comes...

speaker: Xander
text: You monster! Do you really mean to kill them? Even the youngest ones?!

speaker: Zola
text: But of course! King Garon will be so proud when I tell him of my triumph! When I heard the Hoshidan royals were attending a royal banquet in Izumo... I used my incomparable illusive magic to take the archduke's place. Genius, no? Then it was only a matter of time until the Hoshidans crawled into my web, hyo-ho.

speaker: Xander
text: That's despicable, even for you.

speaker: Zola
text: No more flattery, please! I'll blush! Now we can capture Hoshido once and for all. I bet the king will grant me a new title! If you'll excuse me, I have some very important death sentencing to do.

speaker: Xander
text: Zola, halt! ZOLA!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... Wh-what are we going to do?

speaker: Xander
text: Don't worry, Corrin. I won't allow this treachery to go unpunished. Hoshido may be our enemy, but to murder its royals while they are unarmed... I won't have us win the war this way. We will win with honor or die trying. Come, Brother/Sister. Let us go set free our sworn enemy.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm with you all the way, Xander. You really are my hero. I hope you know. ...Heh heh.

speaker: Xander
text: Was that a guffaw I heard? Out with it, little prince/princess. What's so funny?

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh, sorry... It's just that you and Ryoma really are so much alike. If you weren't on opposite sides of a war, I think you could have been great friends.

speaker: Xander
text: Yeesh... Do me a favor and keep that nonsense in your head where it belongs. Now, to the task at hand. Gather our troops and prepare for battle. Zola isn't one to postpone violence. We haven't much time.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm on it!

speaker: Garon
text: So Iago has failed yet again. Pitiful. I'll have to dispose of him one of these days... No matter. Plan B will spring into action anytime now. Oh...and to see the look on Corrin's face when it does... Bwahahaha!

speaker: Elise
text: No, Father... How could you?

speaker: Xander
text: Hello, Elise. Might I ask what you're doing out here?

speaker: Elise
text: Gah! Xander, don't spook me like that.

speaker: Xander
text: Be honest—were you spying on Father?

speaker: Elise
text: ... Yes.

speaker: Xander
text: Elise. You should know better. Father would not be pleased if he found out someone was listening in on him. Even you would likely face some unpleasant consequences.

speaker: Elise
text: I know. It's just... *sob*

speaker: Xander
text: Elise! What's wrong?

speaker: Elise
text: I don't know what to do! Corrin is gone... Leo is gone... Camilla is so depressed that she hardly even leaves her quarters. What's happened to our family, Xander? How can we go back to the way things were?

speaker: Xander
text: Elise... Don't worry, Sister. When this war is over, everything will go back to normal.

speaker: Elise
text: *sniffle* R-really? But how can you be so sure?

speaker: Xander
text: Because I believe. That's why I can keep fighting in the face of heartache. We must all believe that what we're doing is for the greater good... We must trust in our cause and fight for it with all we have! That's all we can do, at least for now.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Well, we had to take the long way around, but we're finally here. This ferry will take us right to your childhood home, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know. I'm having a hard time believing this is really happening.

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, well, don't get too nostalgic or anything. As soon as we step off this boat, there won't be any place to hide.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. We should begin preparing for battle now. There won't be any time to rest once we reach the dock.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Before we get to that, I need to brief you on something, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Just before we boarded this vessel, I received a message from Yukimura.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really? How is that possible?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: He sent a young pegasus rider from the Bottomless Canyon to find us. Both rider and steed appeared exhausted. Sakura is tending to them now.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. So, what was the message?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's bad news, I'm afraid. Yukimura reports that the royal troops are still holding the line in Hoshido. But it appears that soldiers from Mokushu have joined Nohr in attacking us. It sounds like it's only a matter of time until our defenses are breached.

speaker: Corrin
text: No!

speaker: Ryoma
text: It gets worse. That message is at least several weeks old. I wouldn't be surprised to find that the situation has deteriorated even further.

speaker: Corrin
text: It sounds like we don't have much time left. We need to defeat Garon and end this war before our castle falls. How long until we reach our destination?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Another day—maybe two. According to the captain, we need to go far upstream to reach a docking point.

speaker: Takumi
text: But...according to the map that the Rainbow Sage gave us...our destination is directly across the river from us. Why can't we go straight there?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm. I'm not sure. The captain didn't indicate that we had any options.

speaker: Takumi
text: Look. Right there. A port marked Demon's Fall on the map.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Demon's Fall? Show me!

speaker: Corrin
text: He's right. It's handwritten very faintly, right there. Have you heard of the place, Ryoma?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, but I believed it to be a legend. They say it's a waterfall made of fire, which seemed too fantastical to be true.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps it's worth checking out. It could save us a few precious days.

speaker: Takumi
text: Well, we better decide quickly. We're coming up on a fork in the river!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I believe it's worth a shot. What do you say, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I agree. We must act quickly...or else there may no longer BE a Hoshido to save. I think we're ready to take on anything we might find at Demon's Fall. Who's with me?

speaker: Ryoma
text: We're all with you, Corrin! I'll inform the captain.

speaker: Ryoma
text: By gods...the waterfall IS on fire!

speaker: Jakob
text: Yes. It is a strange phenomenon, but I can explain how it came to be. There is a massive reservoir of oil nearby that has mixed with the water. At some point, hundreds of years ago, the river was set aflame. It may have been a lightning strike, or an accident, but regardless... It has burned ever since. All of us living in Nohr have avoided the general area, for obvious reasons. So naturally, there doesn't appear to be any sort of a path for us to follow.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin, do you see that statue over there? I feel the presence of a Dragon Vein nearby...maybe even two!

speaker: Jakob
text: Be careful! I also sense a hostile presence in the area...

speaker: Stoneborn
text: None shall pass. Your life ends...here.

speaker: Corrin
text: What's happening? Is this another of Iago's traps?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin, look!

speaker: Corrin
text: A cave! That wasn't here before, was it?

speaker: Felicia
text: Jakob, is that...what I think it is?

speaker: Jakob
text: Yes, this must be it.

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you two talking about? Care to enlighten the rest of us?

speaker: Jakob
text: Do you feel that breeze? It's fresh air, coming from that passageway. Unless I'm mistaken, it will take us directly to the capital of Nohr, Windmire. There were rumors of such a thing, but I never knew it actually existed...

speaker: Corrin
text: That's...that's good news, right?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, if what they suspect is true, this passage would be a massive shortcut.

speaker: Jakob
text: The air is unmistakable. But I don't see why the path would lead here...

speaker: Ryoma
text: The Rainbow Sage must have known about this.

speaker: Sakura
text: O-or maybe he built the secret path himself!

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah? Well then why didn't he just tell us about it? Sure woulda saved us a lot of trouble and guesswork...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hey! The Rainbow Sage gave us a hand-drawn map. What else do you want from the guy?

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, yeah. I know. Maybe he didn't tell us directly becaus he knew we still had a rat problem. I can just see the traitor now, telling the Nohrians our EXACT route...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi...do you truly believe there is still a spy among us?

speaker: Takumi
text: I'd like to believe not, but...we haven't exactly had the best luck so far.

speaker: Ryoma
text: There's no time to debate this. Not when we're about to enter Nohr proper. Now is a time for unity, not division.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's right. We're probably going to have to face off against Xander and Camilla soon... But I'm prepared to fight even them, if I have to. Hear me, King Garon—we're coming for you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, this should be interesting. I've never sailed before. And we made it just in time to catch the last boat leaving the harbor. How lucky!

speaker: Sakura
text: I know. It's been such a long march—I'm really looking forward to r-resting a bit.

speaker: Azura
text: I wouldn't get too comfortable. Remember, we are on our way to Nohr. Some of the passengers on this ship could be our enemies.

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes, and there could be a spy among us.

speaker: Azura
text: What are you talking about, Takumi?

speaker: Takumi
text: You know exactly what I'm talking about. That whiny little mage from Nohr! Whose idea was it to let him tag along?

speaker: Zola
text: Gah! I'm no threat, guys! I promise! Haven't I been helpful so far?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Don't worry, Takumi. I've been keeping a very close eye on him.

speaker: Takumi
text: I don't know. Didn't he set everyone up back in Izumo? I wouldn't be surprised if he were plotting something.

speaker: Zola
text: But...but...

speaker: Hinoka
text: OK, I'll get my knife ready...

speaker: Zola
text: Eeeek!

speaker: Corrin
text: Calm down, everyone. I trust Zola, and I believe you should as well. He stood with us through one battle without stabbing anyone in the back. Besides, how could he even really information to Nohr? It's a preposterous notion.

speaker: Takumi
text: Sorry. I can't just take your word for it. I don't trust him.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's fine. A little healthy skepticism won't hurt. Just try to be civil, OK?

speaker: Takumi
text: I'll do my best.

speaker: Zola
text: Lord Takumi...

speaker: Takumi
text: What's wrong with you? Did I say that you could speak my name?

speaker: Zola
text: Gah! No, sir. I'm sorry, sir.

speaker: Sakura
text: Well, petty disagreements aside, we've had smooth sailing so far, don't you agree? The captain even says we could reach Nohr tomorrow with favorable winds.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's great news. Although, to be honest, I wouldn't mind a longer trip. It's so relaxing out here.

speaker: Sakura
text: N-not for me. I've been feeling a little seasick, to be honest. But it looks like you've really taken to the sea. You've been out here for hours!

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps when all of this is over, I'll buy my own boat... Although...it does appear that the weather is turning on us.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh! You're right. Those clouds don't look good. And look at the w-waves!

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Let's head inside before we get soaked!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa. It's really roughs out there.

speaker: Sakura
text: Ahhhh! We've stopped moving! How is that even possible? Are you OK, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yeah, I'm fine. But we really need to get out of here! Maybe there's a problem with the boat. Let's go speak with the captain.

speaker: Corrin
text: I've never seen a storm come on this quickly. Is this normal at sea?

speaker: Sakura
text: I don't think so. I'm s-scared, Corrin. My goodness! Look at the sea! Those waves are massive! This boat is too big to capsize, right? Right?

speaker: Corrin
text: Stand back! There's something in the water!

speaker: Sakura
text: Eeeek!

speaker: Corrin
text: What is it?
Shh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Who goes there? Are...are you the spirit who appeared when my mother was killed?
Shh...

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! What's going on?

speaker: Corrin
text: Stay back, Azura!

speaker: Kaze
text: Milady! Are you OK?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, I'm fine. Thank you, Kaze!

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! What is that thing?

speaker: Corrin
text: Your guess is as good as mine. A storm came out of nowhere, and then this spirit appeared on deck.

speaker: Azura
text: Maybe it came out of the water...

speaker: Kaze
text: Well, it looks like we have a fight on our hands. Whatever this spirit is, it seems capable of sinking our ship!

speaker: Corrin
text: We've come too far for that. Everyone, on guard!

speaker: Reina
text: Ah, at last. I can see Lord/Lady Corrin from here. Oh my. Look at them struggling with those spirits. Well, I should be able to help them with that! May my bow strike true and deliver exquisite pain and death upon my enemies!

speaker: Reina
text: Hello, Lord/Lady Corrin. I'm glad you're safe and sound.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, but who are you? And do you realize that we're in the middle of a battle?

speaker: Reina
text: Oh, yes, of course. But this type of battle is like a playground to me. I'm Reina, a kinshi knight from Hoshido. Yukimura sent me here to provide you with my special brand of assistance. Specifically, skewering enemies by the dozen. Oh, I wish you could have seen some of the work I did on the way here. The depth of agony was palpable. And the palette of violent reds...so vivid. Mmm...

speaker: Corrin
text: Uh... What?

speaker: Reina
text: I'm talking about the enemies I killed on the way here.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah. I see. And you're not going to kill any of us, right? Just our enemies?

speaker: Reina
text: Of course! I'm sorry if you misunderstood. Please, just point me in the direction of anything you would like to die.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Well, anyone glowing purple would be a good start...

speaker: Corrin
text: That's the last of them.

speaker: Takumi
text: Ha! Those stupid things didn't know who they were messing with.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I'm glad to see that you're feeling like yourself again. Takumi.

speaker: Takumi
text: Me too. After all, I have a long way to go to redeem myself...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi, that's simply not true.
Shh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Look out!

speaker: Takumi
text: Hmm?

speaker: Zola
text: Lord Takumi! Move!

speaker: Takumi
text: He saved me!

speaker: Zola
text: Ugh...now's your chance. Take him out!

speaker: Takumi
text: With pleasure. Haaaa!
Ugh...

speaker: Takumi
text: That did it.

speaker: Zola
text: Well done...Lord...Takumi... Oh...I forgot. I'm not supposed to say your name... *cough* *cough*

speaker: Takumi
text: Oh. About that...

speaker: Sakura
text: Zola! Are you OK? Took quite a shot there. Here, I can help heal your wounds.

speaker: Zola
text: Thank you, milady...

speaker: Takumi
text: Hmm.

speaker: Corrin
text: That was extremely courageous, Zola. Are you all right?

speaker: Zola
text: It was nothing. I'm just glad that Lady Sakura was able to heal me.

speaker: Corrin
text: I beg to differ. It was not nothing. It was a remarkably selfless act.

speaker: Takumi
text: Zola...I have something to say to you.

speaker: Zola
text: Yes, Lord Tak—I mean yes, milord?

speaker: Takumi
text: Please. You've more than earned the right to speak my name. I'm sorry for doubting you.

speaker: Zola
text: Really? You mean that?

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes. Talk is cheap, and I still think I was smart not to trust you at first. But you may have just saved my life. It was a heroic act.

speaker: Zola
text: Thank you, Lord Takumi! I'm just following Lord/Lady Corrin's lead. If it weren't for him/her, I may have died at the hands of Lord Leo in Izumo. Now maybe you'll have the chance to perform a similar gesture.

speaker: Takumi
text: Wait, Corrin jumped in front of an attack meant for you? Right after you tried to kill him/her?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha! No, Takumi. It wasn't exactly like that. I merely asked Leo to spare Zola's life. He was helpless and defeated.

speaker: Zola
text: Yes. And that kindness was enough to sway Lord Leo. He merely exiled me instead of taking my life.

speaker: Takumi
text: I see. Well, I just hope we can put all of this behind us.

speaker: Zola
text: Of course, milord!

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. It's time to focus on what's next. Who knows what's waiting for us in Nohr...

speaker: Corrin
text: Is everyone ready? This will be our most trying battle yet, but it should hopefully be our last. I urge you to stay on your guard.

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin... Are you really, completely, absolutely sure about all this? About Father being a m-monster?

speaker: Corrin
text: I wish it weren't so, Elise. But it's true. King Garon is no longer of this world. I know it's not easy to hear, but that is what Azura and I have discovered.

speaker: Leo
text: Hmm... You sound pretty sure of yourself, but I can't help but be skeptical. Why didn't you tell us earlier? Why keep it a secret? And why are you two the only ones who know about this alleged truth?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's...it's hard to explain...

speaker: Azura
text: There are answers to your questions, Leo, but we are unable to disclose them. All we can say is that the two of us were able to see through King Garon's disguise. We had to come here, to this throne room, in order to show you what we have seen.

speaker: Camilla
text: We had to come all the way here just to learn the truth? Really, darling?

speaker: Corrin
text: Really. I know how it sounds, but it's the truth! I couldn't have made it through all this if I wasn't completely sure. I've been longing for this moment when I could finally share this with you. Xander and Leo...Elise and Camilla... All of you... I know we've been through a lot, and this is a huge shock, but please... I'm begging you to believe me. I need you to see what's behind these doors with your own eyes.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm... So be it, Corrin. You have led us this far. The least we can do is follow you just a little farther. I am choosing to trust you, Brother/Sister. However, you know what will happen if this all turns out to be an elaborate ruse. If you mean to trap us, your siblings who have loved you all these years... You will be punished, just like any other traitor. I will not allow anyone, even you, to bring harm to my family or the kingdom of Nohr. If you can accept those terms, as I trust you will, let us proceed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course, Xander. If I were lying, I would deserve no better than a traitor's death. Let's go... I need all of you to see this. To see what Father, the great King Garon, has become...

speaker: Xander
text: Father...?

speaker: Leo
text: How could—?

speaker: Garon
text: So...you've seen my true form...

speaker: Elise
text: FATHER?! Please, no!!

speaker: Camilla
text: This...can't be... What's happening to him?!

speaker: Azura
text: Those who sit upon that throne cannot hide the truth within. Behold King Garon's true form!

speaker: Garon
text: Curse you, traitors! How dare you trick your king!! You will pay for this indiscretion! All who see me like this must diiiiie!!

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh! Father... Why?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, stay strong! We have to fight!! If we back down now, he'll kill us all! HYAAAAA!!

speaker: Garon
text: Hmph. Pathetic!

speaker: Corrin
text: Wh-what's happening? The Yato isn't doing any damage!

speaker: Garon
text: You expected to defeat me with a mere child's toy? HA!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin!

speaker: Elise
text: NO! This is too awful!! *sob* Please, Father! Stop this!

speaker: Azura
text: Elise, now is no time to cry! We need you to fight too!

speaker: Camilla
text: You don't understand, Azura... Although we can see the truth, it's not so easy to attack the man we've called... I can't accept that Father is really gone forever... I just...

speaker: Leo
text: Camilla is right. Whatever has happened to him, he's still our father. I don't know if I can do this...

speaker: Azura
text: You can't be serious! Don't you see what he has become?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Everyone, please! I need you to put aside your disbelief and lend me your strength! This thing is not the man you think he is. This is not Nohr's proud King Garon! All that remains is a monster that has taken over his heart and soul!

speaker: Garon
text: MWAHAHAHAHAAA! My children will not be swayed by a pathetic orphan like you! Time to die, Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!

speaker: Garon
text: What is the meaning of this?! You dare point your blade at ME, Crown Prince?

speaker: Xander
text: Silence! Do not speak as though you know me, foul beast.

speaker: Garon
text: What?!

speaker: Xander
text: You are no longer the father I once looked up to. All has become clear. I know...knew my father better than anyone. I always wondered what changed his heart, made it grow cold. Now I know. When I was a young boy, my father was strong and brave... Stern, but fair. But for all his power, he would never have used his strength against his own children. He would never have needlessly conquered or ruined another kingdom!

speaker: Garon
text: Fool! You know nothing.

speaker: Xander
text: It is you who knows nothing! Of my father, of me, or of my brother/sister here. All this time, I have strived to be a good son and a worthy heir. I have faithfully followed your orders, even when doing so tortured my soul. I brushed aside my early memories of Father and accepted you as our king. I fought in your name, hoping one day you would reawaken as the man you once were. But that man is dead and has been for a long time now...

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... I'm so sorry. But you're right—this is not the Father you once loved. Fight with me, Brother! If you don't, everyone we love will die. We've come too far to lose heart now! Father, rest his soul, wouldn't want this monster further soiling his legacy!

speaker: Xander
text: Right you are, Corrin. That is why I shall once more fight at your side. Just like my father would have—with strength and pride. I will defeat this pretender and restore true peace to this world!

speaker: Xander
text: What's this? My Siegfried...the blade is...

speaker: Corrin
text: Could it be...?!

speaker: Xander
text: The light... It's growing brighter.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's happening again!

speaker: Leo
