text: Wow, that light... It's just like when my Brynhildr joined power with the Yato!

speaker: Corrin
text: Does that mean...it's about to change form once more? Whaa... What's...happening...!!

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: My sword! The...power!!

speaker: Xander
text: What's wrong, Corrin? Are you all right?!

speaker: Corrin
text: The power—it's flowing through me... Becoming part of me... The power of your Siegfried...and Leo's Brynhildr... Our weapons have joined forces to unlock the Seal of Flames! It is as the Rainbow Sage prophesied... And this new blade...it's whispering its name to me... In my hands, reborn, I grasp the legendary Shadow Yato!

speaker: Xander
text: The Shadow Yato... It's a fitting name. Use its might to reclaim our dear kingdom, which Father once ruled and we will inherit.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Xander... I finally have the strength now... I feel divine energy coursing through me, warming my heart and tempering my soul.

speaker: Garon
text: Fools! Ingrates!! Come at me with a sacred blade or a wooden stick, it matters not. I will kill you all where you stand!

speaker: Corrin
text: We won't let that happen, not now or ever! HYAAAA!!

speaker: Garon
text: What?! NOOO!! Im...PoSs...IbLe...!! I...I...I aM tHe KiNg! I WoN't fALL to A...a...cHilLd...!!

speaker: Xander
text: It is time to end your reign of terror. Camilla, Leo, Elise! Do not stay idly by while Corrin battles for his/her life and yours. If you are truly Nohrian royals, then stand up and fight! Fight for our kingdom and for our world... Fight for each other...and for our father. In his memory, let us defeat the beast who destroyed him!

speaker: Leo
text: Xander... You're right. I lost my nerve for a moment, but I understand now. As a Nohrian royal, I will fight for all we hold dear, I will fight until we have won!

speaker: Camilla
text: It hurts...so very much, but if we win this battle... Perhaps Father's spirit will be able to rest in peace. I have to believe that.

speaker: Elise
text: This monster... He's the only father I've ever known... But I want to protect the people I love! I won't let them die! Forgive me, Father, but... I'm through listening to you!

speaker: Corrin
text: I believe in you, my brothers and sisters. We will not let this beast prevail! We will fight, and together we shall rid the world of this ancient evil! This evil that has crept into our world and forced Nohr and Hoshido into futile war... We will save the world and free the real King Garon's imprisoned spirit!

speaker: Garon
text: I...WiLl nOt LoSe... I WiLl RuLe nOhR aNd hOsHiDo...tHe wHoLe WoRld!! I aM tHe GrEaTeSt KiNg Of aLl!!

speaker: Garon
text: tHiS iS...ImPoSsIBlE... IMPOSSIBLE!!

speaker: Garon
text: i ShOuLd hAvE KiLlEd YoU... EvEn If iT mEaNt...DisObEyInG tHe GrEaT AnAnKoS...

speaker: Corrin
text: Anankos? What are you talking about?! Your god has nothing to do with this! We all make our own decisions. You are responsible for all of this, monster! You destroyed the heart of a good man for your own selfish gain. But even you could have chosen a different path. No matter the circumstances we are born into, or the blood in our veins... We are all the masters of our own fate! That is why I am not like you, nor could I ever be. I chose the path I believe in, the path of peace. And that conviction, that strength... I will use that power to defeat you!

speaker: Xander
text: ...Rest in peace, Father.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... We did the right thing. I know in my heart this was the only way to save him. I just wish...I could have gotten to know the real Garon. Good-bye...Father... ...

speaker: Corrin
text: That's it, my dear friends and siblings. We won the war! Quickly, let's free the remaining Hoshidan soldiers and release the prisoners—

speaker: Takumi
text: Betrayal...betrayal... I am betrayal!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi?! You're alive! But...what happened to you?

speaker: Takumi
text: The pain of betrayal... Yours and mine... It burns... BURNS!! I must... I WILL...kill you... KILL YOU...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi, snap out of it! Please...

speaker: Takumi
text: I will...kill you...lost brother/sister... Die, Corrin!!

speaker: Takumi
text: Betrayal... Death... Murder... Betrayal... Death... Murder...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi, stop this! The war is over! King Garon has been defeated!! Please, Brother! There's no reason to fight each other anymore!

speaker: Takumi
text: War...betrayal...death...murder... That is all there is... I will not...be swayed... War...betrayal...death...

speaker: Corrin
text: Dammit, Takumi! Please, stop this madness and listen to me for a change!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, wait! I'm afraid he can't be reasoned with. You're not going to want to hear this, but... I believe he is possessed by something, just as King Garon was.

speaker: Corrin
text: No! Please, it can't be so...

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, Corrin, but look at him! The way he's moving and speaking... Takumi is...no longer with us. I'm afraid it's too late to save him. I'm guessing when he threw himself off the Great Wall of Suzanoh he was already—

speaker: Corrin
text: No! I can't accept that!! Are you saying I must now defeat my own brother? Killing my father wasn't enough?!

speaker: Azura
text: *sigh* Yes, that is what I am saying. I'm so sorry...

speaker: Corrin
text: This can't be happening...

speaker: Takumi
text: It's all your fault... Hoshido is dead... All...your...fault!! You destroyed...my kingdom...my family... If you die...I can rest... If you die...the pain... The pain will stop...if I kill you!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi!! Please, my brother. Please don't cry...

speaker: Azura
text: We have to fight him, Corrin. His mind is...not well. The monster has latched on to his regrets, to his resentment and bitterness. His heart and mind have been pushed past the point of no return. We have to stop him before more innocent lives are lost.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait! Don't move.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi has every right to be angry with me. I am to blame for much of the heartache in his life... I chose this path. I do not regret it...but I must take responsibility for it. There's only one way to do that...

speaker: Azura
text: Y-you don't intend to— ?! Wait, Corrin! It's too dangerous! Please! Come back!!

speaker: Takumi
text: Corrin... Betrayal... Death... Must...kill you...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... I know I've never been there for you like a brother/sister should... I've caused you much suffering, and I couldn't save you at the Great Wall... This all grieves me more than you will ever know, but I will not fall here on this day. I won't let you kill me, but the very least I can do...is accept all of your anger.

speaker: Takumi
text: Death! Murder! BETRAYAL!! I will kill you, Corrin! I...WILL...KILL YOU!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! If you're going to aim that thing at anyone, aim it at me. I'm the one you want! Go on then. Loose your arrow, brother!

speaker: Takumi
text: DIIIIIEEEE!!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin!!

speaker: Elise
text: NOOOOO!! Corrin?! Corrin!!

speaker: Xander
text: How could one arrow be so powerful?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Don't worry... I'm...fine... After all I've...been through... That's not enough...to stop me... Ryoma is...counting on me... Takumi! Th-that wasn't enough...was it? To quell your hatred of me... Hit me again...my brother... Do what you need...to do...

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin?! Corrin!!

speaker: Silas
text: We've finally made it to the port. So far, so good. From here we can catch a ferry to Notre Sagesse. Felicia/Jakob's off making the arrangements as we speak.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wonderful. We should all take this rare opportunity to relax for a bit. Azura in particular looks exhausted.

speaker: Silas
text: I noticed too. Well, it hasn't been an easy journey here. But there's also... Well, let's just say Lady Elise has grown awfully found of her. In fact, Lady Elise has been talking to her almost nonstop since they met. Lady Azura is very polite, but I worry all that chatter is wearing her out.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha ha, you may have a point. Poor Azura doesn't stand a chance. Once Elise gets going, it's hard to stop her. She's a one-woman stampede.

speaker: Silas
text: It's as though she's trying to make up for all the sibling time they missed out on. It's rather heartwarming when you think about it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sibling time, eh? Hmm...

speaker: Silas
text: Ah! I'm so sorry, Corrin. I didn't mean to remind you of your own siblings in Hoshido. Please forgive me for making such an insensitive comment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, don't worry about it. I was actually thinking of something else.

speaker: Silas
text: What's wrong, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Oh! It's nothing. I was just lost in thought.

speaker: Silas
text: Are you sure there's nothing... Oh, look at that! Felicia/Jakob has returned. Oh dear/That's strange, she/he appears to be out of breath. I wonder what's wrong...

speaker: Felicia
text: Emergency! EMERGENCY!! Hoshidan f-forces are heading our way. They'll be here any minute!

speaker: Corrin
text: The Hoshidans? Here?! Felicia, are you sure?

speaker: Felicia
text: Yes, milord, I'm afraid so. I overheard one of the guards say so on my way here. He also said they're holding all the ferries until they've left. This is bad! Really bad! What are we going to do, Lord Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Fighting is our only option. We have to beat them and get on that ferry. It's the only way we'll be able to carry out Father's mission. But...

speaker: Felicia
text: What is it, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: When we fought the Hoshidans at Fort Dragonfall, they were only strangers. I haven't had to face Ryoma and the others, not since that fateful day when I... I know it's inevitable, but the thought of fighting my blood siblings... I just...

speaker: Felicia
text: Lord Corrin... I don't know what to say. It's a difficult position, isn't it? I'd understand completely if you decided you didn't want to fight them. If it's causing you so much pain, let's just turn around and go home.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Felicia, but I'm afraid it's not that simple. Sooner or later we all must face the consequences of our actions. I knew this would happen when I followed my heart and sided with my Nohrian family. I must stand behind that decision no matter what. I will not run.

speaker: Felicia
text: I understand. Very well then. I'll tell Lady Elise and the others to prepare for battle.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please do.

speaker: Jakob
text: Milady, we have an emergency situation on our hands! Hoshidan forces are heading our way. They shall arrive momentarily.

speaker: Corrin
text: The Hoshidans? Here?! Jakob, are you sure?

speaker: Jakob
text: I'm afraid so. I overheard as much from a guard on my way here. The guard also said all ferries are being denied until they've left. What would you like to do, milady?

speaker: Corrin
text: ... Fighting is our only option. We have to beat them and get on that ferry. It's the only way we'll be able to carry out Father's mission. But...

speaker: Jakob
text: What's wrong, Lady Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: When we fought the Hoshidans at Fort Dragonfall, they were only strangers. I haven't had to face Ryoma and the others, not since that fateful day when I... I know it's inevitable, but the thought of fighting my blood siblings... I just...

speaker: Jakob
text: Lady Corrin... I hate to see you in such agony. None of us would judge if you chose not to engage in battle against your siblings. Instead of tormenting yourself, why don't we just turn around and go home?

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Jakob, but I'm afraid it's not that simple. Sooner or later we all must face the consequences of our actions. I knew this would happen when I followed my heart and sided with my Nohrian family. I must stand behind that decision no matter what. I will not run.

speaker: Jakob
text: Understood, milady. I'll let the others know what's happened so they can prepare for battle.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please do.

speaker: Corrin
text: ... Making up for lost time with lost siblings... the battlefield is a poor place for that. Perhaps in another life, things could have turned out differently. Please forgive me, Ryoma... Takumi... Please forgive me...

speaker: Takumi
text: You abandoned your family, and Hoshido... Now, pay for your betrayal!

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that... Takumi?! Wow, he's not just fighting, he's leading the whole army! Still, I meant what I said. Even if Takumi is involved, we must defend this port. This is Nohrian territory. I won't allow the Hoshidans to take our homeland from us!

speaker: Hinata
text: Lord Takumi! It seems the Nohrians aren't going to back down.

speaker: Takumi
text: So they plan to fight us, do they? I suppose I shouldn't be surprised. Nohrians aren't like normal, decent people. They live for the thrill of battle. All the better. I shall delight in putting those cowards in their place.

speaker: Oboro
text: It looks like there's only a handful of them anyway. Should be an easy win.

speaker: Takumi
text: Agreed. Even so, it's never a good idea to underestimate one's enemy. I refuse to lose to the Nohrians, especially while that traitor is among their ranks. We must prevail, for the sake of Hoshido and all that is good in the world!

speaker: Old Woman
text: Say what? This town is caught up in the war between Nohr and Hoshido? Blast it all, what a pain in the patoot. Guess I'll hole up until things settle. Thanks for letting me know. Please take this with you.

speaker: Old Man
text: Eh? This town is now a battlefield, you say? What in tarnation... It does seem dangerous out there. Alrighty, I'll lock up tight, then. Thanks for the warning, stranger. Here, take this.

speaker: Girl
text: Oh dear! I've heard rumors about the war, but I never thought it would reach us here. I'll lock up tight and keep the little ones indoors today. Here, please take this as a token of my gratitude. I don't need it anyway.

speaker: Boy
text: Dang, I had a feeling somethin' was up when I heard all that commotion. Never thought this town would see war... well, th-thanks for the heads-up. Really, you might have saved my life. This is for you. Go on, I insist!

speaker: Selena
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! Are these ridiculous Hoshidans giving you a hard time? You're so hopeless, heh heh. Lucky for you we're here to bail you out.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Who are you two? You don't seem like enemies, but...

speaker: Selena
text: Wow. Really? Just wow. I cannot BELIEVE you've forgotten about me. You monster! Beruka! Say something, dammit!

speaker: Corrin
text: Aww, she's shy, isn't she? Beruka, is it? It's nice to meet you!

speaker: Beruka
text: ... You're heartless. A heartless monster.

speaker: Corrin
text: Whaaa?! Why would you say that? Who are you people, anyway?!

speaker: Camilla
text: There you are, my naughty little retainers. Even though I said we were in a rush, that's no excuse to leave me behind!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla!

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin! Oh, I'm so glad we made it in time. Tell your big sister the truth - did these foul creatures make you cry? Be honest!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha ha, of course not! I'm fine, promise!

speaker: Selena
text: Lady Camilla! Sorry we got ahead of you. But you should have heard the horrible things Lord/Lady Corrin said to us. Even though we used to watch over him/her, he/she doesn't remember us at all. Sure, we always stuck to the shadows and never introduced ourselves... but still! I could cry right now. Really! I really could!

speaker: Beruka
text: All that time hovering... caring... watching... it was all for naught. He/She has no heart.

speaker: Camilla
text: Now, now, you two. I'm sure he/she didn't mean to hurt your feelings. I'm certain he/she would remember, given more time. You simply must forgive him/her. Now that all that's settled, let me introduce my lovely retainers to you, Corrin. Say hello to Selena and Beruka. Aren't they tough yet adorable?! I love them so.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's nice to meet you. I mean, to see you again. I'm really sorry I upset you both. Wait... Camilla, if you're here, does that mean you finished your mission already?

speaker: Camilla
text: Heh heh, well, in a sense. Xander and Leo are taking care of it for me. They really liked the idea of me coming to help you. That's our little secret, OK? Now I can destroy any nasty people try to harm my darling baby brother/sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's sweet... if not a little scary. Thank you, Camilla. And you too, Selena and Beruka. I appreciate your help.

speaker: Selena
text: I guess I'll do my best to protect you or whatever. I'm still pretty angry though.

speaker: Beruka
text: I'll kill them all. For Lady Camilla.

speaker: Hinata
text: I'm gonna give this fight all I've got for Lord Takumi! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Hinata
text: Bah! Guess I'll... have to retreat... This isn't over!

speaker: Oboro
text: I'll strike down anyone who dares lay so much as a finger on Lord Takumi!

speaker: Oboro
text: I must retreat... Forgive me, Lord Takumi...

speaker: Takumi
text: On my honor as a prince of Hoshido, I shall not fall upon a Nohrian's blade!

speaker: Takumi
text: No! How could... this happen? Forced to retreat... again...

speaker: Hinata
text: Well, lookee here. Looks like we got a Nohrian pig on our hands. Corrin, right? Or do you prefer Lord/Lady Traitor?

speaker: Corrin
text: Traitor? Is that what Takumi told you? I might have expected as much.

speaker: Hinata
text: Milord calls it like he sees it. He told me all about your lies and betrayal. As Lord Takumi's retainer, it's my job to punish those who cause him pain. Besides, I can't forgive you for what you did to Hoshido either. That's why I'm pleased to pieces to be the one to show you to your grave!

speaker: Oboro
text: Wait... Aren't you Corrin? Lord Takumi's brother/sister? I don't believe we've met. I'm Oboro, his retainer. Usually I'd be under orders to protect you. Sadly, that's not the case today... Today we meet as enemies, so you'll have to forgive what I'm about to do.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand, as I feel precisely the same way. It's truly a shame, isn't it? Oh, um... By the way, you should know you're making a really strange face.

speaker: Oboro
text: Huh? Ah, sorry about that. I do so despise Nohrians. So much so, in fact, that my face turns sour whenever I'm looking at one. Don't worry about it. It's nothing personal.

speaker: Corrin
text: So strange...

speaker: Takumi
text: Any last words, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... In your heart you must know this is the last thing I ever wanted.

speaker: Takumi
text: Ah, how quaint. More pretty words from the Prince/Princess of Betrayal. How can you stand to live after the horrors you caused in Hoshido? My suspicions must be accurate. Nohrians don't have souls.

speaker: Corrin
text: Words could never express my sorrow for what took place...

speaker: Takumi
text: Oh? Are you still human enough to feel remorse? Fascinating. It's a fitting last emotion. I hope you feel its sting as I strike you down!

speaker: Takumi
text: Azura?! Last I heard, you were taken by Hoshidan soldiers. Ryoma worried himself sick planning your rescue. I told him it was pointless. And you proved me right, you Nohrian traitor. You should be ashamed.

speaker: Azura
text: I could not return to Hoshido, Takumi. Not with things as they are. It saddened me deeply to leave behind those who treated me so kindly.

speaker: Takumi
text: You sound just like the royal traitor. I always knew this would happen. That's why I never trusted you. Didn't you always wonder? Had I known your betrayal would come so swiftly, I'd have killed you myself. Still, I should have pressed Ryoma harder to banish you years ago.

speaker: Azura
text: Your grudge is clearly beyond words. Let us do what we came here to do.

speaker: Takumi
text: Dammit! This is unacceptable! We can't push forward with so many of our troops injured. This can't be happening...

speaker: Corrin
text: Please listen to reason, Takumi. You've lost this battle. Do your soldiers a favor and order them to retreat from this port immediately. You may all keep your lives and your dignity if you leave now.

speaker: Takumi
text: Humph! How very generous of you, dear brother/sister. But I know better. The savage Nohrian army knows nothing of mercy.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps you should take this as a lesson not to judge all Nohrians on face value. I spoke the truth. My soldiers do not harm those who do not seek to harm us.

speaker: Takumi
text: Ha! Tell me, Corrin, how is it lies come so easily to you? Your words mean nothing in light of all the innocent Hoshidan lives you took. Including that of our dear mother, or have you forgotten your part in her murder? Yet after all that, you still have the gall to claim you aren't a savage. Pathetic.

speaker: Camilla
text: My, what a rude little boy you are. I should beat some manners into you. Take back what you just said, or that's exactly what I'll do...

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Camilla. He is entitled to his anger. I am at least partly to blame for the tragedies that took place that day.

speaker: Takumi
text: That's right! If you hadn't come back into our lives, Hoshido would still be at peace. Mother... all those innocent townspeople... they would still be alive. They wouldn't have... ARGH! NOOO!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! What's wrong?!

speaker: Takumi
text: M-my head... the pain is... ARGHHH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi!

speaker: Takumi
text: DON'T YOU TOUCH ME! K-keep your filthy Nohrian hands off of me!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... please, let me help!

speaker: Takumi
text: Don't think this means you've won. This is only the beginning! Ryoma has already found the Rainbow Sage and received his power. You're no match for him now, even with the whole vile Nohrian army behind you! And I'm getting stronger, too! Soon I'll be unstoppable. One day you'll beg me for death, and I will happily grant you. Until then, I leave you with your guilt.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! Wait! ...

speaker: Camilla
text: Let him go, Corrin. He's clearly got issues. And not to brag, but Xander received the Rainbow Sage's power ages ago. If we stick together, there's no way we'll lose to the Hoshidan army.

speaker: Corrin
text: I hope you're right...

speaker: Elise
text: Erm, sorry to interrupt, but it looks like the ferries are up and running again. Let's get out of this dump and head to Notre Sagesse. I'll even tell you a fun story I made up about two caterpillars on a little leaf boat.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Elise. You've got yourself a deal. In any case, I need to put this all behind me and focus on the task at hand. If what Father said is true, we'll be facing Hoshidan forces in Notre Sagesse as well. There's no time to overthink things... No time for guilt or regret. Well, what are we waiting for? Let's get going!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods...these stairs seem to go on forever.

speaker: Azura
text: Indeed. But what did you expect? This is the Eternal Stairway. Not to worry—we've almost reached the halfway point.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. I suppose there is no Five-Minute Stairway we could have taken instead.

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, please be silent for a moment...

speaker: Corrin
text: Yeah, that fell a bit flat. Sorry.

speaker: Kaze
text: No, that's not it. I'm sensing an unusual presence. I think we're being followed.

speaker: Corrin
text: How is that possible? I haven't seen any signs of life...

speaker: Kaze
text: Attention! Whoever you are! Show yourself now if you wish to avoid conflict!

speaker: Corrin
text: Faceless! Where did they come from?

speaker: Kaze
text: How strange. I expected humans. The Faceless usually aren't this stealthy. In any case, we have no time to spare. Let's take them out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, can you please guard Sakura while we deal with this?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Sakura
text: Be careful, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you ready, Kaze? Let's do this.

speaker: Kaze
text: You can count on me. Hyah!

speaker: Corrin
text: Stand aside or be destroyed!

speaker: Corrin
text: All right, just a few more standing...

speaker: Corrin
text: Everyone, hold! Something isn't right.

speaker: Azura
text: What's the matter, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: These aren't Faceless—they're people! Gods! What have we done?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm afraid you're right. I recognize their clothing. These people are from the Wind Tribe.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't understand. A moment ago, this person right here was a Faceless monster!
Ahahaha...

speaker: Corrin
text: Who's there? Show yourself at once!

speaker: Iago
text: Good day, Princeling/Princess. Did you enjoy my magic trick?

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago! What have you done?

speaker: Iago
text: I didn't do a thing! You're the one who struck down these poor villagers.

speaker: Corrin
text: Why? What could you possibly have to gain...

speaker: Iago
text: Don't you see? This is just the beginning. Now that you're with the Hoshidans, anything is fair game. Oh, your ignorance does tickle me. Bwahahah!

speaker: Kaze
text: And he's gone.

speaker: Azura
text: This puts us in an unfortunate position, to say the least. The route ahead takes us thorugh Wind Tribe territory. And we're going to have a hard time explaining what just happened.

speaker: Sakura
text: Who was that maniac, anyway? Do you know him, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. His name is Iago. King Garon's right-hand man. I didn't know he was capable of this sort of thing. He probably made US appear to be Faceless to those poor villagers...

speaker: Azura
text: Well, he did do us one favor. He revealed himself to us as an enemy. I'm sure we'll have to go through him to get to King Garon.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I would expect so...

speaker: Kaze
text: We've arrived. This is the Wind Tribe Village we must pass through. Lord/Lady Corrin, are you certain you want to approach the village directly?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. Trying to sneak around will only makes us seem more suspicious. Surely they'll understand that we mean them no harm.

speaker: Kaze
text: I'm not as optimistic, but I will trust your judgment. Ah, it looks as though the decision has been made for us...

speaker: Tribalist
text: Here they are! The savages who attacked our people!

speaker: Tribalist
text: Prepare to die.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please wait! We can explain. It is true that we fought with some of your people. But we were deceived by an enemy from Nohr.

speaker: Tribalist
text: Please. How stupid do you think we are?

speaker: Kaze
text: This is going well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Any ideas?

speaker: Sakura
text: Excuse me! Can I have everyone's attention?

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura! Be careful!

speaker: Sakura
text: Please forgive us. We are so s-sorry to have hurt your people. But you must understand that they appeared before us as Faceless!

speaker: Tribalist
text: Lady Sakura? You're with these brigands?

speaker: Tribalist
text: Yeah, what's going on here?

speaker: Azura
text: Please. You must believe us.

speaker: Tribalist
text: Lady Azura is with them too! Maybe they are telling the truth...

speaker: Tribalist
text: Hold that thought. Have you considered that THIS might be a trap? Either way, we can't make this decision ourselves. Let's see what Chief Fuga has to say.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. We would be happy to speak with your Chief Fuga.

speaker: Tribalist
text: Speak? Bwahaha! Somehow I don't think that's what the chief will have in mind.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see...

speaker: Azura
text: Be careful, Corrin. I believe your strategy is sage, but... We are putting ourselves in a higly vulnerable position.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I'm well aware of that. But what choice do we have?

speaker: Hinoka
text: What's going on here? I thought the Wind Tribe was neutral.

speaker: Azama
text: Oh ho! The human mind is weak and malleable. Things change.

speaker: Setsuna
text: Oops.

speaker: Azama
text: Setsuna? Have you shrunk about, oh, a foot or so in the last minute?

speaker: Setsuna
text: No. I'm actually sinking in some quicksand.

speaker: Azama
text: Mmm? Quicksand at this latitude? How fascinating!

speaker: Setsuna
text: Am I going to die now?

speaker: Azama
text: Physically...yes, probably. But your spirit will live on in our memories...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Azama! Why aren't you doing anything to help her? And Setsuna... Why are you so calm? Is this some sort of joke? Gah! I guess I'll have to save you.

speaker: Setsuna
text: Ah. Thank you, milady.

speaker: Azama
text: My, my. Lady Hinoka the Hero.

speaker: Hinoka
text: *sigh* Azama, we are currently under attack. Can you try to be serious for two seconds?

speaker: Azama
text: Of course, milady! Although, I am currently without any battle implements, so... I'm afraid I'm at the mercy of your protection.

speaker: Setsuna
text: I think I'm stuck in the quicksand again...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Gods. I knew I couldn't rely on the two of you, but this is worse than I imagined! Just try and hold it together long enough for us to see this through, all right? Maybe Ryoma and Takumi can help me babysit, once we finally catch up to them...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka! What are you doing here?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I could ask you the same question, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, well... A lot has happened. I thought you were in the capital.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes, I was. But I decided to try to catch up to Ryoma and Takumi on their way to Izumo.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah. Well, it's good that we met up...but I have some bad news. Ryoma and Takumi are missing. We're trying to track them down.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Missing? Oh gods... They are not the sort of men that simply go missing. What has happened to them, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: We don't know. And we've run into a few problems of our own along the way...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes, I can see that. I thought the Wind Tribe was neutral. Why are we fighting?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's a long story, but I believe that we'll be able to explain ourselves to the chief. Will you join us? We could certainly use a little help.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Of course! Although, a LITTLE help is about all you'll get from these two...

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean by that? Never mind... I'm just happy to have you all on our side. Let's do this!

speaker: Fuga
text: So. You've made it this far.

speaker: Corrin
text: You must be Chief Fuga. Please, allow me to explain—

speaker: Fuga
text: No. You must earn the right to explain. Show me that you fight with honor!

speaker: Fuga
text: You've shown some fortitude. Now show me that you're worthy of my attention!

speaker: Fuga
text: Bahaha! Well done. I suppose I shouldn't have underestimated one who carries the sacred Yato blade. Now, I will gladly hear an explanation for the unprovoked attack on my people.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course. Wait—what do you know of my blade?

speaker: Fuga
text: Ah, King Sumeragi and I were good friends. I learned much about the history of that weapon from him. I also shared concern for its future, which is why it was necessary for me to test you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Test me? How so?

speaker: Fuga
text: Corrin, the blade you possess has the power to link the Seal of Flames. In the wrong hands, it could unleash enough power to end the world. That's why I wanted to see for myself if you are indeed the right person to handle it.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. And what of the villagers we wounded?

speaker: Fuga
text: I already knew that you and your associates were acting in good faith. For what reason would Hoshidan royalty attack a stranger? And then allow her party to be peacefully captured by the stranger's tribe? No, I was well aware that something was amiss.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, thank you for believing in us. This is the first good news we've had in some time, I'm afraid.

speaker: Fuga
text: Oh? Please, I would gladly hear your full story. But let us freshen up from the battle and sit down to a proper meal first.

speaker: Corrin
text: I appreciate the invitation—and believe me, a bit of rest and a meal are what we need... But we're in search of Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi. We haven't a moment to spare.

speaker: Fuga
text: I see. Then you must be on your way. Best of luck.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I suppose that worked out better than it could have...

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. I'm glad to know we can still count the Wind Tribe among our friends.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm still puzzling a bit over what Fuga said about my blade. Do you know anything about the Seal of Flames?

speaker: Azura
text: No. But I found it curious that he described "linking" the seal. Could there be more than one Seal of Flames? If so, could there be more than one sacred blade out there? It is a troubling idea. What if our enemies already possess a similar weapon?

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. That is a troubling thought. But let's focus on the problems in front of us before inventing new ones.

speaker: Azura
text: You're right, Corrin. I suppose I'm getting carried away.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps we've spoken too soon. Here comes Chief Fuga, and he appears to be in a hurry.

speaker: Fuga
text: Corrin! Please wait a moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: How can we help you, Chief? Is everything OK?

speaker: Fuga
text: Yes, yes, thank you. It occurred to me that we might be able to make a mutually beneficial arrangement. You are in need of all the men and women you can get. And we have a skilled diviner who could use some real-world experience. His name is Hayato, and he would like to offer his services to your party.

speaker: Hayato
text: Good day.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...

speaker: Hayato
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Fuga
text: Please! Don't judge him by his youthful appearance. Hayato has mastered a number of unique skills that make him invaluable.

speaker: Hayato
text: I don't mean to sound conceited, but... You would be lucky to have me on your team.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well! I certainly won't turn down your assistance at a time like this.

speaker: Fuga
text: Splendid. I hope he makes a valuable addition to your team. And as for you, Hayato, I'm glad to finally be able to offer you this chance to travel.

speaker: Corrin
text: Travel? I hope you both realize that this isn't exactly a vacation...

speaker: Fuga
text: Of course. It's just that Hayato has not had much opportunity to leave the village. In addition to helping you, he will be exploring the world for the first time.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. I think I understand exactly how he feels. After all, I spent most of my childhood locked in a Nohrian castle.

speaker: Fuga
text: Well, then I'm sure you two will have a lot to talk about. And I trust you'll take good care of our Hayato.

speaker: Hayato
text: Chief! Must I remind you again that I am no longer a child?

speaker: Fuga
text: You're right, you're right. I must admit that I still feel a bit protective at times...

speaker: Hayato
text: Dad! I mean...Chief! Lord/Lady Corrin, he's not my dad. He's just looked after me since I was a child.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's OK. I understand. Anyway...we should get going. Welcome aboard, Hayato. And thank you for everything, Chief Fuga.

speaker: Fuga
text: No need to thank me. Please feel free to come back here anytime you'd like. I'm proud to have met the one whom the sacred Yato chose. We shall meet again.

speaker: Corrin
text: Here we are... The Hoshidan capital. What a long journey it's been.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, but soon this long ordeal will finally be over. If we can take control of the capital and seize the throne room, victory will be ours.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... Are you OK with that?

speaker: Azura
text: ...Why do you ask?

speaker: Corrin
text: We're about to conquer the place where you grew up...the castle you called home. If this is too much for you, I'd understand. You can leave the fighting to me. If you need to, go hide somewhere safe until our work here is done.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, my friend, but I'm afraid I can't do that. I didn't side with Nohr just to lose my nerve and turn tail at the pivotal moment. I told you once, and I shall tell you again. I am with you until the bitter end. Ending this war will benefit us all, even the kingdom I grew up in. This is what I need to do, not just for you, not just for the world... But also for the Hoshidan siblings I love so dearly. That is what I believe, with all my heart. It is why I am able to bear this burden.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...

speaker: Azura
text: Speaking of our Hoshidan siblings... We never did find him.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. I don't know what to think... It's too much to process right now.

speaker: Azura
text: Poor Takumi. Our troops made a thorough search of the area, but didn't find a thing. Nothing... Not even a single clue as to where he might have gone. It's as though Takumi just...vanished. But I know that's not possible.

speaker: Azura
text: We should probably keep this from Princess Sakura. She has enough to deal with at the moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I agree. There will be plenty of time to further break her heart later. *sigh*

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin, I must speak with you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Let me guess... Is it time?

speaker: Xander
text: We have received our orders from Father. We are to invade the capital immediately. Please prepare your troops...and yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: Understood.

speaker: Boy
text: It's them! Gods, the rumors are true! The Nohrian army is headed this way!

speaker: Girl
text: They're so frightening... Like an army of reapers out for blood!

speaker: Boy
text: Look! Prince/Princess Traitor is marching with them! SHAME on him/her!

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Old Man
text: How dare you show your face here after what you did to Queen Mikoto!

speaker: Old Woman
text: My husband died in that explosion, just like our queen. Monsters! All of you!!

speaker: Corrin
text: I must...stay strong...

speaker: Iago
text: Filthy street rats! Out of my way!

speaker: Old Woman
text: AHHHHH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago!

speaker: Iago
text: Hmph, one less blathering fool in the world. Rest easy, Lord/Lady Corrin. I shall personally destroy anyone who dares speak an ill word about you.

speaker: Hans
text: GWAHAHAHA!! Just try and cross us Nohrians, and watch the bodies drop!

speaker: Boy
text: Ahhhhhh!!

speaker: Corrin
text: No... Please...

speaker: Azura
text: Patience, Corrin. King Garon is close behind. There is no telling what he'll do if he sees you standing up for Hoshidans.

speaker: Iago
text: Ah, we've finally arrived at our new castle! And no guards to stop us, heh heh. They must be in defense mode. I'd wager that all of their forces are waiting inside.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm, so it would seem. This bodes well for us. Our army is large enough to surround the entire premises. We might be able to secure their surrender without raising a blade.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, I'm afraid that won't do, Lord Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Pardon?

speaker: Iago
text: This is our only chance to finally eliminate those pesky Hoshidan insects. They don't deserve the honor of a clean and quick surrender. Besides, so long as they live, those who follow them will never stop fighting. Now is the perfect opportunity for us to kill their royalty and stake our claim. For the glory of Nohr, every last one of the Hoshidan royals must die.

speaker: Xander
text: That's low even for you, Iago!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh? Well let's ask our king, shall we? King Garon! Your Majesty! What do you think of my plan? May I proceed?

speaker: Garon
text: Kill them all.

speaker: Iago
text: I thought you might say that. Thank you, my liege.

speaker: Xander
text: Father...

speaker: Iago
text: Now that we've settled our differences, let's begin the invasion. My men will attack from the rear while Lord/Lady Corrin's troops storm the front. Divide and conquer, as they say!

speaker: Xander
text: ... What say you, Corrin? Any objections?

speaker: Corrin
text: ...None. If this is what Father wishes, then so be it.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, Xander, hasn't our "little prince/princess" grown so? How proud must you be! Now then, let's begin. My troops will meet up with yours in the throne room. Do try your best not to slip and die on your own tears, will you? Heh heh heh.

speaker: Corrin
text: ... Xander, what do we—?

speaker: Xander
text: I know. I don't like this plan any more than you do. But we must stay strong. If we falter now, the whole world will pay the price. Corrin... Camilla told me you once asked her where justice lies.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. She didn't have any more answers than I do.

speaker: Xander
text: Little prince/princess... The sad truth is that justice is an illusion. A child's fairy tale. There is no light path that always leads to good, nor dark path that leads to evil. To believe that—to see the world in black and white—is missing half the picture. All that matters are the choices we make—especially the hard ones.

speaker: Corrin
text: But this? It's too much...

speaker: Xander
text: Letting innocents die is a tragedy, but so is letting the chance for peace slip away. This is war. There is no such thing as a clean win when lives are on the line. Instead of clinging to a false sense of justice, hold strong to something true... The desire to do what you know is right and to protect the ones you love... And the ambition to see your vision of a peaceful future through to the end. If we allow evil men to let their vision take precedence over our own, we all lose. Remember that, and find solace in it.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right, Xander. I know in my heart that you're right. Gods, give me strength...

speaker: Azama
text: Oh my... It appears your little brother/sister has brought friends for supper, Lady Hinoka.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin... Hmph.

speaker: Setsuna
text: Are we going to fight?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes. I will not let Castle Shirasagi fall, even to my own brother/sister. Don't let even a single person breach the throne room! If I can't at least stop that, I'm a sorry excuse for a princess.

speaker: Setsuna
text: OK, sure... I'll do my best.

speaker: Azama
text: We will protect you, Lady Hinoka, with all the strength we possess.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Heh, I never thought I'd hear you speak so gravely, Azama. Whatever happens, I'm proud to fight with the two of you at my side. Thank you, Azama. And you, Setsuna. Thank you for everything. And don't even try to die on me... We're in this together!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I spent my whole life looking for you. Finally...I found you!

speaker: Setsuna
text: I told Lady Hinoka I'd do my best... So here I go.

speaker: Setsuna
text: I lost? I've never felt...so frustrated...

speaker: Azama
text: Those who live such a barbaric life do not deserve my mercy. Make peace with your choices, for I am about to send you to your death!

speaker: Azama
text: Fools... Your day of judgment will come...soon enough...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I don't care who you are or who you're with. I will not let you pass!

speaker: Hinoka
text: It's up to you now...Ryoma... Please...protect our home...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hello, Corrin. Here you are back in your true home. How does it feel?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Hinoka, but I must seize the Hoshidan throne. Let me pass, or I will strike you down.

speaker: Hinoka
text: You can't mean that! Do you really feel nothing for this place? For us?! I always imagined welcoming you home, seeing you running up those steps. I longed to watch you grow up...to call you brother/sister and hold you tight. That was my dream. But now... That dream is dead. Isn’t it, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Psh, what am I wasting my time for? Dreaming of things that will never be... The enemy commander is right in front of me. There’s only one thing to do. When I’m through with you, you will never threaten this kingdom again!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Drat! How could I lose?! Our castle... I failed...

speaker: Corrin
text: Lay down your weapon, Hinoka. It's over.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hmph! If you're going to kill me, just get it over with. I won't beg for mercy. All I ask is that you spare the lives of my remaining soldiers.

speaker: Azama
text: No, milady! You don't know what you're saying. You are a princess of Hoshido. You must not fall!

speaker: Setsuna
text: You can't do that, Lady Hinoka... If you die, I'll die with you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Azama, Setsuna... I need you to stay strong for me.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm...I'm afraid I have no choice. Father would never allow an enemy leader to survive. I'm sorry , but...I must do what I must do.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I understand. Please, make it quick.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course. *sigh*

speaker: Corrin
text: HYAAAA!!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ugh!

speaker: Hinoka
text: ...Huh?

speaker: Azama
text: He/She missed?! And not by accident... But why?

speaker: Setsuna
text: Yes, tell us. Why did you spare her?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka... My sister, listen carefully. As of this moment, you are dead to the world. Leave this place, and do it now. I beg of you, take your retainers and find somewhere to hide. I hate to send you out unarmed, but I must ask for your weapon. Quickly. I must have something to show Father as proof that I defeated you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What are you saying?! You're really going to let me go?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I am not my father, Hinoka. The last thing I want is meaningless bloodshed. I will not kill you nor your remaining soldiers, but you must leave now.

speaker: Hinoka
text: No! Let me come with you, Brother/Sister! I knew you were on our side. I knew it! If I explain things to Ryoma, maybe we can end this war before things go any further!

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't let you do that. There's no telling what King Garon would do if he found out I allowed you to live. I know it won't be easy, but I need you to go far away from here. If you can just stay hidden until the war is over, everything will be OK. You don't have to die here. Please, choose to live.

speaker: Hinoka
text: How can I run...when everything I hold dear is on the brink of ruin...?

speaker: Camilla
text: My, what a spoiled child.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What?!

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh dear, how did my naughty blade get so close to your vulnerable little throat? If you move even a tiny bit, I may just slice it open like a ripe tomato.

speaker: Hinoka
text: You're insane! What do you think—

speaker: Camilla
text: Quiet, dear. You see, my brother/sister...who is not yours, by the way... Well, the sweet thing chose to spare your meaningless life. It's rather precious. I support his/her choice, of course. But only so long as you keep your end of the bargain. If you cause my darling brother/sister any harm... If you disobey him/her and refuse to run away... When you least expect it, my naughty little blade might just slip. Understood?

speaker: Camilla
text: Aww, you always make that same frightening face when we speak. Keep that up, and you'll positively terrify Princess Sakura when you see her again.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Sakura is alive?!

speaker: Camilla
text: She is. And she will stay that way if you help me keep my brother/sister safe. That's MY brother/sister, darling. Not yours. In case you were keeping score. Now be a good girl and go hide somewhere safe like Corrin ordered you to. After all, how would young Sakura feel if she found out her sister was dead?

speaker: Hinoka
text: *sigh* Fine! You win. I will do as you say.

speaker: Camilla
text: Wonderful! I'm so glad we had this little chat. You know, now that I'm up close...your face is rather cute. Somewhat similar to Corrin's. Fully adorable and quite pretty.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What am I supposed to say to—

speaker: Camilla
text: Look at that! Absolutely lovely. You even blush like Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...Camilla?

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, my apologies. I got carried away. It seems we must be going. Farewell, princess of Hoshido.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin, wait! You should know that Ryoma is waiting for you inside the castle. You said you wish to avoid bloodshed, and I'm choosing to believe you. So whatever happens...don't kill him. Please, find a way to spare my brother. We've already lost Mother. We couldn't bear to lose Ryoma too... If he fell, it would tear the heart out of our kingdom. I couldn't survive that.

speaker: Corrin
text: You have my word, Hinoka. I will not take Ryoma's life. I swear on the Yato of salvation that I will find a way to protect him.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Thank you, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: One last thing... I know the awful things my kingdom has done to Hoshido and to your family. I know that because of those things, I can never hope for forgiveness. But when all this is over, and peace has been restored to our world... I dearly hope that one day we can all come together as siblings again.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry. Perhaps I should not have spoken. Feel free to cry and scream at me, and to tell me that wish can never come true. But even still, I won't let go of that dream. I just thought you should know.

speaker: Hinoka
text: ... Good-bye, Corrin.

speaker: Azama
text: Lady Hinoka! I am truly grateful that you escaped that ordeal with your life.

speaker: Setsuna
text: It's time to go, milady. If we stay here, they'll catch us for sure.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes. Let's get going. Brother/Sister... You're right about one thing. I cannot forgive the Nohrian army. They started this war, and they're winning it like cowards. They're all barbarians! Yet Corrin's dream of us all uniting as siblings in a world without war... His/her wish is so earnest, so pure, I can't help but believe in it too. Ryoma... Please don't hurt Corrin. Don't kill that lovely dream...

speaker: Iago
text: Ah, Lord/Lady Corrin, I see you've returned to us safe and sound.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Iago. We've just now made it back. It's good to be home. I haven't any time to waste, though. I'd like to report to Father right away.

speaker: Iago
text: Yes, of course. I'm sure you have much to discuss.

speaker: Corrin
text: By the way, what's with all the commotion around here? Did something happen?

speaker: Iago
text: There's a small rebellion in Cheve. Nothing your royal head should worry about. Our soldiers are preparing to quash it as we speak, before it gets out of hand.

speaker: Corrin
text: Another rebellion...

speaker: Iago
text: I'm sure King Garon can fill you in on the specifics if you so please. He's waiting for you in the reception room. I would advise against keeping him waiting.

speaker: Corrin
text: Excellent. I shall go immediately.

speaker: Iago
text: ... Hmph, little snake. Parading around the castle like nothing happened. I suppose the Macarath plan wasn't severe enough. Live and learn. I'll just have to make sure my next plan isn't so easy for him to slither out of.

speaker: Garon
text: Welcome back, child. I hear you have once again fulfilled my orders flawlessly. You're growing stronger right before my eyes. I am proud of you, my son/daughter.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: But we must never rest on our laurels. Cheve requires immediate attention. Perhaps Iago already told you, but there's been a rebellion there. It's still small, but it won't remain so. Cheve is known for it's skilled knights. We cannot afford to underestimate their prowess on the battlefield. I'm sending our standing army to strike them down before this gets out of control. I'm trusting you, Corrin, to lead them to victory.

speaker: Corrin
text: You want ME to lead our standing army against the Chevois knights?!

speaker: Garon
text: That is correct.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm honored by this opportunity, Father. I truly am. It's just... I don't have the necessary expertise to lead our troops against such a talented army. Surely there is someone else who would be better suited for this-

speaker: Garon
text: Are you defying me, boy/girl?! I am entrusting you with this mission because I believe you can succeed. Do not disappoint me, my son/daughter.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Father... *sigh* Understood. I won't let you down. I will suppress the rebellion in Cheve.

speaker: Garon
text: I have high hopes for you, Corrin. You are dismissed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father, wait! If I may have just a moment of your time, I have something to report.

speaker: Garon
text: Well? Out with it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, the Nohrian princess who was taken by the Hoshidans, has returned to us.

speaker: Garon
text: What?!

speaker: Azura
text: Greetings, your majesty.

speaker: Garon
text: Azura...

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, milord. It is I.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmm, how unexpected. I never thought I'd see your face again. If you wish, you may go with Corrin to suppress the rebellion. Think of it as a chance to see more of your homeland.

speaker: Garon
text: That is all. Bring back good news, my children.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father was acting... strangely. Even colder and more distant then usual. You're his long-lost daughter, and yet he barely spoke a word to you...

speaker: Azura
text: It's quite all right, Corrin. I didn't expect much.

speaker: Corrin
text: But he's your father! It's not right. He should be more... I don't know...

speaker: Azura
text: It's fine. Please don't worry about it. To be honest, I never thought I'd see him again. So in a way, the few words we exchanged exceeded my expectations.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* I wonder what's really going on with Father. And Azura, for that matter... They've been separated for a lifetime, yet they barely spoke to each other. Something about it bothers me, though I can't put my finger on it. Ah well, I haven't time to dwell. I must prepare to depart with the army. Speaking of, I'm pretty sure this is where the soldiers gather to rest...

speaker: Hans
text: Prince/Princess Corrin! Milord/Milady!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans! What do you want?

speaker: Hans
text: So it's true. I heard a rumor that our young prince/princess would be leading us. Congratulations on the honor, prince/princess Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Enough with the flattery, Hans. Did you need me for something?

speaker: Hans
text: Yes, I've been awaiting your arrival. As a member of the standing army, I will be accompanying you to Cheve. I've been ordered to aid you in whatever task you you request of me.

speaker: Corrin
text: You? Helping me? And I'm to trust you even after you tried to kill me at the Bottomless Canyon?

speaker: Hans
text: A thousand apologies, milord/milady. I pray you can find it in your heart to forgive me. King Garon commanded I attack you so as to test your abilities. You should be pleased to know you far exceeded his expectations. Despite being a Hoshidan royal, you chose to side with our great kingdom of Nohr. You chose to remain with your Nohrian siblings and the man who raised you. Everyone at the castle was overjoyed. It greatly improved morale! I have every faith that you'll lead us well and to victory, milord/milady.

speaker: Corrin
text: So this is Cheve... Um... Odd. There doesn't seem to be any fighting at the moment.

speaker: Camilla
text: Perhaps they've returned to their safe houses for the night. We should do the same. We'll be better prepared for tomorrow if we get some rest. I know of an abandoned place nearby. Shall we head that way?

speaker: Corrin
text: Sounds great.

speaker: Takumi
text: Hello, brother/sister dear. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: Damn, so close. I was aiming for your traitorous head.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! Are you insane? You could have killed-

speaker: Camilla
text: Stay back, Corrin! It's too dangerous.

speaker: Takumi
text: Hiding behind your fake sister, are you? You've reached a new low. It matters not. I have an army of soldiers at my command.

speaker: Corrin
text: Stop this, Takumi. This doesn't concern you or Hoshido. I've come to peacefully suppress the rebellion in Cheve. Please, lay down your bow and return to Hoshido where you belong.

speaker: Scarlet
text: Bah, I knew you hounds would try to stop our righteous rebellion. All the more reason to stand our ground!

speaker: Corrin
text: I seem to have angered you, stranger. May I ask who you are?

speaker: Scarlet
text: The name's Scarlet. I'm part of the resistance here in Cheve. I've had my people tracking you ever since you left Nohr. Our Hoshidan allies were all too grateful to receive word of your whereabouts.

speaker: Camilla
text: Turning your back on the kingdom of Nohr. Tsk tsk. Quite the little traitor, aren't you?

speaker: Takumi
text: Traitor? Ha! Nohrian logic never ceases to amuse me. Scarlet did the same thing as Corrin, only SHE chose the right side. Joining the enemy and laying a trap for your own countrymen... Sound familiar?

speaker: Elise
text: Quiet, you! Don't say such awful things about my brother/sister, or you'll be sorry! Corrin didn't betray anyone! He's/She's the best person in the world!

speaker: Takumi
text: Ugh, who allowed this little brat to speak? How irritating.

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise!!

speaker: Takumi
text: The sight of that Nohrian brat makes me sick. Just die already. Scarlet and I won't stop until we free Cheve from Nohrian oppression. I plan to eliminate all who stand in our way. It's you against us, Corrin. Isn't that just what King Garon wants? For all of us to fight to the death?

speaker: Corrin
text: You're wrong, Takumi! If you could only see beyond your own hatred of me. If we could just talk things out, we could end this war peacefully. Fighting isn't the only way. How many more people must die before you see that?

speaker: Takumi
text: QUIET, NOHRIAN SCUM! I've had enough of your lies to last a lifetime. I'm going to kill you all and bring peace back to Hoshido! All troops, prepare for battle! Destroy the Nohrian army!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi!

speaker: Takumi
text: I'll... kill you all... Y-yes... If I kill the Nohrians... surely the pain... the pain in my head will go away...

speaker: Child
text: You're from Nohr, aren't you?  Have you come to kill us? Huh? There's a battle going on? Oh, OK. I'll lock up tight. Thanks for the warning. In fact... take this. Might come in handy.

speaker: Boy
text: You're with the Nohrian army, eh? You enforcing a new curfew, or what? I'll just stay inside. I was about to hit the hay anyway. Here, take this before you go.

speaker: Old Man
text: My family and I know full well it's useless to fight the Nohrian army. Here, have this. Anything to help end this war quickly. I only hope that King Garon eventually learns to rule with compassion...

speaker: Girl
text: Visitors from the Nohrian army? This late? Oh dear, you must be ever so tired. Our rebels feel differently, but the people of Cheve are loyal to Nohr. Please believe me! Here, take this as proof of our loyalty.

speaker: Orochi
text: Hee hee, you're afraid of my magic, aren't you? You should be.

speaker: Orochi
text: How could I lose?! My fortune said... I would win...today's battle...

speaker: Reina
text: I will grant you the most divine death if you'll let me hear you scream...

speaker: Reina
text: Such a pity... I was looking forward to watching...the light leave your eyes...

speaker: Scarlet
text: I won't let Nohr oppress my people any longer. For freedom!

speaker: Scarlet
text: Though I fall here...Cheve...will never bow down...

speaker: Takumi
text: I will not lose this time. Death to Nohr!

speaker: Takumi
text: It can't be... I'm so much stronger now! How could this...happen...

speaker: Charlotte
text: Ugh, these jokesters are a real pain in my rear. Why are they making such a racket this late at night? I need my beauty rest! I bet it's those Chevois jerks again. I've had it up to my ears with them. Can't they all just drop dead already?! Benny, I'm talkin' over here!

speaker: Benny
text: ...Yes, Charlotte. They're very loud.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, excuse me, but are you two with the rebels?

speaker: Charlotte
text: How DARE you! We're proud Nohrian soldiers here to defend our border! Geez, the nerve of some people. Comparing us to those savages! Ain't that right, Benny?

speaker: Benny
text: ... Sure.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, my apologies. I didn't realize you were Nohrian border guards. I'm Corrin, prince/princess of Nohr. I'm here to suppress this rebellion.

speaker: Charlotte
text: HUH?! You're a p-prince? Oh... Please forgive me, milord! Where ARE my manners?! I must have been bitten by an evil little fairy, hee hee. I'm so VERY sorry.

speaker: Benny
text: Please forgive my rude companion, milord. She's... eccentric.

speaker: Corrin
text: No need to apologize. But what are you two doing here? Have you come to help us?

speaker: Benny
text: ... No milord. The rebels were being loud, so Charlotte wanted to kick their—

speaker: Charlotte
text: Benny, you silly-billy! Don't joke around with our rich prince friend here. OF COURSE we're here to help you. I'm a delicate little flower, but I know how to battle. Why bother living if we can't help our gorgeous prince in his time of need? Ain't that... I mean, isn't that right, my dear Benny?

speaker: Benny
text: ... Sure.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, you both look strong and able, so we'd be grateful for your help. All I ask is that you do all you can to spare the lives of our enemies.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Of course, my prince! Little flowers like me are ill-equipped to kill anyway. Oh, goodness! I haven't properly introduced myself, have I? Silly me! I'm Charlotte, hee hee. This mammoth here is my totally platonic friend, Benny. It's nice to make your royal acquaintance! I'll do everything I can to make you happy.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's, um, nice to meet you as well. If you'll excuse me...

speaker: Charlotte
text: ... SCORE! We're in the big leagues now, Benny my boy. I'm this close to landing the catch of a lifetime, heh heh!

speaker: Benny
text: ...Whatever you say, Charlotte.

speaker: Ruffian
text: All of the soldiers are going at it pretty hard. Heh, all the better. A chaotic battle is the perfect time to take the villagers for all they're worth...

speaker: Takumi
text: NO! How could I lose... Not again...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's over, Takumi. You can't keep fighting. Return to Hoshido with your troops.

speaker: Takumi
text: Dammit. Why?! Why can't I beat you? You abandoned Hoshido... stood by and watched Mother die... betrayed us all... Why can't I have the justice I deserve?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi...

speaker: Takumi
text: As you said, I must retreat for now. But next time will be different. Next time HAS to be different... I'll never forgive you, Corrin... I won't rest until I've killed you myself. Some day soon, I'll make you pay for your sins. I swear on my mother's grave.

speaker: Azura
text: ...That is not the Takumi I once knew. He's changed.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean? How so?

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi never accepted me as his sister like the others, but he was always kind. He's not the type to raise his voice or threaten to hurt anyone. I can't explain it, but it's like he's a different person...

speaker: Corrin
text: Do you think... it's because I betrayed Hoshido? Could that be the cause?

speaker: Azura
text: To be honest, it's very likely you choosing Nohr played a part. But it still doesn't add up. He's so crazed and focused on Nohr's destruction... I can't help but wonder if that's really Takumi.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Of course that's Takumi. Who else would it-
AAAAAARGHHHH!!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Someone's in pain! What's going on over there?!

speaker: Azura
text: It's getting louder. Let's hurry!

speaker: Hans
text: HA HA HA!! Death to all who defy the great king of Nohr!

speaker: Boy
text: Please... no... Gaaaah... !!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans! Stop this, now! What do you think you're doing?!

speaker: Hans
text: Don't worry, milord/milady, I'm saving some of these rats for you. You're just in time to help us take out the trash that started this rebellion.

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you insane!? We don't kill for the sake of killing! And these are innocent villagers! They're not even soldiers!

speaker: Hans
text: Villagers are just soldiers who haven't grabbed a sword yet, heh heh. If we let them live, it'll come back to haunt us when we least expect it.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's no excuse to take innocent lives. Stop this at once! As Prince/Princess of Nohr, I order you to drop your blade and let these people go!

speaker: Hans
text: Forgive me, milord/milady, but the orders come straight from Lord Garon. You may be a prince/princess, and our leader, but the King's word is law.

speaker: Corrin
text: F-father ordered you... to do this terrible thing...?

speaker: Hans
text: He did. My apologies. Now if you'll excuse me, I'd like to wrap up here so we can get back home. Feel free to find somewhere quieter to rest until the dirty work is over, milord/milady.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans, wait! Stop this madness! HANS!!

speaker: Camilla
text: ... This is a truly horrid sight to behold, my darling brother/sister. I wish things could be different.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla...

speaker: Camilla
text: I'm sorry, but I just found out the injured Hoshidan soldiers have already been killed. And that rebel... what was her name... Scarlet? Yes, the poor thing. They killed her in such a way... Well, they clearly meant to make an example of her.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods, no... but Scarlet would have listened to us if we had just talked things out. Now we'll never have that chance... Why, Camilla? Who wants to live in a world where precious life is destroyed on a whim? Is this the world Father is building? Is this what I've been fighting for?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't understand. I can never understand. How could Father do this? Where is the justice? The respect for life? The common decency?! Tell me, Camilla...

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin... I know you're upset, but we need to report back to Father. He'll be angry if we keep him waiting. I'll summon a messenger.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla! How can you be so calm at a time like this?

speaker: Camilla
text: I'm sorry, Corrin. I don't have the answers you're looking for. I don't know why Father makes some of the decisions he makes. I never have. I do know that even as his blood kin, he wouldn't hesitate to kill me if I disobeyed. If you value your life, as I do... bury your feelings, at least for now. I know it's hard to do that while looking around at what's happening here... But I'm afraid it's your only option. If you'll excuse me, I must hurry.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla... I'm sorry, but I can't do that. I can't accept that this is the Nohrian way. Something must be done...

speaker: Ryoma
text: So this is Windmire...

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I'm finally back... It feels like it's been a lifetime. I never got to spend much time out here. I was always locked away. Still, being so close to the castle. It feels like...returning home. *sigh* It's strange, though. I haven't seen a soul since we arrived. It's so empty and quiet here. It's like the complete opposite of Hoshido.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, it's hard to believe that this is the capital city of a major kingdom.

speaker: Silas
text: Believe it. I'm afraid that the city has been this way for quite some time now. Most regular folks just stay indoors. That way they won't be harassed by brigands or roving Faceless... That's just how it is in Nohr.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Is that so?

speaker: Silas
text: Yes, I'm afraid so. Remember the Woods of the Forlorn? How the trees arched and craned to soak up every possible bit of light? That's how us Nohrians must live as well. Food, resources and even light are limited. That's why our kingdom learned to fight and conquer other countries to prosper. We're like those trees, searching for the sun and trying to survive as best as we can.

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's terrible. Coming from the fruitful land of Hoshido, I had no idea... When this war ends, we'll have to see what we can do to share our resources.

speaker: Silas
text: You're...you're offering aid to a kingdom that you're at war with?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Of course. As the next of kin, I will naturally ascend the throne once I return to Hoshido. And my first priority as king will be revising our foreign policy toward Nohr. We have an abundance of food in Hoshido. More than we can even consume. Why should our neighbors suffer while we live in excess?

speaker: Silas
text: That's much appreciated, milord. You are an inspiration! I am prepared to give up my own life to fight for you. Because truly, fighting for you is as good as fighting for Nohr!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, Silas. I appreciate your support.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you both. It's things like this that keep my dream of peace between Nohr and Hoshido alive.

speaker: Shura
text: Well, what do we have here? Couple of travelers, are you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Who are you?

speaker: Shura
text: Never mind that. This is the bad part of town, kiddo. You shouldn't be walking around here by yourselves. After all, you're might run into some real bad characters. Not unlike...us. Heh, heh.

speaker: Corrin
text: Us? What are you talking about— Oh.

speaker: Takumi
text: Yep, we're surrounded. I don't think these are Nohrian soldiers, though...

speaker: Corrin
text: Argh! we don't have time for this!

speaker: Shura
text: The hell are you mumbling about? Now, we can make this nice and easy. Just give us all of your valuables, including that fancy-lookin' sword there...

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like we have no choice. Get ready for battle, everyone!

speaker: Shura
text: It's nothing personal. But we've got to eat, you know? If only you'd given me that lovely sword...we could have avoided all this.

speaker: Shura
text: You guys...aren't mere travelers...are you?

speaker: Ryoma
text: You're the leader of this pathetic gang, are you not? Someone tie him up! The fewer people who know we're here, the better.

speaker: Shura
text: Geez, just kill me if you're going to kill me!

speaker: Azura
text: Hold on, Ryoma. I want to speak with this man. As a thief, he may know something about the secret passageway into the castle...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm? What passageway?

speaker: Azura
text: It's something I've always remembered about the day I was kidnapped from Nohr... My captors stole me away from the castle through some kind of secret tunnel.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Is that so?

speaker: Azura
text: It must have been made long ago for the purpose of infiltrating the castle unseen. I'm certain that King Garon and the Nohrian royals know nothing about it. If the tunnel is still there, it would benefit us greatly to make use of it. Do you know anything about this, thief?

speaker: Shura
text: Heh. I know a lot of stuff.

speaker: Azura
text: In that case, you must tell us. It is imperative that we reach the castle!

speaker: Shura
text: Or what—you'll kill me? Go ahead.

speaker: Shura
text: Ha! You can't kill me, can you? You need the information too badly. Well... you just need to grease the wheels, kiddo.

speaker: Azura
text: What is it that you desire?

speaker: Shura
text: Ah, now we're talking! Money. And lots of it.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Very well. Money is no object for us. If your motivations are so base and pathetic, we can bury you in coin. On my honor as High Prince of Hoshido, you shall be paid at the first opportunity.

speaker: Shura
text: What did you say? The High Prince of Hoshido?

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's right. I'm Ryoma, heir to the throne of Hoshido. I shall ascend the throne as soon as this war ends. At that time I will grant you as much money as your pathetic mind can comprehend.

speaker: Takumi
text: Um, Ryoma? You sure you want to reveal your true identity to this guy? Not to mention promising him unlimited money...

speaker: Ryoma
text: He has information that could help save us invaluable time. We have no choice. Although, I suppose we haven't yet tried interrogation...

speaker: Shura
text: Milord, please accept my sincerest apologies. I didn't know who you were.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Shura
text: The name's Shura. My family once served yours. I am a ninja of Kohga... a land that exists only in memory now.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Kohga! That's a name I haven't heard for many, many years.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey, Takumi. Do you know what they're talking about? I've never heard of Kohga before.

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, Kohga was a small kingdom that bordered Mokushu. The place was known for its ninja dojos...until Mokushu burned it to the ground. Now that territory belongs to Mokushu and nothing remains of Kohga.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's terrible...

speaker: Shura
text: The day Kohga fell to Mokushu, almost all of my people were slaughtered. I was a child... Chased from my homeland and separated from the other survivors. Even as a refugee, I was denied entry to Hoshido. So I wound up in Nohr. I was exiled and alone. My only choice was to steal or die. You can guess what I chose. I've been here ever since, searching for others like me and trying to stay afloat...

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm sorry for your troubles and that you weren't able to find safe haven in Hoshido. When this war is over, I will do all I can to help your people reclaim your homeland. There's just one condition. Join us! Join us and fight to make our world a better place!

speaker: Shura
text: Lord Ryoma... Anyone who would help my people claim what was taken from us has my support.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Excellent. Now, I believe Azura mentioned something about a secret passageway...

speaker: Shura
text: Of course. The tunnel.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you for your help, Shura. I apologize for threatening you earlier.

speaker: Shura
text: Don't worry about it. I had it coming.

speaker: Azura
text: Well, I'm glad to have you on our side from now on. With your help, we just might gain the advantage we need to defeat King Garon.

speaker: Shura
text: Ehem! Are you folks ready to get moving? We've kicked up enough dust that I'm sure some soldiers will be poking around soon. I'll lead you to the capital's underground. From there, we'll enter the secret tunnel. You're in for a wild ride, heh.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What...what is this place?

speaker: Shura
text: Heh. I told you. This is the REAL Nohr. The royals don't even know about this place. It's how the ordinary people around here get by.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's so...lively! There are so many shops and people. This is more like what I imagine when I think of a capital city.

speaker: Shura
text: Yeah, this is the true heart of Nohr. It's a place free from the prying eyes of the king's spies and soldiers. Here you can see a real glimpse of what it means to be a Nohrian! Only rich foreigners and idiots venture out into the streets above, heh.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is encouraging. I do see some poverty, but aside from a few differences, this could be Hoshido. I'd like to think our kingdoms have more in common than we thought.

speaker: Corrin
text: It makes me so happy to hear you say that, Ryoma. Maybe one day...our two kingdoms will coexist peacefully.

speaker: Flower Girl
text: Hi, hi! Want to buy a flower? I'll make you a special deal, heehee!

speaker: Shura
text: Not today, girlie. Bug off.

speaker: Flower Girl
text: Hey, that's mean! The least you could do is take a look! See? I have all different kinds! They're all so pretty and— *GASP*

speaker: Corrin
text: What's wrong? What's going on?

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise?!

speaker: Elise
text: Is it really you? What are you doing here?

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise...I could ask you the same question! You're a princess! What are you doing selling flowers in the market?

speaker: Elise
text: I...I can't talk about it here. I've got a place just around the corner. Come with me and we'll talk!

speaker: Corrin
text: You've got a...place? This really is some kind of alternate world!

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee! Don't worry—not all that much has changed. I'm just so happy to see you again! Father doesn't know I'm here, so you don't need to worry. Follow me!

speaker: Cassita
text: So you're this big brother/sister I keep hearing about. You're so handsome/lovely!

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, um, thank you.

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin, this is my nanny, Cassita. She lives down here. I...I've been spending a lot of time with her since you left.

speaker: Cassita
text: She gets so lonely. Why don't you come home and visit more often, young man/lady?

speaker: Elise
text: Cassita! Please, that's embarrassing. Would you mind making some tea for everyone?

speaker: Cassita
text: I'm sorry, dear. Yes, of course. Be right back...

speaker: Corrin
text: So, Elise...

speaker: Elise
text: You want to know why I'm here, don't you? *sigh* Well, the castle just doesn't feel like home anymore.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Elise
text: A lot has changed since you left, and since the war started. Us siblings, well... We were all so upset over losing you, we could hardly look at each other anymore... Now Xander's always gone, Leo's left, and Camilla barely speaks. It's like the heart's been ripped from the castle. I get so lonely there. Camilla taught me about the passage that leads here. I've been using it to get away.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Elise. But why are you selling flowers? Surely you don't need the money...

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, that's just to help out Cassita a little bit. I collect the flowers at the castle and bring them here to sell. It takes my mind off the whole situation, and I give the money to Cassita. Flowers make people happy! If I can't be happy, at least I can make others happy.

speaker: Corrin
text: There's that smile again. I've missed it terribly. When I saw you in Cyrkensia, you looked so worried...

speaker: Elise
text: Yes, well...I was with Father... He's been acting so strangely...

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? Why do you say that?

speaker: Elise
text: He's been...scarier than usual. If someone crosses him, he kills them like it's nothing. He even...killed Zola. Right in front of me. It's more than that too. He always has this cold, empty expression on his face. I think even Xander is beginning to question him. Xander said Father is like a different person from the one he knew growing up.

speaker: Corrin
text: A different person... Xander said that?

speaker: Elise
text: Yep. He said Father wasn't nearly as scary when he was younger. He said Father wasn't cruel back then. That he loved showing his strength...
