But he had dignity and charm and didn't care for conquering other kingdoms. He told me that things started getting bad when Queen Arete died. I'm the daughter of someone who came after Arete, so I never got to meet her.

speaker: Corrin
text: I've never even heard of Queen Arete. I've only heard Xander talk about his mother, Queen Katerina.

speaker: Cassita
text: Oh, my! Now THOSE names bring back some memories. Queen Arete! And Queen Katerina, too. I haven't thought of her in ages! Such lovely ladies!

speaker: Elise
text: Cassita! Were you listening to our whole conversation? Yeesh!

speaker: Cassita
text: I'm sorry, honey, but your tea has been ready for ages! I couldn't help but overhear a few little words here and there...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's all right, ma'am. I'm curious, though. Did you know Queen Arete or Queen Katerina?

speaker: Cassita
text: Oh, yes. I worked for both of them for a time. Both fine ladies, just fine! I remember King Garon was really broken up when queen Katerina died. Said he'd never marry again! Hah! That changed the minute he met Lady Arete. She had such an amazing voice. Her singing would fill the castle. And she was so beautiful! She looked an awful lot like your friend there, actually. You know—the one with the blue hair!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Well, that makes sense. Azura was born in Nohr. She's probably King Garon's daughter with Queen Arete.

speaker: Elise
text: WHAT?! I have another sister I didn't even know about?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura?

speaker: Cassita
text: Wowee! This is the most exciting teatime I've had in ages! Let's take it to the next level with some cookies, shall we?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, but we really must be going. Thank you very much for the tea and your hospitality.

speaker: Cassita
text: Oh, that's too bad. I wish you could stay longer.

speaker: Elise
text: I...I still can't believe I have another sister! I wish I'd known earlier... Big sister! I'm so glad I met you!

speaker: Azura
text: Yes... It was nice meeting you as well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Corrin
text: Brrr... It's much colder here than in the forest. The Ice Tribe lives up to its name.

speaker: Felicia
text: Too true! The colder it gets, the closer we are. It won't be long now. My word, isn't this cold air marvelous? It really puts a spring in your step!

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh! Really?! I'm so sorry, your liege. I had no idea you were suffering. Um, how about we try running. Maybe that will warm you up! Come on, everyone! Let's run!

speaker: Jakob
text: The colder it gets, the closer we are. It won't be long until we arrive. The cold air is quite refreshing! I rather enjoy it, don't you?

speaker: Jakob
text: Are you that cold, milady? I'm so sorry, I didn't realize. Perhaps we should run. It might help warm you up, and it will get us there quicker. I shall take the lead. Here I go!

speaker: Elise
text: He's/She's so fast! FELICIAAA!/JAKOOOB! WAIT FOR MEEE!

speaker: Silas
text: Lady Elise, slow down! You mustn't get ahead of the group!

speaker: Corrin
text: They're gone! This won't end well... Woah!

speaker: Corrin
text: They're gone! Woah!

speaker: Corrin
text: The snow is really coming down all of a sudden. Is everyone OK?

speaker: Silas
text: I believe so. But...it looks like we've been separated from the others.

speaker: Corrin
text: Damn, you're right! We have to find them and quickly!

speaker: Silas
text: Don't worry, Corrin. Felicia/Jakob knows this area well, so they should be fine. Honestly, I'm more concerned about the two of us... We must keep pushing forward before we freeze to death.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very true. We better hurry before the path Felicia/Jakob showed us is covered in snow.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's f-freezing...and now the snow's so thick I can hardly see anything. Felicia/Jakob said it gets colder the closer you get to the Ice Tribe village. We must be on the right track. Right, Silas?

speaker: Silas
text: So it would seem.

speaker: Corrin
text: We must carry on. But my mind is...suddenly...hazy... And I can't...feel my...legs...

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: S-sorry, Silas. I'm fine, really. I just...fell a little. No big deal... Are you sleepy? I'm suddenly...so very...so very sleepy...

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin, no! Please, stay with me! You must not fall asleep!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'll get up soon, Elise. Just five more...minutes... Xander can wait... ... ...

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin? Corrin!
Halt! Who goes there?!

speaker: Silas
text: What the...?

speaker: Corrin
text: Arghh... Whaaa...

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin! Thank goodness... For a while there, I thought I'd lost you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas? What happened? I remember falling, and then everything went black. More importantly, where are we?

speaker: Kilma
text: You are safe now, young traveler. Welcome to my village. I am Kilma, leader of the Ice Tribe.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kilma... Thank you for your kindness. It would seem you saved my life. My name is Corrin. I am the second prince/princess of the kingdom of N—

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin! You should rest. NOW. You've had a long day.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas?

speaker: Kilma
text: Is something the matter?

speaker: Silas
text: My apologies, Kilma. Corrin just woke up—his/her mind is still foggy. Perhaps you would allow him/her to rest a bit more before we resume the introductions?

speaker: Kilma
text: ...Yes, of course. I'll go prepare something warm to drink. Please excuse me.

speaker: Silas
text: Phew...that was a close call.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas, what was all that about? I feel fine.

speaker: Silas
text: Don't forget yourself, my lord/milady. It could prove deadly.

speaker: Silas
text: I know all of this is new to you, but don't forget we came to suppress a rebellion. That means the Ice Tribe is disgruntled with the actions of the Kingdom of Nohr. In other words, we are their enemy. To identify yourself as a Nohrian prince/princess, especially while in a weakened state... It's simply a bad idea, old friend.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sound advice, Silas. You're right. I forgot myself for a moment.

speaker: Silas
text: Understandable for one who barely made it back to the land of the living. But we must exercise caution, or neither of us will ever see home again.

speaker: Corrin
text: There's such a fine line between friend and foe, war and peace. It's all so...gray.

speaker: Silas
text: Such is the world we live in, I'm afraid. I must say, you truly have a remarkable knack for getting into trouble. I never thought this is how we'd breach the village. What should we do now?

speaker: Kilma
text: A fresh pot of hot tea, as promised. This should help clear your head.

speaker: Corrin
text: Th-thank you very much.

speaker: Kilma
text: You know, I usually would not allow strangers into my village like this. However, I made an exception for you two. It's that sword you carry, Corrin. That golden blade looks just like that of the hero of legend... It is said the one who wields that blade is destined to save the world.

speaker: Corrin
text: My Yato... A legendary sword... Well, it's a nice thought.

speaker: Kilma
text: As you can imagine, I simply couldn't abandon you after I saw that blade. Who knows, maybe you are the hero the world has been waiting for. If so, then there's a chance we will one day break free from those cruel Norhians.

speaker: Kilma
text: If you'll excuse me, I believe I've babbled on about old Ice Tribe legends long enough. Ah, it looks like my daughter has finally arrived. Allow me to introduce you...

speaker: Flora
text: Corrin? Is that you?!

speaker: Corrin
text: What the... Flora?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Flora
text: I could ask you the same thing. And I shall. Why are you here, my liege?

speaker: Kilma
text: My liege?

speaker: Silas
text: This isn't good...

speaker: Elise
text: Brother/Sister! Yaaay, I knew you'd make it!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise!

speaker: Elise
text: What a relief! I was so worried once I realized we had gotten separated.

speaker: Felicia
text: F-Flora?! What are YOU doing here?! You told me you were going to hold down the fort while I was gone...

speaker: Flora
text: I changed my mind. Why did you and the others follow me here?

speaker: Felicia
text: Follow you? No way! I had no idea you were even here.

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora?! Why are you here? Didn't you agree to hold down the fort in my absence? Don't tell me Felicia is here too...

speaker: Flora
text: No, she's not. I came alone. Why did you and the others follow me here?

speaker: Jakob
text: Nonsense. Whyever would we follow you? I didn't even know you were here.

speaker: Elise
text: Yeah, that's right! We got here all by ourselves! We can't go back until we suppress the Ice Tribe rebellion like Father ordered!

speaker: Kilma
text: WHAT?!

speaker: Silas
text: Elise, why would you say that?!

speaker: Elise
text: Huh? What do you mean? It's not a secret. Wait...doesn't suppress mean... You know, that we ask them to please stop rebelling? And maybe eat dinner together?

speaker: Silas
text: Elise, you don't understand. It's not that easy.

speaker: Kilma
text: All has become clear as ice. You monsters tricked me into helping you so so you could infiltrate my village.

speaker: Corrin
text: I promise you, that was not our intention.

speaker: Kilma
text: Don't play dumb. Such childish games do not befit a prince/princess, even one of Nohr. I know how you Nohrians operate. Well, so be it. Flora! You know what must be done.

speaker: Flora
text: Yes, Father. I will sound the alarm right away. The Nohrians have infiltrated our village. They must be expelled immediately. And permanently.

speaker: Felicia
text: Flora! H-How could you say such a dreadful thing? Fighting was supposed to be a last resort! Can't we talk this out? Or at least try to?

speaker: Flora
text: Felicia, dear sister... You've always been ignorant to the ways of the Nohrians. War is the only language they understand. Side with them and you'll pay the price!

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora! How could you say that? Do you really intend to attack Corrin?

speaker: Flora
text: I have no choice, Jakob. You wouldn't understand. The Nohrians... War is the only language they understand. Side with them and you'll pay the price!

speaker: Silas
text: That could have gone better... Be on your guard, Corrin!

speaker: Kilma
text: The time has come to defeat the Nohrian army. Inform the villagers!

speaker: Silas
text: Sounds like Kilma is dead set on calling in reinforcements from the village. Maybe if we can get to them first, we can dissuade them from fighting...

speaker: Kilma
text: Did you truly manage to melt the lake's ice with the power of Dragon Veins? Well, it was all for nothing. This sacred land is blessed with divine protection. By the power of the Ice Dragon, our lake will freeze once more!

speaker: Odin
text: The darkness is calling...whispering... SEETHING. It's saying...hmmmm... Ahhh, I understand. The shadows within say our foes are unwitting yet dangerous. So it has been decided by the treacherous hand of fate. We have no choice... We must use the darkness swarming inside me to claim the golden glow of victory!

speaker: Niles
text: You're a damn weirdo, Odin. But you know that, don't you? In any case, I'm not going to let you take all the glory for yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: Uh, what's going on over there? Who are you?

speaker: Odin
text: Didn't you hear me? About the darkness?! Sheesh, some people are so rude. Well, it can't be helped. Who am I, you ask...

speaker: Odin
text: I am none other than... Odin Dark! I am the keeper of darkness, chosen protector of the youngest Nohrian prince!

speaker: Corrin
text: So...you're Leo's retainer? And he sent you here to help me?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that would be the sane version of what Odin just said. My name is Niles. By royal decree of Lord Leo, I am here to serve you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Serve me? I would rather you fight at my side as a friend and equal...

speaker: Odin
text: Don't worry about Niles. He's always like this. I suspect he's bitter that the dark spirits chose to inhabit me and not him... But back to the matter at hand. Don't be afraid, Lord/Lady Corrin... I will now use my powers to expel those who wronged you from this world. Ahh...the power! My fell hand awakens... It longs for the blood of our foes! I must annihilate them all, or the curse will surely—

speaker: Corrin
text: Woah, there! Take it easy. Let's all just calm down, OK?

speaker: Odin
text: What, why? But my sword...the curse... What's the holdup?

speaker: Niles
text: Is there a problem? When can we start inflicting pain?

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, no offense... I'm happy you came to help and all, but you're creeping me out. Besides, I would like to settle this dispute with as little bloodshed as possible.

speaker: Niles
text: So we can inflict pain so long as it doesn't cause bloodshed? Interesting challenge...

speaker: Corrin
text: No. Just...no.

speaker: Odin
text: But I prepared at least a dozen torturous moves just for today! I named them all, too. They might be my best names yet...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm very sorry for the, um, inconvenience, but I'm going to have to put my foot down.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if it's an order from my liege's royal sibling, I am obliged to obey. I may appear somewhat despicable, but I have the utmost loyalty for Lord Leo.

speaker: Odin
text: I, too, am a bastion of loyalty, despite the dark forces beckon me from beyond. It will be hard to hold back my true power, but for you, I'll see what I can do.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, gentlemen. Now let's finish this quickly!

speaker: Child
text: Whoa, a soldier! What's goin' on? Huh? Don't leave my house today? Well, if you say so. I'll tell my family.

speaker: Old Woman
text: The N-Nohrian army?! Leave me alone! I have nothing of value, I promise! I know, I'll lock myself inside. Oh, this is just awful. I hate being cooped up...

speaker: Old Man
text: So you've come at last. Scoundrels! Well, if you're going to kill me, get on with it! Huh? You're not going to kill me? I'm so confused... I'm locking up now. Don't come knockin' again, y'hear?

speaker: Boy
text: Ahhh! The N-Nohrian army is here?! But no... we're not ready to fight yet! Look, we surrender, OK? You win! We will not fight. Please spare my family!

speaker: Flora
text: As daughter of the Ice Tribe's leader, it is my duty to protect our people!

speaker: Flora
text: Argh! J-just finish it, why don't you? No point in showing mercy now...

speaker: Kilma
text: We are a proud people, and we shall not yield to the Kingdom of Nohr!

speaker: Kilma
text: You didn't take my life when you had the chance... Why? Tell me why!

speaker: Flora
text: I'm sorry, Corrin. Not for my actions, but for this unfortunate circumstance. Milord/Milady, as your retainer, I know this is tantamount to treason. But my family... My tribe... We simply cannot bow down to Nohrian rule.

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora... No need to apologize. I am the last person ever to begrudge you for your loyalties, my friend. Still, I shall do all I can to suppress this rebellion, albeit in my own way.

speaker: Flora
text: Felicia, my foolish sister. Did you really think this rebellion could be solved by a few pretty words?

speaker: Felicia
text: I'm no fool, Flora! You're the one who wants to fight without hearing us out! That in itself is a betrayal of pride and morality our tribe holds so dear!

speaker: Flora
text: You really don't understand, do you? This goes beyond words. Don't you realize, all of our time in that castle was... I mean, it was just...

speaker: Felicia
text: What are you saying, sister?

speaker: Flora
text: Forget it, there's no point telling you now, after all that's happened. Let's get on with it. You may be my sister, but I won't go easy on you!

speaker: Flora
text: Jakob... It's good to see you, though I wish it was under better circumstances.

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora... When I left you at the castle, I never dreamed I'd find you here. Here with your blade raised in anger against he/she who you swore to protect. I know the difficulty of your situation, but that doesn't excuse your actions. I'm afraid I have no choice to settle this matter with force.

speaker: Flora
text: Jakob... In the b-beginning, I never swore my allegiance. I refused. After all, we were little more than hostages. Taken as children... All to prevent this from happening, to stop the Ice Tribe from rebelling. I often thought of running away, but I never did. I stayed...because of you...

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora...

speaker: Flora
text: I don't want or need your pity, Jakob! Let's finish this!

speaker: Kilma
text: I was a fool to allow myself to be deceived by appearances. You are not the legendary hero after all. What a shame.

speaker: Corrin
text: I make no excuses for what my people have done to yours, Kilma. No matter how this ends, all I ask is that you listen to what I have to say.

speaker: Kilma
text: Felicia, my dear child. I never thought I'd see this day. Taking up arms against your own people, siding with the enemy...

speaker: Felicia
text: Father, please don't say such things! This is the last thing I ever wanted.

speaker: Kilma
text: It pains me to raise a hand against my precious daughter... But alas, this is how it must be for the good of the tribe. Gods, forgive me.

speaker: Corrin
text: The battle is over, at least for now. Thanks to your valiant efforts, we managed a victory without taking any lives. Elise, will you please attend to the injured, regardless of what side they fought on?

speaker: Elise
text: Leave it to me! I'll have them all healed up before you can say "Elise is the best!"

speaker: Kilma
text: The Nohrian army fought a battle without murder or brutality? How is this possible? What are you playing at, Prince/Princess of Nohr?

speaker: Corrin
text: This is no game, Kilma. I don't believe in killing for the sake of killing. Nor am I inclined to repay kindness with violence. I still owe you my life, after all.

speaker: Kilma
text: Even though we attacked you first, while you were weak, you still showed mercy...

speaker: Corrin
text: I would love nothing more than for this day to mark a turning point, for all of us. One fueled not by force, nor control, but by mutual trust. I know it will take time. It won't be easy, but in my heart I know it's the only way. When my Father ordered me to quell this rebellion, I knew I had to do it my way. Whatever the consequences, I want to build a world we can all live in peacefully.

speaker: Silas
text: Could it be...you really did intend to stop this rebellion with words, as Elise said? I would say it must be hereditary, but Elise isn't actually your blood relative.

speaker: Kilma
text: Wait, then are you not a prince/princess of Nohr after all?!

speaker: Flora
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! Is this true?! I don't believe it!

speaker: Corrin
text: It is true, Flora. I found out during my brief time in Hoshido. I am not King Garon's true son/daughter, nor this kingdom's true prince/princess. But I wish nothing more than to end this war, for all of us and for all kingdoms. That is why I must do all I can to make Father recognize me as his son/kin again.

speaker: Flora
text: I had no idea. I seem to have missed a lot after leaving the Northern Fortress...

speaker: Corrin
text: Forgive me, Lord Kilma. I know what I'm about to ask is a somewhat selfish request. But I must ask all the same... Will you and your tribe agree to halt your rebellion? In return, I promise to do all I can to give your people back your autonomy. I will not rest until the Ice Tribe regains the freedoms Nohr so cruelly stripped away. But for this to happen, I must first ask for your cooperation.

speaker: Kilma
text: ... You are full of surprises, young prince/princess. I never thought I would say this, but you may count on our full cooperation.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kilma! I...thank you! I swear to you, you won't regret this.

speaker: Kilma
text: There's a fierce kindness in your eyes, a mysterious calmness in your words. I'm afraid I can't help but take you at your word, Lord/Lady Corrin. If King Garon had said those same words, it would have made no difference. But you... You are a different story. I can't help but believe in you. Perhaps... Perhaps you are the hero that will save this world after all.

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, I'm not so sure about that last part, but I thank you for your trust.

speaker: Flora
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, can you ever forgive me? I know I betrayed my oath to serve you and ran away from the castle, but...

speaker: Corrin
text: No need to apologize, Flora. You did nothing wrong. It was wrong of the Nohrian kingdom to corner you like that, especially as a child. I will, as ever, speak highly of you to Father.

speaker: Flora
text: Your kindness knows no bounds, Lord/Lady Corrin. Thank you. Though I previously refused to do so, I here and now swear my fealty to you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, no need to go overboard, Flora. Without you and Felicia, I would have died of loneliness in the Northern Fortress. You have more than proven your fealty to me, as well as your friendship.

speaker: Flora
text: But that was all just a big... I mean, that whole time... ... I guess it doesn't matter now anymore. From now on, I promise to be truly loyal to you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not sure I fully understand, but the sentiment is much appreciated.

speaker: Elise
text: We're done healing everyone, Corrin! Easier done than said, heehee.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Elise. And you too, Felicia/Jakob. You both did well today.

speaker: Silas
text: Indeed, we all did! Now all we need is for King Garon to recognize your victory...

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, I forgot about that part! What are we going to do? You were supposed to stop the rebellion on your own, but we ruined everything. We've got to come up with some great excuse to tell Father or he'll be angry!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh, I had forgotten that part too. Well, I'll consider my options on the way home.

speaker: Kilma
text: Are you leaving already? Can I not persuade you to stay and rest a while?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm afraid time is of the essence, Lord Kilma. Next time we meet...I dearly hope the world will be a better place.

speaker: Kilma
text: I have every confidence it will be, Lord/Lady Corrin. May the gods protect you on your perilous journey toward peace.

speaker: Old Man
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, please wait! Us villagers wish to thank you. You went out of your way to prevent us from engaging in a futile battle. Though our soldiers tried to defeat you, you still protected and even healed us. Take this as a token of our appreciation. Please, I insist!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh, this forest is so dark and dismal... The trees are blocking the whole sky. I can't even see the moon from here. It feels as though we've been walking in darkness forever.

speaker: Ryoma
text: They say this is the darkest region in the kingdom of Nohr. Which is precisely why we're here. Most Nohrians would have a hard time tracking us through this area. Once we make our way through the forest, we'll be just outside the capital.

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you sure we're on the right track? I'd hate to get lost in here.

speaker: Felicia
text: Don't worry, Lord/Lady Corrin. I know my way around this place pretty well. Flora and I used to camp in this area in the summers. Between the two of us, we had every nook and cranny mapped out. Oh...Flora. *sob*

speaker: Corrin
text: Felicia...I'm so sorry.

speaker: Felicia
text: I'm sorry...I need a moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course. Take all the time you need. I can't imagine what you're going through.

speaker: Felicia
text: Thank you, Lord/Lady Corrin. I know we're all suffering in one way or another. I'm just trying to hold it together.

speaker: Corrin
text: We're all here for you, Felicia.

speaker: Corrin
text: So, Ryoma... I know Felicia said she knows her way around here... But it feels like we've been walking in circles for hours.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm? I don't think so. It probably just feels that way because it's so dark.

speaker: Corrin
text: I hope you're right. Oh, wait. There's something different.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What is it?

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I don't know. It's over there. Something glowing...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Is it some sort of animal?

speaker: Corrin
text: No. It's giving off an unnatural light.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I don't like the looks of this...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Do you think they could be more of Iago's optical illusions?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know, but I'd rather not find out. Let's get out of here!

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's too late—we're surrounded. Let's hope these...things...aren't hostile.

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I think this place is a graveyard.

speaker: Corrin
text: Faceless! They're everywhere! We're in trouble, Ryoma—I can barely see anything, let alone defend myself!

speaker: Ryoma
text: There's something strange about these Faceless. It's almost like they're...waiting. Usually they attack anything in sight without hesitation. Someone must be controlling them!

speaker: Corrin
text: You may be right, but knowing that will do us little good when we can't see anything!
Oh, Corrin. Have you really lost your night eyes so quickly? Hoshido has made you soft.

speaker: Corrin
text: Who's there?!
That's quite an attitude to take with a voice in the dark, is it not? See for yourself. Can you still not see me...

speaker: Leo
text: even when I'm right next to you?

speaker: Leo
text: Nohrian law is blunt on the subject of traitors. There is only one punishment... The sentence is death.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, Brother/Sister. I'm here to settle the score once and for all. No more running or hiding. It's time to answer for your betrayal! I've even gone to the trouble of trapping you in a proper graveyard. After all, the brother/sister I once loved is dead. It's only fitting.

speaker: Takumi
text: That's some big talk from a reedy little bookworm! We won't back down until we defeat your father, King Garon. Why don't you come down here and fight us face-to-face?

speaker: Leo
text: You're quite confident for a coward who shoots his foes with arrows from afar. If you think you can best me, so be it. Let's see how long you can survive my game. You Hoshidans think you're a ray of light in the world, but you're all hypocritical fools. True power comes from a heart forged in darkness!

speaker: Takumi
text: Gah! My feet—they're stuck! Aaaugh!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi? What happened?

speaker: Sakura
text: Ow! Eyaaah!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ughhh...I'm getting so...tired. So...drained...

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's the swamp! Everyone, get out of the water right now!

speaker: Corrin
text: Strange, it doesn't seem to be affecting me...

speaker: Leo
text: Hmm. So your connection to Nohr hasn't been completely severed, I see... No matter. There will be no escape today. In the dark forest, where even the moon and stars dare not shine... All sources of light shall be swallowed up in my darkness, because I will it so. Hoshidans, who have spent all their days in the light, can't survive without it. I'm surprised it didn't work against you too. This only goes to show you were meant to side with us. You chose wrong, Brother/Sister. You chose the light and left those who love you most to rot in the dark, traitor!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, Leo! Stop this! I don't wish to fight you, Brother!

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh, how annoying. I would love nothing more than to best you in battle. Xander always lavished you with praise while ignoring my accomplishments... Camilla was the same. She...she always loved you more than me! You were Xander's perfect little toy soldier and Camilla's dress-up doll! I've always resented you for that, Brother/Sister. I've been keeping all this in for so long, but it doesn't matter anymore. Had I known you'd betray us, I wouldn't have bothered being intimidated by you!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Do...do you really mean that? Have you always resented me? I thought...we were so close. Did you never truly love me? Tell me!

speaker: Leo
text: ...I'm not going to give you the satisfaction of answering that. I'm just going to kill you now.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, no!

speaker: Odin
text: Out of darkness, I spring into action. Fear me! I am Odin Dark!

speaker: Odin
text: Urgh! Back into the darkness I go...

speaker: Niles
text: Say, that’s a nice face you’ve got there. Would be a shame if someone were to slash it. Let’s have some fun, shall we?

speaker: Niles
text: Oof. That’s enough of my own medicine for today. I’ll just slip away now…

speaker: Leo
text: I hope you like the dark. I'm about to drown you in it...

speaker: Leo
text: No...I can't fall like this... Not until I prove myself...

speaker: Odin
text: Halt! I am Odin Dark—warrior chosen by the darkness. It’s been a while, hasn’t it, young Corrin? It’s a shame that I will have to destroy you now, but orders are orders. If only you had stayed true to our glorious and noble kingdom...

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Odin
text: Oh. That’s not the reaction I expected. Do you not remember the darkest and most mysterious of heroes?

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, sorry. I have a really bad memory. REALLY bad. By the way, what’s with the whole "warrior chosen by darkness" thing?

speaker: Odin
text: Yes, well...I am the night! I am the...er... I can’t do this.

speaker: Corrin
text: Then throw down your weapon! There’s no need for us to fight!

speaker: Odin
text: No! Must...tame...the darkness... Let’s just get this over with! I can’t control my powers around you...

speaker: Niles
text: So, you’re the little thorn in my master’s side, are you? Very well. If he wants you dead, who am I to argue?

speaker: Corrin
text: I still can’t believe it. We lived as brothers/sister and brother...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes. The suffering on your face is simply delicious. Now, let’s see what happens when you have a few more holes...

speaker: Corrin
text: You’re sick!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please. This is war. This is my job. I’m good at what I do. I’ll try to make this painless so you can die in peace. Deal?

speaker: Leo
text: Ah, so you made it all the way here. I suppose that means I'll have to kill you with my own hands.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, be honest. Did you really mean what you said earlier? Have you...have you really always hated me? Because...I've always loved you.

speaker: Leo
text: There's no point in answering that. It's all over now.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo...

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh... Go ahead. Do what you must.

speaker: Corrin
text: No. Accept your defeat, and we can end this together.

speaker: Leo
text: Don't you see? This can't ever end! Not until one of us is dead.

speaker: Corrin
text: No! I can't accept that. There was no need for our kingdoms to be at war in the first place. This is all Father's doing, Leo! He's fooled us all!

speaker: Leo
text: You've always been naive, Corrin. This is war! This is life and death! Only the strong survive! If Nohr bows down, we'll lose everything. Our land and our people...our culture and our legacy... Our families...even our lives. I won't let Hoshido take anything more from us! I won't back down!

speaker: Corrin
text: Am I the one who's naive? Or is it you, blind to Garon's lust for power?

speaker: Leo
text: Ha! As though the Hoshidans have never ended a life to serve their own purpose. They would slit your throat in an instant if they thought it served them.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's not true! From the moment I arrive in Hoshido, I was treated as if I belonged. The same goes for Azura. King Garon is mad with power, and he must be stopped!

speaker: Leo
text: Huh?!

speaker: Corrin
text: I hate to do this, but... Don't move an inch, Leo, or I will be forced to end you.

speaker: Leo
text: Heh, I don't doubt your ability to hurt me, dear brother/sister. Go on. Kill me. End this battle, just as you wish.

speaker: Leo
text: What are you waiting for? I'm not helpless, even in this position. I could kill you right now with a spell. Make your move.

speaker: Corrin
text: No...

speaker: Leo
text: Why? What's wrong with you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Me? What's wrong with you? Why haven't you cast your spell?

speaker: Leo
text: Because...

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, I know you. We grew up together. I know you've got a good, kind heart.

speaker: Leo
text: Shut up!

speaker: Corrin
text: No, listen...

speaker: Leo
text: I told you to shut up! What makes you think you understand anything about me?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Because we're family, Leo. Regardless of my true lineage, I'll always think of you as my little brother.

speaker: Leo
text: Hmph.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won't ever give up on you. You said you'd kill me...but I'm still here. If you really wanted me dead, you could have done it a dozen times by now.

speaker: Corrin
text: I believe in our bond, Leo. I have to believe you wouldn't really kill me. As one who betrayed Nohr, maybe I don't have the right to say this, but... I don't want to fight against you, or anyone in Nohr, but especially my family. I still love you, Brother. That will never, ever change.

speaker: Leo
text: *sigh*

speaker: Leo
text: I...I'm sorry, Brother/Sister. I lied to you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, it's OK.

speaker: Leo
text: I never hated you. Not...not ever. I was jealous at times, sure. You were always Xander's favorite. And Camilla...she always doted on you so...

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand. There's no need to say anything more. But, Leo...please. Please join us, Brother! Help us put an end to this war.

speaker: Leo
text: You're asking me to betray my father. And Xander. And everyone else... How can I do that? I can't hurt my siblings! I won't do it!

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can't answer that. Only you can. I'll admit, it's a tough road to tread.

speaker: Azura
text: You'll have to find your own reasons for joining us. We can't give you the answers. But I do have something that can help you...clarify your thoughts.

speaker: Leo
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Azura
text: Take this. Look deep inside it. You might find it helpful.

speaker: Leo
text: Huh? What is it? It looks like some kind of crystal.

speaker: Azura
text: It's...not something I can explain. You'll just have to try it for yourself.

speaker: Leo
text: I see... Understood.

speaker: Leo
text: So you're Azura. You were originally a princess of Nohr, right? Does that mean... Are we related?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, I am Azura. But I'm afraid we're not related.

speaker: Corrin
text: But I thought—

speaker: Azura
text: I'm afraid I haven't been able to share everything about my past quite yet...

speaker: Leo
text: Does that mean you're not originally from Nohr after all? Why are you being mysterious? Why can't you just come out with it?

speaker: Azura
text: I assure you—I have my reasons. But I have given you everything you need to find the answers. That's all I can do.

speaker: Leo
text: Very well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, what are you going to do?

speaker: Leo
text: I don't know. I'm not ready to completely forgive you for betraying Nohr and tearing our family apart. There are a lot of questions that I need answered.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Leo
text: To be honest, all of this may be moot. None of you realize how strong Xander has become.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, I've sparred with Xander dozens of times. I know he's strong, but I'm ready.

speaker: Leo
text: Hah! You mean your friendly little tickling contests up on the roof? You do know he always went easy on you, right? You...know that, right? Xander means business now, Corrin. He is not to be taken lightly. You may have stopped me and my small army of Faceless today... But I doubt the lot of you could defeat Xander all at once.

speaker: Corrin
text: He can't be...THAT powerful... Can he?

speaker: Azura
text: What can we do, Leo?

speaker: Leo
text: Truly, there may be nothing you can do. But I know one thing you can TRY. Make a pilgramage to Notre Sagesse.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Notre Sagesse...land of the philosophers? What possible benefit lies there?

speaker: Leo
text: Notre Sagesse is home to the Rainbow Sage. I don't know who he is or what he does, but Xander visited him ages ago. Upon returning, he put on display of powers the likes of which I've never seen.

speaker: Corrin
text: I hate to ask...but how far away is Notre Sagesse from here?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's more than halfway back to Hoshido, I'm afraid. The most direct route would take us back through Cyrkensia. And then we'd still have a lengthy boat ride ahead of us...

speaker: Corrin
text: Then it's hopeless. We've come too far together to backtrack like that.

speaker: Leo
text: What will you do? I assure you that facing off against Xander as you stand would be akin to suicide.

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose I have no choice. I'll have to go to Notre Sagesse alone.

speaker: Takumi
text: Are you serious, Corrin? Please don't tell me you believe this clown.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi, I've known Leo my whole life. I believe he's telling the truth about Xander. So, even though this is a setback...I believe it gives us the best chance at victory.

speaker: Takumi
text: Unbelievable.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry. I'm not asking anyone else to come with me.

speaker: Takumi
text: Who said anything about not going with you? I just want to make sure you think long and hard about this.

speaker: Corrin
text: But...

speaker: Hinoka
text: We're all with you, Corrin. Right, everyone?

speaker: Sakura
text: Of c-course!

speaker: Corrin
text: Really, I can make this pilgrimage alone...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Nonsense! We stand with you, Corrin.

speaker: Azura
text: Did you really have any doubt? We will all follow your lead.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, everyone. I'm...humbled to have your confidence and support. Especially you, Ryoma. To think...you could be king right now...

speaker: Leo
text: Very well. I suppose if you're all determined to do this...I shouldn't hold this back. Please, take this.

speaker: Corrin
text: What is it, Leo? A book?

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, a warp book. It has the power to transport you instantly to Notre Sagesse. Consider it an even trade for the item Azura gave me.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! That can't be possible, can it?

speaker: Leo
text: Oh yes, Corrin. Believe it. This is why I've always put my faith in books rather than blades. Given the size of your party, I'd say this book has the power for ONE round trip. So, don't push your luck with it...

speaker: Corrin
text: One round trip should be plenty. Thank you, Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, well...I wasn't sure that helping you would be the right decision. But after seeing how determined you are... I suppose it just seems right. You've always been a bit reckless, haven't you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo.

speaker: Leo
text: It's time for me to go now. We'll see each other again, I'm sure of it.

speaker: Corrin
text: He smiled! It's been so long... since I saw that smile. How bittersweet.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I can imagine. Thank you for keeping a steady head throughout all of this. You're a natural-born leader, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Ryoma. I'm just glad I didn't have to kill my own brother. As for you, Leo... I know you can't hear me, but I wish you safe travels. My kind and precocious little brother, who was ever at my side... I hope you find the answers you're looking for... And one day, I hope we'll be together again, as we should be.

speaker: Mikoto
text: You look as if you’re feeling better after a few days to yourself, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: I am, yes. I still have many questions, but at least now I have a few answers. Thank you for giving me the space I needed to think.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Of course. I’m glad to hear you’re feeling better. If you wouldn’t mind, I have a small favor to ask. Would you try sitting on the throne for a moment?

speaker: Corrin
text: Why would I do that?

speaker: Mikoto
text: Well…this throne is infused with the power of the First Dragons. It is said that those who sit on it regain their true form and mind. I thought if you sat on the throne, then perhaps-

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait… Do you not trust me? Do you think I’m under some kind of Nohrian spell?

speaker: Mikoto
text: No! It has nothing to do with trust. I just wonder if the Nohrians have been sealing away your early memories… If so, maybe this special throne could help bring those lost pieces back. Those sweet memories of me and your siblings…

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Mikoto
text: I’m sorry, Corrin. I don’t mean to push you toward something you don’t want.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Excuse me, Lady Mikoto. The ceremony is about to begin.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Thank you, Yukimura. Corrin, you probably don’t remember him, but this is Yukimura. He’s one of our strategists and brightest leaders. We would be lost without him!

speaker: Yukimura
text: You are too kind, milady. Though in truth, I still have much to learn. That said, I am here to help in any way I can, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Mikoto
text: I’d like to make a public announcement about your presence here, Corrin. There have been rumors circulating about spies from Nohr infiltrating the castle. I would like to quash those rumors once and for all. Yukimura, is everything ready?

speaker: Yukimura
text: Yes, milady. People are beginning to gather at the plaza.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Excellent. Thank you. Corrin, I’ve arranged for Takumi, Hinoka, and Sakura to give you a tour. I thought you might want to get to know the area a little bit before this event. I need to speak with Yukimura first, but I’ll meet you at the plaza soon.

speaker: Hinoka
text: We’d be happy to show him/her around. Thank you, Mother.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Azura, do you mind going with them as well?

speaker: Azura
text: Not at all. It would be my pleasure.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura.

speaker: Azura
text: Of course, Corrin.

speaker: Takumi
text: Hmph.

speaker: Sakura
text: I can’t wait to show you around! I think you’ll l-love it here.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Sakura. A guided tour sounds like a great idea.

speaker: Mikoto
text: I hope Corrin is truly OK with all of this…

speaker: Yukimura
text: Yes, I can’t imagine the position he’s/she's in. It’s a lot to process. That said, I think his/her return is a message from the gods.

speaker: Ryoma
text: A good message, I hope.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I don’t know. After that invasion up north, I just feel uneasy. We should remain on high alert, if you ask me.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Hey, young man/lady! Would you like to try my world-famous roasted potatoes? They’re delicious and nutritious! I guarantee you’ll love ’em.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well…sure! Why not? Mmm…I’ve never tasted spices like these before. This is amazing!

speaker: Old Woman
text: Ha ha! Told ya! Here, take an extra one on the house. Share it with your lady friend!/friend!

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, thank you very much! Here you go, Azura.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin. Mmm, you’re right. This is delicious.

speaker: Corrin
text: Everyone really is friendly here. And it’s so…bright…and open. It’s quite a contrast from the fortress I grew up in.

speaker: Azura
text: I’m glad you like it. Like I said, I’ve always been happy here.

speaker: Takumi
text: Just don’t get too comfortable…BROTHER/SISTER.

speaker: Corrin
text: Pardon me?

speaker: Takumi
text: I don’t trust you. Shouldn’t you be heading back to Nohr soon?

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi…

speaker: Takumi
text: Hey, who said you could call me by name? You haven’t earned that privilege either.

speaker: Corrin
text: That doesn’t even make sense.

speaker: Takumi
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura has been in Hoshido for as long as I’ve been gone. Shouldn’t that be enough to consider her part of the family?

speaker: Takumi
text: I don’t care. I don’t trust either of you. I just wanted to tell you that to your face.

speaker: Sakura
text: I apologize for Takumi’s rudeness. He’s a bit of a hothead. Anyway, how’d you like to try a sweet rice dumpling? It’s a Hoshidan specialty!

speaker: Corrin
text: I’d love to. Thanks, Sakura!

speaker: Sakura
text: You’re welcome!

speaker: Corrin
text: You know, I’m very close with a girl in Nohr who’s around your age.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh? What's she like?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, she's generous and kind. Always putting the need of others first...

speaker: Hinoka
text: All right, everyone. The ceremony is starting. Let’s head to the plaza!

speaker: Corrin
text: *gasps*

speaker: Mikoto
text: You were not hurt? Tell me you’re OK.

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m fine…

speaker: Mikoto
text: I’m so glad…

speaker: Corrin
text: Mother!

speaker: Sakura
text: Mother?… Mother!

speaker: Ryoma
text: You there! Show yourself!

speaker: Takumi
text: Gods! What is that?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's an ancient dragon. I never thought I’d see the day…

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! A word of warning, if you can hear me. Watch out for enemies carrying Wyrmslayers! They’re a type of blade designed to pierce dragon scales-and they work!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, listen! My song can help you win this battle. Using it can give you another chance to attack or take cover in a pinch. Please don’t hesitate to ask me for help!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Be careful, everyone! These enemies are no mere Faceless. One wrong move and they’re perfectly capable of ending you. I hope we can count on Corrin even in this new form…

speaker: Sakura
text: Watch out for magical attacks, Corrin! Your defense against physical attacks is strong…but you’ll need higher resistance to protect yourself against mages.
Show me…what you’ve got. Heh. Heh. Heh…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Vengeance will be mine... Prepare to die!
Heh. Heh. Heh...

speaker: Ryoma
text: You can kill me, but you cannot kill the spirit of Hoshido!

speaker: Sakura
text: Brother, no! You have to step back! We can’t afford to lose you…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ugh…you’re right. I’ll retreat for now…

speaker: Azura
text: No! You can't die like this, Corrin! What are we going to do without you...

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves ♪ Ahh...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Azura! No, stop!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ooh! *gasps*

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves, destined to seek ♪  Life beyond the shore, just out of reach.

speaker: Azura
text: Yet the waters ever change ♪

speaker: Sakura
text: No! *whimpers*

speaker: Azura
text: Flowing like time... ♪  The path is yours to climb.

speaker: Azura
text: Kill me if you want, but…do it as yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* Ughhh… I…I finally remember! I remember…

speaker: Garon
text: Fire at will.

speaker: Garon
text: I’m disappointed in you, Sumeragi. *sinister laugh* That wasn’t even my best trap.

speaker: Garon
text: You poor thing. Orphaned at such…a tender young age. You are my child now.

speaker: Corrin
text: My real father…

speaker: Azura
text: Are you all right, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I’m fine. Just disgusted with myself. Are you OK? I can’t believe what I just did to you. It was like…I had no control over myself.

speaker: Azura
text: Please don’t worry about it. That wasn’t you. It was the blood of the ancient dragon that runs in your veins.

speaker: Corrin
text: I thought only the Nohrian royal family had dragon blood.

speaker: Ryoma
text: The blood of the Dusk Dragon runs in the Nohrian royal family. And the blood of the Dawn Dragon runs through ours. But you’re special, Corrin. You can actually take the form of a dragon.

speaker: Azura
text: I’ve heard of such a thing. But this is my first time seeing it in real life…

speaker: Corrin
text: … Never mind me. What happened to all the innocent people in town?

speaker: Corrin
text: I can’t believe this. The entire town…devastated. An hour ago these streets were filled with vendors and children and…

speaker: Ryoma
text: So you see, Corrin. This is the work of the Nohrians. This is what they do. Let me guess. That sword you carried…was it a gift from King Garon?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes.

speaker: Ryoma
text: He masterminded the whole thing. It’s not your fault. He knew you’ll be captured and brought before the queen…

speaker: Corrin
text: But why? Why would he do this? I’m so sorry I couldn’t see it coming…

speaker: Takumi
text: Your apology means NOTHING.

speaker: Takumi
text: This is all your fault! Mother is dead, along with countless others. And it wouldn’t have happened if you hadn’t shown up on our doorstep. You don’t belong here!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Enough, Takumi!

speaker: Azura
text: Your words don’t change anything. And besides-

speaker: Takumi
text: Shut up, Azura! You’re no different than Corrin. An interloper.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi…

speaker: Takumi
text: Don’t speak my name! I don’t want to see you again. Are we really to believe you had no idea this would happen?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Takumi, what are you saying? Knock it off! You just saw Corrin help us defeat those Nohrian soldiers!

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi, please. You must listen. Corrin is your brother/sister. If you don’t trust me, that’s one thing. But Corrin is your own blood.

speaker: Takumi
text: Mother is dead. Thanks to him/her. He’s/She's not my brother/sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m so sorry, everyone. I’ve brought nothing but pain to all of you. It would be better if I’d never come here— maybe I should just leave.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Please wait. I don’t believe that’s what Queen Mikoto would have wanted.

speaker: Takumi
text: What do you know about it, Yukimura?

speaker: Ryoma
text: What do you mean? Did she say something to you?

speaker: Yukimura
text: I hate to deliver this news, but… Queen Mikoto foresaw her own death. This isn’t your fault, Corrin. King Garon set these events in motion. And the queen speculated that there may be an even darker force at work. She didn’t know when or how death would strike, only that it was certain. And there’s one other thing. Please take a look at that statue.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that…a sword?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It can’t be…

speaker: Yukimura
text: It is. The divine sword Yato. Much like your weapon, Ryoma. The divine Raijinto… And your Fujin Yumi, Takumi... Yato may be wielded by only a singular warrior. One who is chosen by the blade itself. It is said that the Yato was forged to be the key to peace in our world.

speaker: Corrin
text: The key to peace…

speaker: Ryoma
text: The blade has chosen Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: Impossible.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin, do you know what this means?

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin? Are you listening? Can you h-hear us?

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord Ryoma! I have important news. A massive Nohrian force is gathering at our border.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is the final straw. I have worked hard to avoid an all-out war, but now… Death is too good for them. Who’s with me?

speaker: Corrin
text: There must be another way. Surely the answer is not more bloodshed. But I feel I must follow Ryoma to the border. If I can help avert total war…

speaker: Azura
text: Wait, Corrin! There’s something you need to know. If you become embroiled in a fight right now, it would be easy to lose control. Your dragon blood could take over again. And if you yield completely to the dragon, you may lose your humanity altogether.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is there anything I can do?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. This is called a Dragonstone. It will allow you to control the dragon’s power and still return to your human form. Now, please close your eyes…

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well…

speaker: Azura
text: … There. You should be OK now. This Dragonstone is now attuned to you. Be sure to keep it safe.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura. I don’t know what I’d do without you.

speaker: Azura
text: Oh! Um…

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m sorry. Did I make you uncomfortable? I know we’ve known each other only a short while, but I feel close to you. You already risked your life to help calm my dragon form. I only hope I can repay the favor someday.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin. I feel close to you as well. I feel…safe when I’m with you. I wish to keep you safe too. That’s why I’m coming with you to face Nohr.

speaker: Azura
text: This is it... Fort Jinya. This is essentially Hoshido's front line. It's rumored to be impregnable. Seizing it is tantamount to conquering Hoshido. We must not fail.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* Of course it's impregnable. Why is it never easy?

speaker: Azura
text: We should brace ourselves. We will likely be battling people we know in there.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm ready. We've made it this far... There's no turning back now. It's just like Xander said. No matter who we lose...or who we end up hurting... We must do what we must do to bring peace to this war-torn land.

speaker: Azura
text: You're right. Even if I must defeat the siblings I grew up with... It is for a higher purpose. Neither of us should regret the events to come. We're in this together, Corrin. I will follow you to the end.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura. Your support gives me strength. Well, there’s no reason to postpone this any longer. The soldiers inside have likely already realized we're here. We should attack first, before they do. Let's go.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Lady Sakura, what are you still doing here? You must escape! NOW!

speaker: Sakura
text: Wh-what's the matter, Yukimura? You're out of breath!

speaker: Yukimura
text: Milady, you must stop healing our soldiers and retreat. There isn't a moment to lose. Lord/Lady Corrin and his/her army are outside the fort, preparing for battle.

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin's here? ...I see. Then I will j-join the fight.

speaker: Yukimura
text: You don't know what you're saying. You need to get back to the castle right—

speaker: Sakura
text: I WILL NOT LEAVE!

speaker: Yukimura
text: L-Lady Sakura?!

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm sorry, Yukimura. I know you're only looking out for me. But I'm no longer a powerless princess. I will f-fight for my kingdom. I refuse to leave these soldiers behind and be the only one who escapes! Please, Yukimura. P-please try to understand.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Lady Sakura... *sigh* My word, what to do? Lord Ryoma would kill me for this, but... If it means that much to you to stay, then I shall not force you to retreat. But only if you allow me to arrange for your protection. We shall fight together.

speaker: Sakura
text: Th-thank you, Yukimura.

speaker: Hana
text: I swear that my sword will not rest until Lady Sakura is safe!

speaker: Hana
text: Lady Sakura, I'm so very sorry... I've lost... Forgive me...

speaker: Subaki
text: I will defend this fort, as well as Lady Sakura's honor!

speaker: Subaki
text: I actually...lost...? How clumsy...

speaker: Sakura
text: I won't let you pass! The people of Hoshido are too p-precious to me!

speaker: Sakura
text: I failed... I guess I'm still just a p-powerless princess...

speaker: Yukimura
text: My brain against your brawn... Let us see which one comes out on top!

speaker: Yukimura
text: Lady Mikoto... I am sorry...

speaker: Hana
text: You're finally here, Lord/Lady Corrin! I am Hana, Lady Sakura's retainer. I'll have your head on a platter!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Hana
text: I could never, ever forgive you after what you did to Lady Mikoto! You tried to destroy Hoshido, and you made Lady Sakura sad... Do you have any idea how many nights she cried herself to sleep over you?! That's why I won't be satisfied... Not until I kill you myself!

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...are you crying?

speaker: Hana
text: Sh-shut up! Samurai don't cry! You're just trying to distract me! I won't cry and I won't lose! You won't hurt my beloved Sakura ever again! You absolutely WILL NOT make it past me. You won't, you won't, you won't!!

speaker: Subaki
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, I presume? The sweet, wonderful, mysterious-yet-charming big brother/sister of Lady Sakura? It's an honor to finally make your acquaintance.

speaker: Corrin
text: Erm... Come again?

speaker: Subaki
text: Oh, Lady Sakura said those things about you after you two met. She wouldn't stop saying those things, as it were. Even after you left. As her retainer, I make it my business to remember such details.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura... She really said all that?

speaker: Subaki
text: Yes. She seems to have nothing but the highest opinion of you. She was devastated after you betrayed her.

speaker: Subaki
text: Worry not. All will be as it should once I send you to your grave. I cannot bear to ever see that sad look in her eyes again. The one YOU caused. So, shall we begin?

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura... I didn’t expect you to be here. But if you insist on blocking our way, I won't back down.

speaker: Sakura
text: I know... And I know I probably can't w-win against you, either. But as a princess, I have to at least try to protect my kingdom! So, r-ready your sword. It's time to battle!

speaker: Corrin
text: As you wish.

speaker: Sakura
text: This is the first time we'll really be fighting, B-brother/S-sister. I wish...we were fighting side by side instead...

speaker: Sakura
text: Azura!

speaker: Azura
text: Sakura... I'm surprised to see you here. When did you learn to fight?

speaker: Sakura
text: After M-Mother died, I began training, so I could protect the ones I love. I won't let anyone get past me - not even you!

speaker: Azura
text: I see. I always knew you would grow into a strong woman. I'm happy to see you like this, Sakura. Whatever happens, I'm proud of you.

speaker: Sakura
text: Azura... *sniff... sniff... * My... sister...

speaker: Azura
text: Don't cry, Sakura. This is a battlefield, and we are at war. Ready your weapon, dear Sister. Show me how strong you've become.

speaker: Sakura
text: *sniff* OK! Let's b-begin!

speaker: Yukimura
text: I will defend this fort and Hoshido, until death if I must. Though seeing us fight would have destroyed Lady Mikoto, it must be so.

speaker: Corrin
text: This is not how I would have wanted this to end either, Yukimura. But here we are... So brace yourself!

speaker: Xander
text: Listen well, Hoshidan army. This fort belongs to Nohr now! To fight back would be futile. Throw down your weapons and surrender! Do as I say, and the lives of all remaining soldiers will be spared!

speaker: Yukimura
text: Bah! I'm afraid we've been outmatched. We have no choice... None who remain are in any shape to continue this battle. The wisest path open to us is to surrender and live to fight another day...

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm s-so sorry... I should have... If only I were...

speaker: Yukimura
text: Nonsense, Lady Sakura. You fought bravely, I am quite proud of you. The same goes for you two, Subaki and Hana.

speaker: Subaki
text: Yukimura... This cannot be happening...

speaker: Hana
text: *sniff* We really lost...didn't we?

speaker: Yukimura
text: Yes, I'm afraid so. But we are still alive. As long as we live, so does our cause. Let us lay down our weapons now. It's time to surrender. There's no reason for any more blood to be shed on these stones.

speaker: Sakura
text: *sniff* Y-you're right Yukimura. It's over...

speaker: Xander
text: Hoshidan army! This is the last time I will repeat myself. The Nohrian army has claimed this fort for our own. Surrender now and—

speaker: Yukimura
text: We heard you the first time, Crown Prince of Nohr.

speaker: Xander
text: Then you should have responded sooner, lest I mistake your silence for cowardice. Or do you still intend to fight the inevitable?

speaker: Yukimura
text: No, we do not. You have won. The Hoshidan army surrenders. All remaining soldiers have been instructed to lay down their weapons. We do so in good faith that you will, at the least, spare our princess...

speaker: Xander
text: You have made the right choice. Your fallen queen would be proud. In return, I promise that your princess and your troops will be spared. Soldiers! Bind the prisoners! But under no circumstances are they to be harmed!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Yes, milord!

speaker: Yukimura
text: Ugh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura, Yukimura... Please forgive me. I know it seems cruel, but this is the only way to end this awful war once and for all. I know you don't understand now... But perhaps one day...

speaker: Hoshidan
text: GYAAAAAA!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Hans
text: HA! Is this really all you Hoshidan rats are capable of? Pathetic!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Yukimura
text: What is the meaning of this?! You swore to spare our soldiers' lives if we surrendered!

speaker: Sakura
text: No, please! I need to heal them right away or th-they'll... Please untie my hands! I swear I won't try to escape! PLEASE, let me help them!!

speaker: Iago
text: I'm afraid I cannot allow that, princess of Hoshido.

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago!

speaker: Iago
text: Ah, if it isn't Prince/Princess Corrin! My, how easily you seized this fort. What a truly impressive display of brute force! King Garon will certainly shower praise upon you for this grand triumph.

speaker: Corrin
text: I could not care less about praise right now, Iago. What is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Iago
text: We were just SO worried about our young prince/princess! We came to help. Now that we're here, just leave the messy part to us. General Hans here is all too eager to put these sorry Hoshidans out of their misery.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, you monster! Those soldiers already surrendered! The battle is won! I will not allow you to take the lives of unarmed soldiers. Stand down, NOW.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh dear, how awkward. You may wish for us to stand down, but you see...

speaker: Hans
text: Die, die, DIE!!

speaker: Hoshidan
text: AAAHHHH!!

speaker: Hoshidan
text: GAAAHHHH!!

speaker: Sakura
text: NOOO! Please, stop it! Don't kill anyone else—I beg of you! *sob* Please...

speaker: Corrin
text: That's ENOUGH, Iago! I order you to stop this madness!

speaker: Xander
text: Damn you, insolent fool! Stop with this cruelty now, or so help me, I will kill you myself!

speaker: Iago
text: What?! You can't be serious, Lord Xander!

speaker: Xander
text: I am not known to make light of serious matters, Iago. I refuse to harbor a cruel and spineless general in the proud Nohrian army. As crown prince, I will not hesitate to strike you down for the honor of Nohr.
Not today, Xander. Stand down.

speaker: Xander
text: No... It cannot be!

speaker: Xander
text: Father...

speaker: Garon
text: My orders have been given. I will not allow anyone, even my own child, to disobey.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Father! Xander was just—

speaker: Garon
text: Did I not make myself clear?! Disobey and die!

speaker: Corrin
text: ... ...Y-yes, Father.

speaker: Xander
text: ...Under...stood.

speaker: Garon
text: Good. Let that be the end of it.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Liars! Cowards! Filthy Nohrian scum! I will never forgive you for this! NEVER! You're all monsters! Demons! DEVILS!!

speaker: Sakura
text: *sob* H-how could this...happen... They were supposed to be safe... This is... It's just too cruel!

speaker: Garon
text: You've done well, my children. Hoshido is as good as conquered. I am proud of you.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is quite a passage. It's more like a catacomb than a tunnel.

speaker: Elise
text: Yeah, there's some spooky stuff down here for sure!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Heh. Thank you for the warning. But I think we'll be all right.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, thank you so much for accompanying us here, Elise. We'll be alright from here. I'd recommend that you stay with Cassita for a while...

speaker: Elise
text: What? Why?

speaker: Corrin
text: Because...we're heading to the castle. That means that we'll be facing off against King Garon, and likely Xander too. Things could get ugly, and there's no need for you to be there.

speaker: Elise
text: So what you're saying is...you're going to try to kill Xander and Father. Right?

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I'm afraid I must do whatever it takes to end this war. Ultimately, I have to do what's right for the people of Hoshido and Nohr. If that means killing King Garon, or even Xander... Well...

speaker: Elise
text: I see... That settles it. I'm coming with you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?! No, Elise! It's too dangerous! And I can't let you fight your family! That's a burden I alone must bear.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, don't be silly. I'm not gonna fight with anyone, and neither are you! I'm not siding with or against you, Brother/Sister. I want to help bring both sides together! I want the war to end just as much as you do. So! I'm coming with you to let Xander and Father and everyone else know how I feel. They're still super mad at YOU, but maybe they'll hear me out! Maybe we CAN end the war without any more fighting! Don't we at least have to try to end this without hurting each other more?

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise... All right. I suppose you won't be in any danger from either side. Just promise me that you won't do anything reckless.

speaker: Elise
text: Yep, yep! I promise!

speaker: Corrin
text: All right, then. Let's get moving!

speaker: Corrin
text: So far, so good. This passage appears fairly well traveled. Although...I see a fork in the road ahead. Which way do we go, Elise?

speaker: Elise
text: The path on the right leads to an area near my quarters. Camilla said that the other path leads more or less to the throne room.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Left path it is.

speaker: Elise
text: But...she also said the left path is like a maze. She warned me to NEVER take that path, you guys!

speaker: Corrin
text: Don't worry, Elise. You wouldn't believe what we've had to overcome to get here. I'm confident that we can get through anything together.

speaker: Elise
text: If you say so...

speaker: Corrin
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Elise
text: It's just...you almost seem like a different person now. You're so...commanding. I guess I just have to get used to you being all grown up...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's true...I've done a lot of growing since I left Nohr. But don't worry, Elise. I'm still the same old Corrin. And I'll always do everything I can to protect you, Little Sister.

speaker: Elise
text: Aww, thank you. I'm so glad you came back! I love you so much!

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha! Whoa! Easy with the monster hugs. I almost fell over!

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee!
Ah! Did you hear that? That's Lady Elise's laugh!
Oh ho! You're right! Let's report this to Lady Camilla posthaste...

speaker: Ryoma
text: This part of the tunnel seems a bit ominous. Be on guard, everyone!

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, are you seeing all of these traps? Most of 'em have been sprung, but I bet there are even more that haven't.

speaker: Hinoka
text: And the ones that did spring look like they were pretty effective. I'm seeing more corpses than I'd like...

speaker: Sakura
text: C-corpses? Eek! I thought those were just decorations to make it spooky! I'm scared, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's OK, Sakura. If you want to close your eyes, I can lead you through this part.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh...th-thank you so much...

speaker: Elise
text: What about me? I'm scared too!

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh. I can help lead you, too. Just come over to this side.

speaker: Elise
text: Yay! Heehee! Uh-oh...do you hear that? There's someone behind us!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise...have you ever seen any Faceless down here?

speaker: Camilla
text: Ah, Elise. There you are! I've been looking all over for you.

speaker: Elise
text: Camilla! What are you doing down here?

speaker: Camilla
text: Like I said, I was looking for you. Are you hurt, darling? Who are all these people? Are you being kidnapped right now?!

speaker: Elise
text: What? No! These are—

speaker: Camilla
text: The Hoshidans! I knew it. Well, I'm so glad we could meet down here. How DARE you bother my baby sister. I shall now make you all dearly regret ever stepping foot in here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hold on, Camilla. It's me, Corrin! We're not kidnapping Elise!

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin! How can this be? You're back in Nohr!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's...a long story.

speaker: Camilla
text: Well, have you come to your senses? Are you returning to Nohr for good?

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh...um... Sorry, but no. I want Hoshido and Nohr to be at peace, and that can't happen while Garon lives.

speaker: Camilla
text: Hmm. I see. So you want to come back, but these awful people are still confusing your little head. Don't worry, darling. Big Sister is here to take care of these monsters for you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla, no! You don't understand!

speaker: Elise
text: Please listen, Sister!

speaker: Camilla
text: Don't worry, Elise. I promise to save our precious Corrin. Once I've killed all his/her friends, he's/she's sure to remember his/her true family. Right? Right!

speaker: Arthur
text: Never fear, Lady Elise! Arthur is here to vanquish your captors!

speaker: Effie
text: This won't be anything more than a light workout...

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, Arthur. I don't need saving! And, Effie...save your energy!

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, Arthur and Effie... Those are your retainers, aren't they?

speaker: Elise
text: Yep! They're the best! They seem to think you're kidnapping me... Whoops! This is all my fault for sneaking out and running around with you. If you can get me over to them, I'm sure we can smooth this over.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK, I'll give it a shot. But remember...this is still a battlefield. Stay close!

speaker: Arthur
text: Lady Elise! I'm so glad you're safe. I was so disappointed in myself when I heard you were missing.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, Arthur. I just came down to get away from the castle for a while. And just to be perfectly clear—Corrin is not kidnapping me!

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh. So there'll be no valiant rescue for me to perform today, I suppose...

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee! No, sorry about that, Arthur. I'm perfectly safe with Corrin. I'm trying to help him/her gain an audience with Father, that's all.

speaker: Arthur
text: Very well. I'll retreat the way I came. And I'll let Effie know as well. However, there's nothing I can do to stop Lady Camilla at this point. I hope you understand, milady.

speaker: Elise
text: *sigh* I know. My big sister can be so stubborn sometimes... Anyway, when this is all over, I'd like it if you came to my quarters for tea.

speaker: Arthur
text: Erm...you mean it's not over...now?

speaker: Elise
text: There's one last thing I gotta help Corrin with! It's all up to me! Don't worry about me. I'll be perfectly safe with Corrin. And afterward we can celebrate a new era of peace with some tea! Heehee!

speaker: Arthur
text: Nothing would please me more, milady. I shall await your triumphant return!

speaker: Elise
text: Yup! Thanks, Arthur. I'm lucky to have you as my retainer!

speaker: Arthur
text: You kind words are much appreciated.

speaker: Effie
text: Corrin, step away from Lady Elise at once!

speaker: Elise
text: No, Effie...it's OK! Corrin isn't kidnapping me. I snuck out of the castle on my own.

speaker: Effie
text: I don't understand... We've all been worried sick!

speaker: Elise
text: I'm trying to help Corrin settle things with Father before someone gets hurt. I can't stand watching people I love trying to kill each other. That includes you!

speaker: Effie
text: Well...my allegiance is to you above all others, Lady Elise. So as long as it appears you are in no danger, I will retreat. However, I'm not sure I can persuade Lady Camilla to stand down. I'm sorry. I hope you understand.

speaker: Elise
text: It's OK. I understand. When all of this is over, please meet me back at my quarters.

speaker: Effie
text: When all of this is over? What do you mean?

speaker: Elise
text: There's still something I need to help Corrin with! I won't be long. Don't worry about me, Effie. Like I said, when this all blows over, we'll have tea in my quarters. I can't wait!

speaker: Effie
text: Very well, milady. I'll let Arthur know you're OK. Please stay safe.

speaker: Elise
text: Yup! Thanks, Effie. Love you!

speaker: Effie
text: I love you, too...

speaker: Arthur
text: In the name of justice, I won't let you scoundrels kidnap Lady Elise!

speaker: Arthur
text: I've failed you, Lady Elise... Please...forgive me.

speaker: Effie
text: I've been training my entire life for this moment. Do you really think you stand a chance?

speaker: Effie
text: I couldn't protect you... I'm so sorry, Elise...

speaker: Selena
text: I let you win last time. You know that, right? Well, the kid gloves are coming off this time! You're going down!

speaker: Selena
text: Not fair!

speaker: Beruka
text: I'll defeat you all. Then Corrin will return, and Lady Camilla will smile again...

speaker: Beruka
text: How frustrating...

speaker: Camilla
text: Hmm... Once all of you are out of my way, Corrin will be all mine!

speaker: Camilla
text: I still love you, Corrin...

speaker: Selena
text: Ugh. You again.

speaker: Corrin
text: Why do you seem so unhappy to see me?

speaker: Selena
text: We're about to fight, dummy! Lady Camilla told me not to kill you, though, so I guess it's your lucky day.

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh, so you're going to go easy on me, then?

speaker: Selena
text: Argh! Yes, but ONLY because Lady Camilla said so! Geez! Anyway, I'm not allowed to kill you, but that doesn't mean I can't beat you up!

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Beruka
text: What are you doing? I'm not supposed to kill you. Just get out of my way, and I'll let you live.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sorry, I can't do that. You'll have to get through me to get to my friends.

speaker: Beruka
text: But I...I'm not allowed to kill you. This doesn't make sense.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're exactly right! There's no need for us to fight.

speaker: Beruka
text: Hmm. I can't disobey an order. I suppose I'll just have to render you unconscious and then kill your friends.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, I'm so happy you're coming back to us, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla...I'm not coming back. I'm trying to end this war! I don't want to fight you, but I can't let you stand in my way.

speaker: Camilla
text: Awww, I can't stand to see you upset like this. Come over here, and I'll just put you to sleep for a little while. I won't hurt you! I just need you to stay calm while I kill these fiends...

speaker: Corrin
text: You leave me no choice...

speaker: Camilla
text: So...it wasn't meant to be...you coming back to us... And now it looks like I'm losing my precious Elise, too...

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla. You're not losing anyone. Elise is just coming with us to help persuade King Garon and Xander.

speaker: Camilla
text: Persuade them? Is it...possible?

speaker: Elise
text: Well, we won't know until we try. We have to change their minds to stop the fighting! I'm just doing whatever I can to bring our family back together again. It turns out we all want the same thing, Camilla! To be together again!

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, Elise...

speaker: Corrin
text: Listen. When the war is over, I want to establish a peaceful alliance. If Nohr and Hoshido are on cordial terms, we don't have to be estranged. I must believe that if I end the war, I'll be able to return to my family one day.

speaker: Camilla
text: Do you really think peace is possible? I'd love to be a family again...

speaker: Corrin
text: What is the point of believing otherwise? We will either forge a peaceful future or die trying.

speaker: Camilla
text: I see. Well, I suppose it would be wonderful if we could all get along... I think I understand what you're trying to do. I hope you can make it happen.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Camilla.

speaker: Camilla
text: Yes...I can imagine it now. Xander, Leo, Elise, and...the Hoshidan Prince/Princess Corrin. We could all have a picnic! And there would be games, and food, and... Oh, dear...I'm feeling a bit woozy...

speaker: Elise
text: Camilla, are you OK?

speaker: Selena
text: Her pulse is strong, and she's breathing normally. I think she's fine. But she took quite a beating in that fight, and she must have been exhausted... No matter. We can take care of her. The rest of you are free to go.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? You won't try to stop us?

speaker: Selena
text: Yeah! You heard what she said, right? We can't go against Lady Camilla's orders just because she's unconscious! As much as I'd like to keep fighting...

speaker: Beruka
text: Selena...anger is clouding your judgment.

speaker: Selena
text: Whatever, Beruka! I'm tired—why don't you pick up Camilla and carry her back to her quarters.

speaker: Beruka
text: Why me?

speaker: Selena
text: Did you not hear me? I'm tired! That's why you!

speaker: Beruka
text: I see.

speaker: Selena
text: All right, Corrin. Get out of here before we change our minds! You just gave Lady Camilla hope... Don't go breaking her heart again!

speaker: Beruka
text: Go ahead, Corrin. Hurry.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Thank you. And thank you, Camilla, for finally understanding my aim. This war is coming to an end...I promise!

speaker: Leo
text: Corrin, we've got trouble up ahead.

speaker: Xander
text: Yes, it would seem our path is blocked by thousands of Hoshidan soldiers. If they engage us, we don't stand a chance.

speaker: Corrin
text: Dammit! This is bad...

speaker: Azura
text: Ryoma must have ordered them to intercept us as soon as he returned. A logical course of action since he knew where we'd be coming from.

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose we'll have to backtrack and find another way into the capital.

speaker: Azura
text: Not necessarily. There's another path just ahead we could potentially use.

speaker: Corrin
text: I get the feeling there's a catch.

speaker: Azura
text: To the west, there's a path through the mountains the Hoshidans never use. There would be no danger of running into their troops. However... That mountain is home to kitsune, a race of people who can transform into foxes. If they find us, there's no guarantee we'll make it back down the mountain alive.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Azura
text: What will you have us do? I know it's tempting to avoid such a risky path... But the more time that passes, the more time the Hoshidans will have to prepare.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* You're right, Azura. We'll go through the mountain. We need to end this war quickly so we can expose the truth about Father.

speaker: Azura
text: Sadly, I agree. Come, I'll show you the way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh, we've climbed up so far already. I wonder where the kitsune live...

speaker: Azura
text: I'm not sure. Very few people have found their village and made it back in one piece. For all we know, we may have already passed it. Pray that's the case. For now, all we can do is remain on guard.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps we should pick up the pace...

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
