text: Don't be frightened, Elise. Hold my hand if you need to, OK?

speaker: Elise
text: Um, it's not that... Look over there.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hm?

speaker: Kaden
text: Ehem.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that what I think it is?!

speaker: Azura
text: A kitsune! Gods, no...

speaker: Kaden
text: ... Hey there, travelers! Nice to meet you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, um... H-hello.

speaker: Kaden
text: It's been a long time since anyone's come up here for a visit. Are you Nohrian humans? You look like Nohrian Humans...

speaker: Azura
text: How does it know we're from Nohr?

speaker: Kaden
text: I'm not an "it", human! I have a name. A better name than yours, no doubt. Call me Kaden. I'm the chief of this village.

speaker: Azura
text: My apologies, Kaden. That was very rude of me. May I ask how you were able to discern that my friends and I are from Nohr?

speaker: Kaden
text: Your clothes, for one. And that smell. *SNIFF* Yep. You’re Nohrian, all right. That's great though. Nohrian humans are fine by me. I tend to wander away from home and lose my way now and then. Nohrian humans always seem to be the ones to help me find my way back. I love Nohrian humans!

speaker: Azura
text: Hm...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's nice to meet you, Kaden. I'm happy to see kitsune are friendlier than expected. We've heard all kinds of crazy rumors about people losing their lives to your kind... But it seems all that is just one big misunderstanding.

speaker: Azura
text: No, I'm afraid that's not so.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! Why would you say that?

speaker: Azura
text: Take a look around.

speaker: Kitsune
text: Grrrr! Rrrowl!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Kitsune! They must have surrounded us while we were distracted!

speaker: Kaden
text: Keehee, not bad, eh? It really was nice to meet you. I wish we could have met elsewhere. I really loathe violence, but since you stepped into our territory... Sorry, but you humans have to die now.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! But you just said you like Nohrian people...

speaker: Kaden
text: Oh, I do! You smell so nice and are expert fur brushers! Honestly, all the humans I've met in the outside world have been nothing but kind. But the humans who come directly into our village never are. Our elders taught us long ago that humans who come here will kill us and take our fur! That's why we have to kill anyone who comes here, to protect our own.

speaker: Corrin
text: But we're not like that at all! We just want to pass through peacefully.

speaker: Kaden
text: Hmmm... I'd really like to trust you. You have an honest face for a human. But as village chief, it's my job to protect everyone, I can't risk it. I love my people too much... Even though I hate fighting, for them I will. I'm really sorry about all this.

speaker: Corrin
text: That makes absolutely no sense!

speaker: Kaden
text: If we meet in the afterlife, I'll make this up to you. Maybe we can even be friends! But for now... This is good-bye.

speaker: Kaden
text: As chief, I will protect my own! This is for peace! It really is!

speaker: Kaden
text: I'm sorry...everyone...!

speaker: Azura
text: It's over. Let's move, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I know we had no choice but to fight them. Still...it felt wrong. We came here to avoid being massacred, but in the end...we're the ones who...

speaker: Azura
text: It could not be helped, Corrin. Though inherently peaceful, they were serious about killing us. We would have all died if we had held back.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know... Still, my heart breaks for them.

speaker: Azura
text: I know what you're thinking... That they'd still be alive if we hadn't come this way. But the war would have been prolonged, and others elsewhere would have died. Surely you see that?

speaker: Corrin
text: This war doesn't concern them. They were only guarding against potential poachers. They died because we brought them into this mess. Because I did.

speaker: Azura
text: And what would you have sacrificed to save them? Your family? Your kingdom?

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?

speaker: Azura
text: In this world, there is no clean-cut path. You can't save everyone. Each path represents a choice to protect one thing while sacrificing another. All you can do is try to protect those you love as best you can. I know it's hard...but we must follow our hearts and let the tide of fate fall as it will. So forgive yourself, Corrin. For all the tragedy that has come and is yet to come. Forgive yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: Forgive myself...?

speaker: Azura
text: Do you remember what you were told about your blade in Hoshido? Your Yato is a legendary sword destined to bring peace to the world. That sword chose you, and you chose this path. Don't you see? No matter how hard it is, or how sad, this path must be the right one. I truly believe that. I hope one day you will too.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... Thank you.

speaker: Azura
text: A smile? How refreshing. That's Corrin I'm used to seeing.

speaker: Corrin
text: If you were trying to cheer me up, you did an amazing job.

speaker: Azura
text: It was for the team. After all, I'm supposed to be the melancholy one! Now let's get down this mountain before the Hoshidans catch wind of our location.

speaker: Corrin
text: I wonder... Is she right?

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves, destined to seek ♪ Life beyond the shore, just out of reach.

speaker: Azura
text: Yet the waters ever change, flowing like time ♪ The path is yours to climb.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Nohrian general! You face the high prince of Hoshido, Ryoma! I challenge you to single combat!

speaker: Xander
text: I will accept your challenge, "high prince". But I'm no general. I am crown prince Xander of Nohr!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Come on, Corrin! We've got work to do.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin, what's the matter with you? You seem distracted... If you're worried, don't be. All your siblings are here with you. The Nohrians don't stand a chance!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ready to attack?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I demand to know why you Nohrian dogs are invading Hoshido! Was that cowardly attack on my people your doing as well, princeling?

speaker: Xander
text: ...I have nothing to say to you. Surrender now. If you refuse...you die here.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, no! The bridge collapsed! How can we help our brother/sister now?

speaker: Camilla
text: Not to worry, Elise. This royal blood in our veins is still good for something!

speaker: Leo
text: Have you spotted a Dragon Vein, Camilla?

speaker: Camilla
text: You know me too well, dear little brother!

speaker: Elise
text: Yaaay, it worked! The river dried up!

speaker: Camilla
text: I would never let you down, darling. Now, everyone follow me.

speaker: Leo
text: Elise, you're not ready for the front lines. Stay back. Camilla, and I will take care of the Hoshidans.

speaker: Hinoka
text: The Nohrian army used a Dragon Vein to dry up the river! But I thought only royals held that power...

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, which means there must be some real big shots over there. Suit me just fine. I've always wanted to use a Nohrian royal for target practice!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Stay focused, Corrin. The Nohrians brought their heavy hitters this time.

speaker: Hans
text: Listen up, cannon fodder! We have a direct order from King Garon. He says kill 'em all!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Dammit, their reinforcements had arrived! I'll go scout out how many there are. Takumi, Sakura, Stay with Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: Understood.

speaker: Sakura
text: Y-yes. Good idea.

speaker: Takumi
text: Hang in there, Corrin. The Nohrian royals are not pushovers... We'll have to work together to beat them. As the eldest, I guess you're in charge. Tell me what to do and I'll do it.

speaker: Sakura
text: Are you hurt, Corrin!? Here, let me heal your wounds!

speaker: Yukimura
text: Comrades! Do not let them cross this line. We must defend Hoshido.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh n-no! An enemy!

speaker: Takumi
text: It's an ambush! Sakura, stay back. You aren't equipped to fight.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Takumi! Corrin! I'm counting on you two. Work together to defeat that solider!

speaker: Takumi
text: Listen, here's how we're gonna do this! With my bow, I can shoot this one from here. I'll soften him up, and then you can jump in and finish him off. Got it?

speaker: Sakura
text: Be careful, Corrin!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin, Takumi, good work fighting off that ambush.

speaker: Sakura
text: You were amazing, Corrin.

speaker: Takumi
text: That went well. Probably because SOMEONE gave you good advice. ...And you're welcome, by the way.

speaker: Hinoka
text: No time to talk! Let's see how Ryoma's doing.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ryoma, are you alright?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'll be fine. I'm glad to see you're all safe. Enemy reinforcements are headed this way. I want you to get rid of them. Corrin, I'm counting on you to keep Hinoka and the others safe.

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin! Thank heavens we found you, and that you're alive and well. Quickly, come join us! Your family has come to take you home where you belong.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Quiet, Nohrian filth! Corrin is my brother/sister and a prince/princess of Hoshido!

speaker: Xander
text: On the contrary, Corrin is MY brother/sister and a prince/princess of Nohr!

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin! I was so worried about you. Don't ever wonder away from me again!

speaker: Leo
text: I'm glad you're OK, Corrin. You must have the devil's own luck!

speaker: Elise
text: Yaaay! We got our brother/sister back!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Nohrian scum! First you kidnap him/her, now you lied to him/her?! Corrin is MY brother/sister, not yours!

speaker: Camilla
text: You are mistaken. Corrin is my sweet little brother/sister. You may not have him/her.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Don't be fool by their words. You belong with your true family in Hoshido!

speaker: Xander
text: We have loved you and raised you since you were a child. Come home, little prince/princess. We can live as a family once more!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Come home to Hoshido, Corrin!

speaker: Xander
text: No, Corrin! Nohr is your home!

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow. This is Cheve? If Ryoma is here, he's probably not in dire need of our help.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Actually, Corrin, Cheve is still inland from here. This place is called Cyrkensia. It belongs to the kingdom of Nestra. Nestra is another neutral kingdom, Like Izumo. As you can see, this city is known for leisure. People from both Nohr and Hoshido vacation here, even in times of war.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah. Well, it certainly seems lively!

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. You'd hardly know there's a war going on elsewhere...

speaker: Corrin
text: Let's hope it stays that way.

speaker: Kaden
text: Hey, guys! You're humans, right? Are you from Hoshido? My name's Kaden!

speaker: Corrin
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Kaden
text: You know, humans? Like, you don't have fuzzy tails or ears? And you don't transform into any other creatures?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well...yes and no.

speaker: Kaden
text: Aww, you're not going to answer my questions? That's rude!

speaker: Corrin
text: No, I'm sorry. It's just that...it's complicated. And as to whether we're from Hoshido... Also complicated. Sorry that I can't be more specific right now. May I ask who—and what—you are?

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, he's a kitsune—a Hoshidan tribe with shapeshifting abilities.

speaker: Kaden
text: Yup! That's exactly it. I can turn into a fox! Wanna see?

speaker: Azura
text: Kaden, what are you doing so far from home? I thought kitsune didn't leave the village for any reason.

speaker: Kaden
text: Yeah, that's true. But I'm a little different, I guess. I'm here to return a favor for someone. Anytime someone's nice to me, I have to be nice in return. One day, I walked out of my village and met some humans. And they were so excellent to me! I had to find a way to repay them. That led me to meet more humans, who were also super nice. One favor led to another, and I wound up here without even knowing how I got here.

speaker: Azura
text: So...you're actually lost?

speaker: Kaden
text: Nah, kitsune never get lost.

speaker: Azura
text: All right. Let me put it another way. Do you know how to get home?

speaker: Kaden
text: No. I don't. But I can't go home yet anyway! I owe someone here a big favor. Hmm... Maybe you guys could help me out... It kind of seems like a human problem, so I don't really know what to do. Here, can you talk to my new friend about it? Her name's Layla.

speaker: Layla
text: *sob*

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh. Um, hello. How can we help you?

speaker: Layla
text: I don't think that you can...

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, try us. We've just arrived, so we have a little time before we have to move on. I know we don't owe you anything, but we'd like to help.

speaker: Layla
text: Very well. My mother lives in a small village a few miles from here. She's old and frail, and I'm told the end could come at any moment. I really need to go and see her right away, but there's a problem... I'm a singer, and I have a performance scheduled today...for King Garon.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods! King Garon is here now?

speaker: Layla
text: Yes. He visits the area often, and he always requests a performance from me. But how can I sing at a time like this?

speaker: Azura
text: I believe that we can help. I can perform in your stead.

speaker: Layla
text: Do you really think that will work?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not sure about this, Azura.

speaker: Azura
text: Don't you see, Corrin? This is our chance to take the enemy by surprise. We shouldn't waste the opportunity!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

speaker: Kaden
text: Uh, guys? Can you not tell that these two look COMPLETELY different? I mean, I know you don't have sweet fox vision like me, but...

speaker: Azura
text: Kaden, we have a mage traveling with us who can make me look exactly like Layla. Your decision to accept Zola is looking quite sage now, Corrin.

speaker: Zola
text: Wait, what do you want me to do?

speaker: Azura
text: You heard me, Zola. While King Garon is distracted by my song, others can approach undetected. If we capture Garon, Nohr would have no choice but to negotiate for peace.

speaker: Zola
text: I don't know. Garon would DEFINITELY kill me if he found out...

speaker: Corrin
text: I thought you were on our side now, Zola. We need you! We are trying to end the war as peacefully as we can. Don't you see that?

speaker: Zola
text: Ugh... I understand. I'll do it. The Nohrians will see Lady Azura as Layla. However, you must understand that my spell won't change her voice! I hope you've got some good pipes, Lady Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, rest assured... Azura is an incredible singer.

speaker: Hinoka
text: That's right. This wouldn't be the first time she's mesmerized a crowd with her voice.

speaker: Layla
text: Well...if you say so. I would be so grateful for the chance to see my mother. Are you really sure about all this? If you fail, King Garon is going to be really mad...

speaker: Azura
text: Don't worry about us. Just go see your mother while you still can. And thank you for providing us this opportunity.

speaker: Layla
text: All right. Good luck!

speaker: Kaden
text: Yay! I think Layla and I are even. But...now I owe you guys. Wow! I've really got myself in a pickle with this whole favor thing... Do you think I could tag along with you humans until I figure out how to repay you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaden, you do realize that we're in the middle of a war, right?

speaker: Kaden
text: Yeah, that sounds crazy and exciting! Did I already tell you that I can turn into a big, scary fox? It's so great!

speaker: Corrin
text: And do you have any combat experience as a fox?

speaker: Kaden
text: Ha! Take a look at this beaststone. It makes me super fierce.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. I suspect you'll be able to repay your supposed debt to us rather quickly.

speaker: Sakura
text: Everyone, we don't have much time left before the show s-starts...

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. Zola, time to work your magic...

speaker: Takumi
text: The show's starting...where's King Garon?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know... Ah, look up there. In the roped-off area. I haven't seen him since the attack. I still can't believe this is happening.

speaker: Takumi
text: Who's that sitting next to him?

speaker: Elise
text: Maybe this music will help distract me from all the awful things going on...

speaker: Corrin
text: That's Elise, my sister. She looks so sad. She was such a bright and cheerful girl before all this happened... Poor Elise. I'm so sorry for choosing to stand against you. When all of this is over, I hope you'll understand the decisions I made...

speaker: Azura
text: Ahem...

speaker: Elise
text: Tell me, Father. What sorts of things does this performer sing about?

speaker: Garon
text: Does it matter? Her voice is divine. Just sit back and enjoy the show.

speaker: Elise
text: All right...

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

speaker: Corrin
text: That song? No, Azura! What are you doing?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't believe it. It's working! The Nohrian soldiers are enthralled by the song. Now's our chance! Soldiers of Hoshido, gather yourselves--

speaker: Garon
text: Well, well, well. Just what do you think you're doing, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Gah!

speaker: Garon
text: Capture them, men!

speaker: Corrin
text: There are so many of them...

speaker: Garon
text: Did you really think you could outsmart me, Corrin? Pathetic.

speaker: Elise
text: What are they going to do to my Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise!

speaker: Garon
text: How fascinating. Despite your treason and betrayal, you still seem to care about your sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't understand. How could you have anticipated this?

speaker: Garon
text: Ah, Corrin. Your naiveté is embarrassing. I still can't believe you willingly allowed one of my men to travel with you.

speaker: Zola
text: Eek! King Garon, what are you doing? They didn't need to know that!

speaker: Corrin
text: Zola was behind this? But he proved his loyalty!

speaker: Takumi
text: That's right. I could be dead if it weren't for him.

speaker: Zola
text: What better way to convince you all? I knew a healer would be nearby.

speaker: Takumi
text: You filthy rat! I'll kill you myself!

speaker: Zola
text: So...Your Majesty. I've followed through on my end of the deal... Can you please tell Lord Leo not to kill me after all? And, um, while you're at it... Would it inconvenience you terribly to pardon Lord/Lady Corrin? The Hoshidans have practically brainwashed him/her! This isn't his/her fault.

speaker: Corrin
text: What's the matter, Zola? Conscience bothering you?

speaker: Zola
text: Please, King Garon! I beg you!

speaker: Garon
text: This grows tiresome.

speaker: Zola
text: Wait...but...

speaker: Garon
text: But nothing! You think you have the right to ask ME for anything?

speaker: Zola
text: Gyaah!

speaker: Elise
text: Father! What are you doing?

speaker: Zola
text: Ugh...Lord/Lady Corrin...please forgive me...

speaker: Corrin
text: That was heartless.

speaker: Garon
text: Still you pity a...creature...such as that! One who betrayed you, nonetheless! This is the source of your weakness.

speaker: Corrin
text: Do you really think it's OK to use people as you see fit and then dispose of them? How admirable.

speaker: Takumi
text: I'll show you weakness. Just come within range of my bow...

speaker: Corrin
text: No. We can't make a stand here. There are too many of them. We need to escape and regroup. Everyone, make for that exit!

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like they’re sending in more reinforcements…

speaker: Xander
text: So it’s come to this. You dare to point your sword at our king… The same man you once called Father.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander…

speaker: Silas
text: Please understand, milord! Lord/Lady Corrin’s actions are justified! King Garon’s dark ambition is the sole cause of this war. Unless we stop him, both kingdoms with continue to suffer.

speaker: Xander
text: Your words mean nothing, traitor.

speaker: Silas
text: Prince Xander, please…

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander, listen—

speaker: Xander
text: I will not. You have betrayed our family, and as such, deserve a traitor’s fate. Draw your sword, Corrin, and we’ll settle this once and for all. Go on! If you would oppose us, then kill your brother with your own hands! Destroy the very friends and soldiers who once protected you!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! There's an escape route behind the stage! Hurry! Before they overwhelm us…

speaker: Garon
text: Are you actually attempting to engage me in battle? Very well. Do your best!

speaker: Garon
text: Hmpf. This is a waste of time. My men can take it from here.

speaker: Xander
text: How reckless. Corrin hasn't prepared you for this fight. Well, his/her failings will be your undoing. Prepare to die.

speaker: Peri
text: I'm gonna bring your guts back to Lord Xander! Teeheehee!

speaker: Peri
text: Huh...that's strange. Usually, I'm the one doing the stabbing and killing. I need to retreat and think about this...

speaker: Laslow
text: Hey! Don't look at me like that!

speaker: Laslow
text: Blast. I hope Xander doesn't restrict my leisure time for this...

speaker: Corrin
text: You're not my father, and you never were. Prepare to die.

speaker: Garon
text: I may not be your father, but I will slap you down like a child. This foolishness ends now!

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother, this is madness.

speaker: Xander
text: I’m not your brother anymore. Put that notion out of your head. By your own choice, we are enemies now. Prepare to fight!

speaker: Peri
text: Ooh! I found you, you little traitor!

speaker: Corrin
text: I am not a traitor! King Garon is a tyrant! And who are you, anyway?

speaker: Peri
text: Not a traitor? But Lord Xander said you were... I'm Peri! No offense, but I'm going to kill you now.

speaker: Corrin
text: None taken. Wait, what am I saying?

speaker: Corrin
text: Who are you? I don't remember you from the castle....

speaker: Laslow
text: Oh, that's too bad. I've always had the highest opinion of you. I'm Laslow, one of Lord Xander's retainers.

speaker: Corrin
text: And I suppose you're here to stop me like the others...

speaker: Laslow
text: Yes, per Lord Xander's orders. It does seem unfortunate.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* I...I think we’re safe here.

speaker: Xander
text: You can’t escape from me, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother!

speaker: Xander
text: You’ve gotten stronger, little prince/princess. But not strong enough. You have betrayed not only your king but your whole family. To think...I once called you Brother/Sister and loved you with all my heart…

speaker: Elise
text: Xander! Corrin! Please stop what you’re doing!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise! What are you doing?

speaker: Xander
text: Stand back, Elise. Leave this to me.

speaker: Elise
text: No! I won’t let you hurt Corrin. If you must fight someone...fight me!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise, please. Don’t do this.

speaker: Azura
text: Quickly—Elise has distracted Xander. Now’s our chance! We have to cut our losses and run. Fighting here put the innocent people of Nestra at risk.

speaker: Corrin
text: But…

speaker: Azura
text: Hurry, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Argh!

speaker: Xander
text: That’s right. Run away while you can. I will always find you, little prince/princess. It is your destiny to face me…

speaker: Takumi
text: I think we really did shake them this time.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. For now. But we’re eventually going to have to settle things once and for all with Xander. I’ve got a lot of work to do before I’ll be his equal in battle.

speaker: Takumi
text: You’re right. I’ve also got a long way to go.

speaker: Corrin
text: Still, we should take advantage of this chance to rest. We won’t get many. Have you seen Azura? I want to make sure she gets the message.

speaker: Takumi
text: Hmm, I saw her a minute ago… Ah, she’s right over there. Behind that tree.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Takumi. Tend to your wounds, and rest well. I’ll talk to you later.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hello, Azura. Is everything OK?

speaker: Azura
text: UNNGH…

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa, what’s wrong?

speaker: Azura
text: *huff* *huff* Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, it’s me! What’s going on? Are you hurt?

speaker: Azura
text: No, no. I’m fine. Please, don’t worry…

speaker: Corrin
text: You really don’t seem fine. Wait here. I’ll go get Sakura.

speaker: Azura
text: No! Really, I’m fine. I just...need a moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you sure? You look exhausted.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. I suppose I am. Thank you for your concern. Really, though. I’m starting to feel better…

speaker: Corrin
text: All right…

speaker: Azura
text: Come on, we should get going. Ryoma is still out there somewhere.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait, Azura—

speaker: Corrin
text: Damn.

speaker: Corrin
text: … … …Hm? Where…am I? It’s so dark… I can’t see a thing… And I’m…so very…tired…

speaker: Mikoto
text: Rise and shine, sweet Corrin…

speaker: Corrin
text: M-Mother?

speaker: Corrin
text: What’s going on? Is this…my room…?

speaker: Mikoto
text: You’re right where you belong, my love. Did you sleep well? You’ve always been such a sleepyhead, even when you were a baby. You’d always put up such a fuss whenever I tried to wake you up. So cute!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hm… Really?

speaker: Mikoto
text: My sweet boy/girl, didn’t Ryoma promise to train with you today? If you don’t get up right now, you’ll be late! You know how much he hates tardiness.

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m going to train…with Ryoma? But I’m still…so sleepy…

speaker: Mikoto
text: Now is not the time for sleep, darling Corrin. I wish I could let you stay… Let you sleep forever so I could keep you here with me. But I can’t be selfish… You have so much left to do.

speaker: Corrin
text: Mother? What are you--?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin! Are you really still in bed? Why am I not surprised?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma!

speaker: Mikoto
text: I told you your brother would not tolerate being kept waiting, haha!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Grab your blade and meet me in the castle garden, lazy brother/sister. The longer you make me wait, the harder this training session will be on you.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK… I’ll be right there… But where did I leave my… That’s odd… Where did my Yato go?

speaker: Ryoma
text: What’s wrong, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I can’t find my sword… But that’s OK. I’m sure I can find another one around here somewhere.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Are you sure you don’t want to find your Yato, Corrin? Don’t you need it?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ha! So, you think if you beat me with your Yato, you can save the world. Is that it?

speaker: Corrin
text: Mother? Ryoma? What are you—

speaker: Ryoma
text: Wake up, Corrin. Surely you haven’t forgotten my dying words?

speaker: Corrin
text: Your…dying words?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: … I’m counting on you, Corrin… That’s what I told you isn’t it? Isn’t it, Brother/Sister?

speaker: Corrin
text: !! Ryoma! You did tell me that… You said it right before you…

speaker: Ryoma
text: So you do remember. I knew you wouldn’t forget.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma… Wh-where am I?! Did Takumi’s last attack…kill me?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Nearly, but you can still go back to that world if your desire is strong enough. If you wish to keep fighting, you can return to your precious allies.

speaker: Corrin
text: Back to…my allies?

speaker: Azura
text: Wake up, Corrin!!

speaker: Azura
text: Please, we need you to wake up! You can’t die here!!

speaker: Takumi
text: Corrin…is dead…at last. He/She will never…open her/his eyes…again.

speaker: Xander
text: Bite your tongue, beast! Corrin is not dead. He/She WILL return to us! I won’t allow such a grotesque monster to take anyone else from me!

speaker: Takumi
text: You are…next…Prince Xander. I will…kill you!!

speaker: Xander
text: ARGH!!

speaker: Azura
text: AHHHH!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Those voices! That was… Xander and Azura!! My friends and loved ones are still fighting Takumi?! But I thought his anger would subside after defeating me…

speaker: Mikoto
text: The bitterness entrapping Takumi is stronger than you know. The beast within will not be satisfied until he has destroyed all Nohrians. But your allies—they won’t give up on you. They believe that you will return to them. They believe you will rise and fight with them once more.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods…

speaker: Azura
text: You must not die here, Corrin. The world still have needs of you…

speaker: Felicia
text: I know you too well, milord/milady! You definitely won't die here. You're stronger than that!

speaker: Jakob
text: Open your eyes! Lord/Lady Corrin. Please...I can't bear to lose you here!

speaker: Kaze
text: I believe in you, Lord/Lady Corrin. I believe you will return to us...

speaker: Silas
text: Hang in there, old friend! Can you hear my voice?! If you can, come back to me!!

speaker: Mozu
text: You're just pretending to be dead, right? It's not funny, so stop it already!

speaker: Shura
text: You believed in me, and now it's time to repay the favor. Don't let me down...

speaker: Xander
text: Our battle is not yet won, little prince/princess! Keep fighting with me until the end!

speaker: Camilla
text: Don’t leave me, my precious Corrin! Please, gods, take me instead…

speaker: Leo
text: You won’t let a sorry attack like that kill you, right? You’re stronger than that…

speaker: Elise
text: You can’t die here! I need you around to hug and play with me! Please… *sniffle*

speaker: Laslow
text: You cannot die. That is not what the future holds in store. You must keep fighting!

speaker: Peri
text: Dying's no fun. If you die, you can't stab stuff anymore! IT'S NOT WORTH IT!

speaker: Selena
text: You wake up THIS INSTANT! I'll never forgive you if you die today!

speaker: Beruka
text: Life is fragile... But you're not like anyone I've ever met...

speaker: Odin
text: An evil illusion is ensnaring you. Grab hold of my fell hand. We'll banish it together!

speaker: Niles
text: Seeing you so defenseless is fascinating, but that’s enough. Come back to us.

speaker: Effie
text: You're not our shield, Corrin—you are our sword. We need you...

speaker: Arthur
text: Fallen hero. I command you to rise in the name of justice!!

speaker: Nyx
text: One so young as you should not rush to your grave. Your time here has just begun...

speaker: Charlotte
text: Stop being worthless and get up already! I ain't got all day...

speaker: Benny
text: I promise to protect everyone until you return, but please hurry...

speaker: Keaton
text: Wake up, Corrin! If you do, I'll give you my second-favorite treasure!

speaker: Kana
text: Mama/Papa, don’t leave me! I promise I’ll be a good boy/girl from now on!! Please… *sob*

speaker: Shigure
text: I wish to sing a song of rebirth or victory, not a dull requiem…

speaker: Dwyer
text: If you die here, you'll regret it. Get up, and I'll take care of you...

speaker: Sophie
text: Why are you lying around like that? Wake up—we have work to do!

speaker: Midori
text: Don't give up! Hang on, and I'll whip up some medicine for you!

speaker: Siegbert
text: Sacrificing your life to save others is noble, but our great kingdom still needs you!

speaker: Forrest
text: Please don’t leave us. You’re too dear to our hearts to die so suddenly!

speaker: Ignatius
text: This isn't over yet. Stop these nonsense and wake up!

speaker: Velouria
text: Daddy will be sad if you don’t get up soon. And, um…so will I…

speaker: Percy
text: Father says that justice never sleeps, so you can't go napping on the job either!

speaker: Ophelia
text: A gentle aura has encircled your body... It whispers words of awakening!

speaker: Soleil
text: Awww, you’re so cute when you’re napping. It’s time to wake up though, silly!

speaker: Nina
text: The battle will go on if you die, but I couldn’t bear the loss…

speaker: Gunter
text: I forbid you to die, milord/milady. No good could possibly come of it.

speaker: Flora
text: Wake up soon, or I'll be forced to use my ice powers on you again. Please...

speaker: Izana
text: Theatrics are My thing, got it? Now open your eyes and rejoin the battle!

speaker: Anna
text: You’re a one-of-a-kind asset… No returns, if you catch my drift. So wake up already!

speaker: Corrin
text: My friends! My family! I hear your cries… I must go back to my world… I must stop Takumi!

speaker: Ryoma
text: So you have decided to return…

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Ryoma. I’m so sorry…but it’s not my time yet. I wish I could stay with you and Mother forever… But standing still is not an option. I have a world to save!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I see. You really are my brother/sister, after all. But before you go, there’s someone who wishes to speak with you…

speaker: Corrin
text: There is? Who?

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi?! Wh-what are you doing here?! Aren’t you in the middle of fighting my allies? How can you be here too?

speaker: Takumi
text: I am here and here alone. That thing is not me. It is merely a monster making a puppet of my corpse, fueled by lingering resentment. Though I cannot truly be free while my body is imprisoned… In truth, my soul left that body long ago.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi… That’s horrible! Is there nothing I can do?!

speaker: Takumi
text: There is. Please, Corrin… I need you to destroy my body. Only your Yato has the power to release it from its unholy master.

speaker: Corrin
text: But Takumi, my Yato is—

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes, I know it was shattered by that monster’s last attack. That’s why you’ll need to take this…my Fujin Yumi.  With this, I know you can find a way to restore your Yato’s sacred power.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can’t accept something so precious! Not after all I’ve done to you…

speaker: Takumi
text: Take it. I won’t accept no for an answer. You’re the only one I can count on… Though it pains me, those of us here are powerless to affect your world. Please…I need you to set me free.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi… I won’t let you down.  I vow on your precious Fujin Yumi to free your body, no matter what!

speaker: Takumi
text: Thank you, Corrin. I wonder…what it would have been like to fight on the same side as you. I always wished we could have been close, as you are with your Nohrian siblings. Right up until my last moments, I wanted so badly to call you my brother/sister. To look up to you and love you…and never allow anything to come between us. I wish I had told you that before I died. While there was still a chance… I was just so stubborn, so hurt. I couldn’t admit those feelings even to myself. For that, I am truly sorry. I’m so sorry for letting you slip away, dear brother/sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi…I’m sorry too. I caused you so much pain. The truth is, I longed to have you accept me as your brother/sister too. I never let go of the dream that after the war we could all be together again… I’m so sorry things turned out the way they did.

speaker: Takumi
text: It’s all right, Corrin. We finally got to say all the things we needed to say. You have done more than enough. My heart… It’s finally at peace. Thank you, Brother/Sister…

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: You can do this, Corrin. Why do you think I entrusted you with saving everyone? It is because you have a pure heart. Kind and strong. You have suffered much and endured much sadness in your life. But now is not the time to look back. Wake up and stand strong. Put one foot in front of the other and press onward. Fight with all your heart to end this war. The Yato chose you for a reason. You can do this. I believe in you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won’t let you down, Ryoma. I’ll fight as though you are fighting beside me. And this time, I’ll keep my promise to you. I won’t give up! As for you…please rest peacefully, Brother, and watch over us and your kingdom.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Oh, Corrin… You’re so sweet when you’re dreaming. Just like the little girl/boy I held so long ago… All that time, I longed to be near you, to watch you grow. I’m so grateful for these fleeting moments with you. I will cherish them always. No matter where you go or what you do… No matter who stands at your side… Know that I will always, always love you. When we next meet here, I look forward to seeing the great man/woman you’ve grown into.

speaker: Corrin
text: I will do all I can to make you proud. That’s a promise, Mother.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Thank you, my sweet child. Hearing you call me that…means everything to me. Go now… I will watch the rest of your journey unfold from afar.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Safe travels, Corrin.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Show them what you’re made of, Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: We’ll all be together again someday, Corrin! Good-bye…

speaker: Corrin
text: Good-bye everyone! Until we meet again!!

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Lady/Lord Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith!!

speaker: Lilith
text: It’s time for you to return home. Please take my hand.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Your hand is so warm, Corrin. Just like it always was. I can feel your kindness radiating through at the slightest touch. I always recall how gentle you were when you rescued me… And how kind you were to me, even though you were locked away from the world… And how bravely you fought against those who would harm the ones you love… I love everything about you, my friend. I hope you know that…

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith… My dear friend, I love you too. I always will.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you, Lady/Lord Corrin. These are our last moments together… I have to let you go now. But I won’t be sad! You were so brave when I died, so I’ll be brave for you too. I wish you the best of luck, Corrin, and all the happiness in the world!

speaker: Corrin
text: Good-bye, Lilith! And thank you! …

speaker: Corrin
text: ... I’m going back…back to where I was before…  My battle is not yet won. I must keep pushing forward! Fujin Yumi… Please, hear my plea!  Lend my shattered Yato your power! Allow me to lay your master’s body to rest. For Takumi!!

speaker: Takumi
text: That light!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Fujin Yumi… Thank you, Takumi…

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin! Everyone, Corrin has returned to us!

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m so sorry, everyone! I’m back where I belong now. Ryoma, Takumi, and the others helped me find my way back here. Back to you. I’m ready to fight!

speaker: Camilla
text: This is so wonderful! My darling Corrin has come back to me!

speaker: Leo
text: I knew you wouldn’t fall so easily. I taught you too well, haha.

speaker: Elise
text: I was so worried I wouldn’t get to hug you again! I’m SO HAPPY!!

speaker: Takumi
text: No…forgiveness… Corrin!! No matter…how long it takes… I…will…KiLL…yOu!!

speaker: Takumi
text: What?!

speaker: Corrin
text: It will not break, beast. This sacred blade will never be shattered by evil again! The power of Takumi’s Fujin Yumi…and the love of everyone I’ve fought with and for… They are all locked inside my Yato! That means it will never falter…and neither will I!

speaker: Takumi
text: My Fujin Yumi…has…betrayed me?!

speaker: Corrin
text: No! The Fujin Yumi doesn’t belong to you. It belongs to my brother! Takumi, that weapon’s true master, died because of YOU!  I chose this path, and I will walk it until the very end. I will make things right again! I WILL defeat you and keep all the promises I made to my loved ones!

speaker: Takumi
text: I will…kill you…filthy Nohrian!! I am…the true…Hoshidan prince… I am…Takumi!! I aM tAkUmI!! I will defend my Hoshido…and destroy Nohr. All Nohrians must die! ALL OF YOU! DIE, DIE DIIIIEEEE!!

speaker: Corrin
text: This is it! Takumi, I’m sorry it took us so long to finally see eye to eye… But I will save both your kingdom and mine, I promise! This will be my… No… This will be OUR final battle!!

speaker: Azura
text: I’m so sorry, Takumi. If I had only been by your side, I might have realized what was happening sooner. Perhaps I could have found a way to save you. I know every choice we make has consequences… I chose to follow Corrin, but did I sacrifice you to do so?

speaker: Azura
text: Regardless, I know what I must do now. I have to make this up to you. I didn’t plan on ever doing this again… But I will now use my forbidden song to weaken the curse and help free you. Once I use this power… Takumi, Ryoma… I wonder if you’ll be upset at me for joining you so soon. Or maybe you’ll be happy to see me too...

speaker: Takumi
text: GAAAAHHH!! Wh-what is…that song…?! My power is…fading… But why? WHY?! No one…loves me… They’re always getting in…my way…!!

speaker: Takumi
text: HAH! I will kill... my enemies... KILL THEM! KILL!!

speaker: Takumi
text: I will... I must... Kill... Betray... ...

speaker: Takumi
text: I will kill you…Corrin… This time…for keeps…

speaker: Corrin
text: Hang in there just a bit longer, Takumi. I’ll set your spirit free… I promise to make good on your dying wish, my brother!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, Takumi… I fulfilled my promise. Rest in peace now, my brother.

speaker: Takumi
text: … Th…thank…you…my…brother/sister…

speaker: Corrin
text: !!  Takumi?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi… Good-bye. You freed my soul too, Brother. Thank you.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* I wonder… What was it that possessed the bodies of King Garon and Takumi? Can sorrow and anger grow so strong they create a monster all their own? Or is there some force beyond our understanding manipulating us all?

speaker: Xander
text: Alas, such questions are not meant to be answered by mortals like us. All I know is that the war is finally over. You did well, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander… Thank you. Many sacrifices were made along the way, but now this world will finally know peace. I think that alone gives great meaning to all we have done…and all we have lost.

speaker: Xander
text: Agreed. Whether others would say your course of action was wrong or right… It was your choice, and your pure heart never led you astray. That is the only justice one can hope for in this world. Now, in memory of all the lives that were lost to this senseless war… We must create a bright future for the whole word to share.

speaker: Corrin
text: You’re right. And that’s just what we’ll do! But wait… Something’s not right. Where’s Azura? She was here just a moment ago… Has anyone seen her?

speaker: Elise
text: She was just here! Where did she go?! Azura! Where are you?!

speaker: Camilla
text: That’s odd… Where could she have run off to?

speaker: Leo
text: She must be somewhere in the castle. This was once her home, after all. Perhaps there’s something she wanted to see or do now that she’s returned.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm…

speaker: Xander
text: Don’t worry, Corrin. We’ll find her. But first we need to locate all remaining soldiers and tell them the war is over.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh! You’re right. We’ll probably find her along the way. Let’s do it!

speaker: Corrin
text: …What is this strange feeling I have? I can’t help feeling…like I’ve seen Azura for the last time. Hmm… I’m probably just still wound up from the battle. That’s all it is…

speaker: Gunter
text: From here forward, let it be known that Garon, King of Nohr…is to be succeeded by Prince Xander, Nohr’s crown prince and rightful heir. King Xander will rule over Nohr and guide us in this new era of peace. Please, my liege… Accept this crown as a symbol of your reign.

speaker: Xander
text: Thank you, Gunter. As king, I vow to rule with dignity and kindness…and to always lead our beloved Nohr down the path of peace.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander! You’re a king now! I’ve never met anyone more worthy of that title than you.

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, the role fits you nicely. Here’s to a fresh start for the kingdom of Nohr! With you at the helm, I know our kingdom will rise to greatness once more.

speaker: Camilla
text: I just know our Xander will bring hope and prosperity back to this land!

speaker: Elise
text: *sniffle* I wish Azura could have seen Xander’s coronation ceremony…

speaker: Corrin
text: Me too, Elise…

speaker: Camilla
text: I can’t believe she ran off like that, right when we finally won the war! I can’t imagine why she left… But I hope wherever she is, that she’s happy.

speaker: Leo
text: Hmph! If she was going to leave us, she could have at least said good-bye. Instead, she disappeared like a wave upon the ocean. Fitting, I suppose…

speaker: Corrin
text: Like a wave upon the ocean…

speaker: Elise
text: Oh! OH!! It looks like Xander’s about to make a speech, heehee!

speaker: Camilla
text: His first speech as king! Let’s listen very quietly, Elise.

speaker: Elise
text: OK, heehee.

speaker: Xander
text: Thank you, fellow Nohrians, for joining me in celebration today. The war is finally over, and we have formed a new alliance with Hoshido. Though once enemies, our kingdoms will now strive for peace together. Since the war began, and long before, both Nohr and Hoshido were in agony. Freedoms were oppressed, possessions were plundered, the land was ravaged. Rebellions and uprisings tore our great kingdom apart. Our world was in pain. I never wish to see that happen again… Not to anyone. I won’t allow it. As such, all tribes and other peoples of Nohr shall be granted autonomy. We will not seek to expand our borders by infringing upon Hoshidan land. Instead, we shall strive to build a foundation of trust. Both kingdoms will do all we can to plant a seed of mutual respect. In the years to come, I look forward to watching that seed grow. We have a long road ahead of us. It will not be easy, but it is worth treading. On this day, as I assume my father’s throne, I vow to steady our course. The night sky is dark, but that is what allows the stars to shine so brilliantly. As king, I hope to be the light that guides Nohr out of this long night. I swear I will not rest until our beloved home awakens to a brighter tomorrow. For the great people of Nohr… Here’s to a future of peace and prosperity!

speaker: Corrin
text: That was a beautiful speech, Xander. I’m certain we’ll be able to do what Father never had the chance to. We’re going to build the kind of world that people can live happily in. Some day in the far-off future, people will sing songs about all this!

speaker: Elise
text: That was amazing, Xander. You sounded just like a king! You’re so cool, Big Brother!

speaker: Leo
text: Elise!! Keep your voice down! And stop waving your arms like a fool! Are you actively trying to bring shame on the entire royal family?!

speaker: Camilla
text: Haha, calm down, Leo. Why not let her be? In any case, your voice got rather loud as well. Everyone’s staring at you.

speaker: Leo
text: Ah… Well…

speaker: Corrin
text: Hahaha, check out that nasty stare Gunter’s giving you! We’re all going to get an earful about this later.

speaker: Gunter
text: EHEM. If I could have everyone’s attention… The coronation ceremony is now complete. May King Xander reign in glory over our great kingdom forever!

speaker: Corrin
text: King Xander… How wonderful…

speaker: Corrin
text: Well done, Xander!

speaker: Xander
text: What do you think, little prince/princess? Did I sound like a worthy king?

speaker: Corrin
text: Absolutely! Your speech was inspiring, and you looked so cool and powerful up there! You should have heard the fuss Elise was making!

speaker: Elise
text: Yeah, but mean ol’ Gunter scolded me about it afterward…

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, darling, but his lecture only lasted a minute or two. He went easy on you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I dunno—he looked pretty ticked off to me…

speaker: Sakura
text: I would have cried my eyes out after a lecture like that…

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka! Sakura! I’m so happy to see you. Thanks for coming today.

speaker: Hinoka
text: No thanks required, Corrin. Our kingdoms signed a permanent peace treaty, so we can visit whenever we want. Of course I’d be here for such a big event. I’ll come running whenever you need me.

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, I know. Thank you…

speaker: Elise
text: Hey, Sakura! Did you see me waving at you? Did you?!

speaker: Sakura
text: Y-yes… But isn’t that part of why you got scolded? Your “excessive” waving?

speaker: Elise
text: Heh, so you heard that? Stupid Gunter…

speaker: Hinoka
text: I thought you looked energetic and happy, just as a princess should be. But I hope you act just a bit more refined at MY coronation ceremony.

speaker: Elise
text: Hee hee, if you insist!

speaker: Camilla
text: So are you to be the next queen of Hoshido, Hinoka? That’s lovely. You’ll make a truly stunning queen.

speaker: Sakura
text: It’s all been really challenging for Hinoka. She’s training to behave more like a queen, but it’s going terribly!

speaker: Hinoka
text: SAKURA! Don’t go around telling people that! I just…can’t help it. I never thought it would fall to me to rule Hoshido. I always took it for granted that Ryoma would eventually be king. And after him, I suppose I expected to pass on the honor to Takumi. I never had any interest in the throne. My brothers were the born leaders…

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m so sorry, Hinoka. I miss them too.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin… No, it’s fine. It is what it is. To be honest, I still battle with feelings of hatred toward the Nohrian army. The way they violated our kingdom for so many years… I won’t soon forget it. But in time, I know even those wounds will heal. I trust you and Xander to prevent such things from ever happening again. In my heart, I know Ryoma and Takumi don’t hold any grudges either.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka…

speaker: Hinoka
text: You should know, however, that there are many Hoshidans who still don’t trust you. I will do all I can to convince the masses, but change won’t come easy. I advise all of you to exercise caution when visiting Hoshido.

speaker: Xander
text: Understood. After all the evil that has been done in the name of Nohr, it’s only natural. The lives that my kingdom has taken are a burden I shall bear for the rest of my life. The blood that was spilled, the tears that fell, the hearts that were broken… For all of that and more, I am truly sorry.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Please, Prince…erm, I mean, King Xander. You can’t take the blame for all that. As queen, it will be my job to help clear up our misconceptions about Nohrians. It will take time, but it will happen. I will make sure of it.

speaker: Sakura
text: I’ll do my best to help out too!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka… Sakura…

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin… When tensions finally subside in Hoshido… Well, I want you to feel free to return to the castle anytime you like. Ryoma and Takumi may not be there anymore…but we are. I want you to feel at home there so we can all spend time together as siblings.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Hinoka. I promise to come visit often!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Good. Well…it’s getting late. We should be heading back. On behalf of Hoshido, allow me to thank you for inviting us here today. Sakura, will you please fetch my pegasus?

speaker: Sakura
text: Sure! I look forward to seeing you all at the coronation ceremony in Hoshido!

speaker: Elise
text: I can’t wait! See you soon!

speaker: Corrin
text: …Off they go.

speaker: Xander
text: Yes, but you’ll see them again soon. They are your siblings, after all.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I’m truly blessed to have so many wonderful siblings in my life. And now I can spend as much time as I want with all of them!

speaker: Camilla
text: Shall we head to the banquet now?

speaker: Corrin
text: Banquet? What banquet?

speaker: Leo
text: Oh, right! This is your first time at an important Nohrian event. In Nohr, whenever something big happens at the castle, we hold a royal banquet. But this time it’s going to be a huge event that spans the whole capital. Xander decided he wanted to provide food for the whole town, not just the royals. Now everyone can celebrate the occasion and enjoy the banquet together.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow! That sounds amazing!

speaker: Elise
text: Doesn’t it! I’m gonna serve up yummy food to all kinds of different people!

speaker: Camilla
text: But you can’t carry it all by yourself, right? I’ll go with you.

speaker: Leo
text: I, for one, shall busy myself by entertaining the lords and ladies. We must not neglect making a good impression on them as well.

speaker: Xander
text: I’m counting on all of you tonight. I doubt I’ll be able to stray too far from the throne.

speaker: Felicia
text: Time to get cooking and show everyone the true meaning of Nohrian cuisine!

speaker: Jakob
text: I’ll make sure to set aside a few plates of your favorite foods, milady/milord.

speaker: Kaze
text: Hmm, I wonder what kind of foods are served at a Nohrian banquet…

speaker: Silas
text: The capital is brimming with jubilation. This is the Nohr I always dreamed of!

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, this is going to be perfect. Let’s all enjoy ourselves tonight! Seeing Nohr filled with so many smiling faces is a dream come true. We sacrificed so much to arrive at this victory we’re now happily celebrating. The path I chose was difficult, but I now know it wasn’t the wrong one. Even if a path looks dark up ahead, you must keep walking until you see the light. Thank you, all of you, for believing in me. Having all of you here at my side fills my heart with joy.

speaker: Corrin
text: Phew! Everyone seems to be having a great time at the banquet. It doesn’t seem like it will stop anytime soon. I’d better take a little break…. Hmmm… This place… It reminds me of the lake where I first met Azura. I wonder where she is right now. Azura…

speaker: Corrin
text: !! That song!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! It’s really you! You’ve come back! Where have you been all this time?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: Hello, Corrin. What do you think of my song?

speaker: Corrin
text: What do I think of it? It’s um…very pretty?

speaker: Azura
text: I see. But if you listen carefully…you might sense a power you didn’t notice before.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. I’m sure you’ll feel it this time. Close your eyes…and listen with your heart.

speaker: Corrin
text: But I don’t—

speaker: Azura
text: Please, Corrin. Just do as I say.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK…  … Azura… I’m really happy you decided to come back to us. Just having you by my side again reminds me of all we’ve been through. You were always there for me, even when my whole world was falling apart. If it weren’t for you, I probably would have died a long time ago. To me you’re—

speaker: Corrin
text: …Azura?

speaker: Corrin
text: Was that…an illusion?

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin. I know we’ll meet again one day…

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura!!...

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I’m sure we will. And when we do, I’ll tell you how much you mean to me……

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin! Enjoying some alone time, are we? I’m about to lead a group of nobles into town. Will you join us?

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course! Sounds fun! Hey, Xander! Wait up! Haha, don’t you dare leave without me!

speaker: Elise
text: Come on—hurry up!

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh! Let me help.

speaker: Leo
text: Did you oversleep again? Better hurry up then.

speaker: Xander
text: You’re just in time.  You’ve always had a gift for that. No doubt you always will.

speaker: Camilla
text: * chuckles affectionately *

speaker: Leo
text: Hmph.

speaker: Elise
text: Hahaha!

speaker: Xander
text: There was no sense in this war, only madness and greed.

speaker: Xander
text: War is monstrous. We are told to make war to support our country. But…it’s a lie.  Told by those who profit from bloodshed. In my reign as Nohr’s new king, I vow to seek peace and understanding.

speaker: Xander
text: With you to guide my hand.

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon, it appears as though the Hoshidans have crossed Mount Garou.

speaker: Garon
text: I am aware of that. It seems your trick with the explosives may be growing stale. Running out of ideas, are we?

speaker: Iago
text: My apologies, Your Majesty. I take full responsibility for this misstep. However, I assure you that I have more tricks up my sleeve. I'll redeem myself—you'll see!

speaker: Garon
text: I certainly hope so.

speaker: Iago
text: Yes...er...of course. I plan on ambushing Corrin and his/her troops shortly.

speaker: Garon
text: Do as you wish. But understand that this is the last failure I will tolerate.

speaker: Iago
text: Certainly, Your Majesty.

speaker: Garon
text: Pitiful.

speaker: Corrin
text: Finally...some sign of civilization. Even though this place looks deserted.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. I believe this place is known as Macarath. It's a town known for stage shows and gambling, much like Nestra. However, it seems as though the war has put a damper on business.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's just as well. We don't have any time to waste. We should probably keep to the outskirts as much as possible.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Agreed.

speaker: Takumi
text: *cough* *cough*

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi? Are you feeling OK?

speaker: Takumi
text: Urgh... Yes, everything's fine...

speaker: Corrin
text: You don't seem very steady on your feet. Perhaps we should rest.

speaker: Takumi
text: No, really, I'm fine. *cough* *cough* Hurrrk...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! Can you hear me?! Someone, help!

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh no...how is this possible?

speaker: Corrin
text: What is it, Sakura? What's wrong with him?

speaker: Sakura
text: I...I think he has a rare fever that's specific to this region. Do you see these spots on his throat? They're one of the unique symptoms. It's extremely s-serious! He could die if we don't treat it immediately.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods... How could this have happened?

speaker: Sakura
text: It's possible he contracted it from one of the wolfskin. They're known scavengers...and carrion is loaded with icky germs. I'm s-sorry. I should've noticed his symptoms a lot earlier.

speaker: Takumi
text: *cough* *cough* Don't worry, Sakura. It's not what you think it is. It'll probably just go away on its own. Or...maybe Azura can try singing for me! Didn't that work before?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, Takumi, but my song isn't a miracle cure. It won't help with this.

speaker: Takumi
text: Oh...now you tell me.

speaker: Sakura
text: If I remember correctly, there's and herb that can reduce the fever considerably. But I have no idea where to find any.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm... The Palace Macarath should have a well-stocked apothecary.

speaker: Corrin
text: But if it's a Nohrian palace, won't it be filled with...you know...Nohrians?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, of course. However, I notice we haven't seen many people around so far. I think it's reasonable to assume the palace will not be fully staffed. Especially when King Garon isn't around.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I can't think of a better idea. Let's check it out.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Very well. Follow me. My intelligence reports are highly detailed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Will you be able to walk, Takumi?

speaker: Takumi
text: Nnngh. Yes, as short way at least. Just put my bow in my hand if we run into any Nohrian scum. Even in this state, I'll take a few of 'em out with me.

speaker: Corrin
text: So this is one of Garon's palaces. It does seem oddly deserted.

speaker: Ryoma
text: We've been lucky so far. Garon wouldn't leave the place completely abandoned. We should remain on high alert.

speaker: Corrin
text: Understood. Is everyone ready?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. Now, let's not dwadle as we enter the palace. There may be roving guards. Let's move one three. One...two... Three!

speaker: Corrin
text: Come on, everyone!
Intruders? Show yourselves!

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like we have company. Brace yourselves and be ready for anything. Garon could have left a monster waiting for us. Or a trap. Or...

speaker: Corrin
text: ...Flora?!

speaker: Flora
text: Lord/Lady Corrin?

speaker: Jakob
text: What are you doing here?!

speaker: Felicia
text: Sister!

speaker: Flora
text: Why are all of YOU here? This is super dangerous! There's an unused room nearby—let's get out of here and talk.

speaker: Flora
text: All right. We should be safe here for a while. It's so good to see you again, Lord/Lady Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: You too, Flora. I miss everyone from Nohr. Except King Garon, of course. Anyway, what are you doing here?

speaker: Flora
text: After you left, everyone in the Northern Fortress was sent away. I got my orders to come here, and that was it.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry. I know my decision impacted a lot of people.

speaker: Flora
text: It's OK. I'm actually happy to be here. Your decision really opened my eyes to what was going on. Now I'm just glad I don't have to see King Garon every day...

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. I'm glad to hear it, Flora.

speaker: Flora
text: So...how did the rest of you end up here?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm sorry, but it's a long story, and right now we need medicine for my brother. Can you help us?

speaker: Flora
text: Yes, of course. Nobody works at the apothecary anymore, but it's fully stocked. I'm sure I can sneak out whatever you need.

speaker: Ryoma
text: You'd do that for us?

speaker: Flora
text: Of course! Any friend of Lord/Lady Corrin's is a friend of mine. After I get the medicine, I'll show you how to sneak out the back door of the palace.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, Flora. You may be saving my brother's life.

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago!

speaker: Iago
text: Hello, Corrin. Happy to see me again?

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you want? You're massively outnumbered here.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh ho! So quickly you begin speaking of battle. Where's the witty banter? One mustn't leap straight into battle without a little banter. It's uncivilized! Also, as usual, you're badly misinformed. You're the one who's outnumbered.

speaker: Corrin
text: How did you know we were here? Were you the one who attacked the hideout in Cheve?

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, I'd love to take credit for that, but I'm afraid it belongs to one of your friends.

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Iago
text: Ah, dearest Flora. I didn't realize you were here. Kicked out of Garon's inner circle, were you?

speaker: Flora
text: I don't have anything to say to you.

speaker: Iago
text: Ooh, saucy! I like it. Maybe I'll kill you last.

speaker: Flora
text: Iago, I'm ordering you to leave at once! I am an official employee of this palace, and you are NOT. Remember, this is King Garon's royal villa. What would he say about you destroying it with a battle?

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, you're so wrong. I can do anything, as long as I get results.

speaker: Iago
text: Like this—see?

speaker: Flora
text: Eyaaaahh!

speaker: Iago
text: That's for talking back. Now, who's next? You'll all bend the knee before I'm finished.

speaker: Flora
text: Lord/Lady Corrin...RUN!

speaker: Flora
text: Urgh...

speaker: Felicia
text: No! Flora!

speaker: Iago
text: She's just taking a little nap. Now. I'm feeling all bantered out. Let's get down to business.

speaker: Corrin
text: You'll pay for this, Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: Wonderful. A pithy final statement from our hero. Unfortunately this is no fairy tale, Prince/Princess Corrin. King Garon would like your head on a platter, and I'm not one to disappoint him.

speaker: Corrin
text: How's this for pithy? GET HIM!

speaker: Iago
text: Pfft. What do you think you're doing, minion? Bring on Corrin!

speaker: Iago
text: And here we are, at last. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm done talking. It's time to finish this.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, I agree. HAH!

speaker: Corrin
text: This is it, Iago. Now, I just need to know one thing. Answer truthfully, and I'll be merciful. Who told you that we were here?

speaker: Iago
text: *cough* *cough* Heh...

speaker: Corrin
text: I assure you, you have nothing to laugh about. Tell me now! Or else...

speaker: Iago
text: Or else you'll have to doubt your own people. Right?

speaker: Corrin
text: What?!

speaker: Iago
text: You, betrayer of Nohr, are now being betrayed yourself. Now, I think I'd like to savor the irony just a while longer, so... Good-bye!

speaker: Corrin
text: How can he just...disappear...like that?

speaker: Iago
text: When will you learn, young prince/princess? You think that was really me? I almost feel bad for you. From this moment on, you'll never be able to let your guard down. Who will be the first to stab you in the back? Who can you really trust?

speaker: Corrin
text: Shut up...

speaker: Iago
text: Very well, Corrin... Good luck.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh...

speaker: Flora
text: Ungh...hrm...

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora, are you all right?

speaker: Flora
text: Uh...yeah. I think so. What happened to Iago?

speaker: Corrin
text: He's gone. We had him for a second there, but then he slipped away. In any case, he can't hurt you anymore.

speaker: Flora
text: Oh, thank goodness.

speaker: Corrin
text: Unfortunately, he left us with some rather troubling words. He implied there's another traitor among us.

speaker: Takumi
text: Come on, Corrin! Do you really believe that? He's just trying to mess with your head.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're probably right. But I have to admit...I do feel a bit uneasy.

speaker: Takumi
text: That's not like you at all. You usually trust everybody!

speaker: Corrin
text: I know, but it's just that...

speaker: Takumi
text: *huff* *huff* *huff*

speaker: Corrin
text: No! Is your fever coming on stronger?

speaker: Takumi
text: I feel so...sluggish...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi!

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh, this isn't good—his fever is s-spiking. We really need that medicine!

speaker: Flora
text: All right, now that Iago's gone, I should be able to get into the apothecary. But...I still don't know what I'm looking for.

speaker: Sakura
text: O-of course. I'll come with you. Let's go!

speaker: Takumi
text: Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like he's sleeping soundly. So the medicine must have worked.

speaker: Sakura
text: Y-yes. He should be fine now. He just needs plenty of rest.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Sakura.

speaker: Flora
text: Yay! Oh, I'm glad he's doing better.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, thank you for your help, Flora. I hate to think about what could have happened if you hadn't been here.

speaker: Flora
text: Please, don't mention it. So...what are you going to do now, Lord/Lady Corrin? Iago knows exactly where you are...

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, that's true. But I think we have to stick to the original plan and head to the capital.

speaker: Flora
text: Oh...I see. I guess I was kind of hoping that you'd stop by my village first.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really? Why?

speaker: Flora
text: To be honest, I don't feel safe here anymore. I want to go home! But it makes sense for you, too. The Ice Tribe village isn't controlled by Nohr. You could take shelter there and plan your next move. And Takumi could get some much-needed rest.

speaker: Corrin
text: But what if King Garon finds out that your village is cooperating with us? Aren't you worried about what could happen?

speaker: Felicia
text: I think the village will be all right. It's full of strong warriors! If soldiers were to invade, the villagers would simply freeze them in place!

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh, I guess that's true.

speaker: Felicia
text: Ooh, this is exciting! I've always wanted to show you my home village, Lord/Lady Corrin. Remember how we used to dream about this, Flora?

speaker: Flora
text: Yes. Yes, we did...

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. This should throw the Nohrian army off our track, at least for a while. Thank you for the offer, Flora.

speaker: Flora
text: Of course! It's my pleasure.

speaker: Corrin
text: Let's give Takumi a few more minutes to rest and then get moving.

speaker: Takumi
text: Zzz... Zzz... Ungh... Be careful...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi? What do you mean?

speaker: Takumi
text: Brother/Sister...something's not right... Look behind the curtain... Ughhh...

speaker: Corrin
text: He's delirious! Did that make sense to anyone else?

speaker: Takumi
text: Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Corrin
text: That must be some fever dream he's having...

speaker: Sakura
text: I-I don't know, Corrin. He sounded lucid for a second there...

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I suppose he did...

speaker: Azura
text: This way, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: What is this place?

speaker: Azura
text: This is Fort Jinya. Sakura is already here, tending to the wounded soldiers and citizens. Let's go and help her.

speaker: Corrin
text: By all means.

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin! Thank you for coming!

speaker: Corrin
text: Is everything OK, Sakura? I'm here to help.

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes, but thank goodness you're here. We're really short staffed.

speaker: Hana
text: Hello Lord/Lady Corrin. I'm Hana. Lady Sakura has told me all about you.

speaker: Subaki
text: And I'm Subaki. It's a pleasure to meet you Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Nice to meet both of you. I'm afraid you probably know a lot more about me than I know about either of you.

speaker: Sakura
text: That's OK, Corrin. I'm sure you'll be fast friends in no time. Hana and Subaki are my retainers—always close at hand and ready to help.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, I see. Well, we should have plenty of time to relax and get to know—

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! We have trouble! Nohrian forces are approaching!

speaker: Corrin
text: Seriously? We haven't even been here five minutes.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, well...the Nohrian soldiers haven't wasted any time surrounding us.

speaker: Corrin
text: Unbelievable.

speaker: Sakura
text: I can't believe they'd attack at a time like this... We're using most of the fort as a makeshift hospital—there's no military target here! Why can't they just leave us alone?

speaker: Hana
text: Don't worry, milady. I can handle this.

speaker: Subaki
text: With my help, of course. If you'd like, Lady Sakura, you may remain with the wounded while we resolve this.

speaker: Sakura
text: I'll consider it. Thank you. Both of you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well then. I guess we'll be getting to know each other in a hurry. Nothing like a life-or-death situation to cut right through the small talk.

speaker: Hana
text: As you command, Lord/Lady Corrin! As Lady Sakura's lead retainer, it will be my pleasure to take your orders.

speaker: Subaki
text: And as Lady Sakura's supervising retainer, I, too, welcome your leadership.

speaker: Hana
text: Supervising retainer? That's not a thing.

speaker: Subaki
text: Well, neither is a lead retainer. I don't remember you getting a promotion.

speaker: Hana
text: Lady Sakura and I have been best friends since childhood! I've ALWAYS been her lead retainer.

speaker: Subaki
text: I'm not sure this is the time or place for such a discussion, but... I believe my results on the battlefield speak for themselves.

speaker: Hana
text: Oh, so is that why you neglect all your nonbattle duties? Is that why I'm the one maintaining all of your gear and scouting the enemy?

speaker: Corrin
text: Guys, um...

speaker: Sakura
text: Knock it off, you two! You're embarrassing yourselves—and me! Corrin, please don't let this juvenile display deceive you. Hana and Subaki are both extremely capable on the battlefield. And they're both going to set aside this petty argument and help you, right?

speaker: Hana
text: Of course, milady.

speaker: Subaki
text: Certainly. Expect perfection, and you will not be disappointed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Excellent. I'm glad to have your support.

speaker: Azura
text: We should get moving and face the intruders head-on. We must protect our wounded!

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course.

speaker: Silas
text: Ho, Corrin! Is that really you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Who's asking?

speaker: Silas
text: Yes, that's the voice I remember! It IS really you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, drop the act. We don't know each other.

speaker: Silas
text: You honestly don't remember? It's me, Silas! We were best friends as children.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't remember much, I'm afraid.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, please be careful. This could be a trap of some sort.

speaker: Silas
text: I promise that I'm telling the truth. However, it seems we are destined to clash swords regardless of our past...

speaker: Silas
text: Don't take this personally. I'm just following orders from King Garon...

speaker: Silas
text: It didn't have to be this way...

speaker: Silas
text: It's been too long, Corrin. I never imagined we'd reunite under these circumstances. I became a knight in hopes of seeing you again, but...

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas...I simply don't remember my past.

speaker: Silas
text: That's OK. You can still come back to Nohr with me. It's not too late!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm afraid you're wrong. I'm way beyond the point of no return.

speaker: Silas
text: Go on. Kill me.

speaker: Corrin
text: No. This isn't right.

speaker: Silas
text: What are you waiting for?

speaker: Corrin
text: You seemed hesitant to attack us, even as you led your army into battle. Why were you holding back? Because we were friends?

speaker: Silas
text: Ugh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Aren't you here on King Garon's orders? Did you even intend to defeat us?

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin... some things are more important than following orders.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're going to need to be clearer than that, or I will finish you off!

speaker: Silas
text: Do as you must. I value an oath I made long ago far more than my own life. I still can't believe you don't remember. We used to play together. You always said how badly you wanted to see the world... So one day I made us a picnic and snuck you out for a few hours to explore. I even packed your favorite meal: Surf and turf! I knew taking you beyond the walls was forbidden, but... I also knew how much it would mean to you. The guards tried to execute me when we returned but you wouldn't let them do it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods! That does ring a bell...

speaker: Silas
text: My life belongs to you, friend. Do as you must.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas... Silas... Yes, of course! I do remember a childhood friend by that name. One who helped me explore outside the walls that bound me.

speaker: Silas
text: Yes! That's it! What else?

speaker: Corrin
text: Only bits and pieces at the moment... But I have a proposal for you. You say you would sacrifice your own life for mine?

speaker: Silas
text: Indeed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Then join forces with me. I know you are a knight of Nohr... and you may not believe what I'm about to say... But King Garon has gone absolutely mad! He gave me a cursed sword and sent me off to be captured by the Hoshidans. Knowing, of course, that I would be brought before my mother. She was killed when the sword exploded. I would have been too...

speaker: Silas
text: I...I don't believe it...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's all part of his grand plan to escalate this conflict into a full-blown war. I can't forgive his actions against Hoshido. And I will never return to Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: You must think I'm manipulating you.

speaker: Silas
text: No, Corrin... I believe you. You've spared my life twice now. I have no reason to doubt your story.

speaker: Corrin
text: Then you will join us?

speaker: Silas
text: Yes. Perhaps together we can bring peace to this world someday.

speaker: Corrin
text: That is my aim, Silas. I promise that I will never deviate from the cause.

speaker: Silas
text: I can't believe this is happening!

speaker: Saizo
text: Lady Sakura, we've got bad news.

speaker: Orochi
text: This is an emergency!

speaker: Sakura
text: Saizo, Orochi... What happened to you? You're both wounded!

speaker: Orochi
text: Our wounds are nothing. but as for Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi—

speaker: Sakura
text: What?! What happened to them?

speaker: Orochi
text: They're missing. Last anyone saw them, they were headed to Izumo. It's possible they were captured en route. I hate to think of the alternative...

speaker: Sakura
text: No! No, no, no, no...

speaker: Kaze
text: Lady Sakura, please take a deep breath. Saizo, Orochi... Please tell me you're joking.

speaker: Saizo
text: Yes, I'm well known for my japes, aren't I? I blame myself. I should have been at lord Ryoma's side every step of the way.

speaker: Orochi
text: Pardon me, but you must be Lord/Lady Corrin, yes? I'm Orochi. I used to serve as a diviner for Lady Mikoto. It seems it would serve a common purpose for our army to join forces. Our tactician, Yukimura, is readying the troops to march on Izumo. Time is of the essence! Will you join us in search of Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course. We'll support you in any way that we can.

speaker: Orochi
text: Thank you. Corrin.

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm coming with you.

speaker: Kaze
text: Lady Sakura, I strongly recommend that you reconsider. The battlefield near the border is highly dangerous, and—

speaker: Sakura
text: I don't care! I can't just stay here and do nothing. If there's anything I can do to help my brothers, I need to be in position to do it.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Sakura. But I'm afraid I agree with Kaze...

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin... Sakura just lost her mother, and now her brothers are missing. It's understandable she would want to accompany us. With my help I believe we can provide adequate protection...

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. I won't try to stop you, Sakura. I just hope you understand the risks.

speaker: Sakura
text: Thank you, Corrin. I do.

speaker: Corrin
text: Will you be joining us as well, Silas?

speaker: Silas
text: Yes, I will join you. Although, I must say that I didn't expect to be pressed into service THIS quickly...

speaker: Saizo
text: You can't be serious, Corrin. You'd really allow this backstabbing Nohrian scum to accompany us.

speaker: Kaze
text: This is not your call, Saizo. And besides, if we abandon him here, he dies. That is not the Hoshidan way.

speaker: Saizo
text: Is the Hoshidan way to allow a potential spy access to our party? I will follow Corrin's lead...for now. But I will keep my eyes wide open.

speaker: Orochi
text: Saizo!

speaker: Kaze
text: Brother, Corrin spared my life when I was a prisoner in Nohr. I assure you that we can trust his/her judgement.

speaker: Saizo
text: Oh, please. A five-year-old wouldn't be fooled by such an obvious setup.

speaker: Corrin
text: I appreciate your skepticism, Saizo. I hope you'll give me a chance to prove you wrong.

speaker: Saizo
text: Words mean little. Actions are what count. We'll see what happens.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, we really must press on. Every second counts!

speaker: Corrin
text: Right, let's get moving.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, we're finally here. Can't say I'm completely used to sea travel yet.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Welcome, Lord/Lady Corrin! We have been waiting for you.

speaker: Corrin
text: You have?

speaker: Kotaro
text: Certainly. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Kotaro, the daimyo of Mokushu.

speaker: Corrin
text: Mokushu?! That's the place Shura mentioned... The country that...
