speaker: Kotaro
text: Milord/Milady? Is something amiss?

speaker: Corrin
text: Pardon me, I was just reflecting on our journey here. It was quite eventful. Mokushu lies within Hoshido's territory does it not? Are your certain your people are prepared to ally with Nohr?

speaker: Kotaro
text: Without a doubt, milord/milady. Our people have long been on good terms with Nohr. We always knew we would side with your kingdom when war inevitably broke out.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. Thank you for your loyalty.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Sorry to rush you after such long journey, but I'd like to show you something. It's the path you'll be using to sneak into Hoshido. This way, milord/milady.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Here we are, milord/milady. This is the quickest and safest route you can take.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Kotaro. We appreciate all the help we can get.

speaker: Kotaro
text: No problem at all. I would normally invite you back to my castle to rest... But I'm sure you must be in a hurry. Do let me know if there's anything else I can do.

speaker: Corrin
text: The sentiment is appreciated, but you've already done your fair share.

speaker: Mokushujin
text: Lord Kotaro! I have an urgent r-report!!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Calm yourself, man! You're in the presence of Lord/Lady Corrin. Show some respect.

speaker: Mokushujin
text: M-my apologies, sir. But please, I must have your attention! Hoshidan ninja have marched into Mokushu, milord! Our forces are fighting them even now in the forest cave. It's not going well...

speaker: Kotaro
text: Hoshidan ninja?! Dammit, why now?

speaker: Mokushujin
text: They're incredibly skilled, milord. I'm afraid our troops can't hold out much longer... Please, you must send reinforcements right away!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Bah! Very well. I'll figure something out. You are dismissed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Why are the Hoshidans attacking your people, Kotaro?

speaker: Kotaro
text: It has been this way ever since the war escalated. Since then, Hoshidan forces have tries to enter our land with increasing frequency. Though we defend our territory, we have never instigated an attack on Hoshido. These attacks are unprovoked, but there's little we can do to stop them.

speaker: Corrin
text: I thought Hoshido valued peace... Are they punishing you for your loyalty to Nohr?

speaker: Kotaro
text: I'm afraid so, milord/milady. We've been fighting them off for weeks now. I fact...our reserves are nearly depleted at this point. Lord/Lady Corrin...it pains me dearly to ask a favor of you at a time like this. But for my people, I must. If there's any way you could lend us a hand...

speaker: Corrin
text: So be it. After all, your people are suffering because of their allegiance to Nohr. As such, the Nohrian army shall aid your cause. Let's go, before it's too late.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Thank you, milord/milady! The people of Mokushu are forever in your debt!

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin, I have dispatched all of the Hoshidan soldiers in this area.

speaker: Azura
text: I have cleared my area as well.

speaker: Elise
text: We're all done too! Camilla and Leo really showed them what's what, heehee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Good work everyone. We've basically been doing all the fighting so far... Is Mokushu really this short on soldiers? Perhaps we should ask Father to send them some guards...

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, look out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Kaze
text: What kind of a coward would take aim at Lord/Lady Corrin when he/she isn't looking? What?! It can't be...

speaker: Saizo
text: Kaze? I didn't expect to see you here.

speaker: Kaze
text: Hello, Brother.

speaker: Saizo
text: The fates are cruel, are they not? But I do not wish to battle my twin again.

speaker: Kaze
text: Agreed. It pains me to stand opposite you in battle, Brother.

speaker: Saizo
text: ...Move along, Kaze. For both of our sakes. My business is with the daimyo, not you.

speaker: Kaze
text: I will not stand down. As a soldier of Nohr, I am obligated to protect our allies.

speaker: Saizo
text: You don't know what you're saying Kaze! Siding with Nohr is bad enough... But to protect that devil, Kotaro?! I won't allow it!

speaker: Kaze
text: Why? Has he wronged you somehow?

speaker: Saizo
text: Fool! That man...that monster...he killed our father! Even now he has taken Kagero as a hostage to try and make us surrender. Do you really intend to align yourself with such a dishonorable and despicable man?!

speaker: Kaze
text: He did what?! Kagero...

speaker: Kotaro
text: Well, well, well. So the enemy leader has decided to grace us with his presence. Nicely done, Lord/Lady Corrin. You are as skilled as the rumors imply.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kotaro... We need to talk.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Oh no, please don't let me interrupt. Kill him so we can end this battle.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silence, Kotaro. I need to ask you something. Did you take a ninja named Kagero hostage to try and force Hoshido to surrender?

speaker: Kotaro
text: What?! Of course not, milord/milady! That man is telling stories.

speaker: Saizo
text: My word is my honor, you coward! I swear, I will kill you myself before the day is done!

speaker: Kaze
text: Calm yourself, Brother.

speaker: Corrin
text: If what you say is true, then you won't mind showing me all of your jail cells. Now.

speaker: Kotaro
text: My jail cells? Do you not trust me, milord/milady?

speaker: Corrin
text: If you have done nothing wrong, my request shouldn't be a problem. As an ally of Nohr, I demand you prove the integrity of your word.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! ... Hmph. You know, for a mutt, you sure are full of yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kotaro!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Fine, you win. I took a hostage and used her as a bargaining chip. What of it?! A true Nohrian prince/princess would praise me for being so cunning, not threaten me. This is war! Lying and using people is par for the course!

speaker: Corrin
text: You're wrong, Kotaro. That is not how we do things any longer.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Is that so? Tell it to King Garon, you filthy mutt. When Nohr prevails, he has promised me a huge piece of land to expand my kingdom. No one will get in the way of Mokushu's future glory—not even a Nohrian prince/princess!

speaker: Xander
text: ...I see. So your tactics are a product of my father's influence. Pity. Still, I won't allow this to go any further. I refuse to accept your methods. I shall correct your behavior now and forever, by force if necessary.

speaker: Kotaro
text: P-Prince Xander?! No! I won't let this happen...

speaker: Xander
text: Mokushujin soldiers?!

speaker: Corrin
text: We came to your aid because you said you were low on troops. So that was a lie too?

speaker: Kotaro
text: I won't waste any more breath on you. In death, you shall keep my secrets! We'll tell King Garon his darling children died fighting the Hoshidans, heh heh. If you had just kept your mouths shut, you could have lived. Such a shame. Instead you will all be sacrifices on the altar of my grand ambition!

speaker: Corrin
text: Everyone! Prepare for battle!

speaker: Saizo
text: I must...not...fall here... My liege still needs me... For him...I shall retreat.

speaker: Kotaro
text: The new kingdom of Mokushu will be built on your graves! Not even King Garon can stop me now, bwaaahahaha!!

speaker: Kotaro
text: No! My ambition... Mokushu's...future...

speaker: Shura
text: Heh... So you're the daimyo of Mokushu, eh? We finally meet.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Who are you? I don't know any generic pirates.

speaker: Shura
text: I am Shura, of Kohga. And you will pay for destroying my people!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Aw, so you came here to get revenge? That's precious. I've killed dozens of men like you. Lowly drifters without a home. Don't even bother. Like your pathetic kingdom, you don't stand a chance.

speaker: Shura
text: Killing you will be no bother at all. In fact, I'm looking forward to it. And one day I will rebuild Kohga and undo the damage you caused!

speaker: Kotaro
text: HA! That's rich. I killed all your people. Burned your village to the ground. All of your ninja combined weren't enough to stop me. Yet you think you alone can kill me?! HAHAHAHA!

speaker: Shura
text: We'll see how funny it is when you're begging for mercy. You took everything from me. Before I rebuild, allow me to return the favor.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Ah, a lovely dream. Let that dream comfort you in your last moments. The last remnant of Kohga ends here!

speaker: Shura
text: For my friends and family...for my honor and vengeance...FOR KOHGA!

speaker: Saizo
text: Kotaro of Mokushu...you will now answer to me for your crimes.

speaker: Kotaro
text: I answer to no one. Who are you to suggest otherwise?

speaker: Saizo
text: I am Saizo the Fifth, servant to the Hoshidan royal family.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Saizo...that name sounds familiar. I believe I've murdered others of your pitiful lineage.

speaker: Saizo
text: You—! How dare you! My father was an honorable man.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Honorable? Maybe. Weak? Definitely. That balding old fool had the audacity to lecture me! So naturally...I put an end to his life.

speaker: Saizo
text: I knew you were the one responsible for his death. Coward!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Bwahaha! Isn't this a stroke of luck? To fell both father and son with the same blade... How poetic!

speaker: Saizo
text: Sorry to disappoint, but I'm about to rewrite your poem's ending...

speaker: Kotaro
text: Ha! If you're anything like your father, you won't land a single blow!

speaker: Saizo
text: How's that for not landing a single blow?

speaker: Kotaro
text: Ugh... My dreams... My Kingdom!! *cough* *cough* How could I lose...?! *sputter* ...

speaker: Saizo
text: A fitting end. Father...you have been avenged. May you rest in peace now.

speaker: Saizo
text: It's over... After all these years, Father's murder has finally been avenged.

speaker: Kaze
text: Saizo... I swear, I did not know. I was told Father died in the line of duty while fighting in Mokushu. All this time... What a burden that knowledge must have been.

speaker: Saizo
text: Yes, Brother. That man killed our father and hid the truth from all. But I knew better. I knew Father was too great a warrior to fall so easily in battle. Still, it took me years of searching to uncover the truth Kotaro buried.

speaker: Kaze
text: Dishonorable scoundrel. No telling how many lives he took without punishment.

speaker: Saizo
text: Indeed. But it's all over now...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey, Kaze! Saizo! I found the dungeon where they were keeping Kagero.

speaker: Saizo
text: You found her?!

speaker: Kagero
text: Saizo!

speaker: Saizo
text: Kagero! Are you hurt? Make haste, friend. We must return to Lord Ryoma right away.

speaker: Kagero
text: I am in your debt, Saizo. To save me, you even cooperated with the traitorous Lord/Lady Corrin. That can't have been easy...

speaker: Saizo
text: I cooperated with no one. It is pure coincidence that we crossed paths. They were battling our soldiers and even aiding Kotaro at first. Still, I must know... Corrin! Why didn't you take the lives of the soldiers you bested? I thought mercy was not a concept familiar to Nohrians.

speaker: Corrin
text: Then perhaps you don't know us as well as you believe you do. We Nohrians aren't all the same. Just as all ninja aren't as vile as Kotaro.

speaker: Saizo
text: ...Perhaps so, Corrin. In any case, Kagero and my men are alive thanks to you. You also helped me to finally avenge my father's death. For that...I thank you. But do not let our temporary truce fool you. When next we meet, it will be as enemies. At that time, I will not hesitate to take your life.

speaker: Corrin
text: If that is how it must be, Saizo, then so be it. I won't hold back either.

speaker: Saizo
text: Hmph.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Kaze
text: Milord/Milady... We should be on our way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze... I'm so sorry. Siding with me has brought you nothing but heartache.

speaker: Kaze
text: One cannot escape heartache, milord/milady. No matter the path we choose to follow.

speaker: Corrin
text: But if it weren't for me... If I had chosen a different path... You might have been fighting alongside your brother instead of against him.

speaker: Kaze
text: Perhaps. There's no telling what might have come to pass. But who's to say that path would have been the right one? Life is not black or white. Both Nohr and Hoshido are fighting for what they believe in. I truly believe that both sides know that. Even my brother.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Kaze. I hope you're right.

speaker: Kaze
text: Ah, that reminds me. This is for you... Saizo knows that it's thanks to you he was able to survive Kotaro's attack. I believe he left this as a token of thanks. ...And as a sign that our battle with him is not yet over.

speaker: Xander
text: Laslow, Peri... I must speak with you two.

speaker: Laslow
text: Yes, Lord Xander! I assume this is about Lord/Lady Corrin and his/her allies. Where will we be engaging the enemy?

speaker: Peri
text: Ooh, I can't wait for them to get here! When does the stabby party begin?!

speaker: Xander
text: The two of you will remain here. This isn't your fight.

speaker: Peri
text: What?! But I wanna spill someone's blood! This is important!

speaker: Laslow
text: Are you concerned that we're not up to the task, milord?

speaker: Xander
text: No, that's not it at all. I have full faith in both of you, as ever. However, I must face Corrin in single combat. That is the only way to limit unnecessary casualties. Enough blood has been spilled. That's why I need you two to remain here. Help keep the Nohrian soldiers at bay.

speaker: Laslow
text: I see. But, milord... how do you know that Corrin will agree to your terms? I don't trust those Hoshido brigands one bit. We should be nearby... just in case.

speaker: Peri
text: I agree! That way I can pop out and kill anyone you need me to!

speaker: Xander
text: I won't say this again. You are to stay behind in this room. Period.

speaker: Peri
text: Aww...

speaker: Laslow
text: But, Lord Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: Look. I trust the two of you, more than you even know. That is why I'm asking you to help me in this way. We've fought valiantly together, and I will always cherish memories with you both.

speaker: Laslow
text: Why are you saying these things? This isn't goodbye...

speaker: Peri
text: Yeah...I don't like this.

speaker: Xander
text: I'm afraid we're out of time. I must go.

speaker: Peri
text: Wait, Lord Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: No! You're not allowed to leave this room, is that clear?

speaker: Laslow
text: Yes, milord...

speaker: Peri
text: This isn't how it's supposed to be... What's going on, Laslow?

speaker: Laslow
text: I don't know. But we must follow Lord Xander's orders...

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* Are we almost there?

speaker: Elise
text: Yes. Father's room is at the top of this tower.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you. Perhaps we should rest for a moment before ascending. We've all been through a lot just to get here.

speaker: Azura
text: That is an excellent idea. But, sadly, it doesn't appear we'll get the chance.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? Why's that?

speaker: Azura
text: Look who's waiting for us.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: You're here. At last. Now, once and for all.

speaker: Xander
text: Hello, Corrin. You've done well to make it this far.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's been a long journey... I was hoping I wouldn't have to face you like this, Brother.

speaker: Xander
text: For all your trials, you're still so naive. Did you think I'd let anyone, even you, kill Father right in front of me? If you insist on toppling Nohr, you'll have to get through me first.

speaker: Elise
text: Big Brother, please stop! Do you two really have to fight like this? Corrin is still our brother/sister, and all he/she wants is peace!

speaker: Xander
text: Elise?! What are you doing? Have you abandoned Nohr as well?

speaker: Elise
text: No, that's not it. I just want our family to go back to the way it was...

speaker: Xander
text: I see. Is that child's logic how you swayed Camilla and Leo? I'm afraid it won't work on me. As the Crown Prince of Nohr, I don't have the luxury of being so naive. There is nothing you can say to dissuade me from protecting Father and Nohr. I will stop Corrin, here and now. It is the only way.

speaker: Elise
text: Xander, no!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hold fast, everyone. As long as no one from Nohr intervenes, neither shall we.

speaker: Xander
text: Don't worry — this isn't a trick. And I won't attack Corrin before he's/she's ready. You see? I am here without the support of my retainers or any soldiers. This is between you and me, little prince/princess. Now, let us begin.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* Understood, Brother.

speaker: Xander
text: There isn't much space here. Let's step over into the great hall.

speaker: Elise
text: Wait!

speaker: Xander
text: Stand back, Elise. there's no need for you to see this.

speaker: Elise
text: But...

speaker: Xander
text: I told you not to move!

speaker: Corrin
text: I tried, Elise. But you knew all along that this might happen.

speaker: Elise
text: *sniff* I'm sorry, Corrin. I'm sorry I couldn't talk Xander out of this...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's OK, Elise. I'm glad you came all the way here with us. And no matter what happens... Having you as my sister has been the best thing that ever happened to me.

speaker: Elise
text: No matter what happens... Please, don't say things like that!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's time for me to go now.

speaker: Elise
text: *sob* There's got to be something more I can do... I can't lose my family forever! I CAN'T!! I'm sorry, Xander, but I can't obey you this time... I won't just let Corrin and Xander kill each other!

speaker: Xander
text: All right, Corrin. Time to settle this once and for all. I hope you've taken all of my training to heart. Don't hesitate like you always used to, do you understand? This isn't a mock battle, little brother/sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won't hesitate, as long as you promise not to go easy on me. I'm not the same person I used to be.

speaker: Xander
text: I sure hope that's true. Otherwise this will be a sad, short fight. Haaah!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo wasn't kidding... Xander is stronger than I remember. But I can't afford to lose...

speaker: Xander
text: You're much stronger than before. I'm impressed. But I'm afraid it's still not enough.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin!

speaker: Azura
text: Gods, he/she's losing!

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* LEAVE US! This is my fight with Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: What's wrong, Corrin? Is that really all you've got?

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... Please... Try to understand... You...you've got so much power... Join me and use it in the service of justice! Together we could easily overthrow King Garon!

speaker: Xander
text: Justice is an illusion. When kingdoms and lives are at stake, there's no justice to be found anywhere! Don't you see that by now?!

speaker: Corrin
text: *cough* *cough* You're wrong... Justice does exist. It's not black and white like some believe, but it's there all the same. Open your eyes... Brother...

speaker: Xander
text: Very well.  You will die fighting for your cause. I shall defend my homeland!

speaker: Xander
text: Elise!

speaker: Xander
text: Elise! Please! Speak to me!

speaker: Elise
text: Xander... Your sword... Lay it down for me.

speaker: Elise
text: Nohr needs more from you. Not just your strength...  What we need...  is caring...and a warm hand...and tears.

speaker: Elise
text: That's the way. Try to be at peace.

speaker: Corrin
text: No... No, this can't be happening!! Elise! Wake up! You can't die like this...  NOOOOO!

speaker: Xander
text: ... Get up, Corrin. Let's end this.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sob* How can you keep fighting like nothing's happened?! Elise just died in your arms trying to stop us from fighting. Yet you just want to pick right up where we left off?

speaker: Xander
text: I...I know. That's why this fight will be our last. Now, get up.  NOW!

speaker: Corrin
text: All she wanted was peace and for us to be a family again... She hated seeing us fight...  Please, Big Brother!

speaker: Xander
text: Don't make me say it again. Draw your sword, Corrin.

speaker: Xander
text: NOW.

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother... ... Fine. As you wish. I guess...you're not the brother I remember, Xander.  Elise...I'm so sorry I couldn't save you. And it doesn’t look like I'll be able to make your last wish come true, either. But I can still end this war. I can still bring peace to our kingdoms.  Xander. You taught me to be brave. You taught me how to wield power. The time has come for me to show you what I've learned. If you have any last words, now's the time!

speaker: Peri
text: Lord Xander! Is everything OK?

speaker: Laslow
text: Is...is that Lady Elise? What happened to her?

speaker: Xander
text: I told you two to stay out of this! What are you doing here?

speaker: Laslow
text: Milord, we both had such a bad feeling about this whole thing... And we thought it better to risk punishment than regret inaction.

speaker: Peri
text: Besides, they must have double-crossed you! Which one of you did this to Lady Elise? I'll gut you!

speaker: Xander
text: No, Elise was... *sigh* As I commanded before, stay out of this! That is an order!

speaker: Peri
text: No way! Like Laslow said, we don't care if you're mad. We want to make sure you don't get killed! So we brought some troops.

speaker: Laslow
text: Against your orders if necessary... we will protect you, milord. Nothing will change our minds on this.

speaker: Azura
text: Watch out, everyone! Xander's retainers just arrived with a team of soldiers.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmph. So much for this duel. Cowards. Prepare to engage the enemy!

speaker: Laslow
text: None of you fiends will get within shouting distance of Lord Xander.

speaker: Peri
text: Yeah! At least, not in one piece. Heehee!

speaker: Xander
text: Blast! This isn't what I wanted...

speaker: Laslow
text: My duty is to protect Lord Xander and the kingdom of Nohr, in that order. May the gods have mercy on anyone who stands against me.

speaker: Laslow
text: Haha! *cough* *cough* Sorry, friends... I won't be able to... return with you...

speaker: Peri
text: Are you ready to die? If not, I'll give you 10 seconds to get ready. Time's up!

speaker: Peri
text: I'm sorry I disobeyed you, Lord Xander. So this is what death feels like...

speaker: Xander
text: Stay back! This is between me and Corrin.

speaker: Xander
text: It wasn't supposed to be this way...

speaker: Xander
text: Fight without fear or hesitation. Don't hold back — I promise you that I won't.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won't. I know I've never bested you before, but that changes now!

speaker: Xander
text: That's the spirit. Come at me!

speaker: Xander
text: I knew you could do it. I'm proud of you, Corrin. I always told you...you could do anything...you set your mind to...

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother!!

speaker: Xander
text: Your technique was flawless... You finally stopped holding yourself back. It's what I've always tried to teach you. You're becoming the leader I always knew you could be...

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: You've done well, Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: N-no... I'm still so weak. I'm still no match for you... Why did you let me win, Xander? TELL ME! WHY?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Answer me! I fought so hard to be stronger... But it's still not enough! You still... *sob* Ended up protecting me in the end... It's just like when we always trained together... It's just like... *sob*

speaker: Xander
text: Dry those eyes, little prince/princess. Do you know what my favorite memory is? Sharing a laugh with you, Elise, Camilla, and Leo around the dinner table. I think Leo had his boots on the wrong feet that day... In my heart I have so many memories of us siblings laughing together... Those were the happiest days of my life.

speaker: Corrin
text: Then why did it have to end this way? Why did we have to fight?! If you had just listened to Elise, or to me... Neither of you would have had to die!

speaker: Xander
text: You can't throw your life away on "if only," little prince/princess. You chose a path... but I never had that choice. I am the Crown Prince of Nohr. My fate was sealed the day I was born.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: I'd like to think that things could have turned out differently in another world. We could have ended the war together, fighting side by side. *cough* *cough*

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander! Stay with me!

speaker: Xander
text: I'm here, Corrin. I...I'm sorry...I let you slip away from me. As crown prince... I didn't have the option of picking sides like you or Leo or the rest. So, I really did intend to kill you for the good of Nohr. But in the end... I did what I always told you not to do. I let my feelings overrule my duty. In the end, it was my undoing. Is that...is that justice?

speaker: Corrin
text: That's not fair, Xander! You think you can just say something like that and die on me? I'll never be as good as you, Xander... I see that now. I've always looked up to you... You can't leave me!

speaker: Xander
text: You have already prevailed, little prince/princess. Don't you see? I couldn't lead this world...or Nohr...into peace. But you...you can. And you will. You can do the things I couldn't. That's how you'll surpass me... In the end...

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: I'm counting on you, Corrin... Father... Garon...he's...he's... *cough* *cough* He's not what he used to be...

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... I think I understand. I promise to stop him!

speaker: Xander
text: Thank you, Corrin. Now, it's time...to say good-bye... Please...don't cry...

speaker: Corrin
text: No... Xander? XANDER! *sob*

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: ... I...I suppose we have to keep going. It's what they would have wanted. If I stayed here crying, Xander would have g-gently scolded me... To honor their sacrifices, I must carry on their honorable legacy. I must be a light in the dark, just like Elise was... And I must be a kind and determined leader... *sob* Just like Xander. If we can't stop King Garon, then all this death will have been in vain... Come on, everyone. It's time.

speaker: Azura
text: You can do this, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura. Everyone...we're almost at the end. King Garon awaits. Xander... Elise... I hope you both know how much I love you. I promise to make you proud...and to end this senseless war for good!

speaker: Xander
text: I have returned, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: So you have. Word of your work in Hoshido precedes you, son. What I've heard pleases me. Your efforts to vanquish our enemies will not go unrewarded.

speaker: Xander
text: Thank you, Father. There's something else. I bring good tidings. it's about Corrin... He/she has already safely returned to us. Our family is whole again.

speaker: Garon
text: Corrin... has returned?

speaker: Corrin
text: ...Hello, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: What are you doing here, boy/girl?! Why did you come back?

speaker: Corrin
text: F-Father! I...

speaker: Elise
text: Father! How could you say such a thing?

speaker: Garon
text: Do you take me for a fool, Corrin? My spies are everywhere. I know you've been at Hoshido castle this whole time. No doubt their filthy queen filled your head with all manner of secrets about your birth. A poor little prince/princess of Hoshido abducted at a young age by the forces of Nohr. You are surely now aware that the royal family of Nohr is your enemy by birthright. Yet you came back, all the same. I can't help but wonder why.

speaker: Iago
text: Hmmm... smells like treachery! Betrayal! He's/She's surely sided with the enemy. Could it be he's/she's planning to assassinate you, King Garon? it's only logical...

speaker: Corrin
text: NO! How could you say that?! I would never do such a thing!

speaker: Xander
text: It's true. That is simply not possible.

speaker: Garon
text: Oh? How can you be so sure? I expect less sentimentality from a future king of Nohr.

speaker: Xander
text: I have proof his/her loyalty still lies with Nohr! Although it was his/her first true battle, he/she fought off the Hoshidan army all alone.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, Xander? That's not exactly... argh!

speaker: Leo
text: Be quiet, Corrin. Don't say a word...

speaker: Xander
text: What's more, I saw him/her elect to return to Nohr with my own eyes. We all did. Because of that choice, Prince Ryoma grew angry and tried to kill Corrin. If he/she were a Hoshidan spy, why would he/she risk his life for us? Why would he alienate himself/herself from the royals by protecting us?

speaker: Iago
text: Hmmm... A convincing story. But it proves nothing. The whole thing could be an elaborate ruse!

speaker: Xander
text: Silence Iago! As Crown Prince of Nohr, I swear on my honor that it was no act. You weren't even there, you fool. How could you possibly know what transpired?

speaker: Garon
text: That is enough, Iago. Your words have been heard and considered. Corrin! Where is the sword I gifted you with before you left?

speaker: Corrin
text: That sword... it broke while I was in Hoshido... it exploded before my eyes. If Mother... I mean, the Hoshidan queen... if she hadn't sacrificed herself to save me, I would have died.

speaker: Garon
text: I see... how very touching.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father...I must ask you something. D-did you give me that sword, knowing this would happen? Was it planned?

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin, I don't think now is the best time to bring that up.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, I must know. For myself, and for the innocent Hoshidans who were killed. Father, please tell me the truth. Did you plan that explosion? Did you raise me as your son/child just to send me with that sword to die in Hoshido?

speaker: Garon
text: That sword is just a sword. I know nothing about this attack of which you speak.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Father...

speaker: Garon
text: I gave you my answer, boy/girl! I won't say it again.

speaker: Iago
text: Still doubting the King, are you? Those Hoshidans really got under your skin. King Garon. I think it's safe to say we have a dirty Hoshidan spy on our hands...

speaker: Garon
text: Sadly, I must agree. Now that the war between our kingdoms has escalated, I have no choice. I cannot allow this little problem to go any further than it already has. Xander... Kill Corrin. That's an order.

speaker: Xander
text: WHAT?!

speaker: Camilla
text: Father, stop this madness! I beg of you!

speaker: Elise
text: Please, no! Don't hurt our brother/sister!

speaker: Iago
text: That's enough, Princess. It is not your place to question the King's decision. Not even a queen would be able to overrule a direct command from King Garon!

speaker: Garon
text: Xander, you have your orders. No more stalling. Proceed.

speaker: Xander
text: I won't do it! I'm sorry, father.

speaker: Iago
text: Awww, what's the matter? Don't have the guts?! Or is our own crown prince also a traitor? He IS defying a royal order, after all...

speaker: Corrin
text: Stop this! Xander is not a traitor. Father... I am the cause of all this. All will be well if I just disappear, correct? Please don't bring Xander into this. I'll do it myself. ... Father?

speaker: Garon
text: So, you're willing to trade your life for his? Fascinating. In that case... I shall allow the great Anankos to decide your fate. Now would be a good time to start praying.

speaker: Xander
text: Father? I don't understand...

speaker: Garon
text: Quiet, children. I will now seek the counsel of the sacred mystical dragon, Anankos. He alone shall decide Corrin's fate.

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon? You can't be serious... Are you feeling well?

speaker: Corrin
text: The mystical dragon... Anankos?

speaker: Garon
text: Mighty Anankos, I call upon your wisdom on this day of reckoning! Grant me a vision... Show me the way... ... ... Understood. It shall be done. Fate has smiled on you today, young Corrin. As decreed by Anankos, you shall be accepted in the Nohrian royal family.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father, I... Thank you!

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon?! This is preposterous!

speaker: Xander
text: You did the right thing, Father. We are all eternally grateful.

speaker: Garon
text: Not so fast. Before it can be done, Corrin must first pass a test.

speaker: Corrin
text: A test? What kind of test?

speaker: Garon
text: Anankos decrees that you must first suppress the Ice Tribe's rebellion. Once you have gloriously fulfilled that obligation on behalf of Nohr... I will welcome you back into the fold as my son/daughter, and all will be as it was.

speaker: Corrin
text: Suppress the rebellion... I understand, Father. No matter what, I won't let you down.

speaker: Xander
text: You'll do great, Corrin. I will prepare the troops immediately. With our army at your side, you will make quick work of that little rebellion.

speaker: Elise
text: Yeah! You can do it! I'll go along too, so I can heal you if you get hurt!

speaker: Garon
text: You fail to understand the task at hand. To fulfill the wishes of Anankos, he/she must perform this task by himself/herself. Corrin will vanquish the tribe alone, without the help of our troops.

speaker: Elise
text: WHAT?! Father! That's... that's not possible!

speaker: Xander
text: Father, be reasonable. Attempting to end this rebellion alone is suicide! To even get there, he/she must first pass through the Woods of the Forlorn. it's too much to ask of him when he's/she's still so inexperienced in the ways of the world!

speaker: Garon
text: If that is so, then kill him/her now. I will not tolerate insolence.

speaker: Xander
text: ... Understood, Father. I apologize for my outburst.

speaker: Corrin
text: Don't worry Xander. I'll find a way to do this alone... somehow. Do you remember when Leo said I have the Devil's luck? It must be true. I swear to you, I will accomplish this task and return home without fail. If you'll excuse me, I must go make the proper preparations for my journey.

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin... May the gods be at your side.

speaker: Garon
text: I have high hopes for you, Corrin. Do not let me down.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won't, father. That's a promise.

speaker: Garon
text: Excellent. All is going according to plan. He/she has already left, all alone, just as Anankos ordained. No traitor of Nohr shall escape justice! Even if he/she begs for the sweet release of death, I won't allow it. He/she must first live long enough to lose all hope and learn the true meaning of pain. Ahahaha!

speaker: Xander
text: ...So it is true. I should have known. Father only wishes to make Corrin suffer... in that case, I know what I must do.

speaker: Corrin
text: So these are the Woods of the Forlorn... if I can't make it through here, I'll never reach the Ice Tribe village. I... I wonder if I'm even going the right way. I've never had to go it alone like this. It's a lonely feeling.

speaker: Lilith
text: AHEM.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Lilith! You're absolutely right - I'm not alone at all. I have you! Thank you for looking after me. Having you here makes me feel a lot better. But enough fooling around. I must fulfill Father's command. Otherwise... Otherwise I betrayed my birth family for nothing. *sigh*

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow, it's pitch black in here. This isn't going to be easy, is it? It's so dark, I could be walking in endless circles for all I know. What to do... Lilith? What was that? I think I heard something... Gah! Is that... a faceless?!

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrrrr... Arrgghhh...

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't believe it! I had no idea there were faceless in this forest. This is bad... I can't run away though. I must make it through here no matter what. That means there's only one option... I'll have to fight my way through!

speaker: Faceless
text: Raaaaaargh!

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow... s-such power! I'm out of my league. I have no choice... I'll have to use my Dragonstone.

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrraaaaargh!

speaker: Corrin
text: Dammit! I'm surrounded. I'm in deep trouble now. There's no way I can transform in time.
Aaaaiiiieeeeee!

speaker: Faceless
text: Graaaargh!

speaker: Felicia
text: I did it! Oh, thank goodness I arrived in time! Are you OK?

speaker: Corrin
text: Felicia?! I'm fine, thanks to you. But... what are you doing here?

speaker: Felicia
text: I'm sorry! I was just so worried about you. I had to make sure you were OK. They say the spirits of the dead inhabit this forest, searching for fresh souls to take... That's scary! There was no way I was going to let you face this place all by yourself! It's not easy to do something behind King Garon's back, but I somehow managed. Besides, Flora, Jakob, and I were all moved from the northern fortress to the castle. With both of them around, no one will even notice I'm gone, so it should be fine!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Felicia. It was very kind of you to come after me like you did. But are you sure this is for the best? According to that... that dragon, I have to do this alone or it doesn't count.

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh! I forgot that part! I am SO STUPID! What are we going to do?! Now you won't be able to pass your test, and it's all my fault!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's OK, Felicia. Anankos just said I have to beat the Ice Tribe by myself. We're not even there yet, so I bet it's fine. Besides, I'd be dead if it weren't for you!

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh, Corrin...

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrrraaaargh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Uh-oh... It looks like we have more company. I hate to ask for your help again so soon, but would you mind lending a hand?

speaker: Felicia
text: Of course! After all, that's why I'm here. I refuse to let you die in this horrible place!

speaker: Corrin
text: Same here. Now let's take these creepy things down and get out of this creepy forest!

speaker: Felicia
text: OK! We can do this!
Hyaaaaa!

speaker: Faceless
text: Graaaargh!

speaker: Jakob
text: Begone, vile beast! Corrin, are you OK? Thank heavens I arrived before it was too late!

speaker: Corrin
text: Jakob?! I'm fine, thanks to you. But... what are you doing here?

speaker: Jakob
text: I apologize for the shock, milady. I was worried sick and just had to check on you. They say the spirits of the dead inhabit this forest, searching for fresh souls to take. I simply could not allow you to face such horrors all by yourself. It's not easy to do something behind King Garon's back, but I managed. In any case, Flora, Felicia and I were all reassigned to the castle after you left. Those two should have no trouble covering for me in my absence, so all should be well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Jakob. It was very kind of you to come after me like you did. But are you sure this is for the best? According to that... that dragon, I have to do this alone or it doesn't count.

speaker: Jakob
text: I... I'm so sorry, Corrin. I didn't think through the consequences of my actions. This is all my fault

speaker: Corrin
text: It's OK, Jakob. Anankos just said I have to beat the ice tribe by myself. We're not even there yet, so I bet it's fine. Besides, I'd be dead if it weren't for you!

speaker: Jakob
text: Thank you, Lady Corrin. It is an honor to serve you.

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrrraaaargh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Uh-oh... It looks like we have more company. I hate to ask for your help again so soon, but would you mind lending a hand?

speaker: Jakob
text: Certainly. You had only to ask. I refuse to let you die in this horrible place.

speaker: Corrin
text: Same here. Now let's take these creepy things down and get out of this creepy forest!

speaker: Jakob
text: As you wish. Leave it to me!

speaker: Corrin
text: They're not backing down. There's no end in sight. I hate to say it Jakob/Felicia, but we're wildly outnumbered here. We need a plan, and fast.

speaker: Silas
text: Hello? Hellooo?

speaker: Corrin
text: Did you hear that? I think someone's calling out to us in the distance...

speaker: Silas
text: Hey, Corrin! Over here!

speaker: Silas
text: Phew! I finally caught up with you. You're faster than you used to be.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, thanks. And you would be...?

speaker: Silas
text: It's me, Silas! It's been a long time, Corrin. You're a lot taller! It makes me so happy to reunite with a childhood friend like this.

speaker: Corrin
text: A childhood friend? I'm really sorry, but I'm drawing a blank.

speaker: Silas
text: So you've forgotten about me, eh? Haha, no worries. It's been ages. We used to play together. You always said how badly you wanted to see the world. So one day I made us a picnic and snuck you out for a few hours to explore. I even packed your favorite meal; vegetarian chowder! I knew taking you beyond the walls was forbidden, but... I also knew how much it would mean to you. The guards tried to execute me when we returned, but you wouldn't let them do it.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, it can't be... Silas?! Is it really you? Of course I remember you! I can't believe it! It's been a lifetime since I last saw you. You look so different!

speaker: Silas
text: You too! I wanted to visit, but I was banned from ever returning after that. I became a Nohrian Knight so that one day I might be able to see you again. Now here we are, in the middle of one of your messes! Just like old times, huh? If you will allow me, I would be honored to fight at your side.

speaker: Corrin
text: Silas... Thank you. You really are a sight for sore eyes.

speaker: Elise
text: Everyone, hold your horses! Corrin, I'm here too!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise?! You came as well?

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee, of course! That's what sisters are for, right? No way I was gonna let our new knight come to your rescue without me! I'm here to help you, Corrin! I don't care what Father thinks!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Elise... that means so much to me.

speaker: Elise
text: Anyway, back to business. Silas, you're a real dummy, you know that? Mean, too. Leaving a cute princess behind while you forge ahead. Shame on you!

speaker: Silas
text: I-I'm so sorry, milady! But, um, don't you have your own retainers to look after you?

speaker: Elise
text: Well, yeah, but... Don't change the subject! Speaking of, they should be here soon.

speaker: Silas
text: So what you're saying is... you left them behind to forge ahead. Right?

speaker: Elise
text: Right!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise... you are adorable. Go easy on Silas for me, OK?

speaker: Arthur
text: There's nothing to fear! Arthur is here! The allies of justice have arrived! I'm sorry for letting you slip away, milady. Evil never rests, and nor should I!

speaker: Effie
text: Elise! I was so worried! Thank goodness we found you. Please don't sneak off again - especially when we're all supposed to be resting.

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee, I'm sorry I made you worry. I was just too excited to see Corrin again!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, I finally have the privilege of meeting Elise's retainers. Thank you for coming.

speaker: Arthur
text: Where injustice dwells, you're sure to find me. I can also be found wherever Elise is. I would have gotten here sooner, but I fell in a swamp and then a bird stole my map. Then another bird stole my backup map... Let's just say it was an ordeal.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, Arthur, that is SO YOU! He has the worst luck, heehee.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see... Well, all that matters is that you're here now.

speaker: Effie
text: I didn't fall in the swamp like Arthur, but my armor did hold me back. Maybe I packed too many training stones into it before I left...

speaker: Elise
text: Effie is super strong! She's amazing!

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, you seem to have some really special retainers, Elise. With all of you on my side, I know we can make it through this. Thank you, all of you, for putting yourselves at risk to come to my aid.

speaker: Elise
text: Sure thing! But really Xander is the one you should thank. He went behind Father's back and sent us all out here to keep you safe!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... Well, I certainly can't die before thanking him. All the more reason to prevail!

speaker: Corrin
text: Phew! It appears all of the Faceless have finally been dispatched. Good work.

speaker: Elise
text: Yaaay! We did it! GO TEAM!

speaker: Silas
text: I can't believe we actually won. Amazing! Now to make our way through this forest and head to the Ice Tribe Village.

speaker: Corrin
text: it's such a dark forest, though... I hope we don't lose our way.

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh dear, that's not possible! I can guide us to the village from here. It's where I was born, after all. I could get us there with my eyes closed! I'll keep them open, though... otherwise I'll surely trip.

speaker: Jakob
text: Worry not, milady. I'm more than happy to guide us from here. I've made it my business to know every inch of our kingdom like the back of my hand.

speaker: Corrin
text: Felicia/Jakob, you never cease to amaze me. Whenever you're ready, lead the way.

speaker: Felicia
text: OK! Everyone, stay close!

speaker: Jakob
text: It would be my pleasure. Please, follow me.

speaker: Iago
text: Drat! So our false prince/princess made it through that battle in one piece... And after I went through all that trouble to summon a Faceless army! This is Prince Xander's fault, the traitor. Though King Garon is not without blame... I don't see why he would allow that child to live after being tainted by the Hoshidans. It is truly beyond my understanding. Luckily he has me to set things right. That's right, Corrin. Enjoy this brief respite, heh heh heh. Hell is waiting for you as soon as you leave this forest. Prepare to suffer and die!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whew...this passage just keeps on going, doesn't it? I'm beginning to worry that we made a wrong turn somewhere...

speaker: Azura
text: Believe it or not, I actually remember this part of the tunnel. So I think we're getting close.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's reassuring. Thank you, Azura. Although...this looks an awful lot like a dead end.

speaker: Azura
text: No, look. There are stairs on one side. You just can't see them from this angle. The exit must be at the top.

speaker: Corrin
text: So. The heart of Nohrian power is just above us. Perhaps a few of us should take a quick look. It might be reckless for all of us to burst into the palace at once...

speaker: Azura
text: Good idea. We're with you, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Here goes nothing...

speaker: Nohrian
text: Hyaaah!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Yah! Hyah!

speaker: Corrin
text: This isn't the throne room... Where are we?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It looks like a training facility. These soldiers are being put through their paces.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, at least we're in the castle.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. But of all the places the tunnel could have led... We're surrounded by Nohr's most elite soldiers!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods! Maybe they haven't noticed us yet. We should keep quiet...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Look, someone's coming!

speaker: Hans
text: What are you idiots doing? This is a FULL CONTACT exercise! I want to see real blood! Get after it!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Corrin
text: That's Hans! It seems like Garon must have given him a promotion...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. If I had to guess, he's in charge of this entire group.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not a vengeful person...but he killed Gunter right in front of me. I'd sure like to avenge his death.

speaker: Nohrian
text: Well, well! What do we have here? Captain Hans! Some intruders are hiding behind the statue!

speaker: Hans
text: Great! Drag 'em out here—we'll use 'em for target practice. Wait...that's Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hello, Hans.

speaker: Hans
text: How the hell did you get in here?

speaker: Corrin
text: I have nothing to say to a coward like you. I'd rather let Noble Yato do the talking.

speaker: Hans
text: Bahaha! You'd threaten me in front of my own battalion? Oh, I'm going to enjoy this. Rip 'em apart, soldiers!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Haaaah!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hah!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Ugh...no...

speaker: Nohrian
text: Taste my steel!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hyaaah!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Oof...

speaker: Corrin
text: Are all your soldiers this poorly trained, Hans? What will Garon think?

speaker: Hans
text: Damn it... Don't be afraid of this pathetic child, soldiers! She's all talk! Sacrifice yourselves if need be. For King Garon's glory!

speaker: Nohrian
text: But, Captain...

speaker: Hans
text: What was that? Please, speak up, and I'll relay your comments to King Garon! I'm sure he'll be sympathetic to you and your family. Now SHUT UP and KILL THE INTRUDERS!

speaker: Nohrian
text: Urk!

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff*

speaker: Hans
text: Bwahaha! There's the pathetic crying baby I remember. Don't let up, soldiers! We've got him/her right where we want him/her.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'll show you who's pathetic.

speaker: Hans
text: Ooh, look who learned to talk like a real soldier! Well, you're not the only one who's gotten stronger. I'm King Garon's newest captain. Let me show you how I got my promotion. HAAAH!

speaker: Corrin
text: OH—

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin, look out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith! NO! Lilith! NO! Talk to me, Lilith! ARGHHH!

speaker: Hans
text: Stupid bird! I'd have had her... Never mind. I won't miss again. I'll have your head off with the next swing—count on it!

speaker: Corrin
text: You'll pay for this, Hans... I'll kill you with my own two hands!

speaker: Hans
text: Let me relieve you of your head! Bwahaha!

speaker: Hans
text: You...you killed me! How can this be? URGHH...

speaker: Hans
text: Ah, I finally get a chance to finish the job. My axe is waiting...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm going to burn you to the ground, Hans. When I'm through with you, your axe will be the only reminder you ever lived.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Stand down, Nohrians! Your captain has been defeated! Drop your weapons, and your lives will be spared.

speaker: Nohrian
text: They killed Captain Hans... What do we do?

speaker: Nohrian
text: I...I don't know. I think we surrender.

speaker: Takumi
text: It looks like they're giving up.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Good. Then we're done here.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Guys, we've got a problem. Lilith took quite a shot...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Gods, no...

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith...please open your eyes. Hans is dead. We finally got him. Please... You have to be OK!

speaker: Sakura
text: She's too far gone for my rod to work. I don't think I can save her, Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! No!

speaker: Elise
text: My staff isn't helping either. What do we do?

speaker: Corrin
text: This can't be happening...

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith! You're...you're human again!

speaker: Lilith
text: *cough* *cough* Only for a moment, it seems... The Astral Dragon Moro has taken pity on me. It's giving me the strength to return to this form for my last few breaths...

speaker: Corrin
text: Please don't say that! You're not going to die. You can't! Please! Stay with us!

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm sorry, milord/milady, but I'm not long for this world. Please don't cry. I decided to give my life for you, and I'm happy I succeeded. After all, you already saved my life once. This just makes us even. I die with no regrets.

speaker: Corrin
text: But...we could end the war today! You could live in a peaceful world... Don't give up!

speaker: Lilith
text: It's OK, Lord/Lady Corrin. I know how far we've come. And I know you will succeed. I can die happy, remembering our time together and the progress we've made. Lord/Lady Corrin...be brave and go on without me.

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith...no. No... WAAAAAH!

speaker: Elise
text: Lilith... This can't be happening...

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm so sorry...I couldn't s-save you...

speaker: Corrin
text: What are we even fighting for? Is it worth it?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Look up, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Dry your tears. Think about Lilith's sacrifice. She gave her life so you could continue fighting. And what are we fighting for? We are fighting for peace! We are fighting for Queen Mikoto and for the whole world! Do you think Lilith would want you to give up like this?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ughhh...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Listen. It is time for you to rise to the occasion. If we want to end this war, now is the time for us to take action!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm just so tired. Tired of loss. Tired of death.

speaker: Ryoma
text: There will be a time for rest. But that time is not now. Rise up! The sacred blade Yato chose YOU, Corrin. We're all counting on you!

speaker: Corrin
text: ... You're right. I know you're right. I will not stop until King Garon's reign of terror is over. Let's go, everyone.

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's the spirit.

speaker: Elise
text: Father's room is this way, Corrin. Please promise you'll try talking first.

speaker: Corrin
text: I will. ... Thank you, Lilith. And good-bye for now.

speaker: Corrin
text: *pant...pant...* This is taking too long. Where is he?! If we don't find Ryoma soon, Iago's troops might get to him first. If that happens...

speaker: Azura
text: I wonder if he went...there. No, that would be too awful...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, if you have any idea where he might be, now's the time to fill me in.

speaker: Azura
text: *sigh* There's a secret space in front of the throne room. You must pass by it to get to the throne. I can't think of where else he could be. He's likely planning a last stand, should we make it that far.

speaker: Corrin
text: In front of the throne room?! But that's where we're meeting up with the others... If you're right, we won't be able to reach him before regrouping with Father!

speaker: Azura
text: I know. I'm sorry, but things don't seem to be going our way at the moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: This can't be happening! If I don't find Ryoma first, they'll kill—

speaker: Iago
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! Lady Azura! I see you made it here unharmed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hello, Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: We were able to take down the Hoshidans with few Nohrian casualties. All thanks to the great King Garon's divine strength.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father...actually fought?

speaker: Iago
text: He insisted. The Hoshidan soldiers were mere babes compared to his might! Not a single enemy soldier escaped with their life. It was most glorious! How did your troops fair ?

speaker: Corrin
text: It was the same on our end. They were no match for our power. We ran into Princess Hinoka on the way. I took her down without hesitation. Here... Take her weapon as a trophy from my latest conquest.

speaker: Iago
text: A bloody lance? Hmmm. A compelling case, but I wouldn't say this counts as proof, much less a trophy. Why didn’t you bring us her head instead?

speaker: Corrin
text: I...had no time for show. We're fighting a war here, Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: Hmmm. You didn't happen to let the princess escape, now did you?

speaker: Corrin
text: How dare you!

speaker: Garon
text: Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon! What is it, my liege?

speaker: Garon
text: That's enough. Or do you intend to discuss this trivial matter all day? Do you truly believe this small matter is more important than conquering Hoshido?

speaker: Iago
text: No, my king! But if the prince/princess DID allow her to live, it might affect our campaign...

speaker: Garon
text: Ha! And what exactly could a little mouse like her do against my army? Even if she is alive, it would be all too easy to crush her once Hoshido has fallen. How long do you intend to make me wait over something so trifling?

speaker: Iago
text: M-my apologies. You are right, as ever. Let us be on our way.

speaker: Garon
text: Don't fall behind, Corrin. I have my eye on you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course, Father.

speaker: Iago
text: ... You lucked out this time, Lord/Lady Corrin. But that's just fine. After all, from here on out, your life will be nothing but misery. I hope you're ready to crush the life out of Prince Ryoma... Heh heh heh.

speaker: Corrin
text: Psst... Are we nearing that space you were talking about, Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: We are. After we pass through here, we'll be in the throne room.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods! Is that...Ryoma?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: You...have done well so far... But that was just practice. No more games—to the death!

speaker: Ryoma
text: So, you made it. That can only mean one thing... The Hoshidan army has fallen.

speaker: Iago
text: How observant of you, Prince Ryoma. Your troops have been obliterated. Hardly anyone remains. Princess Sakura is our prisoner, and Prince Takumi jumped off the Great Wall in shame.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, I almost forgot...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hinoka's lance... You! I swear, you will pay for this!!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, but sadly it wasn't I who killed her. That honor goes to Lord/Lady Corrin. Isn't that right, milord/milady?

speaker: Corrin
text: Y-yes. It was I.

speaker: Ryoma
text: WHAT?! You... You killed Hinoka? Our sister?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is madness! Do you really mean to tell me the blood on this lance is Hinoka's?! Answer me, Corrin! ANSWER ME!!

speaker: Corrin
text: ... It's...it's true. I killed her... I killed Hinoka.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Gods, no!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: YOU MURDERING FIEND!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Argh!

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Don't you dare try to stop me! This doesn't concern you!

speaker: Xander
text: Calm yourself, Prince Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, what are you—

speaker: Ryoma
text: I will have revenge for my sister! I challenge you to a duel!! I will not rest until I kill you myself, you traitorous scum! When the sun sets on this day, one of us will be dead. No one will get between me and my revenge!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma...

speaker: Xander
text: No, I won't allow it! I shall not stand idly by while you attempt to harm my brother/sister. Soldiers! Protect Corrin from this madman at once!

speaker: Iago
text: Stand down, soldiers. Your assistance will not be necessary.

speaker: Xander
text: Iago! What is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Iago
text: If our prince/princess is as strong as you claim, he/she shouldn't need any help. Or are you suggesting Lord/Lady Corrin doesn't have what it takes to win?

speaker: Xander
text: His/her training is solid. His/Her instincts are true. He/She has all the tools he/she needs to prevail.

speaker: Iago
text: There you have it. Then there's no reason for us to intervene. Just sit back and enjoy he show, Lord Xander.

speaker: Xander
text: Scoundrel! The man you would have him/her slay is his/her brother by birth! There's no guarantee his/her divine blade will stay true under such duress! Father! End this! Or will you stand by and watch a prince/princess of Nohr fall?

speaker: Xander
text: Father!

speaker: Iago
text: It's useless, Lord Xander. King Garon has already approved this inevitable showdown. We are both eager to see how much Lord/Lady Corrin has grown with our own eyes. And if the two end up killing each other... Well, lesson learned.

speaker: Xander
text: If you think I will stand by and do nothing, you are grievously mistaken!

speaker: Xander
text: Hoshidan reinforcements...

speaker: Saizo
text: Your trail of blood ends here, Nohrians. After our encounter in Mokushu, I had hoped I would never see you again.

speaker: Kagero
text: On behalf of Lord Ryoma, Saizo and I will not allow you to interfere. we will have our revenge for Lady Hinoka and all the Hoshidan lives you've taken!!

speaker: Xander
text: You have my attention. Ready your weapons. Brother! Sisters! Let's take these soldiers out and go help Corrin.

speaker: Leo
text: We're on it.

speaker: Camilla
text: I will happily kill anyone who gets in the way of saving my precious brother/sister!

speaker: Elise
text: I'll do my best, Xander! For Corrin!

speaker: Saizo
text: We will not surrender. No matter how grim things seem, I believe in Hoshido! I believe in Lord Ryoma!

speaker: Saizo
text: I have failed...Lord Ryoma... Though I must die...my words remain true. I will always believe in Hoshido... We will win this war. The world...will one day...know peace..

speaker: Kagero
text: Do what you will, Nohrian. We cannot afford to lose. Even if our fate is worse than death, we will never give up on Lord Ryoma!

speaker: Kagero
text: This is it. This is the end. Lord Ryoma... Saizo... It was an honor...to fight beside you both. If only I could have lived to see...Hoshido achieve...true peace...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Only an honorless boor would interfere with a duel!

speaker: Ryoma
text: My kingdom... My honor... All is lost...

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's time, Corrin. Show me the power you used to slay our sister! Or does the Yato repel at your touch now that your heart and soul are dead?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, stop this. I don't want to fight you! I can explain all of this, even Hinoka. Please, listen to me!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ha! As though I would allow you to distract me with false remorse. How dare you pretend to be my brother/sister after killing Hinoka! You are nothing to me. Just a filthy coward like the rest of your kingdom. I have said all I wish to say to you. Nothing you can do will sway me. You are no brother/sister of mine, Nohrian prince/princess! Watch as my blade takes back whatever Hoshidan blood remains in you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! No!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hoshido has fallen. I am a disgrace to my people. Corrin... Kill me. Do it now. Once you do, the war is over. Please...end my suffering and let me join Hinoka.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't do that, Ryoma.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Are you really going to deny me even the mercy of a quick death?!

speaker: Corrin
text: My brother... To kill you now would not reunite you with Hinoka. I did not kill her, Ryoma. She's still alive.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This must be...a trick of some kind...

speaker: Corrin
text: It isn't. She and I fought, but I refused to kill her, just as I refuse to kill you. I couldn't do it. It may cost me my life and my mission, but she's too precious to me. I knew Father would not tolerate there being any survivors, so I lied. I made it seem as though she were dead and told her to hide until the war was over. That's why I took her lance as proof. If I had really killed her, don't you think we would have taken her head instead?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I suppose. But how can I trust you after all you've done?!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Ryoma. I don't know what else to say. I know you have no good reason to take me at my word, but I swear it's the truth. Sakura and Yukimura were taken prisoner, but at least they're still alive. Takumi fell, but his body is missing, I'm sure he's out there somewhere. I want to save you too, Ryoma. I don't want anyone else to die! Please, Brother! I would rather die than lie to you a moment longer. The truth is that I am not your enemy. All I have done has been for the good of us all.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin... I...

speaker: Corrin
text: Quiet! Father is approaching... Let me say all I need to say. I want nothing more than to save you and this kingdom. I promised Hinoka I would. You may hate me, but know that no matter what happens...you'll always be my brother.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What's this?! I could have sworn I saw the Yato light up for a moment. Could it be? Is he/she telling the truth? I wonder...

speaker: Corrin
text: Father, the battle is over. Hoshido's high prince is at death's door.

speaker: Garon
text: Well done, my son/daughter.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Father. Now it's time to cement that which you have waited so long for. Once you seize the throne, this kingdom will finally belong to Nohr.

speaker: Garon
text: Yes, but first... I shall bear witness as you kill Prince Ryoma.

speaker: Garon
text: Are you deaf, child? Kill Prince Ryoma! I forbid anyone else from taking your glory. Deal the final blow yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Father! What purpose does it serve? Prince Ryoma can no longer fight. We've won the war! Why not force him to drown in his disgrace rather than needlessly take his life? To watch our king ascend his throne is surely more torturous than death...

speaker: Garon
text: Foolish boy/girl. Have you learned nothing?! Rebellions are like seeds. One must salt the earth before they sprout. You have uttered those very words yourself. Or was your change of heart a lie?

speaker: Corrin
text: It wasn't! I just—

speaker: Iago
text: Oh my, what is the meaning of this? Could it be you lied to your king? If you lied about that, perhaps you lied about Princess Hinoka too... What have you done, Corrin? Have you betrayed Nohr after all?

speaker: Corrin
text: You're wrong! I have proven my allegiance to Nohr over and over again!

speaker: Iago
text: Then prove it one last time. Someone as strong as you should have no trouble ending a life in one strike, right?

speaker: Garon
text: Kill him now. I will not be kept waiting. Do it now or be branded a traitor and condemn yourself and your troops to death.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father!!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma... I... I...

speaker: Iago
text: Enough of this! Prince/Princess Corrin is clearly a trai—

speaker: Ryoma
text: Wait!

speaker: Iago
text: Hm?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I know what must be done, and I will not allow a Nohrian to do it for me. I will end this war...my way.

speaker: Iago
text: What are you talking about? Have you gone mad from despair?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, Corrin. I finally understand. It's all right. Everything will be all right. My beloved brother/sister...

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, no! Don't!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm counting on you, Corrin. I will... trust you. Good-bye...

speaker: Ryoma
text: I cannot fall into the hands of an enemy. So I... fulfill a samurai's... final duty!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm counting on you.

speaker: Corrin
text: NOOO!! This can't be... Ryoma...

speaker: Azura
text: Ryoma... My...brother...

speaker: Iago
text: Hmph! King Garon, do you accept this travesty? Lord/Lady Corrin did not kill the prince as you so clearly commanded!

speaker: Garon
text: True, but I will accept this victory nonetheless. Prince Ryoma is dead, as is Hoshido. Victory belongs to Nohr. At long last, I am now king of everything and everyone! Mwahahaha!

speaker: Garon
text: Heheheheh... MWAHAHAHA!!

speaker: Corrin
text: No!!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin? Where are you going?! Corrin, wait!

speaker: Iago
text: Hmph...

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't cry... I must stay strong... If I cry now, Ryoma's sacrifice will have been in vain... I am King Garon's child! A cold, heartless, prince/princess! That is my disguise. I can't falter. I chose to follow my heart, to walk the path of darkness... I am Corrin the traitor! And so I must remain until the bitter end. I must rejoice in the sorrow of my enemies. I must...revel in their deaths. I have no right to cry over Ryoma... over my...my brother... No!! I can't... I mustn't... *sob* WHY?! WHY IS THIS HAPPENING?! Ryoma! Brother!! *sob...sob...*

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... *sniffle* I couldn't...protect him... I promised Hinoka I'd save him. That we'd all be a family again one day... But it was a lie, just like everything in my life. All I do is hurt the ones I love! *sob*

speaker: Azura
text: Hush now, Corrin. It's OK. I know you couldn't keep that promise you made to Hinoka... But don't forget about the new promise you made to Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: A new...promise...?

speaker: Azura
text: That's right. Remember his last words? He said, "I'm counting on you." That was him entrusting the future of Hoshido to you. Those aren't just empty words from one enemy to another. In the end he realized what you're trying to achieve and recognized you as his brother/sister. That's why he said what he said... and why he did what he did.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma... *sob*

speaker: Azura
text: My brother... He smiled as he died. He smiled just for you. He was proud of you, Corrin. Don't waste his sacrifice. You will fulfill his promise, won't you? His...his dying wish?

speaker: Corrin
text: *sniffle* Y-you're right. I did make him a promise. And as long as I'm alive, I will keep it. I won't let you down, Ryoma...

speaker: Azura
text: You've been so strong, Corrin. We're almost at the end. Once King Garon sits on the throne, everyone will learn the truth. We're so close... But for just...just a brief moment... May I...cry with you? *sniffle*

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon, I have come to report on Lord/Lady Corrin's progress. It would seem he/she successfully captured Notre Sagesse for the glory of Nohr. As for the Rainbow Sage, he/she didn't kill him with his/her own hands... However, as ordered, the Sage is dead.

speaker: Garon
text: So the ancient one has finally passed on... Once more, Corrin has dutifully fulfilled my wishes. Heh heh heh... Ha ha ha ha... MWA HA HA HAA HAAAA!!!

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon? Milord?

speaker: Garon
text: HA HA HA HA HA! MWA HA HA HA HAAA!!!

speaker: Iago
text: Your majesty?!

speaker: Garon
text: ... Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: Y-yes, sire?

speaker: Garon
text: I have an important mission for you. I command you... to make Corrin suffer. Make him/her rue the day he/she was born. But no matter what, no matter how he/she begs for death, do not kill him/her.

speaker: Iago
text: As you wish, sire, but... I'm not entirely sure I understand your aim.

speaker: Garon
text: I do not need you to understand, only to obey. Loyal servant... it is of grave importance that I rule Hoshido. Corrin's life and happiness are a trifling price to pay. Still, he/she must be kept alive for now... the Great Dragon has willed it so. Corrin's body and soul must be tested... primed for what is to come. Like a calf fattened for slaughter, so too shall these trials prepare him/her. My dear son/daughter is not ready, but his/her time is fast approaching. Corrin has faithfully followed my orders thus far, but it's time for a test. He/She must fight those he/she doesn't wish to fight... kill those he/she doesn't wish to kill. His/her sorrow will feed the darkness in his/her soul. And his/her suffering will make him/her a worthy sacrifice upon the altar of Anankos.

speaker: Iago
text: I understand, King Garon. It shall be done, with pleasure. In fact, I have an idea...

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank the gods - we're finally back in familiar territory. If we keep up this pace, we'll be back at the castle in just a few days.

speaker: Elise
text: Th-that's good... I'm at the end of my rope. Can't wait to sleep in my own bed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha ha, poor Elise. You've been through a lot on this journey, haven't you? I've asked so much of you, and you've never complained once. You're an inspiration. Just hang in there a bit longer for me, OK? We'll be back home before you know it.

speaker: Elise
text: You got it, Corrin! I promise I won't let you down!

speaker: Elise
text: *pant... pant...* *cough*

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise? Are you OK, little one?

speaker: Elise
text: I don't... feel so well. Why is... everything... spinning... *gasp*

speaker: Corrin
text: ELISE!

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise, speak to me! What's wrong?! Please, no... Gods, she's burning up!

speaker: Azura
text: Dizziness, fever... Ah, and a rash, too. Just as I feared...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, what is it?! Have you seen these symptoms before?

speaker: Azura
text: Unless I'm mistaken, she is suffering from an illness endemic to the islands. She must have been exposed to it while we were in Notre Sagesse. The illness progresses quickly. If we don't act fast... we may lose her. There's a special plant in Hoshido that I could derive a cure from, however... I'm sorry, but... I don't believe there's anything like it here in Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: We have to do something, dammit. I won't let her die. I won't!

speaker: Silas
text: Corrin! We just received new orders from Iago.

speaker: Corrin
text: Now?! Are you kidding me? We don't have time for this. What is it Father requires of me?

speaker: Silas
text: He apparently wishes to reward you for your success in Notre Sagesse. We are to travel to the royal palace in Macarath for rest and relaxation.

speaker: Corrin
text: Rest? Can it be? Thank goodness. I was afraid he was going to order me to kill again. Perhaps they can help Elise there... it's our only hope.

speaker: Silas
text: What do you mean? Is there something wrong with the princess?

speaker: Corrin
text: She caught a deadly ailment while we were on our last mission. Azura can cure her with a special plant, but it only grows in Hoshido...

speaker: Silas
text: Don't worry, Corrin. Macarath will surely have what she needs.

speaker: Corrin
text: Will they, Silas? How do you know?

speaker: Silas
text: The best doctors in all the land can be found in Macarath. Their stock of medicines is unrivaled.

speaker: Azura
text: We must hurry, Corrin. She doesn't have much time...

speaker: Corrin
text: Let's move it people! To Macarath! Hang in there, Elise...

speaker: Corrin
text: We finally made it to Palace Macarath. There's hope yet. But why is there a crowd at the entrance... Wait... th-that's not just any crowd. It's the Hoshidan army! And they're not alone...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hello, Corrin. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma...

speaker: Ryoma
text: It's been a while, brother/sister. I haven't seen you since that fateful day on the border. I see you've become a faithful Nohrian dog since then. Your master must be proud.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't wish to argue, Ryoma. How did you know we were coming to Macarath?

speaker: Ryoma
text: That doesn't concern you. All you need to know is how fast you can draw your blade.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, please... Let us pass. I beg of you. My sister, Elise, is gravely ill. If we don't treat her right away, she'll die.

speaker: Ryoma
text: The Nohrian princess is sick, is she? I can tell she means a lot to you. Well then, I believe a trade is in order. Her life for yours. Come back to Hoshido with me, and I shall withdraw my troops immediately.

speaker: Corrin
text: You know I can't do that. Please, have mercy.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Your only other option is to fight me, here and now. Ready your blade, Corrin. Show me what you're made of.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, stop this! Please! There must be another way. Although I fight for Nohr, I do not wish to be an enemy of Hoshido. I wish for nothing but peace. Please believe me, Brother.

speaker: Ryoma
text: More empty words. Even if that were true, I doubt that monster you call a father shares the sentiment. They've brainwashed you, brother/sister. You are blind to their evil and cowardly ways. If the sting of my blade is the only way to bring you back to your senses, so be it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Don't do this!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I won't back down today, brother/sister. You're coming home. Now. Prepare to witness firsthand my blade's true power... As the high prince of Hoshido, I order you to surrender! HYAAAAH!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Argh!
Not on my watch!
Heh hee! Prepare to DIE!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Argh!! Wh-what is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Laslow
text: Heh, looks like we made it just in the nick of time. I'm glad to find you unharmed, milord/milady.

speaker: Peri
text: Aw, phooey. I didn't get any stabby-stabby time in. At least we saved you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks for your help, but who are you?

speaker: Laslow
text: You may call me Laslow. My liege, Lord Xander, sent us here to watch your back.

speaker: Peri
text: I'm Peri! P for pulverize, E for eviscerate, R for ruin, I for impale! Kee hee! Laslow and I are Lord Xander's retainers. He's really worried about you! That's why he sent us to kill things on his behalf. Best job ever!

speaker: Corrin
text: That sounds like Xander. Thank you for your assistance, friends.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ah, so you're Prince Xander's retainers. That explains a lot. Your master taught you well if you were able to deflect my attacks like that. But my retainers are just as strong, and their cause is much nobler. You may harbor my brother/sister, but I won't make this easy on you, Nohrians. Troops! Prepare for battle!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, wait! Listen to me! Ryoma...

speaker: Peri
text: It's no use. I know that look in his eyes... it's the same one I have! It means he's raring to fight.

speaker: Laslow
text: Please don't look so glum, milord/milady. It's bad for morale. It's always best to smile during times of hardship, even if you don't feel like it. It will make you feel better, I swear it. Give it a try!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Laslow. I know you're right, but I won't be able to smile until Elise is safe. We need to get her medical attention right away, but-

speaker: Laslow
text: What are you saying?! Has something happened to Lady Elise?

speaker: Corrin
text: She's in bad shape, Laslow. She doesn't have much time.

speaker: Peri
text: Hee hee, then let's gut these fools quickly and save our princess! I'm gonna stabby-stab every last one of them! It'll be SO FUN!

speaker: Corrin
text: Your enthusiasm has been... noted. But do all you can to avoid taking any lives, OK?

speaker: Laslow
text: If you wish it so, so it shall be. I agree that it's always best to secure a win without needlessly sacrificing lives.

speaker: Peri
text: Awww, that's not FAIR! I was all ready to get my killface on. Phooey. Whatever, I'll do my best. I guess hitting things will have to suffice.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, friends. I'm glad to have you on my side. Ryoma, my brother... I do not wish to fight you, but you've left me no other option. I will not let Elise die, and I can't return to Hoshido either...

speaker: Saizo
text: I am Lord Ryoma's retainer, Saizo. Behold my mastery of explosives!

speaker: Saizo
text: Well done. But next time… will be a different story…

speaker: Kagero
text: If you wish to harm Lord Ryoma, you must get through me first.

speaker: Kagero
text: Forgive me… Lord Ryoma. The enemy’s will… was too strong…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Return Corrin to me or feel the wrath of my blade!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Not again! We'll have to...retreat...

speaker: Saizo
text: Fight me, Corrin. It must be destiny that we meet again. Last time we were interrupted… but this time you won’t be so lucky. Let us settle this fair and square.

speaker: Corrin
text: I wouldn’t want it any other way.

speaker: Saizo
text: Kaze... I never thought I'd live to see my own brother betray us. As your twin, and a proud ninja serving the great kingdom of Hoshido... I want you to know that I am truly ashamed of you and your actions.

speaker: Kaze
text: Saizo, we have been close since the moment we were born. I never wished to disappoint you, but I stand by my decision. Say what you will---I have no regrets. I proudly side with Corrin.

speaker: Saizo
