text: You are a fool, Brother. I will show you the error of your ways!

speaker: Kagero
text: As Lord Ryoma’s retainer, it is my duty to follow his every order. He wishes to take you back to Hoshido, and so it must be done.

speaker: Corrin
text: I refuse. You may attempt to take me by force, but it won’t end well.

speaker: Kagero
text: You sound most determined. This should be interesting…

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry Ryoma, but you know I can't go back to Hoshido with you. Though it pains me, I will not hesitate to strike you down to save my sister.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Your sister? Hmph. So you still think of the Nohrian royals as your true family.

speaker: Ryoma
text: If you only knew what it would mean to us to have that place in your heart....It's not too late for that. I won't give up on you, Brother/Sister. Never. That's why I must win this battle and take you back to Hoshido! Let us begin!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Azura... Hinoka and Takumi told me you were fighting with the enemy. I had to see it with my own eyes to believe it. What a pity. I suppose the Nohrian blood flowing in your veins lends itself to betrayal..

speaker: Azura
text: Think of me what you will, Ryoma. But know that I am, and ever shall be, grateful for my time in Hoshido. I'm especially grateful for your family, who raised me as their own. That includes you too, Ryoma. You were like the brother I never had.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Azura... Leave it to you to craft such a lovely farewell. I wish I could forget our time together. It would make this a lot easier. But enough with farewells. Let us battle!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Our line has been breached... We have no choice. Everyone, retreat! We must escape before Nohrian reinforcements arrive!

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like the Hoshidan soldiers have finally retreated. Hang in there, Elise. It won't be long now until we can get you that medicine.

speaker: Elise
text: Thanks... Corrin... Hee... hee... I'm so glad... You didn't... go back... to Hoshido... *gasp*

speaker: Corrin
text: ELISE!!

speaker: Elise
text: *pant... pant...*

speaker: Azura
text: She's running out of time. She needs that medicine now. Stay strong, sweet Elise. We need you to hang in there...

speaker: Elise
text: Zzz... zzz...

speaker: Azura
text: I believe the worst is over. We can rest easy now. As long as she gets plenty of rest, she should make a full recovery.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura. Your knowledge of herbs and medicine saved her life. This has been a trying ordeal for all of us. I propose we take this opportunity to rest.

speaker: Azura
text: That's a splendid idea. Perhaps you could start by telling me what's on your mind.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* You're very keen, aren't you? I keep wondering how Ryoma knew we'd be here. It's killing me. There's no way the Hoshidan army could have known we were making this detour...

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, I've been pondering that as well. We should remain cautious. There might be those among the Nohrians who wish to see you fall...

speaker: Corrin
text: But why? What have I done?

speaker: Elise
text: Hmmm... Mmmm... Corrin... Azura...

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise! You're finally awake. How do you feel?

speaker: Elise
text: I was having... a dream... Gunter was there... He was talking to me...

speaker: Corrin
text: Gunter? Aw, Elise, you know he... That's not possible.

speaker: Elise
text: No... it was really Gunter... He was worried about you... He looked so lonely... Don't worry... Gunter... Soon we'll... we'll... Zzz... zzz... zzz...

speaker: Azura
text: Elise? ... She's fallen back asleep.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm, I wonder why she saw Gunter in her dream. Well, I suppose it was just a dream. Gunter died in the Bottomless Canyon. No matter how much we wish we could see him again, it can never be. And yet, I can't help feeling bothered by it. Gunter... Are you trying to tell us something?

speaker: Garon
text: Iago! Is that the throne room up ahead?

speaker: Iago
text: Yes, my liege. Nothing stand in our way. The kingdom of Hoshido is all yours!

speaker: Garon
text: Mwahaha, the time has finally come! I have awaited this moment for decades upon decades...

speaker: Corrin
text: ... Yes, Father. Please, sit on the throne and claim what is rightfully yours. Let us admire you in your first moments as the conqueror of Hoshido!

speaker: Garon
text: No. Stay right there.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hm?

speaker: Garon
text: I must first consult the sacred mystical dragon, Anankos. No one may enter the throne room until I say so.

speaker: Corrin
text: ...Understood, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: Mwahahaha!! I am ruler of both Nohr and Hoshido, the two greatest kingdoms of all! I shall be remembered forever as the king who conquered the world!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's all right, Azura. Once he's done praying to his god, we'll be allowed to join him in the throne room. Then everyone will finally see his true form. After all we've endured, waiting just a few moments longer is nothing.

speaker: Azura
text: You're right. It's almost time...

speaker: Corrin
text: Relax, everyone. Father will give us permission to enter any minute now.

speaker: Corrin
text: The fighting is finally over. Let's lay down our weapons and rest easy for a change.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, behind you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Iago
text: Drat, I missed! What a slithery little snake you are.

speaker: Azura
text: What are you doing, Iago?! Why did you attack Corrin?

speaker: Iago
text: What am I doing? Is it not I who should be asking that question? What exactly do you think you're doing, Lord/Lady Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you talking about?!

speaker: Iago
text: Princess Hinoka is alive and well. Do you deny it?

speaker: Corrin
text: That's...that's nonsense! You have no proof!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh? While you were fighting Prince Ryoma, I had soldiers search the castle grounds. What do you think they found? Surprise, surprise! Princess Hinoka with a small group quietly escaping from the back.

speaker: Iago
text: You don't seem surprised, young prince/princess. I take your silence as a confession. You let her escape, didn't you?! Such betrayal is an act of treason, and the only possible punishment is death.

speaker: Iago
text: As such, I think I'll go ahead and take your pathetic little life myself!

speaker: Corrin
text: No!

speaker: Xander
text: As though I would ever allow that to happen.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!

speaker: Iago
text: Out of my way, Prince Xander. Otherwise you too will be branded a traitor and executed for your crime.

speaker: Xander
text: So be it. If you wish to kill Corrin, you will have to defeat me first. However, know that I do not intend to go down without a fight.

speaker: Iago
text: Wh-what do you mean?

speaker: Xander
text: I challenge you to a duel, Iago. I have had enough of you and your cruel manner of doing things. You are a disgrace to the great kingdom of Nohr, but that ends today. If you choose not to repent, the only fate left for you is to die by my blade. As the crown prince of Nohr, I am taking back my kingdom!

speaker: Leo
text: Count me in. I've long hoped for the chance to express my discontent with Iago's dirty schemes. If you are going to take him down, allow me to share in the pleasure.

speaker: Iago
text: You d-don't intend to kill me, do you?! Your king's trusted g-general? That's not very becoming of a N-Nohrian royal, now is it?!

speaker: Xander
text: Say what you will, coward. Our father is not here to protect his lapdog. We'll tell him you were murdered by some remaining Hoshidan rebels. How tragic.

speaker: Iago
text: What?! No! That's deceitful! It's traitorous! It's—

speaker: Elise
text: Hmph! Who are you to judge us?! You and Hans have done nothing but awful things to innocent people for years! And what's more, you've been openly mean to Corrin! I've always hated you two! It's time to pay for being such big jerks!!

speaker: Camilla
text: Hmm, well, I perhaps don't feel as strongly as our little Elise here... But anyone who tries to hurt my darling Corrin most certainly deserves death. It's only fair. You're ready to die now, I hope?

speaker: Iago
text: Lady Elise! Lady Camilla! Th-this is bad...

speaker: Hans
text: Are you traitors really turning your blades against your own?! Fine then! Bring it on, gwahaha! I don't care if you're a prince or a princess. You're weak—all of you!

speaker: Azura
text: It seems the only way to settle this is with a battle. Do not expect me to hold back. Though I do not regret returning to Nohr... I will not stand idly by while you desecrate the kingdom I grew up in!

speaker: Corrin
text: If it’s a fight you want, Hans, it’s a fight you’re going to get. I always try to avoid needless violence...but there’s an exception to every rule. You want to see me act more like you? Like a merciless killer? Then watch this. You may be on the side of Nohr, but I will punish you all the same!

speaker: Xander
text: Don't worry, Corrin. We all share the sentiment, and we have your back. You are still the leader of this army, and we are awaiting you orders. You have plotted the course, little prince/princess. Give the word, and we shall act upon it!

speaker: Corrin
text: Right! Everyone, ready your weapons! These men have employed cowardly tactics to hurt innocent people! They have destroyed the reputation of our beloved kingdom! They are traitors, and they will pay for the crimes with their lives! Hurry my friends! It is time to obliterate the king's army and take back Nohr!

speaker: Hans
text: I've waited a long time to wipe that smug look of your face. This is what you get for not bowing down to my might!

speaker: Hans
text: Defeated? How?! No... It can't be... I was to be rewarded with power! So much...power...

speaker: Iago
text: You impertinent traitor! Your ragtag group is no match for my army! Let your death serve as an example to all those who dare oppose King Garon!

speaker: Iago
text: GAAAAH!! This can't...be happening! How could I lose?! King Garon, please...save...me...

speaker: Iago
text: Are you ready to pay for your betrayal, Lord/Lady Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Iago, I am ready to kill you.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh my, how very frightening. I'm trembling! I am the highest-ranking general in the Nohrian army, you fool. Do you really think I'll be so easy to kill? But before you die, I have something to tell you. A parting gift, if you will. It was I who sent the Faceless who killed that flying rat, Lilith.

speaker: Corrin
text: What!?

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, and that's not all. It was I who suggested to King Garon that you be forced to kill Prince Ryoma. And I who told the enemy about your journey to Macarath. Did you enjoy my little gifts of sorrow? I put ever so much thought into them!

speaker: Corrin
text: I will never forgive you for all that, Iago. Prepare to die!

speaker: Iago
text: Ha! So the imprisoned little prince/princess fancies himself/herself all grown up. The king ordered me to make you suffer without killing you... But I can no longer comply. In order to see my plans to fruition, you must die! Say your prayers, Lord/Lady Corrin!

speaker: Iago
text: Eeeeek! No! NO, PLEASE! I don't wanna d-d-die!!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's over, Iago. Have some dignity and let me finish you off quickly.

speaker: Iago
text: Please, Lord/Lady Corrin! Spare me! Have mercy! All we did was follow King Garon's orders, just like you! If you don't like our tactics, blame him! Punish him instead! I'm innocent! Innocent, I say! You wouldn't kill an innocent man, would you?

speaker: Leo
text: Yeesh, this is getting embarrassing. How low are you going to stoop, Iago?

speaker: Iago
text: Lord Leo! I've known you since you were a child! As wise as you are, surely you understand the awful situation I'm in! Please, milord! Spare me! Tell your army how absurd it would be to kill me!

speaker: Leo
text: You are an eyesore, Iago. A cruel fiend who deserves nothing but a blade at your neck. I haven't any mercy to spare for someone like you. You are naught but a spineless coward who brings shame upon our beloved Nohr. These are your final moments. I suggest you muster some dignity for them.

speaker: Iago
text: Lord Leo? No! You can't! You—

speaker: Leo
text: For all the pain you have caused...to hell with you!!

speaker: Iago
text: GAAAAAAAH!!

speaker: Leo
text: *sigh* It is done.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo.

speaker: Leo
text: It was nothing. It actually feels really nice, knowing he's out of our lives.

speaker: Elise
text: That's our Leo! Always thinking of the big picture and stuff!

speaker: Camilla
text: Good work, Brother. Now no one remains who can harm our precious Corrin.

speaker: Xander
text: Yes. This was truly our final battle.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin... I think it's time.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know, Azura. I know. Everyone...I need to tell you something.

speaker: Xander
text: Oh? What's that?

speaker: Corrin
text: The war isn't over just yet. There's still someone we must defeat before our world can know peace.

speaker: Xander
text: Out with it, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, but... That person is King Garon.

speaker: Leo
text: Father?!

speaker: Camilla
text: You...you can't really be telling us to kill our own father, can you?

speaker: Elise
text: That's a horrible thing to say! Why would you say something like that, Corrin?! I know he's rough around the edges, but together we can change him!

speaker: Xander
text: Explain yourself, Corrin. You have our attention.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK. This isn't going to be easy to hear... But you have to know. I fought so hard and sacrificed so much for this moment. I lost Lilith, Ryoma...even myself to an extent, just to make it this far. I did all that so I could show you, my family, the truth about Father.

speaker: Xander
text: And what is this truth of which you speak?

speaker: Corrin
text: Father...King Garon...is no longer human. He has become a monster, kept alive by someone or something truly unholy. There is no way to save him at this point...defeating him is our only option.

speaker: Xander
text: That's impossible... You must be joking!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Xander, but I'm dead serious. I had a hard time believing it myself, but I swear it's the truth. I can prove it to you, too. The truth about our Father...lies behind those doors.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, follow me. Let's go, Azura. We've waited long enough.

speaker: Azura
text: As you wish, Corrin.

speaker: Flora
text: Time to wake up, Lord/Lady Corrin!

speaker: Felicia
text: Hey, wake up, Lord/Lady Corrin! Up and at 'em!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hrmmm...What are you talking about? It's still dark outside.

speaker: Gunter
text: Listen well, Prince. It may be dark, but it is indeed in the morning. You have practice today.

speaker: Jakob
text: I have taken the liberty of reading your armor, and, er, pounding out the dents. Your brother is a fearsome opponent, is he not?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh. Fine. I'm still not completely awake though...

speaker: Flora
text: Oh, we can help you with that! Felicia, would you please assist me?

speaker: Felicia
text: Sure thing!

speaker: Corrin
text: Waauuugh! Cold cold cold! I'm awake! Totally awake now!

speaker: Flora
text: That's how we deal with slugabeds in the Ice Tribe!

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* Trust me, I know. I wish I could have finished the dream I was having though...

speaker: Jakob
text: Interesting. Do tell-what kind of dream was it?

speaker: Corrin
text: It was...strange. Some people who look like Hoshidans kept calling me their brother/sister. But all of my brothers and sisters are here in Nohr...

speaker: Flora
text: Ah, Lord/Lady Corrin, perhaps we should talk about your dream another time?

speaker: Felicia
text: It's time for you to get going, milord/milady. Prince Xander is waiting for you!

speaker: Leo
text: That's our brother/sister for you. You won't beat the strongest knight in Nohr by sleeping all day, Corrin!

speaker: Xander
text: Giving up so soon, Corrin? I expect more of you. You are a prince/princess of Nohr! Pick up your sword and try again.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Xander, I-

speaker: Xander
text: We train like this so that we can defend ourselves from our enemies. Father has been tracking your progress. If you can't land a hit on me today...he may never permit you to leave the Northern Fortress. Ever.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! D-did he really say that? That's insane!

speaker: Xander
text: Motivated, are we? Then use that fire to best me in battle, little Prince/Princess. If you would see the outside world beyond the view from your window, defeat me. Prove that all of the time I've devoted to training you have not be in vain!

speaker: Xander
text: The first move is yours, Corrin. Come at me when you are ready.

speaker: Xander
text: You swing timidly, without resolve. You must genuinely try to kill me.

speaker: Corrin
text: *pant*...*pant*...

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm, looks like that wound needs attention. In that case...

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah! There was a Dragon Vein here?

speaker: Xander
text: Yes. You should have sensed it as well. The blood of dragons flows in your veins, as it does in all royals. You must learn to harness this draconic power wherever you may find it. Heal your wounds, Corrin, then find the courage to come at me again.

speaker: Xander
text: Good. Now that you've recovered some of your strength, try again!

speaker: Xander
text: Well done, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother... how are you... so strong...?

speaker: Xander
text: Is that all it takes to defeat you? What a shame. I guess you don't wish to leave this fortress after all...

speaker: Xander
text: Well done, Corrin. You're getting stronger every day.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Xander. I couldn't have done it without your, uh, tough love.

speaker: Xander
text: I disagree. I believe you have natural talent. Some day, you could be the greatest warrior in all of Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: Now you're just teasing me.

speaker: Xander
text: You know me, Corrin. I never joke about serious matters. I mean what I say. You could be the one to bring light to our kingdom so long shrouded in darkness.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Leo
text: Typical. You know that true strength is more than simple swordplay, right?

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, he didn't mean-

speaker: Xander
text: Calm yourself, little brother. You really are competitive to a fault. As I've always said, you're a talented mage with formidable magical abilities.

speaker: Leo
text: Hmm. Well, just remember that pointy metal sticks are not the only path to power.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, that reminds me of something I've been meaning to tell you, Leo.

speaker: Leo
text: Something important enough to derail this conversation?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well...your collar is inside out.

speaker: Leo
text: What?!

speaker: Xander
text: It would appear someone got dressed while still half-asleep.

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh! Wh-why didn't you say something earlier?!

speaker: Xander
text: Haha, sorry, Leo. But that sort of thing is what makes you so lovable.

speaker: Corrin
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Leo
text: Hmph...

speaker: Camilla
text: Are you all right, Corrin? Did you get hurt at all during practice? If you did, let me know right away so I can take extra-special care of you...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm perfectly fine, Camilla. As always, thanks for your concern.

speaker: Elise
text: I was worried about you too, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: I know, Elise. You wouldn't visit me all the time if you didn't care so much, right?

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee... Do you like it when I visit?

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course! I'm not allowed to leave this fortress, so visits are all I look forward to!

speaker: Elise
text: Yaaay! I'm glad to hear that. Spending time with my brother/sister makes me so happy!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gah!

speaker: Elise
text: I love you so much! I love you more than anything in the whole, wide world!

speaker: Leo
text: Elise, when do you intend to behave like the adult that you technically are?

speaker: Camilla
text: Well, I for one think her cheer is a good complement to this gloomy kingdom, Leo.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well said, Camilla. Every one of you is so dear to me. You've all been so patient and kind since I lost my memory... I don't even mind being quarantined when I'm with you. I'm so grateful to have you all.

speaker: Xander
text: We are grateful to have you as well. But, Corrin, I have some-

speaker: Camilla
text: Let me tell him/her, Xander! We have wonderful news, Corrin! Father asked us to take you back to the capital!

speaker: Corrin
text: Really?! Does that mean...

speaker: Camilla
text: Yes. It means you can finally leave this drafty fortress. You must have been so lonely all this time, separated from the rest of the world... But now you'll be free!

speaker: Elise
text: Isn't that wonderful?!

speaker: Corrin
text: It...it really is. Thanks, Elise. Wow... I'm finally leaving this place... Maybe now I can join you all as a soldier, fighting for Nohr?

speaker: Xander
text: There will be plenty of time to discuss the details with Father. Let us depart.

speaker: Lilith
text: I hear you can finally leave the fortress. You must be very happy, Lord/Lady Corrin. Gunter has asked me to go with you to the capital so I can look after your horses.

speaker: Corrin
text: Glad to hear it! I'd miss you if you weren't coming along too.

speaker: Xander
text: Lilith, are the horses ready?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, milord. Everything is ready, and the horses seem excited about the trip. They are all very fond of Lord/Lady Corrin. Probably from all his/her time in the stables...

speaker: Camilla
text: Our Corrin does love animals. Such a kindhearted soul... Why he/she even nursed an injured baby bird back to health one time!

speaker: Lilith
text: Ah...

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith, is something wrong?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh...no. It's nothing.

speaker: Elise
text: Isn't it obvious, Corrin? Lilith is sad because she's going to miss you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Miss me? But she's coming with us.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, right! Well then, I bet she's sad 'cause she won't have you all to herself anymore. You've always been especially fond of our brother/sister, haven't you, Lilith?

speaker: Lilith
text: I, er-

speaker: Xander
text: As gripping as all this is, we should be on our way. We mustn't keep Father waiting.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, let's go!

speaker: Gunter
text: Flora, you and Felicia/Jakob will remain here to watch over the fortress. Felicia/Jakob and I will accompany Lord/Lady Corrin. We may be gone for some time. Take good care of this place.

speaker: Flora
text: Of course! You may rely on us.

speaker: Felicia
text: Safe travels, Lady Corrin!

speaker: Jakob
text: I wish you safe travels, Lord Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you. I hope to see both of you again soon...just not here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla, are you sure we shouldn't go straight home?

speaker: Camilla
text: Yes, silly Brother/Sister. Father wishes to meet with us here in Cyrkensia. It's his favorite town in all of Nestra.

speaker: Corrin
text: But isn't it dangerous for Father to travel to a place like this?

speaker: Camilla
text: It's fine. Father comes here often, and nothing bad has ever happened. Nestra is neutral territory, so you need not fear unless you try to start a fight.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, I see. So we should all be safe here. That's a relief.

speaker: Leo
text: It's always best to remain on guard. Stay on your toes, Corrin. This territory may be neutral, but there might be unruly Hoshidans about.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo!!

speaker: Leo
text: Long time no see, Brother/Sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so happy to see you! Did you finish Father's mission already?

speaker: Leo
text: For the most part. All that's left is to guard Father during his time here. After that, I'm free to do as I please. That means I'll be joining you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo. I'll feel much better with you on our team.

speaker: Odin
text: Milord! You've finally arrived! I’ve been so worried... My mind has been spiraling intro a dark abyss ever since we parted!

speaker: Niles
text: It's nice to have you back. While you were doing the king's bidding we couldn't help but wonder what awful trials he was forcing you to endure. We've been terribly worried.

speaker: Leo
text: Whoa! This has gotten way too mushy way too fast!! I appreciate your concern, both of you, but give me some breathing room!

speaker: Odin
text: Heh, sorry...

speaker: Niles
text: As you wish, milord.

speaker: Leo
text: If you are quite finished, Father should be here shortly. I'm expected to be at the theatre well before he arrives. If you'll excuse me...

speaker: Corrin
text: The theatre? What theatre?

speaker: Leo
text: Ah, that's right. This is your first time in the fair town of Cyrkensia. This place is known for its incredible singers and dancers. They always put on a big performance whenever Father comes to visit.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's interesting... Sounds exciting.

speaker: Leo
text: If you're free, you should take the time to watch. It's sure to be breathtaking. Even warriors need to rest now and then. Just don't get carried away. Anyway, I really must be going. I'll catch up with you later!

speaker: Corrin
text: Bye, Leo!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's so hard to put up a front when I'm still reeling from the tragedy in Cheve. As fun as it sounds, I'm in no mood for a show right now. Maybe Hans was lying. It's possible Father didn't really intend for us to... I'll ask him about it whenever I get the chance. I need to know. And if he did give the order, maybe I can convince him there's a better way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow! THIS is Cyrkensia's opera house?! It's incredible...

speaker: Leo
text: Corrin! Over here!

speaker: Corrin
text: There you are, Leo! I'm glad I finally found you. I've never seen such a huge crowd.

speaker: Leo
text: It's something else, isn't it? You're just in time. Father arrived moments ago. Father... Corrin is here.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father...

speaker: Garon
text: Corrin, I have received word about the incident in Cheve. I am told you eradicated the rebels, as well as the unarmed townspeople.

speaker: Corrin
text: Father, let me explain...

speaker: Garon
text: You did well, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Garon
text: When I heard that your group destroyed Cheve, I couldn't have been prouder. Rebellions are like seeds. One must salt the earth before they sprout. I knew you'd eventually come around and learn to accept my method of ruling. I'm told you even enjoyed watching the life spark fade from the injured rebel soldiers. Hans praised you highly for displaying behavior befitting a Nohrian royal.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Father... That's not true! Why would Hans say that?! I need to talk to you about what happened in Cheve. If you'll please allow me to–

speaker: Iago
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, the performance is about to begin. Please take your seat.

speaker: Corrin
text: But–

speaker: Iago
text: Such an important show cannot be delayed for one person, even a prince/princess. You can discuss your newfound Nohrian pride with King Garon later.

speaker: Leo
text: What's wrong, Brother/Sister? Did something happen in Cheve?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, Leo... Something awful. But I suppose I'll have to discuss it with Father later.

speaker: Leo
text: Yes I'm afraid so. We can't keep the performers waiting. Your seat is right over there. Please hurry–it's about to begin.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK, I'm going. I'll fill you in later, Leo.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh... It occurs to me I haven't seen Azura in a while. She would love to see this... I hope she found a seat elsewhere.

speaker: Azura
text: Embrace the dark you call a home, ♪ Gaze upon an empty, white throne...

speaker: Garon
text: Argh... Urgh...!!

speaker: Iago
text: My king! What's wrong?! King Garon!! Soldiers! Capture that performer! Do it NOW! Her song may have been a curse of some kind...

speaker: Corrin
text: A curse?! Father...

speaker: Leo
text: Corrin! Hurry, we need to catch that singer! Huh?! The stage... It's empty.

speaker: Corrin
text: Did she get away?! Well, she couldn't have gotten far. Let's hurry!

speaker: Leo
text: Right!

speaker: Kumagera
text: Stop right there, Nohrians.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hoshidan soldiers?!

speaker: Kumagera
text: Back away if you wish to live. This war ends now... And the way to peace begins with the Nohrian king's death.

speaker: Corrin
text: You intend to buy peace with death? That's madness!

speaker: Leo
text: So the Hoshidans are responsible for that singer's curse. I should have known.

speaker: Kumagera
text: Singer? Curse? What are you rambling on about?

speaker: Leo
text: Don't play dumb. One of your underlings performed a cursed song to hurt our father!

speaker: Kumagera
text: I have no idea what you're referring to, nor do I care. Leave it to a filthy Nohrian to fabricate a story to try and distract us.

speaker: Leo
text: You're a liar and a coward! I won't let you get away with this!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, what's going on?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! Where have you been?

speaker: Azura
text: Sorry I'm late. I wasn't feeling well, so I went outside to get some air. Why are there Hoshidan soldiers here?

speaker: Corrin
text: They've come to kill Father. They used some strange song to incapacitate him. Oh! While you were outside, did you see a strange woman fleeing the opera house?

speaker: Azura
text: ...No. I did not.

speaker: Kumagera
text: So you refuse to back down, eh? We'll just have to kill you all! Troops! Prepare to attack!

speaker: Leo
text: Dammit... We have no choice. We'll have to fight them off!

speaker: Corrin
text: Let's do this.

speaker: Keaton
text: *sigh* I've made a real mess for myself. I came down the mountain to gather bugs for my collection, but now I'm lost... Hm? What's going on over there? I thought I heard a ruckus, but wow, that's a lot of people. Hmm... HMM... Ah! That guy/lady looks nice. I'll ask him/her for directions back up the mountain. I may have a horrible sense of direction, but I'm a great judge of character!

speaker: Keaton
text: Hey, you! Yeah, you with the sword and the hair and stuff!!

speaker: Corrin
text: WHAA! Wh-why does that man have a tail?!

speaker: Keaton
text: Wow, really? That's really how you're gonna play this? I thought you looked like a nice guy/lady, but you clearly have issues... For the record, I am NOT a man with a tail. I'm a wolfskin, and proud of it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wolfskin? Sorry, but what's that?

speaker: Keaton
text: Seriously? Have you been living in isolation your whole life or what?

speaker: Corrin
text: Actually...

speaker: Keaton
text: As a wolfskin, I can transform into a wolf by using a beaststone. Pretty killer, eh?

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow, it really is! Sorry, I've lived a rather...sheltered life. I hope I didn't offend you. May I ask what you're doing here?

speaker: Keaton
text: Well, I'm sort of...just a bit...unsure of my whereabouts. I can't find my way home. I was thinking maybe...ya know...you could help a fella out?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, so that's why you called out to me. You're lost, poor thing.

speaker: Keaton
text: No! No... I mean...maybe. I'm maybe just a little lost. but mostly not lost at all. It's complicated.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sorry, but I actually don't know this area, much less the way back to your home.

speaker: Keaton
text: Oh, I see. well, whatever. I can manage on my own. I'll be fine...

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait! Why don't you join my team? You can stick with us until you find your way home. You seem like you'd be a great ally. What do you say?

speaker: Keaton
text: Join your group... Hmm... Well, I could find my way home anytime I wanted. Let's get that clear. But if you really think I'd be helpful, I can't very well turn you down.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha, your tail is wagging! Does that mean you're happy right now? Happy to join us?

speaker: Keaton
text: My tail is NOT wagging! It's not! Got it?! Anyway, I guess it's settled. Nice to know ya! The name's Keaton. As a token of our new friendship, I'd like you to have this treasure I came across.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's a...hair ball...?!

speaker: Keaton
text: Heh heh, gorgeous, ain't it? Best one I've seen in ages. No need to thank me. As my new pal, I'm entrusting this gem to you. You better take good care of it, or else!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks... I'll do that.

speaker: Kumagera
text: We're not leaving until King Garon has met his maker. Stay out of our way!

speaker: Corrin
text: We somehow managed to win...but it seems that singer got away. Who even has the kind of power necessary to curse Father with a song?

speaker: Leo
text: I don't know, but I intend to find out. She's most certainly with the Hoshidans. We'll all be in a world of hurt if she shows up again. She must be stopped.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not convinced she was Hoshidan... I have a strange feeling that...

speaker: Garon
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Father? How are you feeling?

speaker: Garon
text: I'm fine, my son/daughter. I have a new task for you. Kill all of the singers in Nestra. Every last one of them.

speaker: Corrin
text: WHAT?! Y-you can't be serious! It was the Hoshidans who attacked us. The other performers are innocent!

speaker: Garon
text: Foolish boy/girl. This is the only way to keep our royal family safe. Perhaps if you had caught the guilty party, the others could have been spared. But we must destroy anyone who might pose a threat to the Nohrian throne. As I said, rebellions are like seeds, and we must salt the earth before they sprout. You've seen many battles by now. Surely you've at least learned that much.

speaker: Corrin
text: But Father! I won't—

speaker: Iago
text: Consider it done, my king.

speaker: Hans
text: Leave it to us, Your Majesty.

speaker: Garon
text: Iago, Hans. I look forward to hearing good news of Corrin's efforts.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait! Both of you! Father, I tried to bring this up earlier, but now it simply can't wait. You keep ordering me to take lives of innocent people. Why? If we showed mercy and tried to talk things out instead, no one would have to die. Even if we manage to win the war this way, people will lose faith in our kingdom. That's hardly even winning...

speaker: Garon
text: Lose faith? Are you a princess or a saint, foolish child? After what you did in Cheve, I'm shocked to hear such a moralistic complaint.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's true... I didn't stop Hans in Cheve, as much as I wanted to. But what happened there tortures me, Father. It's no way to solve a conflict. Killing innocent people for our own benefit...for selfish glory and control... Is that really the Nohrian way? Is that really the legacy you wish to leave behind?!

speaker: Garon
text: You finally understand, though you still fight it. I desire only to rule Hoshido. I, and those who follow me, will do whatever it takes to achieve that. I don't care if the peons that fill our towns don’t trust us. They are nothing to me. Those who disobey will die. The rest will quickly learn.

speaker: Leo
text: Corrin, that's enough. Let's go. Father, Corrin is clearly exhausted from his/her travels and our recent battle. Please forgive his/her rude remarks. He/She doesn't truly feel that way.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's not true, Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: I said that's enough! Let's go. NOW.

speaker: Leo
text: What were you thinking, challenging Father like that? Do you have a death wish?

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, you heard the awful things he said. You don't agree with him...right? You can't agree that it's acceptable to kill innocent people for our own benefit!

speaker: Leo
text: Of course I don't. Why do you think I helped you save Kaze and Rinkah? But just because we disagree doesn't mean we can openly disobey Father. If you do, one of these days he'll overreact a have you killed on the spot. Trust me, Brother/Sister. It's best to just stay silent and follow orders.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's what Camilla said...

speaker: Leo
text: Your other siblings and I have been living under Father's thumb our whole lives. I am certain Xander and Elise would tell you the same thing.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. I know that's how you and the others have been forced to live all these years... I understand your perspective, but I simply can't carry out the orders Father just gave. I refuse to harm the innocent. All I want to do is protect them—to protect everyone.

speaker: Leo
text: Corrin, wait! Think about who you're talking to. You know me better than that. As I said, we must follow Father's orders...or at least appear to follow them.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Leo
text: Listen well. We may not be able to openly disobey him, but we're not powerless. Us royal siblings have made an art of appearing to be good little soldiers... All while secretly manipulating things for the better from behind the scenes. How do you think we've survived this long with our souls intact?

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo... I'm impressed. But isn't it dangerous to go behind Father's back all the time?

speaker: Leo
text: Sometimes the righteous path is the most treacherous one to walk. Listen up. Start searching in unlikely places to give the performers time to escape. If our soldiers catch any of them, I'll step in and insist on killing them myself. I can't promise we'll be able to save them all, but that's the best I can do.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo... Thank you. I'm sorry I doubted you, even if just for a moment.

speaker: Leo
text: Heh, no worries. But don't think I'm doing this for you! You know how whiny Camilla and Elise get when you're unhappy. No one wants that. Besides, doing things like this is exciting. It's not like I'm a hero or anything.

speaker: Leo
text: Huh?! My Brynhildr is...glowing! And so is your Yato... What's going on?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Could it be? Is this the transformation the Rainbow Sage spoke of...? WHOA!!

speaker: Corrin
text: The Yato has transformed! This must be the Grim Yato the rainbow Sage told me about.

speaker: Leo
text: Grim Yato... what are you talking about?! Did I miss something?

speaker: Corrin
text: In Notre Sagesse, I sought out the Rainbow Sage as Xander suggested. The Sage said I would soon join forces with another hero of Nohr... And when I did, that my Yato would evolve into the Grim Yato.

speaker: Leo
text: The Sage said that? Incredible. Does that mean...I'm that Nohrian hero?

speaker: Corrin
text: That's the only explanation. There's some sort of otherworldly connection between our weapons. The sage also said my sword is fated to become the true Seal of Flames. That's all he was able to tell me.

speaker: Leo
text: The Seal of Flames... I wish I had time to digest all this, but time is a luxury we don't have. Iago and Hans might have already captured some of the singers. I'll leave you here. Promise not to challenge Father while I'm gone. I mean that, Brother/Sister. Your life depends on it.

speaker: Elise
text: *SIGH* It's no use, Corrin! The Wind Tribe refuses to let us pass through their territory. They said if we even set one foot on their land, they'll attack. Big meanies!

speaker: Corrin
text: Don't worry, Elise. We'll figure something out.

speaker: Camilla
text: It's quite bothersome, darling. The Wind Tribe is supposed to be neutral. What's more, cutting through their village is the only safe option we have left.

speaker: Elise
text: Big ol' liars! They're about as neutral as...um... Oh, you know what I mean! They weren't even remotely swayed when Camilla used her feminine wiles on them! That can only mean one thing... They hate Nohr. Or women. Or just Nohrian women.

speaker: Camilla
text: Elise, you silly thing. I did not use wiles of any kind, love. But you may have a point about them hating Nohr. Long ago, their village was attacked by Faceless, sent there by Nohrian mages. That said, I'm afraid there's probably little we can do to win them over.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmmm. Well, something must be done. I'm going to try reasoning with them one more time.

speaker: Camilla
text: You are? Oh, little Corrin! Are you sure that's a good idea?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's our only option, I'm afraid. If that attack still has them apprehensive, I'll apologize on Nohr's behalf. We must earn their trust—show them that our new way is the way of peace.

speaker: Camilla
text: Aww, what a sweet little brother/sister I have! But, darling, what if they don't listen? What if they try to attack you?! The thought is just too much to bear!

speaker: Corrin
text: I appreciate your concern, Camilla, but I'll be fine! We must end this war as soon as possible. We haven't a moment to lose. As wielder of the Yato, it is my duty to do whatever I can to bring peace to the world. Wait here for me, OK? This may take a while, but I'm certain we'll eventually come to an understanding.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, Corrin... Be so careful.

speaker: Fuga
text: Ho ho, I can see the fierce determination blazing in your eyes, outsider.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah. Can you? That's good. Erm... Who are you?

speaker: Fuga
text: I am Fuga, chief of the Wind Tribe.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh! Sorry, I had no idea. I am Prince/Princess Corrin of Nohr. May I request an audience with you?

speaker: Fuga
text: Hmm. I was informed there were outsiders at the entrance of my village. Not just any outsiders, but ones claiming to be Nohrian royalty. I am intrigued.

speaker: Fuga
text: It must have taken great courage for a Nohrian prince/princess to face me like this. I will hear what you have to say.

speaker: Corrin
text: You will?! Thank you!

speaker: Fuga
text: Yes, but not here. The winds cry out with a ferocity no mortal could hope to rival. We shall venture to my castle, Reppu. There, your story will be heard. ...Corrin, is it? In time I will require some information. It's about that blade you grasp. Come.

speaker: Corrin
text: My sword? Hmm...

speaker: Fuga
text: That's quite a tale you just told. I believe I understand your aim. Just this once, I will allow your army to pass through this village. I will alert my people that you are welcomed guests who are not to be disturbed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you so much, sir! Oh, but before I depart... You said there was something you wanted to ask me?

speaker: Fuga
text: Yes. It is about that golden blade of yours. That is the legendary Yato, is it not?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, it is. How did you know?

speaker: Fuga
text: I used to be close friends with Sumeragi, the former king of Hoshido. I was always enthralled by the various Hoshidan legends he shared with me. The legend behind that blade of yours particularly captured my imagination...

speaker: Corrin
text: You were friends with the Hoshidan king?! But wouldn't that make you...our enemy?

speaker: Fuga
text: Calm yourself, young prince/princess. That was many years ago. My tribe has since adopted a policy of neutrality in regard to this war. Though Sumeragi was a friend of mine, we are not allied with Hoshido. However...

speaker: Corrin
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Fuga
text: That divine Yato is the key to the Seal of Flames. Sumeragi once warned me...that if it fell into the wrong hands, it would lead to our world's destruction.

speaker: Corrin
text: I would never let that happen! This blade...it chose me. The Rainbow Sage told me it was my destiny to wield it. That with this Yato, I was fated to unlock the Seal of Flames and end this war.

speaker: Fuga
text: But are you truly worthy? I believe a test is in order. If you are unworthy of wielding the Yato, I will pry it from your dead hands!

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! But you just said that we could pass through here safely!

speaker: Fuga
text: You may—if what you say is true, and you truly mean to bring about peace. If not, the blade will fail you, and I shall take up its noble cause in your stead.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, wait! I don't want to fight you!

speaker: Leo
text: Don't worry, Corrin. Just show him what you're made of. This battle is no different than all the other ones we've fought and won.

speaker: Xander
text: You can do this. You're stronger now than I ever could have imagined. Your family is behind you all the way. Together, we shall prevail.

speaker: Fuga
text: Ho ho, what have we here? Two more wielders of legendary weapons! The glistening metal of Siegfried working alongside the ancient pages of Brynhildr... This fight will be the stuff of legends! Let me witness the power of those who align themselves with the Yato wielder. I will gather my best soldiers, including one nearly as skilled as myself... Hayato!

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmph. I'm right here, Fuga.

speaker: Corrin
text: A child? You expect me to clash blades with a cute little boy?!

speaker: Hayato
text: I am no child, fool. My name is Hayato. You should thank the gods you have the chance to face one as talented as I am.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, right. OK then. He sure is confident for someone so...diminutive. He looks shorter than Elise.

speaker: Hayato
text: What?! What does height have to do with anything? Foul beast! Fuga! We're not gonna let him/her get away with insulting our honor are we?!

speaker: Fuga
text: Ho ho ho. If you're that angry, then exact your revenge on the battlefield. You are the most talented mage in the entire village, young one. Unleash your power, and show these outsiders the Wind Tribe's might!

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmph, like I'm even capable of holding back.

speaker: Fuga
text: Prince/Princess Corrin, the time has come. We will be waiting outside the castle. Come find us when you are ready to meet your fate head-on.

speaker: Corrin
text: If this is how it must be, so be it.

speaker: Hayato
text: Let's get this over with. I have better things to do.

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmph! You're stronger...than you appear...

speaker: Fuga
text: Are you worthy to follow he/she who wields the legendary Yato? If so, prove it!

speaker: Hayato
text: So you're the one the divine Yato chose? Pfft. Laughable. I thought the chosen hero would be a warrior, but you're more bark than bite.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm being ridiculed...by a child. *sigh*. When Fuga told me I'd be battling someone as strong as he was...you're not exactly what I had in mind.

speaker: Hayato
text: I TOLD you I'm no child! Do not underestimate me, fool! Prepare to crumble beneath the weight of my magic!

speaker: Corrin
text: Do your worst, kid!

speaker: Fuga
text: The time has come, Corrin. Show me what you're made of. Prove to me and to yourself that you are worthy to wield the divine Yato!

speaker: Corrin
text: I used to wonder myself if I was worthy. But now that I stand before you... All of my doubts have fallen away upon the wind. Behold my power!

speaker: Fuga
text: You fought well, Corrin. As did your loyal allies. I see now you truly are worthy of wielding the Yato. The divine blade chose well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Do you truly believe that? ... Thank you. I'm...I'm so happy!

speaker: Hayato
text: Wah? Why are you smiling like that?! You look ridiculous!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm just so grateful to finally put my own doubts to rest. All this time, I've struggled with the question of whether or not I'm worthy... Whether or not I chose the right path... Whether I can truly use this divine blade to bring peace to the world...

speaker: Hayato
text: For our fated hero, he/she's so...humble. It's odd!

speaker: Fuga
text: Worry not, young prince/princess. Your power is beyond question, and your aim is true. No matter what path you walk or which kingdom you fight for... I am certain you will always make the right choice and use that blade for good.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Fuga.

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmph, fine. If Fuga accepts you as a hero, I suppose I must do the same.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Hayato. Glad to hear it.

speaker: Hayato
text: But know that the next time we meet on the battlefield, I won't lose. Divine blade or no divine blade, I won't tolerate a defeat! While you're off saving the world, I'm going to keep training. When this war is over, come face me again. If you have the guts, that is.

speaker: Corrin
text: Haha, I better end this war soon then. I don't need you getting any stronger!

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmph, you speak the truth. I look forward to our rematch. Good luck, Corrin. May the winds be ever at your back.

speaker: Fuga
text: Come, Corrin. I will show your people the way through our village.

speaker: Azura
text: Are you ready for this, Corrin? We'll arrive at the Hoshidan capital soon. The battles ahead will be our most difficult yet. Prepare yourself.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm ready. As ready as I'll ever be...

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, it took some doing, but we've finally arrived at Notre Sagesse. The ferry ride over was rather smooth too. Perhaps our luck is improving.

speaker: Silas
text: Perhaps. Although, I must admit, I can't shake this strange feeling I have...

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? Is something the matter?

speaker: Silas
text: Well, King Garon said this place would be overflowing with Hoshidans. And yet we were able to disembark from the ferry without so much as a scuffle.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's a good point. I was so happy that we arrived safely, it hadn't occurred to me.

speaker: Silas
text: As a matter of fact, I don't see any soldiers around here either. Not a single one. I can't help thinking this is either a trap or some big misunderstanding.

speaker: Corrin
text: We'll keep our eyes open. In the meantime, I must learn more about the Rainbow Sage. Let's talk to the locals. Maybe they can help solve these mysteries. Oi! You there! Pardon me, ma'am, but may I speak with you a moment?

speaker: Old Woman
text: Hm? Are you talking to me?

speaker: Corrin
text: I am. So sorry to bother you, but I was hoping you might be able to help me. To start, we had heard that the Hoshidan army was stationed here, but it seems...

speaker: Old Woman
text: Hoshidans? Yeah, there was a whole group of 'em around here not too long ago. They were armed up to their teeth. Didn't do us no harm, but they were a bit forceful. They took the Rainbow Sage, though. Said they was his new guards. Most of us thought that was a load o' horse dung, but who are we to argue?

speaker: Corrin
text: They kidnapped the Rainbow Sage?! Dastards! Do you happen to know where they took him?

speaker: Old Woman
text: Surely. They carted him up Mount Sagesse. It's right over there - ya can't miss it. You fellas ain't plannin' on goin' up there, are you? Cuz that's a fool's errand. There ain't nothin' but heartache up there. If ya like livin', you'd best stay down here.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Old Woman
text: Climbing that mountain is like the ultimate test o' grit and the like. Every now and then some kook tries to scale it. Most never make it back. Rumor has it, if you reach the summit and enter the Sevenfold Sanctuary... you die.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sevenfold Sanctuary... How mysterious.

speaker: Azura
text: What do you want to do, Corrin? It sounds like a trap.

speaker: Corrin
text: It does, but that can't be helped. There's no turning back now. If we fail this mission, I truly believe Father will have me killed. He's using these missions to test me, maybe even torment me. I mustn't falter. I must end this war at all costs, but I can't do that if I'm dead. If I'm to be tested here, so be it. I shall not fail.

speaker: Azura
text: I understand. If you insist on going, I won't try to stop you. I will follow you to the end.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura.

speaker: Old Woman
text: I don't know why you came here or why you wanna climb that thing, but good luck. Just try yer best not to croak, ya hear? It pains me every time some young wannabe hero dies tryin' to scale that mountain.

speaker: Corrin
text: I promise I shall return safely. Thank you for the valuable information, ma'am. You have our gratitude.

speaker: Corrin
text: *pant* *pant*  Phew! Climbing this thing really is a test. A test of endurance. Good gods, this is taking forever.

speaker: Camilla
text: Aww, my poor widdle Corrin. You look so exhausted! Why don't you have a little rest? You can ride my dragon for a bit.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's very sweet of you, Camilla. But I'll survive. Surely someone else could use the break more then myself.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, Corrin. Why are you so cute?! I want to hug you and never let you go! I'll never forgive those pesky Hoshidans for making you suffer like this. When we get to the top, I'll make sure they pay tenfold for the pain they've caused you!  ... Hmm? What might that be? I think I see something.

speaker: Corrin
text: Could it be... the Sevenfold Sanctuary?

speaker: Azura
text: It would appear so. This is where the battle truly begins. Stay on your guard. The place is likely filled with Hoshidan soldiers waiting to ambush.

speaker: Camilla
text: Don't worry, Corrin. This is nothing to fret over. I'm with you all the way, and so are the rest of us. And if your evil fake Hoshidan sisters are in there, all the better. I will not lose.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right - we must win no matter what, no matter who we find inside.

speaker: Kaze
text: Pardon the interruption, Lady Hinoka, but the Nohrian army has arrived.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What?! They actually climbed the mountain and lived to tell the tale? Their little ragtag team is more skilled then I gave them credit for. Still, there's no way they can best our troops after such an exhausting climb. We must keep the Rainbow Sage out of their grasp no matter what. Prepare for battle, everyone! This is NOT a drill!

speaker: Azama
text: Why must you resort to violence? I really do despise savages...

speaker: Azama
text: You have much strength... I am loath to do so, but I must retreat...

speaker: Setsuna
text: You made it all the way up here... Surprising...

speaker: Setsuna
text: I lost. Oh, well. Guess I'll retreat for now...

speaker: Rinkah
text: I am Rinkah, proud daughter of the Flame Tribe's chief. I will not allow you to capture the Rainbow Sage!

speaker: Rinkah
text: Why didn't... you kill me? Perhaps we were wrong about Nohr... No, it can't be! This way of peace must be... Corrin's path...

speaker: Kaze
text: I am Kaze, a ninja in the service of the Hoshidan royal family. But enough pleasantries... to battle!

speaker: Kaze
text: Such power... and determination... you are truly a worthy opponent. Perhaps the royal family was wrong about Nohrians...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I applaud you for making it this far, but your journey ends here. I will not allow you to take this territory OR the Rainbow Sage!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Forgive me, Hoshido... I just wasn't ... strong enough...

speaker: Azama
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, I presume? Lady Hinoka speaks of you often.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sh-she does?

speaker: Azama
text: She does. She said you are her "sweet little brother/sister". But I'm confused... Given her praises, I never expected to see you attacking a defenseless monk. You must have given in to the savagery so abundant in the Kingdom of Nohr. But if fate would have you cut me down, so be it. Do as you will, I am not afraid.

speaker: Setsuna
text: You're Lord/Lady Corrin, yes? I'm Setsuna... I'm Lady Hinoka's retainer... Nice to meet you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Polite even to the enemy... I'd expect nothing less from Hinoka's guardian.

speaker: Setsuna
text: Oh, are you the enemy? Even though you're her brother/sister? Huh.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um... yes. I mean, it's complicated. Did you really not know that?

speaker: Setsuna
text: Hm? No... Maybe? It doesn't really matter... Guess it's time for you to die now.

speaker: Rinkah
text: I don't wish to fight you, Corrin. But it seems I have no choice.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't want to fight you either. After all, I owe you my life. You took me back to Hoshido during my hour of need.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Well, you saved my life as well. If you hadn't intervened, King Garon would have killed me.

speaker: Corrin
text: I wish it didn't have to be this way, but I can't afford to back down. It's difficult to explain, but it's for the good of all. Please forgive me.

speaker: Rinkah
text: We understand each-other perfectly. Enough talk. Prepare yourself. I may owe you my life, but I don't have it in me to hold back!

speaker: Kaze
text: So we meet again, Lord/Lady Corrin. After our last encounter, I did not think we would battle again. But as an enemy of Hoshido, it is my duty to take you down. I respect you too much to hold back. I shall do all I can to vanquish you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand, and I shall do the same. Let's do this!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin! We meet at last!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka...so you're the one who took the Rainbow Sage.

speaker: Hinoka
text: You really are fighting for Nohr eh? I had to see it with my own eyes. You know, I spent so many years wishing that I could be near you. Now you're right in front of me, but we couldn't be further apart.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry it had to be this way. I know you wanted me to return to Hoshido and for us to be a family. It kills me to have caused you so much pain. It is a burden I shall always bear. However I... I...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I know. You needn't say another word. I also know you won't hold back. I can read your sad eyes like an open book. After all, though we hardly know each other, you're still my little brother/sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka....

speaker: Hinoka
text: If you're that determined to fight, then so be it. Let's see if all that resolve is enough to take down your own sister!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Azura?! Is that really you?

speaker: Azura
text: Hello, Hinoka.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Thank goodness you’re safe! I was so upset when I heard you were missing. I’m sorry we couldn’t stop those rogue soldiers from taking you away. You must have gone through a lot of pain and suffering, but it’s over now. Come on back to Hoshido with me, I’ll keep you safe from the Nohrians.

speaker: Azura
text: I’m sorry, Hinoka. I cannot return to Hoshido with you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What?! Why would you say that? Y-you’re not really siding with the Nohrians, are you? Say it isn’t so…

speaker: Azura
text: I am. I will never forget the kindness your family showed me… I bear you no ill will, but even so, I have chosen to fight alongside Corrin.

speaker: Hinoka
text: So you’re to betray us too? …So be it.

speaker: Camilla
text: Heh heh, I finally found you...

speaker: Hinoka
text: You! Aren't you Princess Camilla of Nohr?

speaker: Camilla
text: I am. And you are Princess Hinoka of Hoshido. Corrin's "real" sister.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes, I am. All I've wanted for as long as I can remember is to bring him/her home. I still feel the same way. The last thing I want is to fight him/her. Corrin belongs with us! Can't you see that?!

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh my, how wrong you are. My sweet brother/sister will never return to you. He/She knows who his/her true family is, and it's not the one he/she left in Hoshido. He/She chose Nohr. More specifically, he/she chose me over you. Deal with it.

speaker: Hinoka
text: You! Y-you'll pay for that!

speaker: Camilla
text: Now prepare to beg, Princess. My dear Corrin only needs one big sister! That's why you're the one person I simply can't lose to!

speaker: Camilla
text: We won! It's over, Hoshidans. Retreat while you still can. I'd hate to destroy such brave soldiers, but I will if I must.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Argh... w-we're out of options here... Everyone! Retreat, now! *sigh* Leave the dead behind, at least for now. There's no time to lose.

speaker: Rinkah
text: That won't be necessary. We suffered no casualties. Not one. Many of our soldiers are injured, but they'll recover, and they can all still walk.

speaker: Hinoka
text: What?! How is that possible? I don't understand... Corrin! What is the meaning of this? Was this your doing?

speaker: Corrin
text: Run, Hinoka. Why are you hesitating? GO!

speaker: Hinoka
text: ... Fine I'll retreat, for now. Before that devil you call a sister stabs me in the back. ... good-bye, my brother/sister.

speaker: Camilla
text: Aww, my little Corrin. You really are too kind for your own good. Telling us all not to kill any Hoshidans before we even entered the building... You certainly made things difficult on us, but it was a fun challenge at least! Are you certain we shouldn't chase after them? It's not too late to kill them all...

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Camilla. Let them go. We're blazing a new path for Nohr, one of mercy. There will be no pointless killing. That is the only way to end this war. OK, now that we've seized Notre Sagesse, all that's left is to find the Rainbow Sage.

speaker: Kaze
text: Is that true, Lord/Lady Corrin? Do you really mean to bring peace to this world?

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze?! What are you doing here? Why didn't you retreat with Hinoka and the others?

speaker: Kaze
text: I asked my question first. You said your path is one of peace, and that you seek to end the war. Is that true? if so, why did you choose to return to Nohr?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I spoke the truth. At first I returned because I couldn't bring myself to betray my Nohrian siblings. But I soon realized that being a Nohrian prince/princess granted me certain opportunities. As a Nohrian, I can change things from the inside, stop the death and destruction. Without me, the Nohrian army would keep slaughtering the Hoshidan army... and the Hoshidans would keep retaliating. A never-ending cycle of hate and death. Since I chose to side with Nohr, it's my responsibility to end that cycle.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Kaze. But if your intention is to take me to Hoshido, you're out of luck. I won't let anything come between me and my goal of bringing peace to this world.

speaker: Kaze
text: I see. I have only to look in your eyes to witness how determined you are. Yours is an admirable goal, milord/milady. As such, I request permission to join your ranks.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Kaze
text: Please forgive me for my past brashness. I should not have judged you so quickly. When you left Hoshido, I thought you had betrayed us. Like the others, I was certain that you meant to destroy Hoshido. I see now that I was horribly mistaken. Your reasons for siding with Nohr aren't just sound. They're actually quite pure. You have inspired me to hope for a peace I had long ago dismissed. Please allow me to lend my strength to your noble cause.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you for your kind words, Kaze. I would be happy to have you, but... You know the others will call you a traitor, right? Can you live with that?

speaker: Kaze
text: Words do not harm me, so long as I act with honor. I do not regret my decision.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's all I needed to hear. From now on, you're one of us. Welcome to the team, Kaze!

speaker: Kaze
text: Thank you, Lord/Lady Corrin. I shall serve you to the best of my ability.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't doubt it. Now to find the Rainbow Sage. He should be somewhere in this building...

speaker: Kaze
text: Of course. Allow me to show you the way to his quarters.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hmmmm...

speaker: Corrin
text: Um... pardon me, but are you the Rainbow Sage.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: I am the one you seek. You fought a trying battle to get here, young warrior with a heavy heart.

speaker: Corrin
text: I did... I heard you have the power to make me stronger than I am. Please, oh wise sage, would you consider blessing me with your strength?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hoo hoo hoo... Oh, you're a funny little dragon, aren't you? You have already gone through my trial, and so have already received my power. Does not your body feel lighter and stronger than when it first arrived?

speaker: Corrin
text: I was so distracted I hadn't really... but you're right. I suppose it does!

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: All who seek to find me must struggle through various trials to do so. It is amid that struggle that I witness and unlock their true power and potential. You did well, hero of darkness.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you so much! I can't wait to show Xander my new power.

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: There is one matter we must discuss, brave Corrin. You have in your possession the legendary Yato blade, do you not?

speaker: Corrin
text: How do you know that? And wait... How do you know my name?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hoo hoo hoo, how humorous. I know all that there is to know! I know all that you have done and all that you are still to do. But I won't spoil the ending. That's for you to discover. However, the fates will allow me to divulge one little tidbit to set you on your path... As wielder of the divine blade, it is you who will solve the mystery of the Seal of Flames. The Seal is the key to bringing an end to the hatred and war that soil these lands. Solve the mystery, and you will bring peace to this world at long last. So it shall pass.

speaker: Corrin
text: The Seal of Flames... Where do I start?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Your Yato is the key... that is your first clue. Unfortunately, it seems the Nohrian hero who would aid you is not present. That will change in the not-too-distant future. When the time comes, this will help you lead the way. Lift up your blade, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: As you wish, Sage...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: I, who forged the sacred blade... I, who committed the great sin... I, who wove the divine colors... I call on you now, Seal of Flames!

speaker: Corrin
text: What... just happened?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Nothing, yet. I merely awakened a seed that was already sown. When you enlist the help of another hero of Nohr, your blade will evolve. A blade fierce enough to guide us through the night... the Grim Yato.

speaker: Corrin
text: The Grim Yato... Once I've unlocked it, will I be able to find the Seal?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: The Grim Yato is a part of the Seal of Flames, though it is not it's final form. Perhaps one day you will meet your fate head-on and unlock the Seal's power. Perhaps... That is all I can say. Your path is an arduous one, but I believe in you. You'd better get going, young hero. The King is awaiting your return.

speaker: Corrin
text: What a success! We secured the territory and even found the Rainbow Sage. Let's hurry back to the castle and tell Father we completed his mission.

speaker: Iago
text: Heh heh, not so fast, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Iago?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Iago
text: I am still at the castle, foolish prince/princess. What you see is merely an illusion. King Garon has tasked me with informing you of his latest command.

speaker: Corrin
text: Another command? Already?

speaker: Iago
text: Aren't you lucky? If it were up to me, you would be dead and buried. King Garon doesn't wish for our enemies to obtain the Rainbow Sage's strength. So it is now your illustrious privilege to carry out his will by killing the sage.

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you insane?! I can't do that! I won't! The Rainbow Sage is a force for good. I will not repay his kindness with death. And the Hoshidan high prince, Ryoma, has already received his power. It's too late to prevent it. To kill the Sage now would not only be cruel but pointless.

speaker: Iago
text: I'm afraid an order is an order, Lord/Lady Corrin. As you well know by now, to disobey a direct order from the King is treason. Not even your meddling siblings could save you if you disobey once more. If you value your life, I would rethink your refusal.

speaker: Corrin
text: You dastard! I won't do it! I won't...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Worry not, young hero. All things must pass.

speaker: Iago
text: What the?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Sage! You heard all that?

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Hoo hoo, you never cease to amuse. As I said, I know all there is to know. I am grateful that you chose to protect me, even at the risk of your own life. But now it is my turn to protect you. My time has finally come. I am ready.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wh-what are you saying? You can't mean...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: I am older than you can fathom. My time to pass into the next world is long overdue. When higher beings like myself stay in this realm too long, we eventually go insane. My power is too great to allow that, as I might even destroy this world I so love. I've known for some time now I must die soon. But not until I gave you my strength. Now that my work is done, so too is my time here.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, no! You don't have to do this! I'll find a way to convince Father that...

speaker: Rainbow Sage
text: Thank you for your kindness, Corrin. That kindness may just save this world. Never forget that life is the most precious gift of all. Protect it. Cherish it. And weather your path is bathed in light... or in the gentle veil of darkness... Allow yourself to be happy. This is such a lovely world... Don't take it for granted. Do this, and your soul shall give hope to the future, brave prince/princess... Do this, and it will shine brightly with all the colors... of the... ... ...

speaker: Corrin
text: Sage? SAGE!!! Please don't do this... Don't die... Gods, no... NOOO!!!

speaker: Iago
text: Hmph. You and your loopholes. Well, I suppose dead is dead. You technically fulfilled King Garon’s order. You sneaky little rat…

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Sage... I should have found a way to stop this. I chose this path to bring peace to the world. To stop the senseless death... Yet here I am again, powerless to save an innocent life. I failed you, Rainbow Sage... Forgive me...

speaker: Corrin
text: The road ahead seems heavily forested. Is that where we're going?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. It is dense, but there's a path that leads to the Bottomless Canyon. This whole area is the domain of Mokushu, another independent nation. If we encounter any of its citizens, they should be friendly, but... We would be wise to remember how Nohr compromised Izumo before we arrived.

speaker: Kaze
text: I wouldn't worry about Nohr strong-arming Mokushu, milady. The locals are well known for their proficiency in the martial arts. Many great ninja have sharpened their craft here. No, it's likely that Nohr's strategists would have tried to avoid this area. Even if it meant taking the long route.

speaker: Azura
text: And we haven't heard about any battles in the area—another good sign.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Let's proceed.

speaker: Zola
text: Boo! Betcha didn't expect to see me here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Zola! You've been following us! You're massively outnumbered, so you can't possibly be in search of a fight.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Relax, Corrin. He probably just came back to offer me a chance to cut him. Wasn't that thoughtful of him.

speaker: Zola
text: No! Please! I'm defeated. I did not show up here to challenge all of you by myself. I came here to surrender...and to seek amnesty.

speaker: Corrin
text: And why should we trust you?

speaker: Zola
text: Well, to be honest...you shouldn't. I tried to kill you. But you saw what Lord Leo was about to do to me. I can no longer return to Nohr. I am exiled. Without the backing of an army, I am of little danger to you. But maybe I could be of some assistance...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! Surely you can't be considering his proposal?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Can I cut him yet?

speaker: Zola
text: Eeeek! Stay away from me, please!

speaker: Corrin
text: I think we should bring him with us.

speaker: Zola
text: Wait, really?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, really, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. As he said, he's of little danger to us by himself. And he may prove to have some value. Lastly, it is not the Hoshidan way to turn one's back on the helpless.

speaker: Azura
text: You have a kind heart, Corrin. Perhaps too kind.

speaker: Zola
text: Oh, thank you, Prince/Princess Corrin! I can't believe I let King Garon convince me that you deserved to die. What you've done here today shows your true character—that of a brave leader!

speaker: Corrin
text: You're overreacting, Zola. And please remember... If any of us catch you doing ANYTHING suspicious... I WILL allow Hinoka to cut you down.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'll always be standing by, knife at the ready, Corrin. So don't even think about doing anything stupid. You got that?

speaker: Zola
text: Yes, milady!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ahh. This forest air is refreshing. And I have to say. I'm enjoying this path a fair bit more than the Eternal Stairway... Are we getting anywhere close to the Bottomless Canyon, Sakura?

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes, I believe so. *sigh*

speaker: Corrin
text: What's the matter? Are you getting tired?

speaker: Sakura
text: No... I was just th-thinking about Ryoma and Takumi... Sometimes I forget that they're missing, and then when I remember... It's like a wound is freshly opened.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know the feeling. But please try to stay positive. Worrying about it isn't going to do anything but drive you crazy.

speaker: Sakura
text: You're right. I'll do my best!

speaker: Corrin
text: That's the spirit. Whoa... Watch out!

speaker: Sakura
text: Ahhh!

speaker: Corrin
text: A shuriken?! Get down, everyone!

speaker: Kaze
text: This belongs to a Mokushu ninja.

speaker: Azura
text: I sense the presence of many... I believe we're surrounded, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Blast! So much for Nohr staying away from Mokushu.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm not sure we're dealing with Nohr...

speaker: Zola
text: I think she's right. I know that Nohr wants no fight with the kingdom of Mokushu.

speaker: Hinoka
text: How convenient. Come here, runt.

speaker: Zola
text: Awwk! Please remove that blade from my throat!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Not until you tell us what's going on.

speaker: Zola
text: Gah! Your guess is as good as mine! Perhaps Nohr has made an alliance with Mokushu.

speaker: Kotaro
text: The deformed one is correct. Our kingdom has made an arrangement with Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: Who are you?

speaker: Kotaro
text: I am Kotaro, daimyo of Mokushu.

speaker: Corrin
text: And what is your quarrel with us, Daimyo Kotaro? We merely seek passage through your territory.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. Our understanding was that Mokushu is an independent nation. Yet you are now beholden to Nohr?

speaker: Kotaro
text: Beholden? Pah! Mokushu is beholden to no nation. Our interests simply happen to line up with those of Nohr for the time being. Once Hoshido is defeated, King Garon will grant us considerable new territory. We've long been waiting for the chance to expand. And this war is the perfect opportunity.

speaker: Corrin
text: So you're a war profiteer. How noble.

speaker: Kaze
text: Gods. The famous daimyo of Mokushu turns out to be a scheming politician. I don't even have words for how disappointing that is.

speaker: Kotaro
text: And even if you did, it wouldn't make a difference. Grow up, foolish Hoshidans. Only the ambitious prosper in this world.

speaker: Azura
text: It was careless of us not to think of this possibility.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Indeed! Now that I have you all in one place, I can end the war today. I look forward to building a castle on the smoking ruins where Hoshido once stood.

speaker: Corrin
text: Go on, keep talking. I'll savor making you eat those words.

speaker: Corrin
text: Great, what now? Wait...is that who I think it is?

speaker: Takumi
text: Ungh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! Over here!

speaker: Sakura
text: Brother!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'm so happy to see you again, Brother!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Gah! What's wrong with you? That arrow almost hit me!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi, what are you doing?!

speaker: Takumi
text: Kill...

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...

speaker: Takumi
text: I should have been the chosen one...

speaker: Hinoka
text: This is creepy...

speaker: Sakura
text: *sob* Takumi... What h-happened to you?

speaker: Takumi
text: I am ignored...alone...forgotten. But I am more powerful than they can imagine!

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you saying? Snap out of it, Takumi!

speaker: Takumi
text: Ughhhh... I will not stand in the shadows any longer... They will all see me for the first time! I will make them pay for what they've done. I will make them...I will make them... DIE!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi?!

speaker: Takumi
text: Unnnhhh...

speaker: Azura
text: Look at the color of his eyes... Could it be? There's only one way to find out. I'll have to sing to him...

speaker: Takumi
text: No one...notices me. No one...cares. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die.

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi...listen to me.

speaker: Takumi
text: You... You are...

speaker: Azura
text: It doesn't matter. I'm someone who can help. You're being controlled by a dark force. This is not who you are! You don't have to give in. You can survive this! Listen carefully...

speaker: Takumi
text: Ugh... Gyaaaaah!

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi, can you hear me now?

speaker: Takumi
text: Ohhhh... Azura? Is that you?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, it's me! Oh, thank goodness.

speaker: Takumi
text: Uh...where am I?

speaker: Azura
text: Unfortunately, we're right in the middle of a battle. I don't really have time to explain. Are you in any condition to defend yourself?

speaker: Takumi
text: I...I think so. I feel OK.

speaker: Azura
text: Very well. Just remember.. You're strong and intelligent. There's a certain something about you. I believe in you, Takumi.

speaker: Takumi
text: Um, OK...

speaker: Azura
text: That's the Takumi I remember. Now, come on! You'll need to focus to make it through this battle.

speaker: Takumi
text: Wait! Azura! Ugh, I'm still a bit woozy. So many questions... I guess I'll just have to stay alive to get them answered.

speaker: Takumi
text: Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die...

speaker: Kotaro
text: Thank you SO much for walking right into my domain. Perhaps I'll name one of the latrines in my new castle in your honor.

speaker: Saizo
text: Kotaro of Mokushu...you will now answer to me.

speaker: Kotaro
text: I answer to no one. Who are you to suggest otherwise?

speaker: Saizo
text: I am Saizo the Fifth, servant to the Hoshidan royal family.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Saizo...that's familiar. I believe I've murdered others of your pitiful lineage.

speaker: Saizo
text: You—! How dare you! My father was an honorable man.

speaker: Kotaro
text: Honorable? Maybe. Weak? Definitely. That balding old fool had the audacity to lecture ME! So naturally...I put an end to his life.

speaker: Saizo
text: I knew you were the one responsible for his death. Coward!

speaker: Kotaro
text: Bwahaha! Isn't this a stroke of luck? To fell both father and son with the same blade... How poetic!

speaker: Saizo
text: I'm about to rewrite your poem...

speaker: Kotaro
text: Please. If you're anything like your father, you won't land a single blow!

speaker: Saizo
