text: How's that? Did I land a single blow?

speaker: Kotaro
text: Ugh... *cough* *cough* *gurgle*

speaker: Saizo
text: Fitting. Father, you are avenged.

speaker: Takumi
text: Unhh... I am invisible...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! TAKUMI! He's still not responsive. I don't want to attack him, but... What should we do?

speaker: Takumi
text: Ughhh...

speaker: Azura
text: I have an idea, Corrin. But I'll need to get close to him.

speaker: Corrin
text: All right. Just be careful. Who knows what he's capable of in this state.

speaker: Takumi
text: What... are you...

speaker: Azura
text: It doesn't matter. I'm someone who can help. Listen carefully!

speaker: Takumi
text: Ugh... Gyaaaaah!

speaker: Azura
text: Takumi! Can you hear me?

speaker: Takumi
text: Ugh... Oh, man... What's going on? Why is everyone looking at me?

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! You're back!

speaker: Sakura
text: Brother! I'm so glad you're back to normal. We were all so w-worried about you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah. Don't ever do that again, OK?

speaker: Takumi
text: Whoa, guys! Stop crying. You're making me all embarrassed.

speaker: Sakura
text: I don't care. We didn't know if we'd ever see you again. And then when you showed up all weird like that...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah. We didn't know if you'd ever be the same Takumi we know and love again.

speaker: Takumi
text: Well, it's definitely me guys. Thank you for your concern. And I'm sorry I made you all worried.

speaker: Hinata
text: Phew! I'm glad Lord Takumi is safe and sound after all. It wasn't looking good for us for a while there...

speaker: Oboro
text: Lord Takumi! Now that you're back, we'll never let anything happen to you again!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's good to have you back, Takumi. But as much as I would like to savor this moment. Ryoma is still missing. Can you tell us anything about what happened to you two?

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah. It was insane. We ran into Nohrian troops just outside Izumo and began fighting. Ryoma and I were separated in the early stages of combat, before we had to retreat. We were outnumbered...and pushed to the brink of the Bottomless Canyon.

speaker: Corrin
text: So we still have no idea where he is...

speaker: Takumi
text: No, I'm afraid not. Something triggered a massive landslide, and I was caught up in it. That's how I fell into the canyon.

speaker: Corrin
text: You actually fell into the Bottomless Canyon? How are you still alive?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I've never heard of anyone returning from there before.

speaker: Takumi
text: I...I have no idea. All I remember is falling. There was a period of darkness, and then I woke up here.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Well, I'm just glad to have you back. It's a miracle you survived a fall like that!

speaker: Takumi
text: So, um, can anyone tell me how I ended up here? Or what, exactly, I was doing before I woke up just no?

speaker: Azura
text: It's best you don't worry about it for now. Just get some rest.

speaker: Takumi
text: No, I need to know. My Fujin Yumi was in my hand when I came to. And some of you have wounds in your backs...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Well...

speaker: Takumi
text: Tell me! What did I do?

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi...you must have been under some sort of spell. You stumbled out of the woods and started attacking our party. Please, try not to worry about it. We know it wasn't really you.

speaker: Takumi
text: Oh, what have I done? A prince attacking his own men? How can I show my face in Hoshido again?

speaker: Corrin
text: Please! Someone...or something...was controlling you. We know you were not in your right mind.

speaker: Takumi
text: That's small comfort right now, I'm afraid.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I'm sorry you feel that way, but all that matters now is that we're all here. Will you join us in the search for Ryoma? Perhaps something along the way will jog your memory. Can we count on you?

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes. If you can forgive me for all the hurtful things I've said and done.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course. We must move forward—not dwell on the past.

speaker: Takumi
text: Thank you, Corrin. I also need to thank you...Sister.

speaker: Azura
text: Oh! You called me— I mean...you're quite welcome, Takumi. Ahem... *cough* *cough*

speaker: Corrin
text: Is everything OK, Azura? You don't look well.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm fine. I think I'm just a bit tired. Please, don't worry about me. I'll be better in no time.

speaker: Corrin
text: If you say so.

speaker: Kaze
text: Excuse me, everyone. I have more good news. Our forces rescued Kagero from an underground prison nearby. Welcome back, Kagero.

speaker: Kagero
text: Hello, everyone. Good day, milady.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Welcome back! Are you all right? Do you know what happened to Ryoma?

speaker: Kagero
text: Yes. But I'm afraid—

speaker: Hinoka
text: No! Ryoma could not have fallen to the Nohr army. It isn't possible!

speaker: Sakura
text: No! Brother... *sob* *sob*

speaker: Takumi
text: I can't believe he's gone...

speaker: Hinoka
text: We will build a monument to his glory when we return home...

speaker: Kagero
text: Please, if you would allow me to continue. Lord Ryoma is still alive, as far as I know.

speaker: Hinoka
text: But? You said you were afraid of something.

speaker: Kagero
text: I was going to say I'm afraid I don't know exactly where he is. After being separated from Lord Takumi, Lord Ryoma met with a Hoshidan scout. The scout informed him of a new civil strife in Nohr. Ryoma departed at once in the direction of Cheve.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Cheve...so he's on his way to Nohr right now!

speaker: Kagero
text: I can only assume so. I was given the order to return to Hoshido and report this information... But I was careless while traveling through Mokushu and ended up being caught. I must apologize to everyone for such shameful conduct.

speaker: Hinoka
text: It's OK. We're just glad to see you alive. And knowing that Ryoma is still out there is valuable information to have.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. But we should depart quickly if we hope to catch up to him. Corrin, this may mean returning all the way to Nohr. Are you ready to do that?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Kaze
text: If we travel by sea, it will be faster. We should head to the nearest port town. And even though Kotaro is defeated we should take care. There will surely be other ninja who share his ambition, lying in wait...

speaker: Kagero
text: Yes, that sounds wise. I've also dispatched another ally back to Hoshido. He will warn everyone to avoid this area for the time being. I expect he'll reach Hoshido and inform Yukimura within half a day or so. Lord/Lady Corrin, would you permit me to join you? I feel I must make up for my previous shortcomings.

speaker: Corrin
text: You owe nothing, but we would be more than happy to have you. Everyone—the sooner we find Ryoma, the sooner we can end this war.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Ah, you’re awake. Sorry about that bump on your head.

speaker: Corrin
text: It’s you! From the Flame Tribe, right? Where are we?

speaker: Rinkah
text: Yes, I am Rinkah. This is a Flame Tribe village within Hoshido’s territory. I’m going to hand you over to the Hoshidan authorities.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. I suppose they’ll want to hear an explanation for the unprovoked attack. And then they’ll probably execute me.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Heh. I don’t think so.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods…they’re here already, aren’t they?

speaker: Rinkah
text: Yes. It’s time to go.

speaker: Corrin
text: We meet again. Kaze, right?

speaker: Kaze
text: Yes. I’m glad we found you, Prince/Princess Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: You are? Wait, am I missing something?

speaker: Kaze
text: Please come with me. All will be explained.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Welcome back, Kaze. Good work.

speaker: Kaze
text: Thank you, Lord Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: Did…did you just say Lord Ryoma?

speaker: Rinkah
text: Yes, this is the high prince of Hoshido, Lord Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hmm…

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you waiting for? If you’re going to execute me, please get on with it.

speaker: Mikoto
text: I cannot believe it is really you…

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m sorry, do we know each other?

speaker: Mikoto
text: Oh, I’ve missed you so much! Come here, Corrin, my sweet child!

speaker: Corrin
text: Your sweet child?! What are you talking about? That’s not possible…

speaker: Mikoto
text: Oh, my poor Corrin. It’s a sad story. When you were very young, you were abducted by forces from Nohr. I am your mother, Mikoto. All this time, I didn’t know if I’d ever see you again!

speaker: Corrin
text: But King Garon is my father! None of what you’re saying makes sense.

speaker: Ryoma
text: It must be quite a shock, but I assure you that she speaks the truth. I am your elder brother, Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, no, no… Xander is my older brother! Leo, Elise, and Camilla are my siblings…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Are those the Nohrian royals? They’re not your real family. I still remember the day you were taken. In those days, there was tension between Hoshido and Nohr, but no full-blown war. Not until King Garon lured King Sumeragi-our father-to Cheve under false pretenses. He said it was for a peace conference. Ha! His real plan was to murder our father in cold blood. And to make matters even worse…he kidnapped you.

speaker: Corrin
text: No. That’s just not possible…

speaker: Ryoma
text: You really don’t remember any of this? Not even a single memory?

speaker: Corrin
text: No. Honestly, I have only the vaguest memories from my early childhood…

speaker: Corrin
text: These are times when I can sense something beneath the surface… A blurry image. Like a stone at the bottom of a lake, shimmering and ethereal. But that’s it. Nothing of substance.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Well, I can’t imagine the Nohrian royals would share much of the past with you. I know this is a lot to take in.

speaker: Hoshidan
text: Lord Ryoma! I have an urgent message. We’re under attack from the north!

speaker: Ryoma
text: No! Hinoka and Sakura are in that area right now!

speaker: Hoshidan
text: Yes, milord. I’ve been told that they’re working to help evacuate the villagers.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Very well. We’ll need to provide support. I’ll leave immediately. Corrin, will you come with me? I want you to see the truth with your own eyes.

speaker: Sakura
text: Sorry I’m slowing us down. Of all the times to sprain an ankle…

speaker: Hinoka
text: Don’t worried about it, Sis. We’ll be OK. These stupid beasts don’t stand a chance against me.

speaker: Sakura
text: I hope you’re right…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Take a look around, Corrin. This is a treacherous region for battle. It’s important to scout ahead and look for any troublesome areas.

speaker: Rinkah
text: Hm? That village… Not everyone has evacuated yet. We should warn them to stay out of harm’s way!

speaker: Kaze
text: I hope it doesn’t come to this, but I’ve brought some Vulnerary for you. Please use it as necessary, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, thank you, kind warrior! Everyone in our village is so grateful. Please, take this. Good luck!

speaker: Rinkah
text: Did you see that? The entire hill just disintegrated! Is that the power of a Dragon Vein? I had no idea…

speaker: Kaze
text: To harness the ancient dragon powers is truly a magnificent gift. Yet I wonder if even the royals who wield that power can fully control it… Still, strategically using Dragon Veins could be the key to this rescue.

speaker: Ryoma
text: When you are in command, you can lead your allies in battle. Or, you can allow them to engage the enemy as they see fit. Just be careful to never let your guard down!

speaker: Corrin
text: I think I see someone over there. It might be the princesses. We should get close and try to speak to one of them.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey, are you all right? We’re here to help.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah, we’re fine. Who are you? I thought I knew most of my brother’s troops. Anyway, I appreciate the help, but it’s really not necessary. It takes more than a few dozen 800-pound monsters to bring me down!

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I’m glad you’re feeling confident. Just know that we’ve got your back.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hey, wait a second!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I didn’t mean to be dismissive. Thank you for coming all the way out here. I owe you one…so take this. You can use it in a pinch to heal your wounds. Now really, don’t worry about me. I’m at my best in situations like this!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you. I’ll use this wisely.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hey, you never did tell me your name.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, sorry. I’m Corrin. Nice to meet you.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin? Corrin?! This can’t be a coincidence!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey! Are you OK? We’re here to help.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh! Th-thank you so much. Yes, we’re OK…for n-now.

speaker: Corrin
text: Excellent. I think we have things under control at the moment. But please stay back for the time bring. We’ll take care of the rest of the monsters.

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes, of c-course. Oh. I didn’t even get a chance to ask his/her name…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hold strong, Sisters! I’m coming for you!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Do your worst, monsters. I promise I can be meaner than you!

speaker: Sakura
text: I’m not scared of these things…as long as Hinoka is close by!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ugh! I lost to that... THING.

speaker: Sakura
text: Hinoka! You've taken too much damage. Please, you must retreat!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Never! Urk... Well, maybe just this once...

speaker: Corrin
text: I wasn't prepared for this! I'm sorry, I can't go on...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin, no! How could I let this happen...

speaker: Sakura
text: No! *sob*

speaker: Hinoka
text: Sakura, get out of here! You can't possibly go on!

speaker: Sakura
text: You're right. I'm sorry, Hinoka...

speaker: Sakura
text: Thank you so much for coming to our aid. Those monsters would have caused more damage if you hadn’t come. I have to ask, though… Who are you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, my name is-

speaker: Hinoka
text: His/Her name is Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Er, yes. Nice to meet you properly.

speaker: Sakura
text: Hinoka? Are you OK?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Finally…after all these years… I…I’ve missed you so much.

speaker: Hinoka
text: S-sorry…

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh! Um…

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hinoka was so attached to you when you were little, Corrin. When you were taken from us, she cried for months. One day she stopped crying and pick up the naginata. And I will say…if you ever find yourself facing business end of her weapon… …you will soon be filled with major regrets about your life decisions. She vowed to bring you back to us someday… And now here you are.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I’m sorry, Corrin. I’m not usually this emotional. But I’m just so happy to have you back. Take that, Nohrian scumbags! We win, you lose!

speaker: Sakura
text: Wait…is this really Corrin?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. I know it’s big news. I’ll fill you in on the whole story later. For now we should return to the castle before Nohr deploys more monsters. Everyone, let’s head home!

speaker: Corrin
text: What are those things, anyway?

speaker: Ryoma
text: They’re known as the Faceless. Creature with no will of their own. Created by Nohrian mages.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I call ’em dead meat. But they’re the only thing Nohr can throw at us right now. Our mother, Queen Mikoto, put up a magical barrier around our kingdom. Regular enemy soldiers find themselves without the will to fight upon crossing it. So long as Mother is able to keep the barrier up, Nohr can’t invade Hoshido.

speaker: Ryoma
text: That’s why Nohr sends those…things. They have no souls-no will of their own.That’s why they are able to penetrate the barrier and terrorize our borders.

speaker: Corrin
text: But…the Nohrians wouldn’t send monsters to terrorize innocent people…

speaker: Hinoka
text: Of course they would. They’re pure evil. Sometimes the Faceless even turn on the mages who created them. But the Nohrians don’t care. They’re willing to sacrifice their own just to hurt others. I’ll never forgive them for that, or for stealing you away. They’ll pay for all the suffering they’ve caused!

speaker: Corrin
text: I can’t believe it…

speaker: Mikoto
text: Welcome back, Corrin! This is your old room.

speaker: Corrin
text: And what’s this?

speaker: Mikoto
text: Oh! That’s a picture you drew when you were a little boy/girl. This is your father, this is me, and that’s you. It’s so cute!

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh*

speaker: Mikoto
text: We couldn’t bear to touch a thing in this room after you were taken. If we put your things away, it would have felt like giving up. You’ve grown so much. I can’t believe how handsome/beautiful you are!

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m afraid I still don’t remember anything.

speaker: Mikoto
text: Oh?

speaker: Corrin
text: I…I just don’t know how to respond to your stories. I do believe I could be your child… But everyone here simply feels like a stranger to me.

speaker: Mikoto
text: I understand, Corrin. Please don’t worry about it.

speaker: Corrin
text: I’m so sorry. Here you are, maybe my real mother, and I don’t feel anything…

speaker: Mikoto
text: Please. It makes sense. You spent your whole childhood in Nohr. I’m sure you were quite sheltered. You will need time to think all of this through and search your soul. But I hope that someday we can be a family again.

speaker: Mikoto
text: For now, please make yourself comfortable. Explore the castle, or stroll the grounds outside. You’ll be safe here.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can’t stop thinking about Xander. Or about Camilla, Leo, and Elise…

speaker: Corrin
text: Hm? What a beautiful song…

speaker: Azura
text: Yet the waters ever change, flowing like time. The path is yours to climb.

speaker: Corrin
text: Er, hello. I’m sorry to bother you. I just got lost in your singing. There is something about that song captivated me…

speaker: Azura
text: You must be Prince/Princess Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. And you are?

speaker: Azura
text: I’m Azura. A former princess of Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: Former? I don’t understand. If that were true, surely I would have heard of you. I grew up with the Nohrian royal family…

speaker: Azura
text: I’m afraid I’ve been here a long time. After you were taken by the Nohrians, the Hoshidan forces retaliated. They tried desperately to get you back, but they failed again and again. However, I wasn’t as heavily guarded. Hoshidan ninja easily kidnapped me. I suppose we’ve both been hostages for most of our lives…

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods…I’m so sorry.

speaker: Azura
text: No, it’s OK. I may technically be a hostage, but I’ve lived a happy life. The people of Hoshido have accepted me as one of their own. Even Queen Mikoto herself treats me as if I were her daughter.

speaker: Corrin
text: Does she? Hmm…

speaker: Azura
text: Did something happen between you and Queen Mikoto?

speaker: Corrin
text: No. I just don’t know what to do. She seems perfectly lovely, but I don’t feel any connection to her. But she loves me. And so do all my blood siblings-who I’ve just met.

speaker: Azura
text: I understand. If I were to return to Nohr, I suspect I’d feel the same way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Do you think you could start over there? Live a new life among strangers?

speaker: Azura
text: No. Given a choice, I would prefer to stay here in Hoshido. Queen Mikoto is a peace-loving ruler. King Garon is not.

speaker: Azura
text: So, Corrin…what are you going to do?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don’t know. For now, I’m just going to spend some time thinking.

speaker: Elise
text: All right...the throne room is just upstairs from here.

speaker: Corrin
text: Understood. Wait. Someone's coming down.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh!

speaker: Iago
text: Well, well...look who's still alive! You're just full of surprises, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm through playing games, Iago. Let's just do this.

speaker: Iago
text: Not so fast! Lady Elise, I'm here for you! Why don't you come over here, and I'll protect you.

speaker: Elise
text: Why would I ever listen to YOU! You tried to make Xander and Leo fight Corrin! And you've tried to kill him/her, like, five times already!

speaker: Corrin
text: Save your breath, Elise. This guy never listens to reason. He doesn't care about right or wrong. He's just looking out for himself. I think it's time we taught him a lesson he'll never forget.

speaker: Iago
text: Ooh, such big words. Hoshidan prince/princess! But you are right... I don't care about what's right or wrong. That's why I always get my way. I'm willing to do what's necessary. Like THIS!

speaker: Azura
text: AHHH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi! What are you doing?

speaker: Takumi
text: Die die die die die...

speaker: Azura
text: Urk...you're...hurting me! Why...

speaker: Corrin
text: What's wrong with you? Stop hurting her!

speaker: Iago
text: *sigh* I just knew this would be too much for your feeble mind to understand... And I need you to comprehend the totality of your defeat. Otherwise I can't properly enjoy myself, you see? Very well, let me explain. Prince Takumi has been on our side all along! Thanks to him, I've known your whereabouts every step of the way.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're lying. How could that be possible? Takumi, tell me this is a joke!

speaker: Iago
text: Bwahaha! How does it feel? Being stabbed in the back again and again? And to think of all that time you spent looking for poor little Takumi...

speaker: Corrin
text: There's no way Takumi would betray us of his own free will. He must still be possessed!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, please. Of course he's possessed. But the spell wouldn't work without a kernel of dissatisfaction in his soul. He's always felt like an afterthought in the royal family. He has quite the inferiority complex. He desperately wants to prove himself. That's how he survived. His hatred kept him going so he could deceive you all! Now it's his turn to shine. Mwahahaha! He's deliciously evil, is he not? Better hurry up and kill him... before he kills Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: There's got to be a better way... Takumi, listen! What happened in the Bottomless Canyon? What made you this way?

speaker: Takumi
text: Nnngh...

speaker: Azura
text: I can fix this... Just need to sing my song...

speaker: Azura
text: Aieeee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, I'm so glad I'm getting to see this all in person for once. It's quite a show! I wonder how it will end...

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi...you've got to listen to me.

speaker: Iago
text: Are you really just going to let him kill Azura like this? What are you waiting for? Kill Takumi! And then see how Ryoma reacts. Oh ho ho!

speaker: Corrin
text: I believe in you, Takumi. I know the real you is still in there.

speaker: Takumi
text: Nnngh...Brother/Sister...

speaker: Iago
text: What?!

speaker: Azura
text: Now's my chance... You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

speaker: Iago
text: No! Shut up!

speaker: Sakura
text: Haaah!

speaker: Iago
text: Gwaahhh...

speaker: Sakura
text: I w-won't let you interrupt her!

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura! Thank you!

speaker: Iago
text: You will pay for that bit of sass, young lady. I didn't want to get my hands dirty, but I suppose it can't be avoided.

speaker: Sakura
text: Eeeee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leave her out of this, Iago!

speaker: Takumi
text: *cough* *cough* It's OK, everyone... I'm myself again. Thank you, Azura.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes! I knew you'd snap out of it!

speaker: Takumi
text: Thank you for believing in me, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course.

speaker: Iago
text: What just happened?

speaker: Takumi
text: I just woke up for good. That's what happened. You were able to exploit some of my deepest fears and flaws, but that's over. My brothers and sisters need me, and I won't let them down. I'm a proud prince of Hoshido, and from now on I will live up to the title!

speaker: Iago
text: How disappointing.

speaker: Corrin
text: This is it for you, Iago. You're on the wrong side of history. Peace is coming, and you can't stand in its way any longer. WE WILL GRIND YOU TO DUST!

speaker: Iago
text: You poor fool. Doing Corrin's dirty work for him/her...

speaker: Iago
text: Save me...King Garon...

speaker: Iago
text: You're like a rather pesky cockroach, you know that? Just when I think I've got you under my foot, you scamper away.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sure. Just keep talking. It's what you do best. I'm through talking.

speaker: Iago
text: Well, then! I'll save the rest of my clever analogies for another time... And kill you right now. HAAH!

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes! I was hoping I'd get a chance to kill you myself. This is for everything you've put me through!

speaker: Iago
text: *yawn* You know I chose you because you were the weakest, right? You should never have come out of that spell—now you're going to suffer!

speaker: Takumi
text: Wrong! Now that my head is clear, my aim is truer than ever. I'm going to turn your face into my own personal bull's-eye.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're finished, Iago.

speaker: Iago
text: Awk! No...I don't want to die! Please...listen! I was under a spell the whole time. This is all King Garon's fault! I would never have done all those things to you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sure.

speaker: Iago
text: Won't somebody save me? King Garon is the evil behind all of this. I've been used! Have mercy on me!
Pathetic. I've never seen someone face their own death with less dignity. For that, and for all of your cruelty, you're a disgrace to Nohr!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: Any last words, Iago?

speaker: Iago
text: Lord Leo! I throw myself upon your mercy. You're here to save me, right?

speaker: Leo
text: Weren't you listening just now? I am not your ally, you monster. I won't allow you to sully our kingdom a moment longer!

speaker: Iago
text: B-but, milord...

speaker: Leo
text: Just stop talking. I'll put you out of your misery.

speaker: Iago
text: Please, I beg you!

speaker: Leo
text: Die!

speaker: Iago
text: Gyah!

speaker: Leo
text: Good riddance.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo. Have you come to join us? We're about to confront King Garon.

speaker: Leo
text: Not exactly. I have had a moment of enlightenment, and I believe you are on the side of justice. However, I'm still a Nohrian prince, and King Garon is still my father. I won't stop you, but I cannot assist you further.

speaker: Corrin
text: I understand. Even though I now know we're not related, I still think of you as my brother.

speaker: Leo
text: Thank you, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Also, I meant to tell you earlier, but... No, wait. Never mind.

speaker: Leo
text: What? What is it? You can't tease me like that!

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* Your collar is inside out again.

speaker: Leo
text: DAMN IT. Why didn't you tell me before?

speaker: Corrin
text: Sorry, I didn't want to interrupt your moment with Iago. You really took charge there!

speaker: Leo
text: Well...thank you. I guess.

speaker: Elise
text: Don't worry, Leo! You still looked super cool!

speaker: Leo
text: Elise! What are you doing here?

speaker: Elise
text: I'm here to try and talk Xander and Father into listening to Corrin. I can't stand watching our family self-destruct anymore!

speaker: Leo
text: I see. Well, I'm not sure Xander or Father are in the mood for chatting... You should go wait this out in that secret passage Camilla thinks I don't know about.

speaker: Elise
text: You know about that?! Ugh, of course you do. Nothing gets past you. But it doesn't matter. I have to do this! I'm the only one who has a chance of making them drop their guard and listen. I can't just sit by and do nothing while everyone I love tries to kill each other! I couldn't live with myself...

speaker: Leo
text: But, Elise...

speaker: Elise
text: Sorry, my mind's made up.

speaker: Leo
text: Well, I suppose I can't make you change your mind. So...do as you wish. But please be careful.

speaker: Elise
text: Yay! Thank you, Leo! Your blessing means a lot to me.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo.

speaker: Leo
text: You two...so reckless. Since you can't be stopped, I must at least warn you one last time... Xander is stronger than you can fathom. Much stronger than either of us. And Father is perhaps stronger still.

speaker: Corrin
text: I appreciate the warning. But I am willing to give my life for this cause. And I am confident enough to believe I won't have to.

speaker: Leo
text: You have grown considerably, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Leo. We'll be on our way now. I hope we can meet again.

speaker: Elise
text: See you soon, Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: Yes... Good-bye.

speaker: Leo
text: I honestly have no idea how this is all going to turn out... Wait a moment. Was that Odin giggling? And did I hear Niles cough? Guys, why don't you stop hiding and come out here.

speaker: Niles
text: So sorry, Lord Leo. We simply didn't wish to disturb you unless it became necessary.

speaker: Odin
text: Yes, but then this insolvent creature tickled my fancy with a mirth-filled quip! Even my dark aura could not resist a chuckle.

speaker: Leo
text: What have I said about referring to your dark aura all the time?

speaker: Odin
text: But, milord...to even think of you being imprisoned within eternal darkness... Your soul yearning to break free.... Oh, the lamentations I would express...

speaker: Leo
text: Huh?

speaker: Niles
text: He's trying to say that he was worried about you, milord. You went off to the Bottomless Canyon with that strange crystal all alone... I was worried about you, too. That's why we're here.

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, well...thank you, I suppose.

speaker: Odin
text: Tell us, what fantastic truths did the dark crystal reveal to you?

speaker: Leo
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh. That good, huh?

speaker: Leo
text: No, it's just... Father... He's no longer... Ugh. Let's just say, big changes are on the horizon, for all of us. There's going to be a major battle, and anything could happen.

speaker: Niles
text: Understood, milord.

speaker: Odin
text: Yes. I have prophesied this from the very beginning...

speaker: Leo
text: Heh. You're hopeless, Odin. ... *sigh* Good luck, Corrin...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Welcome to the Cheve Underground. This is where the resistance meets. We should be safe here for the time being.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Ryoma. I think I speak for everyone when I say this... We're so glad to have you back in command.

speaker: Sakura
text: We all missed you so much!

speaker: Takumi
text: I knew you'd be fine. But I'm still glad to have you back.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Now that we're all reunited, nothing can stop us!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, everyone. It's great to see you all again. And I must apologize for making you all worry so much. To think of all you've overcome to track me down... I've never been prouder to be your older brother.

speaker: Corrin
text: So, what's next? Now that we're all back together, it seems like anything is possible.

speaker: Scarlet
text: I like the sound of that. So you all must be Ryoma's siblings, right?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Ah, yes. It seems introductions are in order.

speaker: Ryoma
text: These are my younger brothers, Corrin and Takumi. And my sisters, Hinoka, Azura, and Sakura.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is my younger brother, Takumi. And my sisters, Hinoka, Azura, Corrin, and Sakura.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Everyone, this is Scarlet.

speaker: Scarlet
text: Wait...those names are awfully familiar. Are you named after the Hoshidan royal family?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Er. You could say that. We ARE the Hoshidan royal family.

speaker: Scarlet
text: Urk! Please forgive me, Your Highness! I had no idea you were THE Ryoma!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Please, Scarlet. You may simply call me Lord Ryoma. I apologize for not revealing my true identity earlier, but it was necessary. I wanted to get a true feel for your group without my royalty muddying the waters.

speaker: Scarlet
text: You needn't have worried. We have a common enemy. And many of us have strong ties to Hoshido. My own grandfather was one of the king's servants many years ago.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Is that so?

speaker: Scarlet
text: Yes! I've always wanted to be a knight because of him. I fact, if it wouldn't be out of place...I'd really like to join your party. You've seen what I can do in battle. What do you say?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I say we'd be lucky to have you. Welcome aboard.

speaker: Scarlet
text: Yes! Thank you so much, Lord Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma, can you tell us more about the resistance?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. The group here in Cheve is one of the most well organized. In the early stages of battle, I learned of this group and decided to investigate. I made my way to this region and joined the resistance under false pretenses. Of course, you must realize that there are underground anti-Hoshido groups as well. That's why it's important for us to have a presence in regions controlled by Nohr. In case the conflict spreads.

speaker: Scarlet
text: I can't believe I didn't recognize him. Oh well. I'm just glad we're on the same side. All of us in the Cheve resistance simply wish to be free of Nohr's oppressive rule.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. It's important to remember that we're not just fighting for Hoshido. Garon's mania for conquest must not be allowed to claim one nation more!

speaker: Corrin
text: What was that? I thought this was a safe house.

speaker: Scarlet
text: It is! Nobody outside the resistance knows about this place. Let's see what's going on.

speaker: Scarlet
text: What's going on? What was that blast?

speaker: Resistance
text: Milady, we're surrounded by Nohrian troops. Our men have engaged the enemy, but we're severely outnumbered.

speaker: Scarlet
text: No! How did they know that we were here?

speaker: Azura
text: We may still have a traitor among us...

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you suggesting? You saw what happened to Zola.

speaker: Azura
text: I don't know, Corrin. How else could this have happened?

speaker: Corrin
text: I refuse to believe...

speaker: Ryoma
text: No matter. We must evacuate immediately. There's a secret path nearby. Come, everyone!

speaker: Scarlet
text: But what then? That path leads right to Nohr's doorstep.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Indeed. And that is exactly where I intend to go.

speaker: Scarlet
text: Are you serious? We're not ready for that kind of mission.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Running from the enemy won't bring this war to an end. We need to confront King Garon directly. And I believe that a swift counterattack would be the last thing he expects now. What do you think, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I think you're right. Moving forward quickly with a small force could actually work.

speaker: Scarlet
text: I don't know...

speaker: Corrin
text: Scarlet, if you're not on board with this plan, please don't feel obligated to join. I understand it must be hard to leave your troops here to fend for themselves.

speaker: Scarlet
text: No...I'll go with you. The resistance here is strong. We may be outnumbered, but we'll win the day. I can see the conviction in your eyes. Let's do this!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Excellent. Now that we're in agreement, we should get moving. The sooner we make our move, the greater our advantage!

speaker: Corrin
text: So this path leads all the way to Nohr? Are you sure we'll be safe?

speaker: Scarlet
text: We should be. Then again, I thought that our safe house was actually SAFE. We built the path for this exact purpose, but I had no idea we'd use it this soon...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Scarlet. Our arrival has certainly set things in motion.

speaker: Scarlet
text: It's all right. Maybe it's just the spark we needed to finally make a move. So please, wipe that sad look of your face. We're going to kick some butt!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa! Thanks, I guess I needed that. If we're going to invade Nohr all by ourselves, I'd better be confident.

speaker: Ryoma
text: We're close, everyone. Time to get serious.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, that's a formidable wall. And there's no shortage of troops... Everyone, please listen up. Once we cross the border, there's no turning back. If anyone wants to retreat, now's your chance. You will not be judged.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'll follow you to the end of the world, Corrin. You have my support.

speaker: Takumi
text: And leave you here to take on these jerks all by yourself? Forget about it. I'll bend my bow to your will, Corrin!

speaker: Sakura
text: I wouldn't think of staying behind after all you've done for us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm pleased to see you taking on the role of a leader, Corrin. You're becoming worthy of the sword that has chosen you. Naturally, I will not be turning back.

speaker: Azura
text: You know this already, but you have my support as well, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, everyone. Your support means the world to me. Now, let's head into Nohr and show King Garon we mean business!

speaker: Benny
text: Nothing personal. I'll make it quick...

speaker: Benny
text: I did my best. That's all I can say...

speaker: Charlotte
text: Ugh, I have better things to do. Why'd you have to invade today?

speaker: Charlotte
text: You're such a pain...

speaker: Daniela
text: How sad for you to make it all the way here only to be butchered by me!

speaker: Corrin
text: We made it! Did that really just happen?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, Corrin. We won this battle. But remember, we're in Nohrian territory now. We've got a long way to go.

speaker: Corrin
text: Can't I just be happy for a minute?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Of course. But time is of the essence. Garon will hear about this soon. It won't be long before more Nohrian troops are on our trail.

speaker: Takumi
text: He's right. We've got to find someplace to rest. It'll be dark soon. There's cover in the forest nearby. What do you think, Ryoma?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I think that's a good idea. Let's move toward the forest. I've been studying maps of the area in preparation for this scenario. Follow me!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh...I can't get any sleep. If only I could shut off my brain for a few hours... What's that?

speaker: Azura
text: Ugh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, it's Azura. I wonder what she's doing up at this hour. I hope everything's OK. It almost seemed like she was going to faint back in Nestra. Well, there's only one way to find out.

speaker: Corrin
text: Where'd she go? I can hear her voice... It sounds like she's singing that song again.

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

speaker: Corrin
text: Ah, there she is. It seems a bit cold for a swim...

speaker: Azura
text: Oh, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...what are you doing out here? Couldn't sleep?

speaker: Azura
text: Were you following me?

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose I was. I just heard your voice, and I wanted to ask you something.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes? What is it?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, it's about the song you were singing just now.

speaker: Azura
text: I see.

speaker: Corrin
text: What can you tell me about it? It seems to have a different effect on everyone. For example, when you sang to Takumi, it seemed to break the spell he was under. But when you sang to the Nohrian soldiers, it was almost like they were in a trance. And Izana knew some of the words—even though he'd never heard it sung before! How is that possible?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, but I'd rather not talk about it.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really? Azura, it's me. You can tell me anything.

speaker: Azura
text: You should try and get some sleep. We're going to be up early tomorrow.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please don't change the subject. You won't talk about the song, and I feel as though I hardly know anything about you. Doesn't that make you lonely? You know that we're all friends—we're here for you!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...it's not that simple... Ugh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! What's wrong? How can I help?

speaker: Azura
text: Agghhh...

speaker: Corrin
text: No! Azura!

speaker: Azura
text: Don't look...at me...please.

speaker: Corrin
text: What's happening to you?

speaker: Azura
text: *huff *huff* *huff* Phew... I'm OK now. I'm sorry to have worried you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, don't apologize. I'll go get someone. Can Sakura help?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm afraid not. What you've seen is the result of a curse. Like you, I carry special blood in my veins. But this comes at a price... I can sing for fun, or even to help someone in battle, and I'll be OK. But when I sing THAT song, in combination with my pendant... I'm able to generate a special kind of power.

speaker: Corrin
text: The power to exorcise demons?

speaker: Azura
text: Something like that. But in exchange, every time I use the power, I suffer. It doesn't always happen right away. But it always happens.

speaker: Corrin
text: Why didn't you tell us before? You've been suffering needlessly this whole time!

speaker: Azura
text: No. The suffering is temporary, and I always recover.

speaker: Corrin
text: But...

speaker: Azura
text: But nothing. Each time I have sung that song, it was required. And it will be required again in the near future. We will eventually need the song's power to defeat King Garon.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see.

speaker: Azura
text: Please don't worry. Although it is excruciating, the pain always subsides. If my song can help us end the war, I'll sing it as many times as necessary.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK. But you must promise that you won't ever put yourself in danger. I don't know how you can willingly inflict such suffering upon yourself...

speaker: Azura
text: I promise. If only everyone were as kindhearted as you, we'd have no war at all, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Azura.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry for no telling you about this before, but... I didn't want you to worry. Remember, you mustn't hesitate to have me use the song if it becomes necessary.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmmm, so clever little Corrin has returned home. And he/she has carried out my order in an alarmingly competent fashion, no less. Heh heh heh... well done, child. Mwahahahaha. HA HA HA HA! Well, I'll just have to give my dear son/daughter a truly agonizing mission now, won't I?

speaker: Garon
text: ... You may enter.

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon, Corrin has returned. It seems he/she managed to quell the rebellion without sacrificing a single life. He/She has requested an audience with you, my liege. What should I tell him/her?

speaker: Garon
text: Tell him/her I received the message and will be there momentarily.

speaker: Iago
text: Consider it done, your majesty.

speaker: Corrin
text: I have returned, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: And gloriously so, I might add. Iago told me of your impressive feat. Stopping a rebellion without taking a single life is no small accomplishment. You've done well, Corrin. I am... proud of you. As promised, I now welcome you back into the royal family. Well done, my son/daughter.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Father! I can't tell you how much this means to me.

speaker: Xander
text: I told you all would be well in the end. Good job, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Xander!

speaker: Iago
text: Ehem, there is one small problem, King Garon. My sources tell me Corrin did not carry out his/her mission alone.

speaker: Xander
text: Iago! That was unnecessarily cruel, even for you.

speaker: Garon
text: Is this true, Corrin. Did you or did you not face the Ice Tribe alone?

speaker: Corrin
text: ... It is true. I did not face them alone. I set out on my own, as ordered, but along the way I ran into trouble. Felicia/Jakob, Silas and Elise came to help me. I couldn't have done it without them. I'm sorry for defying you in that regard, Father. I beg your forgiveness.

speaker: Garon
text: So you defined my holy orders and involved not only retainers but also your sister?

speaker: Iago
text: This behavior simply cannot be tolerated. Right, King Garon? He/she betrayed the wishes of the divine dragon, Anankos. Such sacrilege demands a swift and severe punishment. If you ask me, we should put an end to Corrin once and for all.

speaker: Elise
text: Stop it, Iago! That's never gonna happen! I won't let it! Corrin never asked us to follow him/her - we did that on our own! It's not his/her fault! So... s-so if the punishment is death, you'll have to kill me too.

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise! Don't say that, dear sister. I'm not worth dying for.

speaker: Xander
text: Quiet, both of you. Father, if you must punish someone, punish me. It was I who told the others to tag along and help Corrin with his/her mission. If death is the price for this indiscretion, it is I, and I alone, who will pay it.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Xander
text: Father, kill me or kill no one. That is all there is to it.

speaker: Garon
text: Enough. I have no intention of harming any of my beloved children. Though it was not exactly as I requested, he/she did accomplish his/her mission. By the grace of Anankos, I shall let this pass. He/She is, after all, still my son/daughter.

speaker: Iago
text: King Garon! You can't mean that!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Father! And you, Xander. Thank you for looking out for me, even at the risk of your own life.

speaker: Xander
text: Think nothing of it, little prince/princess. Such is the duty of an older brother.

speaker: Garon
text: I must admit, my child, I never thought you would pull off such a grand feat. Given your ability for combat, I shall waste no time in assigning you a new mission.

speaker: Corrin
text: A new mission? So soon?

speaker: Garon
text: Skills like yours need to be put to good use. I'd like you to head for Notre Sagesse. I need you to capture that territory and bring it under Nohrian rule.

speaker: Corrin
text: Notre Sagesse, eh? As you wish, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: I have heard that the place is even now teaming with Hoshidan soldiers. The Hoshidans are taking steps to topple Nohr and all we hold dear. Such bad seeds must not be allowed to take root. Head there immediately and eradicate all Hoshidan soldiers you find along the way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Y-you want me to fight against the Hoshidan army?!

speaker: Garon
text: That's not a problem, is it? Or, after all that, are you reluctant to raise a sword against the kingdom of your birth?

speaker: Corrin
text: N-no problem at all. I am a Nohrian, through and through. I will carry out your mission without fail, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: Good. Do not let me down, son/daughter. I'm counting on you.

speaker: Corrin
text: I won't fail you, Father.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I'm off on another daring mission, ha ha. So for now, this is good-bye.

speaker: Xander
text: Take care, Corrin. Even when we are apart, know we are still with you in spirit.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, it just doesn't seem fair! Going on a mission like that with such a small army. I'd go with you, but Father tasked us with a mission of our own. I really wish there was something we could do to help...

speaker: Corrin
text: Don't worry, Camilla. We'll be fine on our own. Right, Elise?

speaker: Elise
text: Yeah, that's right! We'll be just dandy! With me and my retainers at your side, we'll be back home in no time flat!

speaker: Leo
text: Elise is going too? Now I'm really worried. It was nice knowing you, Corrin.

speaker: Elise
text: HEY! That's not funny, Leo! Why would you say such a terrible thing?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha ha, he's just trying to get a rise out of you, Elise. You know I'm counting on you.

speaker: Elise
text: Thanks, Corrin! That's why you're my favorite! Because you aren't mean and stupid like Leo!

speaker: Leo
text: Even after spending time on the battlefield, you're somehow still the same spoiled brat. It's actually quite impressive. See, Elise? I'm not mean at all. I just said you impress me.

speaker: Elise
text: XANDER! MAKE LEO STOP TEASING ME!

speaker: Xander
text: *sigh* Corrin, listen well. The mysterious Rainbow Sage resides in Notre Sagesse. He grants divine power to those he deems worthy. Seek him, if you have the courage.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow, is that so? I never knew such a being existed, much less in Notre Sagesse. But wait... if you know about him, does that mean YOU received divine power?!

speaker: Xander
text: It is true. Father and I each visited the sage and were each gifted with his power.

speaker: Corrin
text: Th-that's incredible.

speaker: Xander
text: It was a great honor. However, be aware that you will have to face severe trials first. If you decide to seek out the sage's trials, make sure you're prepared.

speaker: Corrin
text: I see. Thank you for your advice, Xander. I must become as strong as possible so that I can end this war once and for all. I have no choice but to seek out the sage and face whatever trials he has in store.

speaker: Xander
text: As expected. I look forward to seeing that new power when you return safely.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Xander. Well, I suppose I had better get going. Good-bye, everyone!

speaker: Leo
text: Best of luck, Corrin.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, my little Corrin... please be careful.

speaker: Corrin
text: That fort up ahead is enormous! Silas, are we supposed to pass through that?

speaker: Silas
text: We are. The road that leads to port is on the other side.

speaker: Corrin
text: Amazing. It kind of looks like a gigantic sleeping dragon.

speaker: Elise
text: Heehee, you're so keen, Corrin! That place is called Fort Dragonfall. It's some big 'ol dragon that died a long time ago.

speaker: Corrin
text: Fort Dragonfall... Tell me more, Elise.

speaker: Elise
text: Sure! Well, rumor has it this dragon was incredibly powerful. They say when it died, it's body eventually became this very fort!

speaker: Corrin
text: So this was a dragon from a long time ago... How very awe inspiring.

speaker: Silas
text: It is, isn't it? But the fort is now occupied by the Hoshidan army. We'll have to fight them off if we want to get through.

speaker: Corrin
text: Fate is cruel, isn't it? Well, I suppose we have no choice. We must get to Notre Sagesse so I can complete my mission and find the sage. I'll have to face the Hoshidan army eventually. It's now or never. I'm ready. I... I can do this.

speaker: Silas
text: Understood. In that case, let's prepare for battle before they spot us.

speaker: Nyx
text: What a nuisance. I might have known the Hoshidan army would be here. "There's a young girl in there! We've got to take her into custody!" Blah blah blah. Children barely out of the womb out to capture a grown woman. Pathetic. It makes me sick. This is why I usually choose to remain hidden from the ignorant masses. *sigh*

speaker: Azura
text: Once again, here I am. Dragged to some horrible place with no explanation. *sigh* Is it my destiny to forever be tossed aside, a stranger to all lands? Maybe the Nohrians will accept me. Or maybe this is where I die... Well, it is out of my control. If only I were a Hoshidan by birth. I knew if and when the war began, I would be among the first casualties. At least in the end... Hm? Is that... a Dragon Vein I sense? Ah, I do recall hearing that this fort was built from the remains of a dark dragon. Perhaps it can be used to attack those within the fort...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey, miss! What are you doing out here?! You're definitely not a Hoshidan soldier. It's dangerous out here, young lady. Come on over to our side, and we'll protect you. Your family must be worried sick.

speaker: Nyx
text: I am no "young lady", and I neither desire nor require your paltry protection.

speaker: Corrin
text: R-really? Are you sure?

speaker: Nyx
text: Are you as deaf as you are dumb, boy/girl? Begone before I curse you into oblivion.

speaker: Corrin
text: Boy/Girl?! You're one to talk! You look about the same age as my little sister!

speaker: Nyx
text: Appearances can be deceiving, boy/girl. I'm afraid my situation is beyond your ability to comprehend. All I want is to live in solitude and to avoid the harsh gaze of the world around me... Is that really too much to ask?

speaker: Corrin
text: Live in solitude? Does that mean... you're all alone? Don't you have a family?

speaker: Nyx
text: My family left a very long time ago. They were... frightened of me and my abilities. They thought I was strange... Maybe I am. Who needs a family, anyway? I-I'm not sure why I told you all that... your eyes are very trustworthy and calming. So yes, intrusive stranger. I am all alone and shall remain so for all my days.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, I can't accept that. Why don't you join my team? We'll be your family from now on.

speaker: Nyx
text: What are you saying?! You know nothing about me or my dark past.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's true, but that doesn't matter. Only the present and the future. Besides, you can't evade the Hoshidan army all by yourself. You need us. Trust me, I know what it's like to feel lost and alone. That's no way to live. If my friends and family hadn't come to my aid, I wouldn't be alive right now. Everyone needs someone to lean on, stranger. Please join us.

speaker: Corrin
text: I really shouldn't leave such a helpless little lady alone, anyway, haha.

speaker: Nyx
text: I already told you I'm much older then I appear! Insolent fool. Or perhaps that was... what was it called... a "humorous joke" of some sort? Hmmm... Maybe you have a point. I suppose it would be advantageous to join you. For now. It has been a long while since I had any sort of companionship. It might be... nice. Well, fine. Since you insist, I shall join your ranks. Use my powers as you see fit.

speaker: Nyx
text: Oh, since we're on the same side now, I should let you in on a little secret. See that wall over there? It has a weak spot. It should break if you attack it. That knowledge should help us prevail over the Hoshidan Army.

speaker: Haitaka
text: Hey there, Nohrian pawn. Care for a little lesson in Hoshidan combat?

speaker: Haitaka
text: How...mortifying...

speaker: Azura
text: Hello, Corrin. It's nice to see you again.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's nice to see you too, Azura. But what are you doing in Nohr? Actually, never mind that part. Why were the Hoshidans fighting against you? I thought the people of Hoshido were your allies.

speaker: Azura
text: As did I. But when the war started, everything changed. After you, A prince/princess of Hoshido, sided with Nohr, the Hoshidans wished to banish me. The general consensus was that nobody with ties to the enemy could be trusted. Since I was taken from Nohr as a child, I bore the brunt of these wild suspicions.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... that's awful.

speaker: Azura
text: Ryoma and the others stood up for me. They tried their best to protect me. But one day a group of Hoshidan soldiers captured me and took me here. If you hadn't come along, I can't imagine what would have become of me. So thank you, Corrin. I owe you my life.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please don't thank me, Azura. It's my fault you were caught up in all this to begin with. It's not fair that you were torn from your home again on my account. I'm so sorry.

speaker: Azura
text: Please don't blame yourself. It's really not your fault. When a war starts, it's only natural to distrust the enemy. I always knew this would happen if Nohr and Hoshido ever went to war.

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose so. But I'm still sorry for the part I played in your misfortune.

speaker: Azura
text: Think nothing of it. Actually... If it's not too much of a burden, I was hoping you would allow me to join you. Perhaps with our powers combined we can end this senseless war.

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course! Would be honored to have you fight by my side. You were a valued friend during my time in Hoshido. I'm happy to return the favor.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin. I'm so glad we crossed paths once more. After I was captured, I couldn't stop thinking about you. Not just you, but also your... Oh, never mind.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura?

speaker: Elise
text: Corrin! I finally found you! We're all ready to go now.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Elise. We'll leave momentarily.

speaker: Elise
text: Um, brother/sister? Who is this pretty lady you're talking to?

speaker: Corrin
text: This is Azura. She'll be traveling with us from now on. She was once a Nohrian Princess, but she was stolen away many years ago.

speaker: Elise
text: A Nohrian princess? Really? Wow! Oh, wow! Why didn't you say so? Does that mean you're my big sister?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ha ha! Of course it does! Isn't that right, Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: Well, um...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, is something wrong? You seem-

speaker: Elise
text: I have a sister named Azura! And she's SO PRETTY! It's nice to meet you, sis!

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, it's a p-pleasure to meet you as well. Thank you for the warm welcome, Elise.

speaker: Elise
text: Tee hee hee, no problem! Oh my goodness! I'm all shy now because of my new big sis! Come on already! Follow me! I wanna be the one to introduce you to everyone!

speaker: Azura
text: Huh? Oh, my...

speaker: Corrin
text: Elise, Azura is a bit shy. Please don't overwhelm her. ELISE?! Azura... what a mystery you are. It was almost like she was about to say she and Elise weren't really sisters. Perhaps it was just my imagination...

speaker: Corrin
text: And just like that...we're back in Nohr. Amazing...

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah. Did all that stuff with the Rainbow Sage actually happen? Or was it a dream?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It was no dream, Brother. The wisdom he imparted to us was real. I've never been more ready to take on King Garon!

speaker: Corrin
text: Let's not forget his other practical words of advice... Nohr's army passed through this area looking for us. So we should head in the opposite direction right away!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Right. Our best bet is to head northeast. There's a direct route that will take us very close to the royal castle. And remember...we may have evaded their forces for now... But we can't let our guard drop, even for a moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Understood.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's quite a fort. Are we going through it, Ryoma?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. It's the fastest way to get to the royal castle. And if we encounter resistance, the enclosed space will actually favor us. We can't be surrounded by a large army in there.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sounds like a solid strategy to me. I'm fascinated by the structure...I can't wait to see the inside.

speaker: Ryoma
text: As am I. The fort itself was built partially from the remains of a dragon!

speaker: Corrin
text: So that's why it's called Fort Dragonfall...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. You look upon the carcass of an ancient, legendary beast. Its bones and carcass never seemed to deteriorate, even in death. Eventually, someone got the idea to incorporate them into this fort. In any case, it appears completely unguarded at the moment. Let's move forward.

speaker: Corrin
text: You heard him!

speaker: Corrin
text: You would think the Nohrian army would have left SOMEONE behind, right? Yet again, it seems they've just left a major facility abandoned...

speaker: Ryoma
text: You're right. I'd definitely rather have discovered a token resistance. This doesn't feel right...

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa...what was that?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I don't know! It could have been an earthquake... We should evacuate for the time being.

speaker: Corrin
text: Good idea. Let's get to the exit, everyone!

speaker: Ryoma
text: What?! This isn't possible...

speaker: Corrin
text: What is it? Why aren't you moving?

speaker: Ryoma
text: The exit was right here...but now it's gone!

speaker: Corrin
text: Maybe it's an illusion. We've seen this kind of thing before...
Gahaha! This is no illusion, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, no...not again...

speaker: Iago
text: Well, it sounds like I've lost the element of surprise. Boohoo.

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you doing, Iago? Again, we've got you outnumbered.

speaker: Iago
text: Oh ho ho! As if I'd grace this battle with my own physical presence. No, there's quite simply no need for me to get my hands dirty...

speaker: Corrin
text: Then what's your plan? Destroy the fort on top of us? You know it's made out of an indestructible dragon, right?

speaker: Iago
text: Well, of course! Why else do you think I chose this location to corner you? The dragon is even more indestructible than you can imagine...

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you talking about? Everyone, look at the floor! It's...it's covered in some kind of acid!

speaker: Iago
text: Bingo, Hoshidan prince/princess! Stomach acid, to be precise. You're about to be dinner for a dragon that hasn't eaten in a VERY long time!

speaker: Azura
text: He's...he's reviving the dragon somehow! Corrin...I don't think this is mere illusion!

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, it's real. Dip your toes in that acid, and you'll see just how real. Compliments of King Garon, of course. He's entrusted me with some rather fabulous new powers. Bwahaha!

speaker: Azura
text: I should have known you wouldn't be capable of something like this on your own.

speaker: Iago
text: Ooh...the blue-haired one is being MEAN to me! No matter. I can ignore a minor affront like that...since you're about to die and all.

speaker: Corrin
text: Dragon or not, these walls can't hold us! Everyone, we just need to break through to the outside. Give me a hand! Hyaaah!

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can't make a dent...

speaker: Iago
text: Oh, foolish Corrin... Did you really expect to be able to break through the rib cage of an elder dragon? There's only one way out of here, and I assure you, it isn't pleasant. Also, you'll die. In case that wasn't clear.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do we do?

speaker: Iago
text: Just sit back and enjoy being digested. It's all you can do. Actually, if you're bored, I suppose I can give you a few new friends to play with. Enjoy!

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRRRAAAH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Faceless! Watch out, everyone!

speaker: Iago
text: I know—I'm too generous. These lovelies may end up sparing you a wonderfully delicious death by digestion. Either way, I'll be watching from a cozy chair at the palace. Bwahaha!

speaker: Corrin
text: Damn you, Iago! All right, our weapons and magic do nothing against these walls. What can we do?

speaker: Azura
text: Perhaps if I sing...

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know, Azura. I don't want you to suffer...

speaker: Azura
text: But my song may be able to break the curse. It could be our only way out!

speaker: Corrin
text: But last time... I saw what happened...

speaker: Azura
text: Please, Corrin. Don't worry about that. Remember what I told you? I may suffer a little bit, but I'll always be fine. I can deal with a little pain if it means saving all of our lives!

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well...

speaker: Azura
text: There is just one thing. I'll need you and the others to defeat the Faceless before I begin. My song can be disrupted by the sounds they're making... I'm afraid it won't be powerful enough to break Iago's spell until they're gone.

speaker: Corrin
text: You can count on us. Just promise that you won't do any permanent damage to yourself, OK?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. I'll be fine. You can trust me.

speaker: Corrin
text: All right. Everyone, forget trying to escape. Focus your attention on the Faceless! Let's take 'em down!

speaker: Corrin
text: Their leader is dead. Azura, now's your chance!

speaker: Azura
text: I'll do my best. Ahem...

speaker: Azura
text: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

speaker: Corrin
text: It's working...the walls are going back to normal. Let's work quickly, now. Hyaaah!

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes! We've done it. Everyone, get out while you can! Great work, Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whew...that was close. Thank you, Azura. We couldn't have done it without you.

speaker: Azura
text: It was nothing. You guys did all the hard work.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, come on. Anyone who can swing a sword can take out some Faceless. But only you could have broken the spell that Iago cast. Now that we're safe...how are you feeling?

speaker: Azura
text: I...I'm fine. But let's not linger here too long. Iago said he was able to watch us somehow, so he knows we escaped. We should flee while he's busy apologizing to King Garon.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right.

speaker: Azura
text: Ohhh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm? Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes?

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you sure you're feeling well? I thought I heard a whimper...

speaker: Azura
text: You're imagining things. I'm fine. Let's just get moving!

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Come on, everyone. Let's— Wait, Azura...what's happening?!

speaker: Azura
text: Please...don't come any closer...

speaker: Corrin
text: No! Azura! How can I help?

speaker: Azura
text: Ngh...ugh...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's...it's like you're fading away! This is even worse than last time! Azura, please tell me you'll be OK... AZURA!

speaker: Azura
text: Gah... *huff* *huff* I...I told you to leave me alone. I'll be fine...eventually.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura. It's time you told me the truth about your song.

speaker: Azura
text: There's nothing more to tell. I...I'm feeling better already...

speaker: Corrin
text: A moment ago, it looked as though you were literally fading out of existence. Please, tell me the truth. If you truly care about me, be honest. Are you risking your life each time you sing the song?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...

speaker: Azura
text: I, um... OK, here's the truth. The stronger an enemy is, the stronger my song must be in order to work. And the more powerful I sing—the more power I draw from my amulet...the more damage I sustain.

speaker: Corrin
text: And this damage... What's the worst that could happen?

speaker: Azura
text: It's possible that if I sang long enough, and with enough power... I could disintegrate completely.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! But you told me back in Cyrkensia that there was no danger! You said that the song could cause you pain, but never kill you.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm so sorry, Corrin. I lied. I knew that telling you the truth would only make you worry. And for the good of us all—and the entire worlds—your focus can't be on me.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know. I don't think you should use your song anymore. I think we're just going to have to figure out a way to get by without it.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...I really appreciate your concern... Bu the reality is that we can't get by without my song. We can't defeat King Garon without it. The war will just rage on. I want to bring peace to this world. And if I have to sacrifice...so be it. I believe it's my purpose in life...

speaker: Corrin
text: But...

speaker: Azura
text: Please, don't worry. It doesn't mean that I'm destined to die. It only means that I'm willing to give my life for this cause. My dream is to live a long and happy life in a peaceful world. So, believe me...I don't want to go anywhere. I will be cautious.

speaker: Azura
text: Trust me, Corrin. I know I lied to you before, but... I won't ever disappear.

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose I don't have a choice but to believe you. It's not like I can stop you from using your power anyway. But I expect you to honor your promise. Be mindful of your own well-being!

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. I promise, Corrin.

speaker: Iago
text: Hmph. So the little snake has slithered out of our grasp once more... How did that ragtag team manage to make it through the Wind Tribe village?! One of their ranks should have lost a leg or at least an arm by now! Yet they are all in perfect health and high spirits. How utterly disappointing. King Garon must be furious. As his advisor, it is my duty to set things right. Luckily, their next stop is a fitting location for Corrin's fall from grace. The Eternal Stairway, rumored to lead straight to hell. Heh, it's too perfect! I wonder how many friends and loved ones our little prince/princess will lose there... Prepare to drown in your despair, Lord/Lady Corrin. Your king and I look forward to feasting upon your cries of agony!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh, so many stairs. Just a shot in the dark here, but is this the Eternal Stairway?

speaker: Azura
text: It is. Once we make it through here, we'll be near the Hoshidan castle. Soldiers will undoubtedly be awaiting our arrival, but this path is our only option. We'll have to break through their numbers by sheer force of will.

speaker: Corrin
text: And so we shall... Well, let's get on with it.

speaker: Felicia
text: M-milord/milady! We have an emergency!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Let me guess... Hoshidan soldiers?

speaker: Felicia
text: Um, well, yes! But... I mean, no? It's a little... Oh boy. So! The thing is... Um...

speaker: Jakob
text: Quiet, Felicia. Your stammering isn't helping anyone. Milord/Milady, we scouted ahead as ordered. We found a great many Hoshidan soldiers... All dead. The stairs up ahead are littered with their corpses.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods... What happened?!

speaker: Felicia
text: W-we're not sure. They all appear to be healthy, strong warriors. And yet there's not a single survivor. It's...it's awful to behold.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps Father sent another unit of Nohrian soldiers ahead of us...

speaker: Jakob
text: Highly unlikely, milord/milady. There's no way they could have passed us unnoticed. The only other route into Hoshido requires crossing the Bottomless Canyon... But they would have had to circle back, so we still would have gotten here first.

speaker: Camilla
text: A tragedy to be sure, but this works out quite nicely for us. Having our enemy taken care of before we even arrive is a huge boon. We should take advantage of this and get going before more troops arrive.

speaker: Leo
text: Agreed. These soldiers would have fallen anyway—better that it's not by our hands. We should be grateful that someone saved us the trouble of a tiring battle.

speaker: Corrin
text: I suppose. But...

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?! What's that sound?

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRAAARRRGHH!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Faceless! Here?!

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh no, oh no, oh no! There are too many of them, and they're headed right for us!

speaker: Jakob
text: Damn! So this is what befell those Hoshidan soldiers. We must not let the same thing happen to us, Felicia, follow me!

speaker: Faceless
text: RAAAAARGH!!

speaker: Felicia
text: Take that! AND THAT!

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrraaargh...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's no use! There are too many of them! Everyone, pull back! We can't win this battle!

speaker: Elise
text: We can't leave! They've got us surrounded!

speaker: Corrin
text: We're trapped...

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, Father... Did you really have to send quite so many of these beasties?

speaker: Leo
text: Camilla, this is no joking matter!

speaker: Xander
text: Something's not right... Even Father wouldn't dispatch this many Faceless to one location. There's more at play here than we know.

speaker: Corrin
text: We'll figure it out later! For now, we need to concentrate on making it out alive. All we can do is carve through the Faceless and head for the top of the stairs. Everyone, watch each other's backs. I won't lose any of you! I WON'T!

speaker: Azura
text: Listen carefully, Corrin. We cannot possibly vanquish this many Faceless. There's no end in sight. We must try to get past them as quickly as possible.

speaker: Faceless
text: RAAARGH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Dammit! There really is no end in sight! Ugh!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm...I'm OK, Azura. But I'm not sure we'll be able to make it back up the stairs like this...

speaker: Azura
text: The Faceless seem to be concentrating their attacks on you, Corrin. I've never seen anything quite like it.

speaker: Xander
text: ... Corrin, go on ahead while we fend them off. That's an order.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! No! I won't leave you!

speaker: Xander
text: You are our leader, Corrin. Think with your head, not your heart. No matter what happens to us, you mustn't fall here. All of Nohr is counting on you. Leave this mess to us and get out of here! We'll buy enough time to escape. I won't say it again, little prince/princess. as the crown prince of Nohr, my word is law. Go, NOW!

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Xander! I can't just leave you to... I...I can't let you...

speaker: Azura
text: Xander is right. If we're to end this war and bring peace to the world, we can't let you die here. You are the fated hero, Corrin. The Yato chose you for a reason. So please trust us. Get out of here while you still can.

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRAAAAARRRGH!!

speaker: Azura
text: Run, Corrin!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura... OK. I trust you, and I will do as you say. We WILL meet again. We must. Until then...good-bye.

speaker: Corrin
text: *pant...pant...pant...* I finally made it up the Eternal Stairway... Hoshido...is just ahead... I hope everyone is all right. Please gods, let them be all right...

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRAAAAWR!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?! More Faceless! How can this be?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith! NO!!

speaker: Corrin
text: Why, Lilith? Why?! Why did you risk your life for me? This can't be happening... Hang in there, Lilith!

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith... You're...

speaker: Lilith
text: *cough* It would seem the Astral Dragon Moro has taken pity on me. He's chosen to...let me return to my human form...for my last few—

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Lilith! Don't you dare say it! I...I forbid it! You aren't allowed to die, Lilith! Please! I need you to live...

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm sorry, milord/milady... For the first and last time...I can't follow your orders. But please...please don't cry for me. I'm so grateful I was able to protect you. It's only fitting. After all, you saved my life too, all those years ago. More than saving me, you gave me a place to call home...a family...someone to... I'll never forget all of our happy memories together. I die without regrets.

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith, don't go... We've come so far! The war is nearly won! Don't make me say good-bye...

speaker: Lilith
text: Please, don't cry, milord/milady. Let me see you smile once more... I...I always adored you, Corrin. You've meant so much to me. Keep me in your heart, and I'll always... I'll always be with you... ... ...

speaker: Corrin
text: ...Lilith? LILITH!! NOOO!! Why, gods? WHY?! Why does someone as pure as Lilith have to die, that I might live? How can I go on...knowing she's dead because...*sob* because of me... *sob*

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRAAAAWR!!

speaker: Corrin
text: More? Now?! But, I..

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRRAAAAARGH!!

speaker: Xander
text: It's all right, Corrin. We are at your side once more.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!! You're alive!

speaker: Azura
text: Yes, thanks to Xander's incomparable skill, we somehow made it out alive. We're sorry to have kept you waiting.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so happy to see you both. ... But...Lilith... She...

speaker: Azura
text: What's happened? Why is she... No! Please, no...

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith... She saved me from the Faceless. Yet another life lost because of me... I want only to end this war...to stop all of the death and destruction...and yet... How...how could this... *sob...sob...*

speaker: Xander
text: ... Pull yourself together, Corrin. There is no time for tears.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander?

speaker: Xander
text: Crying will not bring her back, nor is it what she would have wanted for you.

speaker: Xander
text: Listen, Corrin. I know this sounds harsh, but there's nothing you can do. Falling into misery and blaming yourself will not change anything. Lilith paid the ultimate price because she believes in you, as do we all. Do not tarnish the beauty of her sacrifice by letting it cloud your judgment. This is a war. If you let one death stop you from fighting with all your heart... We will not prevail. Do you really wish for her to have died in vain? Or for your sorrow to put those of us who remain in danger?

speaker: Corrin
text: No, but... It hurts so much...

speaker: Xander
text: The final showdown is still to come. This is just the beginning. There's a good chance that more of us will die in the battle that lie ahead. Elise, Leo, Camilla... If any of us die in the days ahead, you must keep fighting. You must stand tall, swallow your sorrow, and fight until the bitter end. If you waver, your troops will waver too. You must not allow that to happen. As he/she who wields the legendary Yato, that is your divine responsibility. So dry those tears, little prince/princess. There's work to be done.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander...

speaker: Xander
text: Fight without fear or hesitation, and you will lead this world into the light.

speaker: Corrin
text: Without fear or hesitation... But how, Xander? How do you do it?

speaker: Xander
text: By searching your soul and finding strength in your resolve. That is how. No matter what happens, don't ever stop fighting. Isn't that what Lilith would want?

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith... You're right, Xander. As always. Before she died, Lilith told me not to cry for her, to smile instead. I know it would upset her to see me like this. For her, I will carry on. Thank you, Brother. I feel much better now. I promise not to waver, no matter what.

speaker: Xander
text: There's that smile Lilith was so keen to see. I'm proud of you, little brother/sister. Now, back to the task at hand. We cannot afford to stall here forever.

speaker: Corrin
text: Right. ... Lilith... We're going to lay you to rest now, but then we must keep pressing forward. I'll see you on the other side, my friend. We'll ride horses and chat about the good times we've had since we last met. I'm sorry to leave you in this place, but the path to peace is finally within reach. From here, we're a stone's throw away from the Hoshidan castle. It won't be long now. Please keep watching over me, old friend. Just like you always did. I hope you know how much I loved you, and that I always will. ...Good-bye, Lilith.

speaker: Iago
text: So the little flying rat died, did she? I always did despise Lilith. What an annoying way to go, protecting her master from her rightful torment. If it weren't for her intervention, I could have made Corrin suffer even more! Ah well, at least that's one less shield for her to hide behind. Poor Corrin. I have only just begun digging your pit of despair. Soon you will find yourself lost in its infinite darkness for all eternity... Your time is nearly up, false prince/princess... Enjoy your last moments of joy...

speaker: Garon
text: You have done well to return to us, Gunter. Welcome back.

speaker: Gunter
text: Thank you, King Garon.

speaker: Garon
text: To think you fell into the depths of the Bottomless Canyon... It must have been quite the ordeal. I am pleased to see you alive and well.

speaker: Hans
text: Heh heh, welcome back, Sir Gunter.

speaker: Garon
