text: Enough of that. I would like to discuss our next endeavor. Soon Nohr and Hoshido will be engaged in an all-out war. Our army will set up base here in Cyrkensia and immediately send troops to Hoshido. If we catch them by surprise, we may be able to secure a win early on. Corrin, I'm putting you in charge of the Hoshidan infiltration.

speaker: Corrin
text: ...As you wish, Father.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmm...good boy/girl. Go by sea rather than taking the overland route. The Hoshidans will expect us to go by land and may be waiting to ambush. We shall outsmart them at every turn. In the meantime, I will return to Castle Krakenburg. I will monitor the situation from there and send more soldiers when the time is right. Iago, Hans, you two will come with me.

speaker: Hans
text: Certainly, my king.

speaker: Iago
text: Understood, King Garon.

speaker: Garon
text: I have high hopes for you, my child.

speaker: Corrin
text: I shall do my best to bring back good news, Father.

speaker: Iago
text: Before you depart, Lord/Lady Corrin, I must ask... Where exactly did you and Lady Azura disappear to last night?

speaker: Corrin
text: Hm?

speaker: Iago
text: Was I not clear? Then I shall repeat myself. I saw you follow Lady Azura into the night. Very suspicious, if you ask me. I shudder to even suggest it, but in times like these.. You weren't meeting with Hoshidan spies by any chance, were you?

speaker: Corrin
text: Nothing of the sort. She and I just went for a little stroll in the moonlight.

speaker: Iago
text: A stroll? You expect us to believe that?

speaker: Corrin
text: I do, as it is the truth. I was rattled after the attack on Father in Nestra. Azura suggested we walk through the forest to calm my nerves. While we were gone, we ran into a strange group of soldiers. Naturally, we eliminated them all.

speaker: Iago
text: What?! Y-you did?

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: As sharp as you are, surely you noticed the new blood stains on my armor. There's your proof. I'm not sure who they were, but they threatened the royal family. That alone is reason enough to destroy every last one of them, is it not? After all, rebellions are like seeds. We must salt the earth before they can sprout. ...Have I acted out of line?

speaker: Iago
text: N-no, milord/milady. You are a role model to us all...

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Iago. Let that be the last time I hear you question my loyalty. Father, if you'll please excuse me.

speaker: Garon
text: Go.

speaker: Corrin
text: Phew. That was close...

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin... May I ask why you lied to Iago just then?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, it wasn't a complete lie... They may have been monsters, but we DID vanquish strange soldiers that attacked us. I merely left out the details of where the actual fight took place.

speaker: Azura
text: Ah, I see. So you said all that to gain King Garon's trust?

speaker: Corrin
text: Precisely. If we want our plan to succeed, it's imperative that Father trusts us. Winning the war won't matter if we can't convince him to sit on the throne.

speaker: Azura
text: That makes perfect sense. Sorry, I guess I was just caught off guard. Hearing you speak like him so casually... It was unsettling.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh wow, I must be a better actor/actress than I thought. Sorry, but until this war is over, you'll have to get used to seeing me like that. I'll have to grow comfortable with that disguise, at least in front of Father. No matter how hard it is... Or how it tortures me.

speaker: Azura
text: I suppose so...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hey, Leo, isn't our boat due to arrive soon?

speaker: Leo
text: It is. Patience, Corrin. Ah, that reminds me. Iago gave me some extra funds for our war chest. He said he hoped it would prove useful.

speaker: Corrin
text: What?! He really gave us this much?

speaker: Leo
text: I was also surprised. I'm not sure what's gotten into him. Prying money from Iago is usually like trying to take a baby bird from its mother. But we'll take what we can get, I suppose.

speaker: Corrin
text: Too true. We should take this opportunity to stock up on supplies before we leave.

speaker: Leo
text: Excellent idea. Hm? Corrin! Behind you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?!

speaker: Xander
text: Well done, Corrin! Your reflexes have vastly improved since last I surprise attacked you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!!

speaker: Xander
text: It's been too long, little prince.

speaker: Xander
text: Hello, little princess.

speaker: Xander
text: I'm pleased to find you in good health and spirits. I heard the Rainbow Sage granted you new strength. Congratulations.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Xander! But sheesh, did you have to give me such a fright! We haven't seen each other in ages, yet the first thing you do is test my reflexes! I guess some people never change. By the way, what brings you here?

speaker: Xander
text: I finally completed the mission Father tasked me with. It was quite arduous. The first thing I did after reporting back was come after you. If you're to infiltrate Hoshido, I'm going with you. It's not negotiable.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... Thank you! Having you on my side is like having a thousand extra soldiers.

speaker: Xander
text: That is kind of you to say, if not a bit of an exaggeration.

speaker: Laslow
text: Lord Xander! It's great to see you again. We did our best to make you proud.

speaker: Peri
text: MILORD! I missed you so much! I made sure to keep Lord/Lady Corrin safe even though she didn't let me kill things!

speaker: Xander
text: Well done, both of you. I am grateful for your efforts to protect my brother/sister.

speaker: Laslow
text: Wow... Praise from the great Lord Xander. It's a little embarrassing!

speaker: Peri
text: Heehee, I'm an expert at making baddies suffer, so it was a piece of cake!

speaker: Leo
text: Now that Xander has joined us, the whole family is finally together again.

speaker: Camilla
text: That's a good point, Leo! It makes me so happy to be near all of my beloved siblings.

speaker: Elise
text: Even better, we have a new sister to welcome to the fold! Right, Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: Y-yes, that's right. Sorry, I don't wish to intrude on your reunion...

speaker: Xander
text: Azura? Can it be...our kidnapped sister?

speaker: Azura
text: You remember me?

speaker: Xander
text: Of course. Though not as much as I would have liked, we met a handful of times. I especially remember how horribly the other Nohrians treated you back then...

speaker: Corrin
text: They did? But why?

speaker: Xander
text: Azura is the child of Father's second wife, the late Queen Arete. When they married, many Nohrians were still distraught over my mother's death. Those who loved Queen Katerina were not happy about Queen Arete or her daughter. Camilla and I...and later Leo...were told not to associate with Azura because of this. I suppose Father wanted to protect the strength of his legacy or some nonsense. However, we always wished we could be close with her, as siblings should be. I can't tell you how happy I am to have you here with us Azura.

speaker: Azura
text: Xander... Thank you. Your words have touched me deeply. You are truly as kind as Corrin made you out to be.

speaker: Corrin
text: This is wonderful. Now we can all be the big, happy family we were meant to be!

speaker: Elise
text: YEAH!! Let's all go to Hoshido together! It will be an adventure!

speaker: Camilla
text: Elise, darling, we're not going to play. Make sure to behave yourself.

speaker: Leo
text: It's true. We should all mentally prepare ourselves for the battle looming ahead. Traipsing into enemy territory isn't going to be easy.

speaker: Xander
text: Worry not, Leo. No task is too great for the Nohrian royal siblings. Isn't that right, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Right, We'll find a way to win this war together. And I'll protect all of you... That's a promise.

speaker: Xander
text: The wind is at our backs, and there are no Hoshidan ships in sight. So far, so good.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, things are going quite smoothly. I hope it stays this way...

speaker: Nohrian
text: Lord Xander! Lord/Lady Corrin! Pirates are aboard the ship. They're raiding our war chest!

speaker: Xander
text: What?! Where did they come from?

speaker: Nohrian
text: I'm sorry, milord, but they must have snuck aboard before we set sail.

speaker: Xander
text: That's not possible. Unless...those are no ordinary pirates. To pull off such a stealthy move, they can be none other than Hoshidan ninja. Corrin, follow me.

speaker: Corrin
text: OK!

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm... To make it this far, they must be quite skilled and highly organized. Somebody is clearly leading the charge. If we take down the leader, the rest will fall.

speaker: Leo
text: Agreed, but I can't figure out who it is. They're all acting in unison.

speaker: Xander
text: Then perhaps... Their leader is not among them.

speaker: Leo
text: Hm? Ah! I see.. Nice thinking, Xander. After all, Hoshidan ninja are masters of disguise. Their leader must be masquerading as a Nohrian soldier, giving orders on the sly. That means we'll have to speak to each of our soldiers directly to smoke him out.

speaker: Xander
text: Let's move quickly. The longer this skirmish takes, the more we stand to lose.

speaker: Nohrian
text: I haven't seen anyone that looks like an enemy commander yet... Wha—?! Why are you pulling on my cheeks? OW OW OW! Please stop! You'll bruise my gorgeous face! Did you think I was an enemy in disguise? Never! I'm a Nohrian through and through! Are we done here? I feel a little abused.

speaker: Nohrian
text: Still no sign of the enemy commander. I'm afraid. Um, do I have something in my teeth? I suppose I did eat not too long ago... Huh?! You need to inspect my face? Erm. OK. V-very well. that was...strange. If you're finished, I shall return to my post!

speaker: Nohrian
text: No sign of our enemy yet. Am I wearing...a disguise? Not a chance! Test me all you want. My face and my Nohrian pride are both the real deal. If you're satisfied, please allow me to return to the task at hand.

speaker: Nohrian
text: I haven't seen anyone suspicious around here, but I'll keep looking. Huh? You wish to inspect my face? I'm sorry—I can't allow that. I'm not hiding anything, I just... Hey, stop that! Unhand me, you fiends! I guess I have no choice...

speaker: Shura
text: Bah! I must be getting sloppy if you were able to see through my disguise.

speaker: Xander
text: Wait...that's a Nohrian pirate! But he leads his men just like ninja... And how did a common pirate manage to sneak aboard? This doesn't add up. I'll get to the bottom of this later. For now, all that matters is stopping him!

speaker: Leo
text: Drat... We took too long trying to find their commander. They've stolen all the money Iago gave to us. How will I explain this to Father...

speaker: Shura
text: Now that you've found me, I have no choice but to defeat you all! Say good-bye to your men, your war chest, and this ship!

speaker: Xander
text: This battle is over. Surrender quietly, if you know what's good for you.

speaker: Shura
text: You're right... We lost. So now what? Well?! What are you going to do with me? For what it's worth, I'd much rather live than die.

speaker: Xander
text: Don't move a muscle. If you even breathe wrong, we shall end you. Stay in the cabin until my brother/sister here decides what to do with you.

speaker: Shura
text: Yeah, sure, whatever. Why not just execute me here and now? As though I could expect anything else from Nohrian royals.

speaker: Azura
text: You must know you deserve to be punished after what you did. You may be dressed as a Nohrian pirate but...I don't understand. Why would you board a ship for Hoshido when our country is at war with them? It doesn't make any sense. Can you explain?

speaker: Leo
text: Hmph. Like a dirty thief needs a reason to do what he does best. He and his men likely just hopped aboard without thinking things through. Trying to reason with him is a waste of time, Azura.

speaker: Shura
text: Azura?! So you're the one...

speaker: Azura
text: You know who I am? How?

speaker: Azura
text: No more games. Tell me what you know, or we shall kill you and be done with it. How do you know who I am?

speaker: Shura
text: ... I know...because... I was one of the people responsible for kidnapping you all those years ago.

speaker: Azura
text: Wh-what?!

speaker: Shura
text: I was commissioned by a Hoshidan strategist named Yukimura. I led him through the secret tunnel that runs beneath Castle Krakenburg.

speaker: Azura
text: But you're Nohrian yourself, aren't you? How could you do such a thing?

speaker: Shura
text: I am no Nohrian, but a ninja from Kohga, a land that exists only in memory now. Long ago, my clan proudly served the Hoshidan royalty. Those days were long past, but I still felt I should help avenge their loss. Besides, I figured if war broke out, I could use the chaos to take down Mokushu. Heh, I don't think Yukimura even realized he had enlisted a genuine ninja from Kohga.

speaker: Azura
text: I recall learning of the destruction of Kohga by the neighboring Mokushu. Rumor has it all who lived there were brutally killed... I'm surprised you were able to escape. Is that why you became a thief?

speaker: Shura
text: After Kohga fell, I was chased from home and separated from the other survivors. I...had no choice. I was a child at the time. It was either steal or die. I chose to steal. I eventually found myself in Nohr, where I carved out a life for myself as a pirate.

speaker: Azura
text: And now that war is upon us, you wish to return home to exact your revenge?

speaker: Shura
text: Yep, spot on.

speaker: Corrin
text: A former Hoshidan ninja, seeking revenge for his massacred people...

speaker: Shura
text: Please...you seem like a reasonable person. My name is Shura. Have mercy and spare my life, and I swear you won't regret it. I promise to serve and protect Lady Azura and to help you however I can. I'm not crazy about the Hoshidans, and I feel bad for helping kidnap your princess.

speaker: Corrin
text: So first you stole from us, but now you want to be our ally?

speaker: Shura
text: Yeah, sorry about that stealing business. Think of it as a showcase of my skills! Come on, whaddya say? Wouldn't hurt to have somebody like me around, right?!

speaker: Leo
text: Don't listen to him, Corrin. He could be lying through his teeth. For all we know, he's a Hoshidan spy. He could warn them we're coming. Hate to say it, but if we don't kill him now, it could endanger us all.

speaker: Camilla
text: I agree, sweet brother/sister. No matter his reasons, he tried to hurt us. There's no way to ensure he won't betray us to those nasty Hoshidans. I'd never stop worrying about you if that mongrel was on the loose!

speaker: Xander
text: Silence. That choice is not ours to make. What will you do, Corrin? As our leader, this is your call to make. Are we going to kill Shura or let him go?

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right... He's too dangerous to take with us. I take no pleasure in this decision, but I can't endanger my family. Your time is at an end, Shura. I'm sorry.

speaker: Shura
text: HUH?!

speaker: Leo
text: I know it's not easy, but you made the right decision.

speaker: Camilla
text: I'll feel much safer now. That's my good little Corrin!

speaker: Xander
text: Take heart, Corrin. You likely saved our lives this day. We all respect your decision to protect your loved ones at any cost. You've grown so much while I was away... Making rational choices for the greater good is what being a prince/princess is all about. I shall send a messenger to Father at once. He will be proud to learn that you brought one of Azura's kidnappers to justice. I know Father can be...difficult. But this is sure to earn you his favor.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thanks, Xander. I don't know what I would do without you.

speaker: Shura
text: I suppose I'm getting what I deserve. Just make it quick.

speaker: Corrin
text: ... The path I walk...is so cold. Please...let this war end soon.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, Camilla... I know you believe this man to be dangerous. And maybe he is. But in my heart, I feel that we can trust him. I will allow him to join our cause.

speaker: Shura
text: Y-you mean it?! Thank you, milord/milady!

speaker: Corrin
text: After all you've been through, Shura, I feel you're long overdue for some mercy. But know that if you place even one toe out of line, I will kill you myself. No one endangers my family. Got it?

speaker: Shura
text: Understood, milord/milady. I swear on my fallen people, I will never betray your kindness. Thank you, Lord/Lady Corrin. My life is yours now.

speaker: Leo
text: *sigh* Oh, Corrin. You're much too soft. Do recall that this is war.

speaker: Camilla
text: That's part of why we love you so much, dear Brother/Sister, but... I hope that kindness of yours never comes back to haunt you.

speaker: Xander
text: If that is your decision, then we shall respect it. I will make sure word of this never reaches Father. If he knew you intended to make an ally out of one of Azura's kidnappers... He would never trust you again.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know... Thank you, Xander. I don't know what I'd do without you.

speaker: Xander
text: You'll never have to find out, little prince/princess.

speaker: Azura
text: Finally. This is Cheve.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh, I hope Ryoma is here...

speaker: Takumi
text: He's the toughest person I've ever met, but... I'm still worried.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Have faith, Takumi. Soon, the six of us will be reunited in the fight against Nohr!

speaker: Corrin
text: I agree. I'm confident we're on the right path.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hmm, someone's coming this way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Who is it?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I can't tell yet. Look, over there, coming out of the shadows.

speaker: Corrin
text: It can't be Xander. He couldn't have tracked us down so quickly. Wait. That's not Xander. But it's definitely trouble...

speaker: Camilla
text: Ah. I see you miss your big sister.

speaker: Camilla
text: Heh. You're so...cute.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, my darling Corrin! I missed you so much...A little birdie told me that you were coming here, and I just couldn't resist.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Back off, lady! That's my brother/sister you're smothering.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Hinoka...it's OK.

speaker: Camilla
text: So, this is your new big sister, eh? Hmm...

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla... I hope you know I could never replace you. But I couldn't stand for what King Garon represents, either. I had to make an impossible decision...

speaker: Camilla
text: Well, I'm happy for you. I'm happy to see you with your new siblings and your new friends. All I ever wanted was for you to be loved! So I'm glad that you are, even though we're not together any longer.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla...

speaker: Camilla
text: If only this joy could last, baby brother/sister... Oh, how I wish it didn't have to be this way.

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Sakura
text: Look out, Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: Will someone hurry up and take her out?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'm working on it!

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, I'm so terribly jealous of you all. My dear Corrin chose you. He'll/She'll never be our brother/sister again. I'll never get to sing him/her to sleep. We've loved him/her for most of his/her life, but I guess that wasn't enough in the end... I'll make you pay for taking him/her from us! You'll all die, here and now!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla, no!

speaker: Hans
text: Is it time, milady?

speaker: Camilla
text: Yes, yes. Sorry for the delay.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hans?!

speaker: Camilla
text: I'm sorry, dearest Corrin. I wish all could be as it was, but I came here to fight. I won't allow you to meet with the Hoshidan prince! Hans and my lovely retainers will help me take good care of you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla, please! No!

speaker: Camilla
text: I love you, Corrin. But if you survive long enough to make it all the way up here... I will do what I must and pierce your body with my blade. And then cradle you in my arms...just as I did when you were a child.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sister...

speaker: Old Woman
text: You must be from Hoshido, right? No need to hide it from me! People here are fed up with Nohr. We're on your side! Here, I don't have much, but maybe this will help. Good luck!

speaker: Girl
text: I heard that the resistance fighters have some mysterious new recruit. If you meet up with them, can you give the new guy this gift? We need all the help we can get!

speaker: Old Man
text: I spent some time in Hoshido as a younger man. What a wonderful place. Here, take this. It was a souvenir from my time there. This feels like fate!

speaker: Old Man
text: We may be under Nohrian rule, but not everyone here supports the king. Here, take this. Give it to someone who can make good use of it.

speaker: Boy
text: Are you working with the resistance fighters? Their leader is named Scarlet. Here, take this. And keep fighting the good fight!

speaker: Child
text: You're here to fight all those meanies from Nohr, right? Well, take this! I hope you give 'em hell!

speaker: Hans
text: I've always wanted a trophy... I think I'll keep your head in a jar.

speaker: Hans
text: Not again...

speaker: Selena
text: Ugh, you don't deserve to even LOOK at me. Get out of here!

speaker: Selena
text: Whatever. I wasn't even trying my best...

speaker: Beruka
text: My orders are to kill everyone from Hoshido. I will not fail.

speaker: Beruka
text: I've failed...for now.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, how I envy all the time you've spent with my dear Corrin...

speaker: Camilla
text: I still love you, Corrin...

speaker: Selena
text: Well, if it isn't Corrin. Do you even remember who I am?

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...

speaker: Selena
text: Ugh, whatever! Like I care whether you remember me or not. You're a monster for making Lady Camilla so sad! Now it's up to me to make you pay for breaking her heart!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gah!

speaker: Beruka
text: It's not my place to question orders. But still...I don't understand.

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Beruka
text: Lady Camilla can't stop talking about how much she loves you. And yet she's ordered me to kill you and all your friends.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's complicated.

speaker: Beruka
text: No matter. My mission is to kill, and I will not fail.

speaker: Camilla
text: Ah, Corrin. So we'll get to dance one last time after all.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla. Please clear the way. I don't want to fight you.

speaker: Camilla
text: Well, I don't want to fight you either! But your decision left me no choice.

speaker: Corrin
text: Can't you see what Garon is doing? I had no choice!

speaker: Camilla
text: Darling, I'm completely talked out. It's time for action. Get over here!

speaker: Camilla
text: Well, if someone had to defeat me...I'm glad it was you, Corrin. Are you going to kill me now? It has to be you... Don't let anyone else do it.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, Camilla. I can't just kill you in cold blood.

speaker: Camilla
text: Won't you even put a defeated enemy out of her misery? Aww, that's the Corrin I know. So sweet and innocent. But then...why did you betray us, Brother/Sister? Tell me! Why are you fighting for Hoshido?

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla, you have to listen to me. King Garon was manipulating me. Possibly for as long as I've been alive!

speaker: Camilla
text: What?! How so?

speaker: Corrin
text: The sword he gave me before I left the castle was cursed. He knew I'd fall in with the Hoshidans and get close to the queen. That's when the sword exploded, killing her and dozens of innocent people.

speaker: Camilla
text: But...but what would have happened to you, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I probably should have been killed as well, if not for Queen Mikoto's sacrifice. Garon surely didn't care if I died, as long as his plan inflamed relations with Hoshido.

speaker: Camilla
text: How DARE he even THINK about harming a hair on your precious head! To think that Father has been up to such evil... I can't believe it. I'm sorry, Corrin. I had no idea.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hold! Who's there?

speaker: Leo
text: Stay right where you are, traitor. And please stop trying to brainwash my sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo! I'm glad you're here. Camilla and I have something to-

speaker: Leo
text: Enough. Sorry for the delay, Sister. I'll take over from here.

speaker: Camilla
text: No, Leo! Listen to Corrin. He's/She's still the same person we knew.

speaker: Leo
text: Sister... Listen carefully. He's/She's fooling you. Do not allow him/her to do so!

speaker: Camilla
text: But...

speaker: Leo
text: Please stand back, Sister. Your wounds are serious. You should be resting.

speaker: Leo
text: I'll take it from here... I'm the only little brother you have left, after all.

speaker: Camilla
text: Leo...

speaker: Leo
text: Listen up, Corrin! I'm coming for you and all your friends. That's the only way to fix what you've broken. If you don't want to be my brother/sister, fine! I'll erase you from my heart forever!

speaker: Corrin
text: No!

speaker: Leo
text: Argh!

speaker: Corrin
text: What's happening?

speaker: Leo
text: Who are you?
Wouldn't you like to know?

speaker: Hans
text: How dare you attack Lord Leo! Prepare to die for your mistake.
Heh. And how do you propose defeating us with so few soldiers?

speaker: Hans
text: What are you talking about?
Soldiers! Sally forth!

speaker: Scarlet
text: We're on it! Look at those pathetic losers. We can take 'em, no problem.

speaker: Leo
text: Where did you come from? When did the resistance get this strong?

speaker: Hans
text: Milord, we must retreat. We don't have a chance against these numbers.

speaker: Leo
text: Damn it! If Camilla weren't injured, we could make a stand... But I think you're right. We have no choice but to leave. This isn't over, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whew...

speaker: Scarlet
text: Ha! They turned tail and ran! I guess the Nohrian royal army isn't so tough after all!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, stranger. I'm not sure what would have happened if you hadn't arrived.

speaker: Scarlet
text: No problem. I'm Scarlet, by the way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Nice to meet you. I'm Corrin from Hoshido. So you're the leader of this resistance force we keep hearing about...

speaker: Scarlet
text: Yeah, that's us. Even though we live in Nohrian territory, we can't stand Garon. That's why we're on your side. The enemy of my enemy is my friend, right?
Heh. Heh.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, and you're the brave soldier who was first on the scene. You weren't scared of Leo at all, were you? I wish I could say we were as brave.
You still don't know who I am, do you?

speaker: Corrin
text: No. Should I? Wait...it can't be...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Haha! Thanks for coming all the way here to my aid, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Boy, are we glad to see you!

speaker: Corrin
text: At last. King Garon...

speaker: Garon
text: I'm so glad you made it home.

speaker: Garon
text: Heh. Heh. Young Prince/Princess Corrin. It has been a while, hasn't it. For someone who spent much of his/her life as a pampered shut-in... You've achieved something approaching competence.

speaker: Corrin
text: Gee, thanks for the compliment. As I'm sure you're aware...we're here to dethrone you. You've sparked a needless war that has claimed thousands of innocent lives. Including my mother's...and those of your own children. Xander and Elise.

speaker: Garon
text: Hmm. I am surprised to hear that. Xander in particular was quite a capable pawn.

speaker: Corrin
text: A capable pawn? Your own son? Do you feel nothing at their deaths? What happened to you, old man?

speaker: Garon
text: How dare you insult me! Of course my own children were pawns. As are you. AS IS EVERYONE HERE!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander and Elise thought of you until the very end! They fought and died trying to save you from my blade! Yet you feel no remorse?! You are clearly beyond redemption or negotiation. The only thing left is to do is end your reign...and your life.

speaker: Garon
text: Bwahaha!

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can't even scratch his armor...

speaker: Garon
text: What did you expect? Attacking me with that pitiful letter opener you call a sword... Let me show you how it is done!

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin! Are you OK?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm fine, Azura. He's not so tough.

speaker: Azura
text: Psst... Get ready. I'm going to sing my song now... He'll be vulnerable for a moment or two—so attack immediately! *ahem*

speaker: Garon
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! Let her go, Garon!

speaker: Garon
text: Don't even think about it. You'll never hear her pretty voice again. If any of you wish to escape here with your lives, I demand total surrender!

speaker: Azura
text: Forget...about...me. Just...attack him!

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I can't!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hold it! Let's hear what he has to say before Azura gets hurt. King Garon... What are your demands? If you are reasonable, I'm sure that Nohr and Hoshido can come to an agreement. Now, please...let Azura go so that we can discuss this.

speaker: Garon
text: Wise decision. I demand nothing less than total, unconditional surrender from Hoshido. You are to transfer control of your kingdom to Nohr immediately. Also...I require your life. BAHAHA!

speaker: Corrin
text: No! Ryoma!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Watch out, Corrin. He's more powerful than I imagined...

speaker: Corrin
text: This negotiation is a sham! I won't let anyone else die today!

speaker: Garon
text: BAHAHA! What are you going to do about it, exactly? Will you drop your pathetic sword and surrender to me? Or will you fight—and ensure the deaths of all your friends?

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't understand... When I attacked him earlier, it was like my sword just bounced off Garon's armor... That never happened before. I need to figure out a way to hurt him...

speaker: Ryoma
text: You're right. We need more power...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Look... Raijinto is glowing!

speaker: Corrin
text: Is Garon doing that? What's going on?

speaker: Takumi
text: I don't think so. Remember when my Fujin Yumi combined with Yato? It's happening again!

speaker: Corrin
text: So that means Raijinto is— Urgh!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Noble Yato is...changing somehow...

speaker: Ryoma
text: I can feel a new power coursing through Raijinto as well...

speaker: Corrin
text: This must be what the Rainbow Sage was talking about... The Seal of Flames! Our three weapons are unlocking something amazing... Noble Yato is becoming...Blazing Yato!

speaker: Garon
text: Call it whatever you like. It still has no hope of penetrating my defenses.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps you're right. But there's only one way to know for sure. Hyaaah!

speaker: Garon
text: GRAAAH! That...actually hurt...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, now's your chance!

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin!

speaker: Garon
text: You've just sealed your fate. Prepare to die. I'll cast your soul into the eternal darkness of Nohr! Soldiers! Surround them!

speaker: Corrin
text: Wrong. Blazing Yato gives me the power to bring light to your kingdom of darkness! Your reign is practically over, Garon!

speaker: Garon
text: HAH! Corrin should have known better than to send an underling. Or perhaps you're just a sacrificial lamb...

speaker: Garon
text: You...you think you've won? Urk...

speaker: Garon
text: You're like a cockroach to me... How can you possibly think you can win?

speaker: Corrin
text: I've grown, Garon. I'm not a victim anymore. And I WILL defeat you!

speaker: Corrin
text: I did it... I really did it... Soldiers of Nohr! Lay down your weapons! Garon is defeated! Our next order of business is forging a peace treaty as soon as possible.

speaker: Garon
text: ...PEACE TREATY? GWAHAHA...

speaker: Corrin
text: No!

speaker: Garon
text: ARE YOU REALLY SURPRISED?

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you?!

speaker: Garon
text: NOW YOU SEE MY TRUE FORM. THE BLOOD OF THE DRAGONS RUNS IN MY VEINS—AS IT DOES YOURS. WITNESS MY POWER UNLEASHED!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: *cough* *cough* No! He destroyed the Blazing Yato! HOW?!

speaker: Garon
text: BAHAHA! EVEN I AM SURPRISED. I EXPECTED MORE FROM HOSHIDO'S MOST FEARSOME WEAPON.

speaker: Corrin
text: This can't be happening...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Hold fast, Corrin! Blazing Yato may be destroyed, but I can still attack with the power of Raijinto!

speaker: Takumi
text: Don't forget my Fujin Yumi!

speaker: Garon
text: YOUR WEAPONS ARE MERE TOYS AGAINST ME.

speaker: Corrin
text: NO! Ryoma, Takumi...are you OK?

speaker: Garon
text: YOUR ALLIES ARE WEAK. I WILL DESTROY THEM NOW.

speaker: Corrin
text: You can't! I...I'll protect them... Somehow...

speaker: Garon
text: DIE!

speaker: Corrin
text: Over here, Garon!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ugh...

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin! Stop hurting him/her, you monster!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Why did you do that?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma...are you hurt?

speaker: Ryoma
text: What were you thinking, moving in front of his attack like that? You could have been killed!

speaker: Corrin
text: You worry too much, Brother... I'm fine. I can keep fighting. I can stop him. I can... Urgh...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: ... Ugh...where am I? It's so dark... And I'm so tired...

speaker: Flora
text: Rise and shine, Lord/Lady Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora! I...I must be in my bedroom.

speaker: Lilith
text: Heehee! Of course, Lord/Lady Corrin. Where else? Anyway, I've prepared your horse for you. You have practice this morning!

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, Lilith, you're here too. But...I'm so sleepy. How late was I up last night?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well...

speaker: Flora
text: I know just the thing for a slugabed like you. ... Actually...never mind. I think you're going to have to wake up on your own for once.

speaker: Corrin
text: What's that supposed to mean? You seem...different somehow. Where's the ice magic I've come to know and loathe over the years? Come to think of it...where are Felicia and Jakob? They should be here...

speaker: Flora
text: Um...

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora? What's wrong?

speaker: Elise
text: Still in bed? Wake up, lazybones! Heehee!

speaker: Xander
text: Yes, your retainers have been awake and working on your behalf for hours.

speaker: Corrin
text: Good morning, Xander. And Elise... Sorry, I don't know what's wrong with me today. I'm just exhausted!

speaker: Elise
text: Well, you better get it together, or you'll be stuck in here forever!

speaker: Corrin
text: That's OK. As long as I have all of you with me, I'll always be happy. I don't mind staying here for the rest of my life.

speaker: Elise
text: Are you sure about that? Is that really what you want?

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean? Of course! And it's what Father wants for me, too.

speaker: Xander
text: Listen to me carefully, Corrin. What do you think Father's true intentions for you are?

speaker: Corrin
text: That's a weird question... I mean, he's my father! He gave me this castle and servants and raised me... Well, I mean, I guess you did most of the raising. But you know what I mean! He intends for me to follow in your footsteps, naturally! Remember? He gave me that special sword, and... And... NO!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods, I remember everything now... King Garon isn't my father! We...we were just battling in his throne room...

speaker: Xander
text: So you remember. What now?

speaker: Corrin
text: Am...am I dead?

speaker: Xander
text: No. You can still go back. But you must make a decision. You can choose to remain here, with us. Or you can go back...and fight with your allies.

speaker: Corrin
text: My allies...

speaker: Garon
text: YOUR HERO IS DEAD. ADMIT DEFEAT NOW AND YOUR SUFFERING WILL BE MINIMAL.

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is far from from over, Garon! Corrin still lives... I know it!

speaker: Azura
text: I, too, sense that Corrin is still present somehow...

speaker: Garon
text: VERY WELL. YOU HAVE BROUGHT THIS UPON YOURSELVES!

speaker: Azura
text: EEEE!

speaker: Ryoma
text: ARGHH!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Azura! They're all in danger!

speaker: Xander
text: Yes. They're all waiting for you, Corrin. They believe you will rise again and fight alongside them.

speaker: Azura
text: It's not your time, Corrin. Open your eyes. Let me hear you voice again!

speaker: Felicia
text: I just know you're coming back. You're stronger than anyone!

speaker: Jakob
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, of all the times I've asked you to wake... This is the most crucial of them all!

speaker: Kaze
text: I believe in you Lord/Lady Corrin. You can't die here.

speaker: Silas
text: Can you still hear my voice? Hang in there, Corrin!

speaker: Mozu
text: You're just playing dead, right? It's the oldest trick in the book.

speaker: Shura
text: I believe in you. Just like you believed in me. Come on back to us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Come on, Corrin... Wake up! I know you can do it!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I won't give up, so you can't either!

speaker: Takumi
text: Are you gonna let this overgrown salamander take you out like that? Get up!

speaker: Sakura
text: I won't leave your side, no matter what happens!

speaker: Saizo
text: Rise, Corrin. Your story cannot end this way.

speaker: Kagero
text: You've got to keep fighting, Corrin!

speaker: Azama
text: It is not your time to die, Corrin! Not for another 72 years and 19 days...

speaker: Setsuna
text: So you fainted. No big deal. Just get yourself together, and come back to us!

speaker: Hinata
text: You're stronger than this. Get up and fight like you always do.

speaker: Oboro
text: You can't die like this... You hair is all messed up!

speaker: Hana
text: I get it, you're taking a breather. Well, nap time's over—get up and fight!

speaker: Subaki
text: Perfection is in your grasp, Corrin!

speaker: Rinkah
text: Everyone believes in you. Your flame will go on forever!

speaker: Orochi
text: Your fate is not to die here. You will wake up!

speaker: Kaden
text: You can't die here, Corrin... I still haven't paid you back!

speaker: Hayato
text: This doesn't have to be the way it ends. Come on—let's finish this together!

speaker: Kana
text: Mama/Papa, don’t leave me! I promise I’ll be a good boy/girl from now on!! Please… *sniff*

speaker: Shigure
text: I do not wish to sing a requiem for you...

speaker: Dwyer
text: I know it's tempting to sleep forever, but you can't leave us like this!

speaker: Sophie
text: Why are you lying around like that? Wake up—we have work to do!

speaker: Midori
text: Don't give up! Hang on, and I'll whip up some medicine for you!

speaker: Shiro
text: I promise to keep fighting until you awaken. I won't give up, so you can't either!

speaker: Kiragi
text: Everything will be OK. It just has to be! I know you'll get up really soon!

speaker: Asugi
text: I should have been the one to take that hit! We still need you to lead us!

speaker: Selkie
text: Hey, dum-dum, if you die here, playtime is over FOREVER! So don't do it, OK?

speaker: Hisame
text: We've come too far to have the battle end like this...

speaker: Mitama
text: The flame of life burns / Truly, deeply...in your soul... / Awaken, my friend!

speaker: Caeldori
text: I want to fight at your side until the very end. You can't die!

speaker: Rhajat
text: You have to wake up... I can't follow you into death!

speaker: Reina
text: You can't die this way, Corrin! I want to hear you voice again.

speaker: Scarlet
text: I know you can open those eyes again, Corrin...

speaker: Yukimura
text: Lady Mikoto, if you can hear me... Please guide Corrin back to the living...

speaker: Izana
text: It wouldn't be a party without you, kid. So open those eyes, OK?

speaker: Anna
text: You’re a one-of-a-kind asset... No returns, if you catch my drift. So wake up already!

speaker: Corrin
text: My friends... I need to go back... I need to keep fighting!

speaker: Flora
text: Have you made up your mind, Lord/Lady Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes. I have to go back. It's so tempting to stay here forever with all of you... But the world needs me right now.

speaker: Flora
text: I'm so proud of you. You've grown into such a fine young man/woman. Go! Save your friends, and save the world from Garon. We will always be watching over you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Flora. I'm glad you could help me wake up one last time.

speaker: Lilith
text: None of us will ever forget you, Lord/Lady Corrin. I'll treasure every moment we spent together. The warmth of your hands when you rescued me that day... The feeling of comfort when I perched upon your shoulder. If you ever feel lonely, just know that I'm out there somewhere...thinking of you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Lilith...you're going to make me cry. I will never forget you, either. Your bravery...and your kindness. Thank you for everything.

speaker: Elise
text: Be strong, Corrin! I love you more than anyone else in the entire world! Oh! Can you give a message to Leo and Camilla for me? This might be my only chance to tell then how much I love them... And there's so much I want to say... Just tell them that I'm always thinking of them and that I miss them. And they better not fight anymore, or I'll be angry! Heehee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course, Elise. I love you too. I'll miss you...

speaker: Xander
text: Time has stopped for us here, but you have so much more life to live, little prince/princess. You can accomplish what we couldn't. You can save this world. I urge you to seize the future! Do it for those of us who cannot. Go now. My beloved brother/sister...

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Xander. I finally understand why you made the choices you did. I won't let you down. I promise to make you proud no matter what!

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: Everyone... I must leave now. I know someday our paths will cross again. In this realm or beyond... ... I'm going back to fight, not just for me but for all of you too! Everyone is waiting for me... I won't give up. I won't let Garon win. Yato, give me your strength!

speaker: Garon
text: SO YOU AWAKEN...

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, trusted Yato blade...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Everyone, Corrin is revived!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry for worrying you. Xander, Elise, and the others helped me find my way back to you. It's...hard to explain. But I'm back...and more determined than ever to end this war!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah! Let's get 'em, Corrin!

speaker: Takumi
text: It's always all about you, isn't it... Just kidding, Brother/Sister. Let's do this.

speaker: Sakura
text: I was so w-worried about you...

speaker: Garon
text: NO MATTER. THIS MERELY DELAYS THE INEVITABLE. READY YOUR SWORD, SO THAT I MAY SHATTER IT ANEW!

speaker: Corrin
text: We'll see...

speaker: Garon
text: WHAT?!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hah! You see? Blazing Yato can never be destroyed! It is now fueled by the faith of Xander and Elise and everyone I love!

speaker: Garon
text: IMPUDENT FOOL!

speaker: Corrin
text: You're wrong, Garon. This is the path I chose, and you were always meant to be at the end of it. I WILL bring peace to the world and right all of your wrongs! And I'm not alone. We are all prepared to sacrifice ourselves for the greater good. That's true power. As you are about to find out!

speaker: Garon
text: THE ONLY THING I AM ABOUT TO FIND OUT... IS WHETHER YOUR BODY OR YOUR SWORD WILL BREAK FIRST!

speaker: Corrin
text: Get ready, everyone. This is it. We can end this war RIGHT NOW. Join me! And fight for the salvation of Hoshido...and Nohr!

speaker: Azura
text: It's time, Corrin. I'm going to sing my song without restraint. You must act while its effects are at their strongest.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait—

speaker: Azura
text: No! Don't worry—and don't try to stop me. This is my destiny.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Just don't forget the promise you made to me.

speaker: Azura
text: I haven't forgotten. Believe me, I have no wish to disappear!

speaker: Corrin
text: Then by all means, sing your heart out!

speaker: Azura
text: ...That's the first time you've ever done that.

speaker: Corrin
text: Done what?

speaker: Azura
text: Asked me to sing! It makes me happy to contribute to the cause.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, we need all the help we can get. But not at the expense of your life.

speaker: Azura
text: I know, I'm sorry to worry you... But here I go!

speaker: Garon
text: GRAAAAH! I CAN'T MOVE! NO MATTER. SIMPLE TRICKS LIKE THIS WILL NOT HELP YOU. ANANKOS! GREAT ONE! GIVE ME POWER!

speaker: Garon
text: HAH! NEVER FORGET THAT YOU CHOSE THIS PATH. YOU CHOSE DEATH AND DEFEAT. YOU CHOSE DOOM. YOUR DEATH IS AT HAND!

speaker: Garon
text: URGH! THESE WOUNDS! THIS CAN'T BE! I REFUSE TO ACCEPT DEATH! I REFU— GYAAAAH!

speaker: Garon
text: I should have killed you when I had the chance. When you were a mere child...

speaker: Corrin
text: And why didn't you, King Garon? Why... Tell me why, Father!

speaker: Garon
text: Because you were my most precious pawn. I knew I could use you to get Queen Mikoto. No matter. I feel at peace now. How long has it been since I felt like this? Perhaps this is what I wanted all along... The sweet release of death... My...my body was destroyed. My mind...lost... Ever since that moment...I became something... Something... ...

speaker: Corrin
text: What...just happened? What did he mean by that? Was he...already dead? Were those the delirious ramblings of a dying man...or something more? Xander did say that Father—I mean King Garon—had changed... I wonder...

speaker: Azura
text: At...last. We can live...in peace...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: Please tell me you didn't overdo it... You don't look good!

speaker: Azura
text: Ughh... I'm sorry, Corrin. I promised you I wouldn't disappear. But...I'm not sure...I can keep my word...

speaker: Corrin
text: Please You can't just die like this! We did it, Azura! We made your dream come true. But what's it worth if you never experience it for yourself?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm at peace now, Corrin. I know that you and everyone else will be safe. That is worth everything. Will you listen to one more selfish request?

speaker: Corrin
text: *sob* What is it?

speaker: Azura
text: I want you to live a joyful life. Don't let this sour your victory.

speaker: Azura
text: The war is over, thanks to you. A world at peace... That's the world we dreamed of. That's the world I risked my life for. And it was worth it. So, it's your turn to make me a promise, Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...no...

speaker: Azura
text: Can I see you smile for me  one last time? One more smile...before I go.  That's right... Lovely...

speaker: Corrin
text: NO! I...I can't lose anyone else. I've lost so much... ...I will keep my promise, Azura. I won't let your sacrifice be in vain. Everyone... We have a lot of work ahead of us. Let's make this world a place we can be proud of again. When those who fell watch over us they'll know they can rest in peace. Azura... Sing for me again someday...

speaker: Yukimura
text: People of Hoshido! Let it be known that Ryoma, High Prince of Hoshido, has succeeded Queen Mikoto! He takes the throne at the cusp of a new era of peace in our land. Ryoma, please accept this crown as a symbol of your title.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, Yukimura. As king, I vow to uphold the values my mother represented so well. Justice. Charity. Equality. And above all else...peace. We shall lead the world into a new age of prosperity!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma...has it even hit you? You're king!

speaker: Sakura
text: You look so r-regal! I'm so happy for you, Brother... *sniffle*

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you OK, Sakura? This should be a happy occasion...

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes, I know. I was just thinking of how happy this would make Mother...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry. But I think you're right. She is happy, wherever she is...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah. She's probably watching over us right now, tearing up herself. *sniffle* Aw, damn it!

speaker: Corrin
text: You too, Hinoka? We've got to pull ourselves together—at least until the end of the ceremony!

speaker: Takumi
text: He's/She's right. How does it look to people out there with us all sobbing up here?

speaker: Corrin
text: Quiet, everyone! I think Ryoma has a bit more to say...

speaker: Sakura
text: Shh!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Before you all leave, I have a few more words for you. With any war come casualties. But the casualties of this war have been almost too much to bear. I speak, of course, of our beloved Queen Mikoto. Still, we must move forward. The crisis our world faced is finally at an end. And in this moment, we have done something extraordinary... We have made peace with the kingdom of Nohr! I know some of you here today probably find it hard to swallow. But there can be no light without dark. The two complement each other... And so, too, do the two greatest kingdoms there ever were. They each have something the other lacks and together are made whole. We in Hoshido must share our light and our bounty. We have much to learn from our brothers and sisters at Nohr. Let us live...together. Let us move forward on the same path toward a brighter future. Thank you for your time, and may the gods bless you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well spoken, Ryoma. *sob*

speaker: Sakura
text: Hah! He got you, too.

speaker: Corrin
text: No, I just some smoke in my eyes...

speaker: Hinoka
text: It's OK. We all did.

speaker: Takumi
text: AHEM. Speak for yourself, Sister.

speaker: Corrin
text: Hah! At lease we can count on Takumi to bring us back to reality.

speaker: Yukimura
text: Excuse me, but the ceremony is not quite over...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Yukimura. Please continue.

speaker: Yukimura
text: This concludes the coronation ceremony! May Hoshido and King Ryoma reign in glory forever.

speaker: Corrin
text: That was a wonderful speech, Ryoma. I just hope all the crying didn't distract you too much.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you, Corrin. No, I didn't even notice. Hopefully you didn't notice how nervous I was up there.

speaker: Corrin
text: You, nervous? I don't believe it! You looked right in your element. Bold and regal, befitting your new title.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Really? Well, thank you. That's reassuring.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, It was quite a moment what Yukimura handed you the crown.

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh yes. Even I was moved. Not to tears, mind you...

speaker: Leo
text: I had no idea the Hoshidan royals were such softies.

speaker: Corrin
text: Camilla! Leo! I'm so glad you could make it today.

speaker: Leo
text: Of course. It wouldn't do for Hoshido's newest allies to miss Ryoma's coronation, would it?

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I suppose not. But I know you've both been busy since the way ended. I'm so happy to see both of you!

speaker: Leo
text: You too, Corrin. Although I can't say I'm fully comfortable walking around Hoshido just yet.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, I assure you—

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh please, Leo. What about when you were milling around the outdoor market this morning? Remember? You were going on about how great it was to see Corrin again?

speaker: Leo
text: Camilla!

speaker: Camilla
text: Ahaha! Anyway, it's wonderful to see you, Corrin. But I must admit that the loss of Xander and Elise still weighs heavily on me... How are you holding up?

speaker: Corrin
text: I think about them every day. Their deaths will be a burden I carry for the rest of my life.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm so sorry for your loss. Those who fell in the war will never be forgotten. We won't easily forget how many lives were lost to Hoshidan blades... All we can do to atone is prevent such a war from ever happening again.

speaker: Camilla
text: Right you are.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Were it within my power as king, my first act would be to bring back your siblings. And Azura as well...

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh...I miss Azura so much...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I didn't spend enough time with her when she was alive... *sniffle*

speaker: Takumi
text: Again with the crying? Look, it may have taken me a while to warm up to Azura, but in the end... I..I really miss her, too. *sniffle*

speaker: Corrin
text: Now we've done it. Even Takumi is crying.

speaker: Leo
text: You guys are going to need to hold it together at my coronation, OK? We can't have all Nohr thinking that Hoshidans are moved so easily to tears.

speaker: Corrin
text: YOUR coronation? But I thought Camilla was next in line...

speaker: Camilla
text: Oh, that was supposed to be a surprise! You ruined it, Leo! To answer your question... Yes, I am next in line for the crown. But I begged Leo to take my place, and he has graciously accepted. I have no desire to run a kingdom.

speaker: Leo
text: So there you have it. You should know that I have big plans for Nohr. I think a friendly competition with Hoshido will be good for both of us. And on that note, I'm quite busy...so it's time I said my good-byes.

speaker: Camilla
text: I'll join you. Everyone, I look forward to seeing you at the coronation ceremony in Nohr!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Camilla. We'll be there. And off they go...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes, but you'll see them again soon. They are your siblings, after all.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Too bad they're leaving so soon. They're going to miss the festival!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm?

speaker: Hinoka
text: That's right...I forgot you've never seen a Hoshidan festival before. It's kind of like...the biggest party you can imagine. So put all those sad feelings on the back burner...and get ready to DANCE!

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank sounds like just the thing. We could all stand to let off some steam.

speaker: Sakura
text: Oh, it's been so long since we've had a proper festival... I can w-wait!

speaker: Takumi
text: Just try not to embarrass yourselves this time, guys. You're members of the royal family!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Need I remind you of a certain incident not so long ago? ...Involving you dancing on stage with a band of musicians? I kid, Brother. Hmm...it would behoove me to make an offering on Mother's behalf at some point. Perhaps some vendor is selling those sweet rice dumplings she used to love...

speaker: Felicia
text: This is going to be great! How can I help?

speaker: Jakob
text: Let's just make sure the crowds don't get too rowdy. Other than that, we're on official orders to have a good time!

speaker: Silas
text: Nohrians and Hoshidans...partying together. What has the world come to?

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, everyone. Having all of you by my side fills my heart with joy. Now, please. I've heard enough about peace and justice and the future. As Hinoka said, let's have some fun for once!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whew...they weren't kidding about the festival. I'm exhausted. Maybe I should take a little break... It's all just a bit overwhelming. Hmm... This place seems familiar... Oh! It's where I first met Azura. Oh, Azura...

speaker: Corrin
text: Am I hearing things?! That's her song!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura! Maybe I'm just hallucinating due to the exhaustion, but I don't care. I'm so glad to see you!

speaker: Azura
text: Shh.

speaker: Corrin
text: ...Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: Tell me, Corrin. What do you see in this lake?

speaker: Corrin
text: Just water, I suppose. What am I supposed to see?

speaker: Azura
text: I think if you look carefully, you might sense something deeper... Empty your mind of thoughts, and let yourself be in the moment.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, OK...

speaker: Azura
text: Good. Keep you focus on the lake. Don't look away.

speaker: Corrin
text: But, I have so much I want to say...

speaker: Azura
text: Not now. Just do as I ask.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. ... I'm sorry, but I have to get this off my chest. I want to thank you for everything you've done. You're the most selfless person I've ever known, and I just... Wait Azura? *sigh*

speaker: Corrin
text: Maybe my mind was just playing a trick on me...

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you for your bravery, Corrin. I hope we can meet again someday...

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...if you can hear me... ... I'm sure we will meet again. Somehow. Until then...I will never forget you.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin, what are you doing out here all by yourself? Don't tell me you're calling it a night. The festival is still going strong!

speaker: Corrin
text: Heh. I was just taking a breather. You guys sure know how to celebrate. You can tell everyone I'll be right back. I just need a few more minutes to dream...

speaker: Hinoka
text: You know, I always wanted to take you flying.

speaker: Sakura
text: Hello, hello! How's the view up there?  Hey!

speaker: Takumi
text: Don't fall now! Careful!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I told Mother...the war is over.

speaker: Ryoma
text: You stood for peace. Always. We carry on your legacy.

speaker: Takumi
text: Yes.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yeah.

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes.

speaker: Ryoma
text: That said...our task will always be a difficult one.

speaker: Ryoma
text: But no matter how hard it may be...

speaker: Ryoma
text: We will succeed...with you at our side.

speaker: Ryoma
text: All of us...hand in hand.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm guessing we're on the right track... It's absolutely freezing out here.

speaker: Flora
text: Heehee. It feels great to me, but I know it's not for everyone. Just hang tight. There's a warm cabin waiting for you at the end.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Flora. I have to commend your navigating skills as well. We've somehow managed to avoid running afoul of any Nohrian troops the whole way.

speaker: Flora
text: Yeah...I guess we just got lucky...

speaker: Felicia
text: She's right, Lord/Lady Corrin. This was just the most direct route. I would have chosen the same route if I were leading us.

speaker: Flora
text: Why must you always one-up me, sister? What's the point?

speaker: Felicia
text: What are you talking about? I'm not trying to one-up you. You're the one who's always been so perfect. I've always looked up to you.

speaker: Flora
text: Oh, I'm sorry. I don't know what came over me. Thank you for the kind words.

speaker: Felicia
text: Just don't let it go to your head, all right?

speaker: Corrin
text: For the rest of the group's reference: yes, they've always been like this. *sigh*

speaker: Ryoma
text: What's wrong, Corrin? You haven't seemed yourself lately.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, to be honest...our encounter with Iago is still bothering me. I'd hate to think I can't trust everyone here, but I've been burned once before...

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's not your style, Corrin. You're on your way to becoming a great leader, and you lead by example. If you don't trust your own troops, how will they trust you? Don't let what happened with Zola shake your confidence.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know. I feel like things have changed. The stakes have been raised. As if they could get any higher...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Let's take a step back, shall we? Do you trust me, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Of course.

speaker: Ryoma
text: All right. How about Sakura and Takumi? Think about Hinoka, Azura, and Silas too. Any of them potential suspects?

speaker: Corrin
text: Absolutely not. I believe in all of them!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Very well. How can you be so sure?

speaker: Corrin
text: I...I just can. I don't know. It's a gut feeling, I guess...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Precisely. This is both your weakness and your strength. You have a keen intuition for people and natural charisma. Yet you lack the years of experience needed to make calculated decisions. So? Follow your strength. Use your intuition. Don't try to be what you're not.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you Ryoma. The problem is that my intuition is telling me that Iago wasn't lying. Regardless, I'll try to focus on the task at hand. Thank you.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Of course.

speaker: Felicia
text: Hey, guys, we're almost there!

speaker: Corrin
text: Brr! Where's that warm cabin you promised, Flora?

speaker: Flora
text: Just a minute, Lord/Lady Corrin. I need to check in with the village elders.

speaker: Corrin
text: By all means. But please, hurry back—we're freezing out here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods...I can't feel my own face. How does anyone actually LIVE here?

speaker: Felicia
text: Heehee! When you're born here, you never even notice how cold it is.

speaker: Corrin
text: The rest of us, meanwhile, could use some sweaters and a roaring fire.

speaker: Felicia
text: Well, hopefully Flora will be back shortly. I don't want you to think the Ice Tribe doesn't know how to treat its guests. Ah, here she is. Hey, Sister!

speaker: Flora
text: Ahem...

speaker: Felicia
text: Flora, everyone is freezing. It's adorable! But we should really get them inside so they can warm up.

speaker: Flora
text: Felicia...I'm sorry.

speaker: Felicia
text: What for?

speaker: Corrin
text: It's getting even colder! And I can't see anything... What's going on?

speaker: Felicia
text: What are you doing, Sister? Knock it off!

speaker: Flora
text: I can't. I can't allow Lord/Lady Corrin to live. He/She betrayed King Garon and the kingdom of Nohr.

speaker: Felicia
text: You can't be serious!

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora, listen to reason. This is madness.

speaker: Flora
text: No, it is our king's will. Stand aside, Jakob, or I'll destroy you as well.

speaker: Jakob
text: How dare you...

speaker: Flora
text: Very well. If I have to kill all of you, I won't hesitate to do so. You've been warned.

speaker: Corrin
text: This can't be happening. Flora, are you under the direct control of King Garon or Iago? Stop this at once and rejoin us! And together we can end his hateful rule!

speaker: Flora
text: No. My mind is made up, and I'm acting of my own free will.

speaker: Felicia
text: What is wrong with you?!

speaker: Flora
text: Felicia... Don't worry—I won't target you. You have betrayed us as well, but I'm sure King Garon will be merciful...if you join my side right now.

speaker: Felicia
text: Never!

speaker: Flora
text: Really? Come on, Felicia. It's still me. We can do this together!

speaker: Felicia
text: I could never attack Lord/Lady Corrin... My job is to protect him/her!

speaker: Felicia
text: And I'm not the only Nohrian who's turned her back on King Garon's atrocities.

speaker: Felicia
text: If you had, you'd know that Corrin is just trying to follow the path of justice! So, even though it means fighting against my own sister and tribe... I stand with Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Flora
text: I wish I had your strength...

speaker: Felicia
text: You do! You can still do the right thing!

speaker: Flora
text: No! Forget what I said. This has gone on long enough. I'm going to end it quickly.

speaker: Felicia
text: Please, no!

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora, I still believe in you! I know that King Garon must have something over you. But if we stick together, I promise we have the strength to take him on. Flora! Are you listening?

speaker: Boy
text: I've got nothing for you. Go ahead and kill me if you must! You should give up now, though. Do you even realize you're surrounded?

speaker: Old Man
text: Nothing but old bones and dust in this house, youngster. All I can offer is a warning—our soldiers love hiding in the snow!

speaker: Child
text: People in town are saying you're the bad guys...but I don't know what to think. I've seen some of those Nohr soldiers doing awful things to our people. Here, take this. It's not much, but it's all I can give. I just ask that you spare Flora and the other locals. Good luck!

speaker: Girl
text: Why did you have to come here and make all this fuss? Well, no matter. Now that you're here, we can't let any of you leave, I'm afraid.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Ahhh! Get out of here! I don't want any trouble. Hey, soldiers! The invaders are at my front doorstep. COME GET 'EM!

speaker: Flora
text: I had no choice...

speaker: Flora
text: Thank you...for stopping me...

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora! Why are you doing this? Please! There must be a reason.

speaker: Flora
text: I told you already. You betrayed Nohr. Now quit asking about it!

speaker: Corrin
text: This isn’t you...

speaker: Flora
text: You don’t even know the real me. Now it’s time for you to die!

speaker: Flora
text: So...they sent you to face me.

speaker: Felicia
text: Sister, I’m here to talk you out of this madness. It’s not too late to change your mind!

speaker: Flora
text: No, I can’t turn back. And I won’t go easy on anyone—not even you.

speaker: Felicia
text: *sob* *sob* No! This can’t be happening…

speaker: Jakob
text: Flora! Stop this madness at once and return to your senses. You've embarrassed me more than enough for one lifetime.

speaker: Flora
text: Jakob... I wish it didn't have to be this way. I wish we could have just stayed in the fortress... Happily serving Lord/Lady Corrin until we were old and gray... We could have had a future together. Just know that I'll always regret this.

speaker: Jakob
text: What? I can't hear you over this ridiculous snowstorm.

speaker: Flora
text: That's just as well. It's fitting that my hopes and dreams should blow away in the wind...

speaker: Corrin
text: You left me no choice, Flora. I've been as merciful as I can be, but I need to hear it from you. What is Garon threatening you with?

speaker: Flora
text: I...I can't... Ugh. I guess it's all over. I have nothing left to lose, so... Garon said he'd destroy my entire village if I didn't cooperate.

speaker: Corrin
text: You see? That's exactly why we must stand against him!

speaker: Flora
text: But you don't understand! Garon said that if I didn't kill you and Felicia myself...he'd kill everyone in the village and burn it to the ground! I made the toughest choice of my life. To protect many at the expense of a few...

speaker: Corrin
text: But, Flora... How could you be sure Garon would even keep his promise to spare your village?

speaker: Flora
text: I know...but it was that or risk certain destruction. He gave me 30 seconds to make a decision before killing me on the spot. Being weak and afraid of death...I shamefully decided to betray you.

speaker: Corrin
text: None of this is your fault, Flora. I just wish you'd trusted that we could help you...

speaker: Flora
text: Well, nothing will change the fact that I betrayed you. Not to mention my own flesh and blood. For that...I deserve to die.

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora. Please don't be so hard on yourself.

speaker: Jakob
text: Yes. You've been foolish, but we have survived. Now it's time to regroup.

speaker: Felicia
text: See, Sister? It's all over. All is forgiven. Please come talk to me.

speaker: Flora
text: Everyone... GET BACK!

speaker: Felicia
text: Flora...NO!

speaker: Jakob
text: What in the devil are you doing?

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh, gods! No! Flora, what have you done?

speaker: Flora
text: This is what I should have done the moment Garon threatened me. Perhaps I could have taken him out with me...

speaker: Corrin
text: Somebody help! Put out the fire!

speaker: Felicia
text: Stand back... HAAA!

speaker: Felicia
text: Oh no... It's not working!

speaker: Jakob
text: The fire must be enchanted... It's getting even stronger! We need water! Won't someone bring water?

speaker: Corrin
text: Flora! You have the power to stop this! PLEASE! DO IT NOW!

speaker: Flora
text: No, Lord/Lady Corrin. I finally feel at peace.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please! *sob* Don't do this! We can still save you...

speaker: Felicia
text: My ice power isn't strong enough to put out the fire... Flora, why won't you listen to reason?

speaker: Flora
text: Please stop trying to save me. This is what I deserve.

speaker: Felicia
text: Flora, NO! You can't die like this!

speaker: Flora
text: Ughh... The end is near... Felicia... Lord/Lady Corrin... I regret...everything. ...

speaker: Felicia
text: Sister, NO! NOOOOOO! SISTER!

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods...why... Flora...

speaker: Jakob
text: What a foolish and terrible waste of life. I think I am going to be sick.

speaker: Felicia
text: *sob* *sob* Sister...please wake up! Tell me that this is just a bad dream...

speaker: Corrin
text: ... King Garon claims another beautiful life. He...will...PAY! I swear on my own life. We're coming for you, Garon.

speaker: Azura
text: We're finally here. Izumo.

speaker: Corrin
text: It's beautiful. I had no idea...

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. Some call this place the kingdom of the gods. Even when other kingdom are at war. Izumo has remained neutral. It almost seems...too good to be true.

speaker: Izumite
text: Who's there?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ho! Visitors from Hoshido. We seek information about two of our friends who may have passed this way.

speaker: Azura
text: Will you please give us permission to enter your territory?

speaker: Izumite
text: Ah, Lady Azura. Of course. People from the kingdom of Hoshido are always welcome within our borders. I'll notify the palace, and someone will be with you shortly.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Excuse me, before you go... We're looking for Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi. We believe they were involved in a battle near your borders. Do you have any information about them?

speaker: Izumite
text: A battle...around here? No, I don't think so.

speaker: Corrin
text: Really? Nothing?

speaker: Izumite
text: Sir/Milady, Izumo has been a neutral territory for many generations. There's simply no way a battle could have been staged around here. Ah, it seems we're ready to welcome you. Please, come this way.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, I'm no quite sure what we're supposed to do now. Just wait around until someone arrives?

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes. This is probably just a bit of formal grandstanding. I've heard that Archduke Izana likes to make people wait a few m-minutes.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, as long as he eventually shows up with some answers for us...

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow, is that the archduke? He looks so...serene!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I've never met him, but I think it must be. And you're right about his looks. He's almost oddly calm...

speaker: Sakura
text: This is actually making me nervous...

speaker: Izana
text: Welcome.

speaker: Corrin
text: Lord? Archduke Izana? May I call you Lord?

speaker: Izana
text: Bwahaha! Please, call me anything you like. Welcome, welcome! Can I get you anything fizzy or bubbly? Or anything wibbly or wobbly? Heehee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Um...

speaker: Hinoka
text: He's a little different than I expected...

speaker: Izana
text: Oh, pardon me, I didn't even introduce myself. I'm Archduke Izana! Voted best hair in Izumo five years running! I'm so happy to have some visitors from Hoshido. Now, what kind of weird stuff do y'all like to get into back in the homeland? No, never mind, we'll get into all that later. Let's just sit back and relax and put on some slippers for now, right? Am I right?

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, yes. You're right. Than you.

speaker: Azura
text: Archduke, before we get to the slippers, we have some important questions for you. Are you aware of a recent battle between Hoshido and Nohr in this area?

speaker: Izana
text: A recent battle? Ha! Not likely! And I'd be the first one to know about it. You know, 'cause I'm the archduke. Giddyup! Haha!

speaker: Azura
text: I see.

speaker: Corrin
text: Maybe we're in the wrong place...

speaker: Izana
text: Now hold on just a minute, partner. You're in the rightest place of all. Izana's house! But now that you mentioned a battle, I do see that some of you are wounded. Gosh, we can't have that, can we? Not with all the resources I have here. Guys, we've got some great healers and doctors in my kingdom.

speaker: Sakura
text: Yes, I've heard about the healers here. They're supposed to be the best.

speaker: Corrin
text: Excellent. We certainly could use a little bit of rejuvenation. Of course, we can't stay long, but it seems wise to heal our wounds while we can.

speaker: Azura
text: Perhaps...

speaker: Izana
text: Well, I won't take no for an answer. Let's get started with treatments right away! Come on, everyone, let's head over to the spa.

speaker: Sakura
text: Thank you, Archduke.

speaker: Izana
text: Ooh, what do we have here? You look pretty banged up, little lady! And your friend—Corrin, was it? Well, you're looking a bit frazzled as well. Tell you what. I've got something special in mind for the two of you. Deep restorative healing is what I call it. It mends the body and soothes the mind. Whaddaya say?

speaker: Sakura
text: Just the two of us?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm not sure we're the only ones with significant wounds... But perhaps we should just play along.

speaker: Izana
text: Come on, guys! The hot towels won't stay hot forever!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Hmm...

speaker: Corrin
text: It's pretty dark in here. I guess that must help with relaxation. I wonder what all of these sharp-looking devices are for...

speaker: Izana
text: Welcome.

speaker: Corrin
text: Archduke, are we in the right place? This is the deep-relaxation chamber?

speaker: Izana
text: Oh yes. You will go to sleep literally forever in this room. It's our execution chamber! Heehee!

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait a minute!

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin, we're surrounded!

speaker: Corrin
text: What are you playing at, Izana? This is not funny.

speaker: Izana
text: Well, we haven't even reached the punchline yet. I'm not Izana. Boom.

speaker: Zola
text: Eeheehee! It's been a while, hasn't it, young Corrin? Or don't you remember me? I'm Zola! Dark mage of Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: Am I supposed to be impressed? I don't care who you are. All I care about is what you've done with Izana.

speaker: Zola
text: What? Why would you care about that creep? I'm the one who's finally captured the famous Corrin! I'm the one who matters! Anyway, good luck getting yourself and Princess Sakura out of THIS! Heehee!

speaker: Corrin
text: All right...stay behind me, Sakura.

speaker: Sakura
text: What are you going to do? There are too many of them...

speaker: Zola
text: Prepare to die!

speaker: Corrin
text: Here we go...

speaker: Corrin
text: What's going on? Are they attacking each other?

speaker: Zola
text: No! Idiots! What are you doing?

speaker: Hinoka
text: This is some healing treatment our hosts have arranged for us, eh?

speaker: Corrin
text: Hinoka! How did you know?

speaker: Zola
text: This can't be happening...

speaker: Kaze
text: Very impressive, Lady Hinoka. You were right on all counts.

speaker: Azura
text: I, too, had my doubts about this situation. Thank you for acting on your instincts, Hinoka.

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm so glad you guys are here.

speaker: Zola
text: How in the world did you suspect anything? My Izana disguise as perfect! No matter. I still have enough power to defeat you. The joke is still on you!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Your supposed archduke acted a buffoon. No royalty would behave like that.

speaker: Azura
text: Precisely.

speaker: Zola
text: How dare you! My impression was flawless. Move forth, men. Take them out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Get ready, everyone. We've still got a fight on our hands.

speaker: Hinata
text: What's going on here? I thought we were in Izumo! I guess that whole "neutral kingdom" thing isn't working out for 'em anymore. Anyway...do you see Lord Takumi anywhere? I didn't get much info out of those Nohrian soldiers.

speaker: Oboro
text: Perhaps that's because you tied them up and gagged them before questioning them!

speaker: Hinata
text: Bah. You would have done the same thing, and you know it. I'll tie up as many people as I need to track down Lord Takumi.

speaker: Oboro
text: Whatever. I just wish you were the one missing. Then it would just be me and Lord Takumi relaxing in an Izumo sauna...

speaker: Hinata
text: Ugh! Keep it to yourself! Anyway, we've got some work to do. Maybe these guys can lead us to Lord Takumi.

speaker: Oboro
text: You're right. I can't stand these Nohrian scum. If they've done ANYTHING to harm our master...I don't know what I'll do.

speaker: Hinata
text: OK, OK, get a hold of yourself. If you kill all of them on a bloody rampage, then where will we be?

speaker: Oboro
text: You're right. I will decimate them with calculated efficiency...but spare a few. Let's go!

speaker: Oboro
text: Die, Nohr scum!

speaker: Corrin
text: Hold! I'm with Hoshido!

speaker: Oboro
text: Wait...who are you? You seem familiar.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm Corrin. And who are you?

speaker: Oboro
text: Oh! Lord Takumi's brother/sister! It's nice to finally meet you. I'm Oboro, Lord Takumi's retainer. Have...have you seen him? We can't find him anywhere!

speaker: Corrin
text: No. But we're hopeful that he's not far from here. We could use your assistance tracking him. Will you join us? I only ask that you...temper your zeal for killing Nohrian moderately.

speaker: Oboro
text: Yes, of course. It's just...every time I see one of those evil jerks... I just...start to rage! GRRRRRR! But, if I keep my thoughts focused on my dear Takumi. I can control myself. I'll do my best to assist you, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Oboro, good to have you with us.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're not with Zola. Whose side are you on?

speaker: Hinata
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! You don't know who I am?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm afraid not. Should I?

speaker: Hinata
text: Ha! Probably. The name’s Hinata. I'm Lord Takumi's retainer. Unfortunately, we became separated on the battlefield. We're doing everything we can to track him down, but we're running out of ideas. Will you help us find him?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course. That's why we're all here, too. It looks like we must be on the right track. since we've all arrived at the same location.

speaker: Hinata
text: Thank you, Lord/Lady Corrin. It's big of you to put aside your differences and help us find Takumi. Especially after some of the things he's been saying...

speaker: Zola
text: Ah, I see you're ready to die. I'm going to enjoy this!

speaker: Zola
text: Urgh... What was I thinking...

speaker: Corrin
text: Game over, Zola. Now tell us where you're keeping Izana!

speaker: Zola
text: *cough* *cough* Urk... No...

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you mean, no? You're beaten!

speaker: Zola
text: Oh my. How naive you are. What a sheltered life you've lived! I'd rather die than give you ANYTHING. Luckily, I won't have to. PAH!

speaker: Corrin
text: *cough* *cough* He's using some kind of a smoke screen!

speaker: Zola
text: Bingo! Until next time, fools!

speaker: Zola
text: GYAAAH! Ow, ow, ow... What are you doing? Let me go!

speaker: Leo
text: No.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo! What are you doing here?

speaker: Leo
text: Ah, Zola. You've embarrassed our kingdom for the last time.

speaker: Zola
text: Milord! Please, you don't mean that... I was just attempting to preserve my dignity.

speaker: Leo
text: Dignity? What would you know about that? You're done here.

speaker: Zola
text: Gyaaaah! Nooo...

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, what are you going to do?

speaker: Leo
