text: Zola is a monster. I'm going to make the world a better place.

speaker: Corrin
text: But he's one of your own! I refuse to believe you'd harm a fellow Nohrian.

speaker: Leo
text: Why should I listen to a traitor like you? You abandoned us! You have no right to tell me what to do!

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo...please.

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh, fine! Keep this pitiful fool if you like him so much. Good-bye, Corrin. When the time is right, you'll pay for what you've done.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo, wait! It doesn't have to be this way...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I've never seen such a display of power.

speaker: Jakob
text: Yes... Lord Leo is a gifted dark mage. He's feared and respected in Nohr.

speaker: Corrin
text: He's certainly changed since the time I spent there. The Leo I remember was kind and curious. Even clumsy at times. I wonder what happened to him...

speaker: Izana
text: Woooo! You guys saved me! This calls for a feast. No, better idea—an all-night party! We'll wear pajamas and eat bonbons. Let's get started! Izana in the house!

speaker: Sakura
text: Is...is this still Zola?

speaker: Hinoka
text: No...but I think we underestimated Zola's Izana impression.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, Archduke Izana, before we get to the bonbons, I have a few questions. Have you witnessed any nearby conflicts involving the Nohrians?

speaker: Izana
text: Oh, yeah. Definitely. What a bunch of party poopers they were. We were just listening to some music and getting massages. And then I heard, like, a big explosion or something outside. I went to see what was going on, and they captured me. I was still wearing my silk pj's! Anyway, we're all about love, peace, and chicken grease here in Izumo... So we don't exactly have a world-class military force. I don't know what happened after that. I was in my own jail. Luckily, I previously had the cell equipped with velvet sheets and scented candles. Best sleep I've had in weeks!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry you had to, uh, suffer through all that...

speaker: Hinoka
text: Yes. It's despicable for Nohr to take advantage of a neutral realm like this. Archduke Izana, I know you've been confined to a luxuriously appointed cell... But would you happen to know anything about my brothers Ryoma and Takumi?

speaker: Izana
text: Well, I've heard of them! That's something, right? I did overhear that the battle stretched all the way to the Bottomless Canyon. Maybe they just fell in?

speaker: Sakura
text: Gods! No!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Get ahold of yourself, Sakura! Your brothers are not the type to accidentally fall into a canyon. We've got to believe that both of them are alive and healthy.

speaker: Izana
text: I'm sorry—that was rude of me to speculate like that. It's just that that canyon is totally treacherous! Such a hazard! Anyway, maybe I can help by reading your fortune.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm a bit skeptical of fortune-telling...but this is your kingdom...

speaker: Izana
text: Yep! And I'm a descendant of the gods! It really is a pretty sweet deal from me. All right, here we go...

speaker: Izana
text: Oh, ancient gods... What's up? I ask that you please answer me. ... Oh, I'm getting something! In the white light, a hand ♪ reaches through... A double edged blade cuts your ♪ heart in two... waking dreams fade away... ♪ Embrace the brand-new day...

speaker: Azura
text: Can it be?

speaker: Izana
text: Om...

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that it?

speaker: Izana
text: Om...

speaker: Corrin
text: Hmm.

speaker: Izana
text: All right, I'm all done.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh. That's it?

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'm sorry, but that wasn't very helpful.

speaker: Izana
text: Hey, what can I tell you? I don't make the fortunes up—I just read 'em.

speaker: Corrin
text: Very well. Let's just move on.

speaker: Izana
text: Sounds good to me. I'm dying for something bubbly to drink. Who wants to join me in the sauna? Oh, right. You probably want to hurry off and find your friends. Well, there's no rush. I peeked into their fortunes a little bit just now. And I can tell you that they're both doing OK at the moment.

speaker: Sakura
text: Are you s-sure? I'd really like to believe that.

speaker: Izana
text: I swear it on my gold-plated statue of myself. They're fine.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well. Thank you, Archduke Izana, for your hospitality and services as fortune-teller. It is tempting to stay and rest, but we'll leave now in search of our brothers.

speaker: Izana
text: I knew it. Oh well! Come back again sometime, and we'll have a toga party.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know what that is, but...OK. Take care.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't stop thinking about the fortune Izana read for us... Those words were so poetic. "A double-edged blade..." "Embrace the brand-new day..."

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, I must speak with you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Is everything OK?

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. Well, I don't know, actually... It's about that fortune.

speaker: Corrin
text: It was strange, wasn't it? And a bit haunting, too...

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. Those were the words to a song my mother taught me as a child.

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you certain? Do you remember the meaning behind the lyrics?

speaker: Azura
text: No. It's an ancient song. But this is what troubles me. The lyrics almost seem to speak directly to YOU.

speaker: Corrin
text: To me? How is that possible?

speaker: Azura
text: I don't know. the song has always been a bit of a mystery... But I never thought about trying to solve it until now.

speaker: Corrin
text: Perhaps it's just a coincidence. Right? I mean, how could someone write a song about me if I hadn't been born... Oh, um...

speaker: Azura
text: *sob*

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, what's the matter?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry... Please forget about all of this.

speaker: Corrin
text: All right, I'll drop it for now. But don't hesitate to come speak with me about anything. At any time. I'm here for you.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Corrin. All right, let's get going, shall we?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura?

speaker: Corrin
text: What was she trying to tell me?

speaker: Kaze
text: Pardon me, milord/milady. I've finished scouting the surrounding area.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you Kaze. How does it look?

speaker: Kaze
text: I'm afraid it's not good. I don't believe the Nohrian army is aware of our precise location, but... They have moved to block all possible routes to the castle. Even the back roads and trails. They are being quite thorough. There are thousands of troops massing.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thousands. And we are just a handful. Well, thank you again, Kaze, for taking on such a difficult scouting mission.

speaker: Kaze
text: Of course, milord/milady. May I ask... How do you plan on proceeding? I don't see any way we can get around Nohr's forces undetected.

speaker: Corrin
text: There's really NO other route we can take?

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's not entirely true.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? Well, let's hear it! It doesn't look like we have any other options.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Technically speaking, it is possible to reach Nohr via Mount Garou. However, Mount Garou is more commonly known as the Impassable Peak.

speaker: Kaze
text: How can you even suggest such a thing, Lord Ryoma? We'd fare better against 10,000 Nohrian soldiers out in the open!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I am aware of the downside... and so is Nohr. That must be why they're forcing us in that direction.

speaker: Kaze
text: Right. I didn't see any troops blocking the entrance to the peak... But that is surely intentional.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What do you think, Corrin? This may be our best chance.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well, we can't just stay here. We're a small force, but we're powerful and nimble. I think we should take our chances with Garou.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Then it is agreed. Kaze, can you guide us to the best possible entry point?

speaker: Kaze
text: Of course, milord.

speaker: Corrin
text: *huff* *huff* *huff* First the Eternal Stairway...now this. At least we don't have to worry about staying in condition with all this exercise.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm afraid the physical demands of this peak aren't our only worry... How are you doing, Corrin? Do you need to take a break?

speaker: Corrin
text: No, I'm OK. But it looks as though we've put some distance on the others. Perhaps we should give them a chance to catch up and rest.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Good idea. I'll backtrack a little bit and alert the leaders. Wait...someone else is here!

speaker: Corrin
text: Where? I don't see anyone...

speaker: Wolfskin
text: Grrrr...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Watch out, Corrin!

speaker: Wolfskin
text: Grr... *snarl*

speaker: Corrin
text: What are we dealing with, Ryoma? Another of Nohr's monsters?

speaker: Ryoma
text: No, these are wolfskin—a tribe with shapeshifting abilities. They're the other hazard associated with crossing Mount Garou.

speaker: Keaton
text: Hey! What are you guys doing in our den?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry...who are you?

speaker: Keaton
text: Me? Oh, my name's Keaton. And you CAN'T HAVE MY FUR, got it? Some other humans came and tried to get my fur. But I collected their bones instead. Ha! The joke's on them.

speaker: Ryoma
text: He does appear to have a collection of human bones...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry. I think there's been a misunderstanding. We're not after your fur. We just want to pass through the area. We mean you no harm!

speaker: Keaton
text: Really? How can I trust you? My fur is pretty soft, you know. A lot of people want it!

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, believe me. We have no intention of fighting. Everyone! Set down your weapons.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I hope you know what you're doing, Corrin...

speaker: Takumi
text: Yeah, you better be right about this.

speaker: Corrin
text: There. You see, we're sorry about trespassing, but we come in peace. We'd just like to pass through this area.

speaker: Keaton
text: Hmm...

speaker: Wolfskin
text: Grr!

speaker: Keaton
text: All right, all right. I think they're telling the truth. Let's let these humans through.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you Keaton. We appreciate it.

speaker: Wolfskin
text: Gyaaah!

speaker: Keaton
text: What was that?

speaker: Corrin
text: Some kind of explosion! Everyone, get down!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Look, up there. What is that?

speaker: Corrin
text: It looks like...dark energy. The same kind that exploded from my sword... Have we been set up by King Garon again?

speaker: Keaton
text: Hey! Hey! Wake up! This isn't funny, OK? Snap to it! Aww, open your eyes. Please? Not like this... *sniff* *sniff*

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh dear.

speaker: Keaton
text: YOU! You did this, didn't you? You were tricking us the whole time!

speaker: Corrin
text: No! That's not true. We had nothing to do with this!

speaker: Keaton
text: Lies! You'll die for this. ALL OF YOU!

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! Are you OK?

speaker: Keaton
text: Gah! Get out of my way! This is between me and him/her.

speaker: Kaze
text: Urgh...

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze!

speaker: Kaze
text: I don't think we can talk our way out of this one, Lord/Lady Corrin. We're going to sustain heavy losses if we don't fight back.

speaker: Keaton
text: I knew I shouldn't have trusted humans. None of you are leaving this place alive!

speaker: Kaze
text: Quickly, Lord/Lady Corrin! We need to take action one way or another.

speaker: Corrin
text: Argh! I guess we have no choice... Please forgive us, wolfskin!

speaker: Keaton
text: Now I'll take your life in exchange for my friend's. Rawr!

speaker: Keaton
text: Ugh... Why did you have to come here...

speaker: Corrin
text: We owe the wolfskin an apology. As meaningless as they may believe it to be... We can't undo what happened here today.

speaker: Kaze
text: An apology may be in order, but we're not at fault here. Please don't be too hard on yourself about all of this.

speaker: Corrin
text: I don't know. I'll never be able to fully forgive myself. I suppose it's just another burden I'll carry until the end.

speaker: Kaze
text: Perhaps it's a burden I can help you carry, milord/milady.

speaker: Kaze
text: Would you allow me to serve you?

speaker: Corrin
text: To...serve me? What do you mean?

speaker: Kaze
text: Ah, pardon me. Of course you wouldn't be familiar with Hoshidan tradition. It is expected that the most skilled elite soldiers will eventually choose a liege. As you're aware, Subaki and Hana serve Lady Sakura. Hinata and Oboro support Lord Takumi. Lady Hinoka counts on Azama and Setsuna as her retainers. And Kagero and my older brother Saizo work directly for Lord Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course. I suppose I'm the only one left for you. Sorry about that.

speaker: Kaze
text: On the contrary. I feel blessed that I've remained unattached. Because now I can pledge my loyalty to you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze, are you sure?

speaker: Kaze
text: Yes. I've seen you make tough but necesary decisions in the face of danger. I'm confident that you're the right leader for our group in this time of crisis. Besides, I've done something to you that can never be forgiven...

speaker: Corrin
text: How could you possibly? I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: Kaze
text: Lord/Lady Corrin, allow me to explain. When I was much younger—

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoah, what's happening? I think it's a landslide! Watch out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze! You have to let go of me! We'll both fall if you don't!

speaker: Kaze
text: Ungh...never! I couldn't live with myself. I already owe you my life...I'm the reason you were kidnapped as a child!

speaker: Corrin
text: That can't be true!

speaker: Kaze
text: It is. I was traveling with you that day, and I saw an unusual Nohrain troop presence. If I had only said something... But I was young... I didn't know the risk they posed. I could have prevented everything!

speaker: Corrin
text: You were a child! You couldn't have known. It's not your fault!

speaker: Kaze
text: I wish you were right. But I was raised in a family of ninja. I should have known better. I owe you a lifetime of service. But perhaps sacrificing myself will do.

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze, no! Don't do anything foolish!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin! Kaze! Hold on!

speaker: Corrin
text: Over here, Hinoka. Please help!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'm coming!

speaker: Corrin
text: Agh...the ground is moving again!

speaker: Kaze
text: It has been a pleasure serving you, Lord/Lady Corrin. Lady Hinoka! You know what you have to do. Haaa!

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoa!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I've got you, Corrin!

speaker: Kaze
text: Please forgive me, Lord/Lady Corrin. I am only doing what is necessary.

speaker: Corrin
text: NO! Kaze!

speaker: Hinoka
text: I...I couldn't save him! What just happened?!

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't belive it... Kaze, why? WHY?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Well, we've reached the summit. How are you doing, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: We...we lost Kaze. I still can't believe it.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. Another tragedy among countless tragedies we've witness of late. ... Look, Corrin. Can you see the sun breaking over the horizon?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes...I suppose I can.

speaker: Ryoma
text: They say the sun never shines in Nohr, but we can see that that's not true. Perhaps it's small comfort, but I take this as a good omen.

speaker: Corrin
text: It is warm here. The same kind of warmth I felt walking the streets of Hoshido. Perhaps Kaze's spirit lives on in another world, watching over us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Anything is possible, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you for saving me, Kaze. I promise that you won't have died in vain. rest in peace, friend...

speaker: Kaze
text: I'll always be at your side—especially at times like this.

speaker: Corrin
text: Thank you, Kaze. Your words mean a lot to me.

speaker: Corrin
text: Whoah, what's happening? I think it's a landslide! Watch out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Kaze! You have to let go of me! We'll both fall if you don't!

speaker: Kaze
text: Never milord/milady! I won't let you die!

speaker: Kaze
text: Hrrrgh! I can't hold this much longer... Hmm, is that what I think it is? Milord/Milady! I'm going to try something! Please hold tight!

speaker: Corrin
text: What?!

speaker: Kaze
text: Hah!

speaker: Corrin
text: WHOA!

speaker: Kaze
text: Are you all right, Lord/Lady Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes...I think I am. Thanks to you. What WAS that?

speaker: Kaze
text: I...I don't know. I didn't know what would happen...but I'm afraid I didn't have many options.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't say I'm disappointed, but you should have let me go and saved yourself.

speaker: Kaze
text: Nonsense. If anything, I was prepared to sacrifice myself. Hoshido needs you, Lord/Lady Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: Well...thank you.

speaker: Azura
text: Are you two OK? I heard what sounded like another explosion.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, we're fine Azura. Kaze managed to save us both.

speaker: Azura
text: Oh, thank goodness. I must admit, I feared the worst. Even though we're out of danger for now, it would be wise to stay alert.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Well, we've reached the summit. How are you doing, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm still upset about what happened with the wolfskin. Not to mention the fact that Kaze and I just nearly died.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. This clash with the wolfskin is just another tragedy in a long line. ... Look, Corrin. Can you see the sun breaking over the horizon?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes...I suppose I can.

speaker: Ryoma
text: They say the sun never shines in Nohr, but we can see that that's not true. Perhaps it's small comfort, but I take this as a good omen.

speaker: Corrin
text: It is warm here. The same kind of warmth I felt walking the streets of Hoshido. I hope someday, both Hoshido and Nohr can share this kind of warmth.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Anything is possible, Corrin.

speaker: Lilith
text: Lady Corrin, could I have a moment of your time? There's a familiar face here to see you.

speaker: Felicia
text: Lady Corrin! I'm so glad you're safe! When I'd heard you'd gone missing I couldn't think about anything else! I've been tracking you down ever since, through the astral whosits! It wasn't easy, but I made it here and I want to fight!

speaker: Jakob
text: Lord Corrin, it's truly splendid to see you are doing well! When word reached us that you had gone missing, I could not rest. Tracking nobles across dimensional barriers was a new item for my résumé... But I am undoubtedly richer for it. Now that I am here, I would like to fight at your side.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander. Withdraw your troops.

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin... Don't tell me you're siding with Hoshido.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm afraid so. I've made up my mind---I stand with Hoshido.

speaker: Xander
text: I fear the Hoshidans might try to brainwash you... I am well aware of your Hoshidan lineage. It is true that we lack common blood. But still, we've treated you as kin since the very day you arrived in Nohr. No matter what anyone says, you are my brother/sister, Corrin. I know that Camilla, Leo, and Elise feel the same way. And Father will forgive you. I know it. You are of Nohr! Return to us, Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry. I can't go back. King Garon is a coward and a liar. I've witnessed enough of his destruction. Causing an explosion in a crowded city center with no regard for innocent life. That's the action of a madman.

speaker: Corrin
text: Tell me. If King Garon thinks of me as family... how could he have orchestrated this attack? I could have easily been killed along with Queen Mikoto. The truth is that I was just a pawn. Collateral damage. King Garon was willing to sacrifice my life in pursuit of his agenda. Face it, Xander---Garon is no longer human. He's pure evil.

speaker: Xander
text: Father... evil? How could you say that, little prince/princess?

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander, please... Join me! Join me and help put an end to his cruelty!

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin...

speaker: Xander
text: There's my answer, traitor.

speaker: Corrin
text: Traitor? Brother, wait!

speaker: Xander
text: Enough. I never thought you would turn your back on your kingdom and your family. Your betrayal will not be forgiven. You want to side with Hoshido? Fine. Over my dead body!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!

speaker: Xander
text: You have been deceived, Brother/Sister. They've clearly brainwashed you. I will not rest until I've returned you to your senses. Get up! Get up and return to Nohr with me. Surely there's some part of you that still remembers your true family.

speaker: Corrin
text: Brother, my mind is made up.

speaker: Xander
text: If that's the case... I will end this quickly.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wait!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Just try it, Nohrian scum.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Please, we can settle this peacefully.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What's wrong, Corrin? Lost your focus? Tossing your sword aside and dying as a martyr won't do us any good.

speaker: Xander
text: Fiend! If you seek to take my brother/sister from me, I won't go easy on you.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Oh, why don't you spare ME the chitchat? Shut up and attack, if you dare!

speaker: Xander
text: A splendid idea. I've yearned to introduce you to a dear friend of mine---the dark blade Siegfried! Camilla, Leo, Elise! Are you ready?

speaker: Camilla
text: Darling, I was born ready. Let's kill them all quickly so that we can make it in time for Corrin's nap.

speaker: Leo
text: You're coming with us---that's all there is to it. Understood, Corrin?

speaker: Elise
text: Yay! We're gonna take Corrin back home!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Please. Corrin has made his/her choice. All that remains is to spill your blood and wipe my divine sword clean. Hinoka, Takumi, Sakura! Steel yourselves.

speaker: Hinoka
text: I'll be your shield, Corrin. They won't kidnap you again.

speaker: Takumi
text: Stupid Nohrian jerks! I'll kill all of you!

speaker: Sakura
text: I'm r-ready. I won't let them hurt you, Corrin.

speaker: Xander
text: Very well. All forces, attack!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Warriors of Hoshido... prepare for battle!

speaker: Felicia
text: I made it Lord Corrin! Is everything OK?

speaker: Corrin
text: Felicia? No, we're far from OK. But there's no time to explain. Your timing is terrible. What are you doing here now?

speaker: Felicia
text: How can you say that? I've been looking for you all this time! Anyway, I'm here now, and I'll stand by your side!

speaker: Jakob
text: Pardon me, Lady Corrin. It took me a while to track you down. Is everything OK?

speaker: Corrin
text: Jakob? No, we're far from OK. But there's no time to explain right now. Your timing is terrible. What are you doing here now?

speaker: Jakob
text: I apologize. I've been searching for you this whole time. Regardless, I'm here now, and I'll stand by your side.

speaker: Xander
text: What foolishness. I will not tolerate traitors in our midst!

speaker: Xander
text: How is this possible? We must retreat! This isn't over, Corrin...

speaker: Xander
text: So, you've chosen to take up arms against your own brother... It's not too late for all to be forgiven. Come back to Nohr with us.

speaker: Corrin
text: I can't do that, Xander. I've made my decision, and I stand by it.

speaker: Xander
text: How unfortunate. You leave me no choice. If force is the only thing that can make you listen to reason, so be it!

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander!

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin belongs to us!

speaker: Camilla
text: How could you let this happen, Corrin?

speaker: Camilla
text: Tell me this isn't really happening, my sweet Corrin! Won't you come back to Nohr with us?

speaker: Corrin
text: Gods... Camilla... I wish it didn't have to be this way.

speaker: Camilla
text: I can't believe it.

speaker: Leo
text: If you attack, I will offer no mercy. I hope you are prepared to die.

speaker: Leo
text: You're stronger than I expected...

speaker: Leo
text: What are you doing, Brother/Sister? There's still time to change your mind. I'll even smooth things over with Father. Please, come back to us.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Leo. But I can't go back. Father is dead to me.

speaker: Leo
text: Do you even hear what you're saying? This is madness! I suppose I'll just have to knock some sense into you. Know that I take no joy in this...

speaker: Elise
text: I want my brother/sister back!

speaker: Elise
text: I never thought this could happen...

speaker: Elise
text: Why are you doing this, Corrin? I don't want to fight you! Why don't you stop all this and come home with us?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry, Elise. The last thing I want to do is fight you. I know it's hard to understand, but this is the only way!

speaker: Elise
text: Grr! Stop being so stubborn!

speaker: Corrin
text: Is this really our future? A lifetime of conflict with Nohr?

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin... I can understand why you are reluctant to fight. If it would make you feel better, you can leave the fighting to me and Ryoma.

speaker: Corrin
text: No. Burying my head in the sand won't change the reality of the situation. I will stand with you, and the rest of Hoshido.

speaker: Azura
text: Very well.

speaker: Corrin
text: I know this is the right choice. Even if it's the hardest one I've ever had to make. I have to believe this is the path that will eventually lead to peace.

speaker: Corrin
text: *sigh* It's no use. I just can't fall asleep. First the incident in Cheve, now the hunt for those singers... The thought of attacking innocent people hurts my heart. I wonder if I did the right thing. Is it even possible to change things from the inside? Sometimes I wonder if siding with Nohr...was a mistake. Should I have sided with Hoshido? Helped them take down Father? But no, Xander and the rest... I love them so much. I could never betray them. *SIGH* I feel like I don't know anything anymore. Hm? Is that...Azura?

speaker: Corrin
text: That's Azura all right... I wonder where she's going. Maybe I'll feel better if I talk to her about our decision to side with Nohr. She's the only one in the world who's going through something similar. Fighting the Hoshidan siblings she grew up with... It can't be easy. I bet it would benefit both of us to talk all this through.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's weird... Where did she go? Into the forest, maybe...? Th-that song! It's just like the one that performer sang in Nestra. The one that cursed Father... The mysterious singer and Azura... Could they be the same person? N-no, it can't be. That's insane. I need to find Azura right now. There she is... Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh?! She's walking into the lake... Is she taking a bath? No, it can't be that. She's fully clothed... What is she—

speaker: Corrin
text: She's gone! Gods, she's not coming back up... Don't tell me she's... Azura? Azura! AZURA!!

speaker: Azura
text: Tell me... Why are you here?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura? Wh-what happened? I dive onto the lake to save you...and then...

speaker: Azura
text: You shouldn't be here, Corrin. Go back while you still can.

speaker: Corrin
text: Go back? What do you mean? Where are we?

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin, watch out!

speaker: Corrin
text: Who is this person? Why is he attacking me?!

speaker: Azura
text: This is bad... We need to get out of here, Corrin! That thing attacking you may look human, but it's only a monster now. It feels no emotion. It can't love or even communicate. A soulless killing machine. If you get to close, it will surely destroy you.

speaker: Corrin
text: But Azura... There's nowhere to run!

speaker: Azura
text: What?! Oh no... The path has closed. That means we'll have to fight our way through. Don't die on me, Corrin. Not before I can tell you the truth.

speaker: Gunter
text: Milord/Milady!

speaker: Corrin
text: HUH?! It...it can't be... GUNTER!! Is that really you? You're not a ghost...are you?

speaker: Gunter
text: It is I, milord/milady, in the flesh. And I won't tolerate being called a ghost. I saw that the two of you were in trouble, so I've come to help.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so happy to see you alive and well, Gunter! It's unbelievable! I don't understand, though... Why are you here?

speaker: Gunter
text: We can discuss all that later. First we must dispatch these cretins!

speaker: Corrin
text: Valid point! I'm so glad to have you fighting by my side again, Gunter...

speaker: Corrin
text: Gunter!! I can't believe it's really you! Where have you been all this time?

speaker: Gunter
text: As you may recall, Hans knocked me into the Bottomless Canyon. I hit solid ground, but it wasn't a canyon floor. When I came to, I was here. I barely had time to find my bearings before those monsters started attacking me. I tried to fight, then to run. I almost died a number of times, but then Lady Azura—

speaker: Corrin
text: You know Azura?!

speaker: Azura
text: He does. When I felt lost and lonely in Hoshido, I often found my way here. In this abyss I tried to derive some clue as to how I could achieve peace for the world. During one of my visits, I found Gunter here, on the brink of death.

speaker: Gunter
text: Lady Azura taught me how to hide here—where I could go to stay safe. I would be dead right now if it weren't for her kindness. I am forever in her debt.

speaker: Azura
text: Thank you, Gunter, but I don't deserve your praise. After I left you that day, I was captured by Hoshidan soldiers. I wasn't able to come back for you until now. I'm so sorry I left you alone...

speaker: Gunter
text: Think nothing of it, milord/milady. I'm just happy to see you again.

speaker: Corrin
text: So, where exactly are we? Gunter got here by falling in the Bottomless Canyon... But we came here by diving into the lake. It sounds mad... Is that even possible?

speaker: Azura
text: It is. We are no longer in Nohr, but we are not in Hoshido either. It is a land separate from both. Ever near, but hidden to all.

speaker: Corrin
text: A hidden land.

speaker: Azura
text: Yes. Time flows differently here than it does in the world we came from. There's something else... You must never speak of this place in the outside world. There exists a curse...if you speak of this land outside of it, you'll vanish.

speaker: Corrin
text: Vanish?!

speaker: Azura
text: Don't worry. So long as you don't talk about it, you'll be fine. We should head back. Please heed my warning and keep this place a secret. Both of you, follow me.

speaker: Azura
text: Listen carefully. This place leads to the Bottomless Canyon in the other world. If we jump here, we can return to the world from whence we came.

speaker: Corrin
text: Wow, so this is how you go back and forth between worlds. Amazing.

speaker: Azura
text: Hm? Oh no, it's actually not. I always travel through water.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh. Then why don't we just go back the same way we came?

speaker: Azura
text: We can't. You and I are the only ones who can use water to travel between worlds. This is the only way to bring Gunter back with us. I realized that last time I was here. I tried to take Gunter with me but was unable to.

speaker: Corrin
text: Just the two of us can travel through water? But why? Why us?

speaker: Azura
text: That's... ... I'm sorry, but that's not something I can talk about right now. We need to get back to the other world now, before those things attack again.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? Azura?! Wow! She didn't even hesitate...

speaker: Gunter
text: Then let us show the same strength of will. I've got your back, milord/milady.

speaker: Corrin
text: So, um...basically...you're saying you want me to jump first? ... This may very well be the most frightening thing I've ever done. But I have no choice... ... OK, I'm going to do it... Deep breaths... HERE GOES NOTHING!

speaker: Azura
text: Welcome back, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm back already? Incredible. Wait a minute... Where's Gunter?! H-he didn't get lost or something did he?!

speaker: Azura
text: Not to worry. If he jumped off the cliff as instructed, he'll show up here eventually.

speaker: Azura
text: As I said, time flows differently there. That's why there´s a lag between when someone jumps and when they arrive back. While we wait for him to appear...there's something I need to tell you.

speaker: Corrin
text: Oh? What's that?

speaker: Azura
text: I've heard you say numerous times that you'd stop at nothing to end this war. If that's true, there's something you must do. It won't be easy though... I'm afraid if we're ever to obtain peace, you must...dethrone King Garon.

speaker: Corrin
text: Dethrone Father? Are you mad?!

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry, but it's the only way. All he does is spread hate and evil. He's a cruel and heartless man, even to his own children. It's despicable.

speaker: Corrin
text: Sadly, I can't disagree with any of that. But, Azura... He's still my father, and the father of my siblings. Must we shame and defeat him?

speaker: Azura
text: I wished to shield you from this knowledge, Corrin, but it's time you knew. The man you call Father...is not King Garon. Not anymore. The man masquerading as your father is not of this world. He's being controlled by something—by a demon of some sort. I know that's a lot to swallow, but I think I can prove it to you......with this.

speaker: Corrin
text: What...is it?

speaker: Azura
text: This is a crystal from the other world we just returned from. It has the power to reveal the truth. It takes an incredibly gifted mage, like Leo, to access its power at will. ...Or someone with highly potent dragon blood in their veins. Someone like you. Now, if you would, go ahead and touch the crystal.

speaker: Corrin
text: Um, OK...

speaker: Azura
text: Now you know the truth about King Garon. Are you OK, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: ...I'll be fine. Azura... Can I ask you something? Is there really no way we can save him? No way at all?

speaker: Azura
text: Sadly, it's far too late for that. His soul has been corrupted beyond salvaging. The best we can do for him is to defeat him and release his soul to the next world. I did all I could to help...when I sang that song at the theatre in Cyrkensia.

speaker: Corrin
text: So it was you...

speaker: Azura
text: It was. That song I sang has a mysterious power. I thought perhaps I could use it to turn Garon back to normal. ...It didn't work. That's when I realized he was too far gone to save. Worse than my failure is the fact that I endangered all those innocent singers. It's my fault they're being hunted. I'll never forgive myself for that.

speaker: Corrin
text: You're not the only one who has suffered failures on the path to peace. I wanted so badly to end this war without sacrificing any lives. And yet...in Cheve, I was unable to stop the murder of all those innocent people.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin...

speaker: Corrin
text: You're right. I see that now. we must stop Father so such things never happen again. I can't do it without Xander and the others, though. They need to know. Ugh, but how do I explain all this to them? Will they even believe me? I don't know where to begin, and what's worse, I can't mention that other world!

speaker: Azura
text: Hmm... There might be a way to show them, but it's risky...

speaker: Corrin
text: What do you have in mind?

speaker: Azura
text: We'll have to conquer Hoshido. Win the war in King Garon's name. Once we've won, all we have to do is get Garon to sit on the Hoshidan throne.

speaker: Corrin
text: That's right. I remember Mother saying something about that throne. She said those who sit on it regain their true form and mind.

speaker: Azura
text: Precisely. With that crystal, I was able to show you the truth. But with that throne, we could reveal the truth to our siblings too. Unfortunately, to make this plan work, we'll have to keep following Garon's orders. And to conquer Hoshido, we'll have to keep fighting your Hoshidan siblings. It won't be easy for you, Corrin... For that, I'm sorry.

speaker: Corrin
text: ... My happiness is a small price to pay for the good of the whole world. I will continue to fight for Nohr and follow my father's every command. If I must sacrifice my soul and walk the path of evil to end this war, so be it. Even if no one understands why I'm doing this... Even if they grow to hate me...

speaker: Azura
text: If that's the path you choose to walk, I shall walk it with you. I am ever at your service, Corrin. Together we will claim victory for Nohr.

speaker: Gunter
text: Lord/Lady Corrin! Lady Azura!

speaker: Corrin
text: Welcome back, Gunter.

speaker: Azura
text: I'm so glad you made it back safely. Well, no time to spare. Let's hurry back and rejoin the others. King Garon will grow suspicious if we're gone too long...

speaker: Corrin
text: ...I know what I must do. Ryoma! Withdraw your troops.

speaker: Ryoma
text: You don't mean that, Corrin. You cannot possibly!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Ryoma, but I will not fight for Hoshido.

speaker: Ryoma
text: How can you say that?! Open your eyes! Can you not see how vile those Nohrians are? They're hateful fiends who wish to trample Hoshido! They killed our mother!

speaker: Corrin
text: It's not that simple... I know what the Nohrian kingdom has done to Hoshido is unforgivable... And I know now that these are not my brothers and sisters by birth... Yet even still, I must side with them. My heart won’t allow me to do otherwise.

speaker: Ryoma
text: How can you fight alongside those monsters after what they did?! Now that you know of their sins, how can you possibly justify joining them? You are a prince/princess of Hoshido! You are my brother/sister! They are to blame for you not growing up with us as you were meant to. Do you truly mean to fight for those who stole you away?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma... My sorrow is beyond words. Still, I simply will not abandon the only family I have ever known.

speaker: Xander
text: You did the right thing, Corrin. As you now know, you do not share the same bloodline as the rest of us. But it matters not. I have regarded you as family since I first laid eyes on you. I cannot express what it means to me that you've chosen to return to us. Father will be pleased with your decision as well.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Are you certain of that, Prince Xander? Surely you must know of King Garon's attempt to murder Corrin!

speaker: Xander
text: Explain yourself. Swiftly.

speaker: Ryoma
text: There was an attack in our capital's square. The explosion came from Corrin's sword. If my mother hadn't sacrificed herself, he/she would be dead now. If King Garon truly cares, why did he risk Corrin's life just to hurt Hoshido?

speaker: Xander
text: Is this true, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: ...It is. But I still need to hear Father's side of the story. That's why I must return home right away. I must know the truth of this tragedy.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm afraid that is not an option.

speaker: Corrin
text: Arrrgh!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Everyone! Attack Corrin! I will not allow you to return to Nohr until we've settled this on the battlefield.

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Please don't do this!

speaker: Ryoma
text: If you are looking for forgiveness, you'll find none here. So you wish to side with Nohr? Then you must first defeat your true brother. It is your birthright to fight on my side. I cannot forgive the choice you've made. How dare you use the sacred Yato blade against your own kingdom! Perhaps it is a blessing Mother isn't here to witness your betrayal.

speaker: Xander
text: Stand down, prince of Hoshido. I will not allow you to cause any further harm to Corrin.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Order me around once more, and Nohr will lose two princes/a prince as well as a princess today. I will do what I must to awaken my brother/sister from the spell that binds him/her. You vile Nohrians have brainwashed him/her, and I will not rest until he/she is free!

speaker: Xander
text: More false accusations. You know very well he/she chose this of his/her own free will. No matter the blood that courses through his/her veins, we are his/her true family. That will never change.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I will not stand here and listen to your lies! Your heart knows only deceit and betrayal. Nohrians are notorious for their cruel and cowardly methods. This is no different. But enough of your foolish words. We must resolve this with blades.

speaker: Xander
text: So be it. I always knew it would come to this. The crown prince of Nohr clashing blades with Hoshido’s heir. It’s almost poetic.

speaker: Corrin
text: Please, stop this madness! Both of you! Xander, I beg of you. Let it go for now. We must return to Nohr right away. There has been enough senseless death on this day...

speaker: Leo
text: I'm afraid retreat is not an option.

speaker: Corrin
text: Leo? Why would you say that?

speaker: Leo
text: If we retreat, they'll think we fear them. Or worse, that we coerced you into joining us. This is our chance to prove beyond a doubt that you chose us of your own volition. We have no choice but to stand our ground and fight!

speaker: Camilla
text: I agree with Leo. After all, we've done nothing wrong. Why should we flee? You're one of us, Corrin. that's worth fighting for!

speaker: Elise
text: Don't worry, Corrin! Everything's OK now that we're together again! If we all try our hardest, there's no way we can lose!

speaker: Corrin
text: Is that really what you want? Leo, Camilla, even Elise...

speaker: Ryoma
text: If you mean to fight, then FIGHT! Nohrian pawns. Soon you shall be a mere stain on my sacred blade, Raijinto. Hinoka! Takumi! Sakura! Are you ready?

speaker: Hinoka
text: Ready and waiting! Like I'd ever let them take Corrin away from us again.

speaker: Takumi
text: Show no mercy. Now is our chance to avenge Mother's death!

speaker: Sakura
text: I'll help too. I'll do my b-best! Please, Corrin, come back to us...

speaker: Xander
text: Fools, all of you. You have my pity. Sadly for you, my sacred blade, Siegfried, knows nothing of pity—only triumph. Camilla! Leo! Elise! prepare for battle!

speaker: Camilla
text: I swear to protect our dear Corrin no matter what!

speaker: Leo
text: Failure is no option. Let's show those scoundrels what it means to be a family!

speaker: Elise
text: I'm ready too! Let's finish this quickly, though. I'm starving!

speaker: Ryoma
text: This is it... ATTACK!

speaker: Xander
text: It begins!

speaker: Sakura
text: I don't care what happens to me, but I w-won't let you hurt the people I love!

speaker: Sakura
text: I don't...understand...

speaker: Hinoka
text: I won't rest until Corrin returns home. I've been training for this day!

speaker: Hinoka
text: How could this happen?! What have I been fighting for all this time...?

speaker: Takumi
text: Prepare to pay for what you monsters have done. This is for Mother!

speaker: Takumi
text: Gah! You may not have honor, but you certainly have skill. This isn't over...

speaker: Ryoma
text: I will not allow a filthy Nohrian to sully my honor!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Damn! I'll have to withdraw for now... This isn't over, Corrin!

speaker: Yukimura
text: This battle is truly lamentable. It would have broken Lady Mikoto's heart to watch these events unfold...

speaker: Yukimura
text: I must withdraw... Forgive me, Lady Mikoto...

speaker: Sakura
text: Corrin! Are you r-really gonna fight me right now? What did I ever do to you? All I wanted was to l-love you!

speaker: Corrin
text: Sakura, I'm so sorry for all this. You didn't do anything wrong, I promise. It's difficult to explain, but I just need you to...um, take a little nap right now.

speaker: Sakura
text: Brother/Sister, no...

speaker: Hinoka
text: What exactly do you think you're doing, Corrin?! Betraying us for Nohr... It just can't be true! They must have tricked you somehow, right?

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Hinoka. I just... I can't abandon the ones I loved all these years. It's as simple as that.

speaker: Hinoka
text: Corrin... Say it isn't so...

speaker: Takumi
text: Hmph. I knew it would come to this. From the moment we met, I knew you couldn't be trusted. And I was right.

speaker: Corrin
text: Takumi... Please, let me explain.

speaker: Takumi
text: I have no time for your empty words. Ryoma and the others were fools. I knew trusting a Nohrian would only lead to death and heartbreak. But I am not Ryoma, nor my siblings. I won't make that same mistake. I shall take great joy in slaying you here and now like the traitor you are!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Corrin! Do not allow them to fool you a moment longer. There's still time... Come back to your true family, where you belong!

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm sorry, Ryoma. I'm afraid that's not possible. I've made up my mind. I'm staying with Xander and my Nohrian siblings.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Very well. Although it pains me, I see you cannot be dissuaded. In that case, I have no choice but to drag you back to Hoshido by force!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma! Don't do this!!

speaker: Yukimura
text: So, here we are. You have come back to us, but with a blade in hand. I suppose it's safe to surmise you have no intention of returning to Hoshido?

speaker: Corrin
text: You are correct. Nohr is my home. It's where I belong.

speaker: Yukimura
text: How very upsetting. If Lady Mikoto were here to see this, it would break her heart. Then again, she may just have smiled and said, "It's his/her path to choose."

speaker: Corrin
text: Yukimura...

speaker: Yukimura
text: But such talk is pointless, for our dear queen has left this realm. As for myself, I am above all a tactician for the honorable Hoshidan army. As such, I am obligated to prevent you from returning to Nohr!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma… Everyone… Please find it in your hearts to forgive me. I know that a prince/princess of Hoshido siding with Nohr seems like the ultimate betrayal. But I swear on my honor…I will end this war, for all of us. For Nohr and Hoshido—for you and me. I promise you that. Until then…farewell.

speaker: Azura
text: Corrin!

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura?

speaker: Azura
text: So...you're really leaving us?

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura, I...

speaker: Azura
text: Are you sure about this, Corrin? Once done, it cannot be undone.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, I know. But it's the only way. These people, I've loved them for as long as I can remember. They are my family.

speaker: Azura
text: I see. If that is the path you have chosen, I will not try to stop you. I am certain we will meet again. But for now... I suppose this is good-bye.

speaker: Corrin
text: Azura...

speaker: Xander
text: Corrin, you're alive! They haven't harmed you, have they?

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander! I'm fine. But... why are you invading Hoshido?!

speaker: Xander
text: Father say's it's time to show our true strength. Join us, and we'll end this quickly. If we conquer Hoshido here and now, we can avoid unnecessary bloodshed.

speaker: Corrin
text: Xander... I...I need a minute.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Be careful, Corrin. That man is a Nohrian commander!

speaker: Corrin
text: Ryoma...

speaker: Camilla
text: Corrin! I was so worried about you. Don't ever wander away from me again!

speaker: Leo
text: I'm glad you're OK, Corrin. You must have the devil's own luck!

speaker: Elise
text: Yaaay! We got our brother/sister back!

speaker: Hinoka
text: Nohrian scum! First you kidnap him/her, now you lied to him/her?! Corrin is MY brother/sister, not yours!

speaker: Camilla
text: You are mistaken. Corrin is my sweet little brother/sister. You may not have him/her.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Don't be fooled by their words. You belong with your true family in Hoshido!

speaker: Xander
text: We have loved you and raised you since you were a child. Come home, little prince/princess. We can live as a family once more!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Come home to Hoshido, Corrin!

speaker: Xander
text: No, Corrin! Nohr is your home!

speaker: Ryoma
text: This way!

speaker: Sakura
text: B-Big brother/sister?

speaker: Elise
text: He's/She's my brother/sister!

speaker: Xander
text: We're your family.

speaker: Corrin
text: My family...
